Reviews.Title: “Really excellent choice, couldn't have picked a better one.”
Reviews.Author: Kay R
Reviews.Content: This was the best place ever, could not believe how beautiful this hotel was, loads of shops and restaurants right on site was so easy to get around. Had a great view from the 44th floor was worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME SINGAPORE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: ernrich
Reviews.Content: Excellent location right across the street from the famous Long Bar in Raffles Hotel. There is also a huge shopping arcade in underground and on the second floor. Our room on the 44th had a terrific view of Singapore and at night the lights of the tall buildings and The Singapore Flyer were awesome. Staff was more than knowledgeable and extremely accommodating. Breakfast was very good with a wide variety of both Western & Asian selections. A excellent stay to say the least.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better....”
Reviews.Author: Infodesign
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night as a change to the Marina Mandarin, so could compare the two. We got a deal on a Club room on the executive floor for SGD 375 a night, so would expect 5 star for this amount. Reception was good, except somehow our luggage got lost between there and our room and it took a few phone calls and a trip to the lobby to find it. Room was smaller than other ones we have stayed in on previous visits, and had twin beds, not a double. Bathroom was a bit tired. Internet was included in the room rate, but only by buying it and then having this taken off the bill - strange system! At least it was a fast connection. Otherwise all the usual room facilities, including iron (useful) and Nespresso machine. Club lounge is good as the reception downstairs was very crowded with a convention underway. Hotel location is good. Ordered a morning paper but it never arrived. Comparison with the Mandarin? Not as good public areas, rooms about the same but smaller bathroom, service the same (generally excellent, but with occasional flaws).

Reviews.Title: “Great views of singapore”
Reviews.Author: Del99uk
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel from the 27th march for 3 nights. We book via a singapore stopover and got very good rates. As i wanted everything to be smooth upon check in, i did email them directly to inform we must have a king size bed as it was the start of out honeymoon. The respones was quick and ber professional. Upon check in, we were given a room on the 22nd floor with an amazing view of the harbour. The room size was spacious and had the most comfortable bed. Also a small balcony which was great. I coudnt really fault the room, but i must say the bathroom was a lil small for my liking. The shower leaked, but it didnt bother me at all. I usally stay in pan pacific or the ritz when i go singapore, but the swissotel is definatley just as good. The new asia bar on the 72nd floor was amazing, great views and was a good place to chill. Also the hotel is connected to a mall and mrt. Very convienient. Would i stay here again? I think i will the next time im in town.

Reviews.Title: “Had a nice time”
Reviews.Author: Duliabbot
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights there. The room was really nice. The breakfast consisted of a wide variety of food. I was quite surprised that the water bottles weren't complimentary. I had a nice night view of the city from my room. Overall it was a excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience everything the solo business traveller needs”
Reviews.Author: Travelingtribeof6
Reviews.Content: Good hotel good staff - no request was too much stayed on buiness and found it to be of a great standard - good Internet and comfortable beds no problem recommending

Reviews.Title: “Good Singapore option, well located and good value”
Reviews.Author: NicDD1
Reviews.Content: A hard to find good value hotel option in Singapore. Got the club option which included internet & breakfast - as this is a very big hotel, having breakfast on Club floor is worth it to avoid the scrum downstairs!! Pillow menu in the the rooms was a good touch. Rooms are getting a little old, but well maintained and this was not really an issue

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: tommyfromsydney
Reviews.Content: As soon as we arrived from the airport the staff were there to great us and whisk away our luggage. We were escorted to the front desk for check-in and greeted by name. ( I think they check the luggage tags and radio it through to the reception, but it's a nice touch) We had booked a standard room as part of a package deal with a cruise line and were pleasantly surprised to get a room on the 53rd floor overlooking the harbour. The views were spectacular, looking out over the Singapore Flyer and Marina Bay sands Hotel to the bustling harbour. The room itself was quite spacious. Nice TV. Good size safe. Fully stocked mini-bar (which we soon emptied and re-stocked with our own supplies from the supermarket) Breakfast was quite good too. Decent selection of food and an egg station. Only fault I could talk about were the bathrooms. They did seem a bit dated. Old fittings etc.And low water pressure in the shower. Overall, a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Big hotel in the center of the city with a panoramic view”
Reviews.Author: LinenBank
Reviews.Content: Swissotel Stamford is a big hotel. It has 1,261 guest rooms, but despite the big size it still is able to keep personal touch. Its location is perfect for shopping, concerts or pretty much anything. If you don't find what you are looking for in the vicinity you can take a train. The station is located just downstairs. The selection of restaurants is wide starting from simple foodcourt food to more pricey gourmet offering. For non-Asians my recommendation is to explore Asian Market Cafe or the KopiTiam. With reasonable price you can get something different (but not too different). Of course Equinox is the place to have dinner or drinks and enjoy the view over the city. Singapore looks just marvelous from the 70th floor. The only drawback with the hotel is that at times it is crowded; you may need to wait for the lift or the check-out takes a bit longer, but apart from that it offers a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great located hotel for Singapore”
Reviews.Author: CezJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last month for 2 nights before heading onto Borneo. Its location is great - basically across the street from Raffles and overlooking the Marina Bay Sands (the big hotel with the boat on top of it!). As it is the tallest hotel in Singapore the views are therefore stunning at night with panoramic views. The rooms are a little tired, but its very clean and the location and views make up for it. The Equinox bar at the roof is also worth a visit..... and check the champagne offers! We didn't get breakfast with our room but there's plenty of places to eat in the attached mall and by raffles. Also, the hop and hop off bus which we used stopped outside so its a great way to see the main sites in the short time we had. Highlights: Marina Bay Sands at night.... fab with lots going on, Equinox Bar, Long Bar in Raffles for cocktails (£££ but its fun!), China Town and Little India.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: stephanie101photo
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel last minute as a stopover to break my journey up from the UK to Australia. I was so sick on the flight over and really needed a clean, quiet place to stay to try and feel better before my continuing flight the next morning. I booked the executive suite which was immaculate and very quiet however the bathroom was quite small and pokey compared to other 5* hotels I have stayed in for less money paid. Saying that the breakfast was fantastic, with a great selection of food and in a small private room of only about 10 tables, so really nice and quiet. The area is fantastic and close to everything and is a 2 minute walk to the train station which takes you directly to the airport saving on cab fees. Overall an enjoyable stay and I definitely felt better for my flight!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great location, amazing views”
Reviews.Author: Tracey B
Reviews.Content: We booked the Classic Harbour View room (guaranteed to be a room on the higher floors) with a complimentary rollaway.Check in was relatively quick and we were upgraded to one of their Executive Club rooms on the 60th floor with complimentary buffet breakfast in the lounge on the same floor and complimentary drinks/nibbles from 5pm to 8pm (although we didn't get to try the latter as we were too busy doing other things!). We couldn't fault this hotel. The room and bathroom were both spotless and spacious. The view was spectacular and the room had a balcony. We didn't hear any noise from the street. All staff were very pleasant and helpful. The two pools were lovely. As others have said, the location is excellent with the MRT and shopping plaza/food court right there, Raffles Hotel over the road, and the Merlion a 10 minute walk away. We used a combination of MRT and taxis to get around and found everything easy to get to from here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location but very noisy”
Reviews.Author: AusBeagle
Reviews.Content: The Stamford has a fantastic location right above shops and the City Hall MRT making transport a breeze. Service is also excellent. Sadly that's where the positives end for me. The room was incredibly noisy meaning there is next to no soundproofing. Even on 23rd floor we could clearly hear construction noise all night and day as well as showers and toilet from neighbouring rooms. Sleep was horrendous the whole time. On Sunday morning we were woken by over an hour of bell ringing from the church at 5am!! Not happy. Bed was typical Asian style and very hard - pillows were also stiff and uncomfy, For a 5 star hotel, the rooms are pretty daggy. When we first checked in the room wasn't a renovated one and was atrocious. I asked for another room which was marginally better but you'd wonder when those tiles and carpets were ever in fashion! Gym was average. All in all, I loved the location but sleep quality ruined it for me.

Reviews.Title: “Old, rundown and desperately in need of a makeover”
Reviews.Author: Manav D
Reviews.Content: Rooms are quite spacious and service was generally good, however was very dated. Furniture and decor are ancient for the price being paid.

Reviews.Title: “Tired. Desperate for a renovation”
Reviews.Author: TheDinas
Reviews.Content: Hotel is attached to the metro and loads of shops, so from that perspective great hotel. Far from Orchard Road though where the bulk of the shops are located but a simple metro ride away. The most disappointing thing about this hotel is that is is simply TIRED, really dated and needs a good fresh make over. It's still clean and tidy and feels safe and comfortable but the price is quite high for what u get.

Reviews.Title: “Swissotel The Stamford - A superlative experience”
Reviews.Author: SantanuB11
Reviews.Content: Its gorgeous and conveniently located too. Right from Check in to check out , we found nothing wrong there . Room was spacious , huge bed, house keeping immaculate , toilet adequate . There are two separate sets of elevators , six for 1-38 floors, six for 39 and beyond . Less than 100 Meters away one side is the MRT station . On the other side is the underground mall. There you can get everything you require including lots of options of breakfast lunch and dinner .Marlion is walking distance away , en route you get the street food corner . If you opt for it , you get the bay view room . That magnifies the charm manifold. One of the best Hotels you can get into , in Singapore . You get free bus rides for Sentosa, Universal Studio too . Equinox is a bonus

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kieranmc0
Reviews.Content: Overall a very pleasant stay, nice room and good service. During my stay all toilets stopped working for a morning which took time to fix but the hotel left a selection of chocolates in the room as an apology. When paying a bill in one of the bars a colleagues credit card was misplaced by the bar staff and they could not find it, they did try to bill another credit card instead of aplogising and canceling the bill. The layout of the hotelm is a bit strange and finding the gym takes a bit of perserverance as its in the other hotel which is part of the complex. Very central and easy to access transport,

Reviews.Title: “Needs better facilities”
Reviews.Author: CarolPerthWA
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few days ago for 2 nights. The lobby is large but with limited seating and always busy and noisy. The bedroom was very dated, dark wood, very hard mattress and the worst shower I've experienced in a long time. The bathroom was fairly clean but there was chipping around the sink and it wasn't spotless. Toiletries provided were limited and not great quality. Breakfast was just OK but very noisy and extremely long queues for tables. We were offered a special breakfast price when we checked in, but our colleagues at the next desk (checking in at the same time) were not offered this. No free wifi available anywhere in the hotel and building works could be very clearly heard above the bar area. Good location, adjoining a shopping centre. Will choose a different hotel next time I visit Singapore. Have stayed at the Shangri La before, which was fantastic and in a completely different class to the Swissotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Raison89
Reviews.Content: We arrived much earlier than "check-in" time with the intention of dropping our luggage and heading out t explore. We were very pleasantly surprised to be able to check-in and have access to our room immediately. Check in service was fast, friendly and efficient. Our room was on the 58th floor with a fantastic view over the Marina Bay area and city. The bed was very comfortable and the room well set out and furnished. The Nespresso coffee maker was particularly nice to have. We were able to use a hospitality room on the day of our departure. It was very good to be able to freshen up and change clothes after a long day sight-seeing before we headed to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful & central place to stay, with very friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: BHewi
Reviews.Content: From our arrival the staff could not be more helpful & before we left helped book & select seats on our next flight. The Restaurant & food was excellent, the rooms were spacious. The closeness to Clark Quay, MRT & China Town were all a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: adnannalshaili
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel, during my last visit to singapore in NOV2011, the hotel has its own access to the shopping mall and underground tube station. the location is good, easy to get a taxi, near to the singapore flyer and the marelion park is just a walking distance from the hotel, but you will have to cross major roads(take care). I stayed in an excecutive room, with marina view, please select the marina view, or you will miss a lot, the marina from the hotel room, is just stunning specially at night. for food, there is macdonalds and other restaurents in the shopping complex. It is far from the santosa island and the singapore zoo, around 20 minutes drive in general I loved my stay in this hotel, but please take the executive room, with marina view, you will not regret

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, good service hotel”
Reviews.Author: Higasa
Reviews.Content: The Swissotel is in a great location - easy access to MRT, shopping centers and also the major sightseeing locations. The hotel itself is slightly old, but the good thing about that is the rooms are fairly spacious. The staff were also very helpful and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Check your Shower”
Reviews.Author: dancingqueen11
Reviews.Content: After my Sister and I spent 8+ hours flying to Singapore - the first thing we wanted was a shower. Not impressed to discover shower head broken and hanging off wall - and no matter how much paper I tried to hold it up with - couldn't have a shower!!! Then we got this desperate guy in Kopitiam Restaurant trying to chat us up (which was pathetic) and made us feel very uncomfortable. To top it off - the next morning we had to line up - yes line up - to wait for a table for breakfast. There were two queues into two different restaurants - have never, ever had to line up for breakfast before and had to wait for 10 minutes - just standing there like sheep. Also, wasn't impressed with these great big red mugs to drink our tea out of - I suppose there is a first for everything. Had another stop over the following week and then put into a smoking room - I think we were being punished by the friendly (not) woman in Reception. Sadly, this is one Hotel I wouldn't feel confident recommending to anyone I know visiting Singapore - sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Good but there are better”
Reviews.Author: lbo80
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Swissotel on a 10 day business trip to Singapore. Check in was a disappointment. Though hotel was being paid my my company the check in person wanted my credit card imprint for the cost of the entire stay. I couldn't allow this amount to be held on my personal credit card. Fortunately my company managed to sort out the confusion for me, but in the meantime the front desk kept chasing me for payment e ery day. Not a good start. Hotel itself is fine, central location, good transport links. The shopping mall is convenient for food etc but means you can expect high prices for bland food offerings. You need to get away from this tourist trap to really taste the delights and bargains Singapore actually offers. Even a few blocks walk can really help your wallet. Breakfast choice excellent but as a large hotel don't expect a relaxing breakfast unless you arrive early. It can get quite chaotic after 8am. Breakfast staff friendly. No free wifi or even reasonably charged wifi is a big negative. The cost is simply ridiculous. Use Starbucks instead, Didn't eat in hotel or use mini bar as prices very high. Room on 25th floor ok but very 1990s. Also faced Suntec construction site which means sounds of machinery from 5am every day including Sunday. I believe the site will be finished by 2016 so you should be ok after that. In the meantime, the windows aren't particularly soundproof.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Hotel Expensive and a little tired!”
Reviews.Author: TravellingWilburys
Reviews.Content: We booked into The Swissotel The Stamford for one night stop over on our way to Cambodia at the end of March 2012. I had requested an early check via telephone prior to our departure, when we arrived we found this had not been noted. However the Reception staff were very obliging and we were able to get into our room early and refresh ourselves before taking a trip out to the Zoo. The hotel is in a great position overlooking the Harbour and is placed next to a shopping centre which incorporates lots of restaurants, food halls, bars and of course shops. The centre can be reached via a walkway on the second floor of the hotel. We found Singapore extremely expensive, for everything. Eating out was very pricey, but having said that we had a lovely meal at a restaurant belonging to the adjacent Fairmont. The dinner was a buffet affair with foods from around the world. However the cost was approximately AUD80 per head and although the food was good, you would be very pushed to eat enough food to justify that cost. Drinks in our hotel bar were also very expensive, AUD14.00 for a weak Gin and Tonic. My husband was able to take advantage of a two for one offer on a beer, the beer was about AUD11.00 so as you can imagine eating or drinking out in Singapore is not for the faint hearted or for those on a strict budget. Our breakfasts which again were excellent but not included in our tariff cost AUD45.00 per head (expensive by anyone's standards) and because the cafes in the shopping centre did not open until about 11.00am each morning there really was not much choice but to eat in the hotel. Our room was spotlessly clean and was very comfortable, we also had a spectacular view. However, as other reviewers have commented, the bathroom and certain aspects of the room were very tired. The bathroom really needs updating when compared with hotels rooms of similar cost around the World. It was very clean, but the shower/bath tap configuration was difficult to work out and quite old fashioned. Overall we did enjoy our brief stay in Singapore very much and could not praise the hotel's staff enough, they were very attentive and it is the staff that make this hotel. We would think twice about stopping over in Singapore again, as it is one of the most expensive cities we have stayed in on our travels, which is a shame as Singapore is a beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not exactly up to date facilities”
Reviews.Author: hahafie
Reviews.Content: I was here for business and i was travelling with my husband. We got an upgrade to a room overlooking the harbour which we love. Thank you. However soon we began to realize that the tv remote and hot shower were not working. We were expecting everything to work being in singapore! All in all it was value for money considering the location. Could be sharper, swissotel.

Reviews.Title: “Noise, confusion, pack lobbies”
Reviews.Author: IndyGuynside
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at several hotels in Singapore and this was my first time staying at The Samford Swisshotel. Upon arrival from Changi, the front door staff was alert, attentive and helpful. But when I entered the lobby that is when I got the idea that this was not going to necessarily be a restful visit. To be fair, the hotel is priced accordingly for what you get and it is part of a complex including the Fairmount Hotel and a large shopping center. It is also fairly close to Changi, so used by overnight connecting travelers plus huge numbers of Qantas crews. When I was there I noted at least 40 Qantas crews trying to check into the "crews only" area. They were clogging the lobby making the lobby resemble a airport check in hall or a busy train or bus station. It was really uncomfortable. All this makes for a really busy place. The lobby is loud, disorganized, baggage stacked everywhere to a point I thought it was part of the airport baggage operation. There were several staff members doing their best to help guests, but the noise level is so loud that it was hard to hear the staff member to check me in. The room I was given was OK, close to the elevation and normal size. All include an iron and board and the internet connection was acceptable. Nothing fancy here with minimal amenities, little bitty soap bars, old rather worn carpet and lighting controls from the early 90's. But the room did have a new flat screen TV. But the bed was OK and I slept well. Next morning I had breakfast on the 4th floor and the food was great. Everything you need including cooked to order eggs. But the venue is again loud, cold, and difficult to navigate. Staff was trying, but service was slow, disorganized and generally lacking. I ended up filling my own coffee numerous times. Again, they were trying hard, but to me there were a lack of staff and nobody really running the show looking for problems. The exercise facility is located in the Willow Stream Spa. The facility is too small for this large of a hotel and is strangely organized on different levels, with a cramped cardio room where machines are touching each other. The locker room is dated, but the sauna and steam facilities and showers are OK. In general this is basically an airport hotel with airport type amenities. Don't expect a calm restful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel, hard bed”
Reviews.Author: MeegieD
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel made me happy. The location, the staff, the rooms, but damn, the beds were so hard. I rejected other hotels that had reviews saying they had hard beds. If I'd known I'd've stayed elsewhere. It's sad because everything else was so good

Reviews.Title: “Met and exceeded all expectations”
Reviews.Author: HL2098
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Stamford Swissotel in Singapore for 3 nights after a cruise with some friends. Check-in was efficient and fast. We arrived at the hotel at 9am and only one of the rooms were ready. The bell staff took care of all our bags and put them in the one room. The concierge staff members were extremely friendly and helpful with suggestions and directions. The rooms were spacious and well maintained with views of city and river. The hotel was very conveniently located, right above a MRT station and a shopping mall with a variety of shops and dining establishments. This is our second stay at the Stamford and it met and exceeded all our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: 7_0f_9
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one week last April. Overall it’s a OK hotel, good location, but nothing exceptional. Some details: 1） No WIFI. All 5 stars I have been to provide free WIFI, so I was shocked when I found out they did not even have WIFI. 2) The room service send coconut drink that was expired. I spit it out immediately but the horrible taste was not gone until 2 hours later. They sent a replacement but DID NOT APOLOGIZE. 3) The spa was free. But the treatments were seriously overpriced. So if you want a proper spa treatment , i.e facial or message., go somewhere else. There was a naked woman walking around in the spa, which makes people really uncomfortable. I am not sure if she was a hotel guest. She may be the member of the spa? 4) The housekeeping staffs are really friendly and polite. But the receptionists at the front desks and the staffs answering the phones are not as friendly. A bit smile will make a big difference! I will stay in this hotel again end April and early May. This time for two weeks. I hope this time I wont get the expired coconut drink again!

Reviews.Title: “Five star hotel, outdoor pool and tennis courts, in the tallest hotel in SE Asia”
Reviews.Author: Others_on_Lost
Reviews.Content: Extremely convenient to the Suntec convention center. Great service. Be warned that the wireless Internet costs around 28 Singapore dollars daily! I paid the little extra for the view of water, gorgeous view, especially from my room on 52nd floor. Pool is nice, it is located outdoors on 8th floor. They also have a separate kids pool, shallower. I went in March, it was warm enough to swim certainly. I would definitely stay here again for business, and would certainly consider staying for pleasure if I were sightseeing downtown sites.

Reviews.Title: “The right place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Charlie7fR
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really nice. Located in the best part of town, connected to malls, the best restaurants. Subway is just a 1 minute walk. The room view is amazing, I stayed at floor 57. The room is perfect, light are controlled with a remote control. Bed was comfortable, bathroom was big. Staff is really nice. I stayed at the execute club and breakfast was just for the club members, nice! The only thing I do not recommend is dining room, was not that good for westerns.

Reviews.Title: “impeccable, unique view”
Reviews.Author: corinaZ
Reviews.Content: I don`t really know with what to start...the rooms are impeccable, huge, clean and cleaned thoroughly every day. We had a room with the view to the port...breathtaking, especially during evening. Breakfast allowed us to taste indian, chinese, western cuisine...with an abundance of fresh fruit and vegetables, but also with omlettes made on spot, just in front of you (in order to satisfy every possible preference) . Best breakfast I ever had in ages... The staff is polite and helpful in any imaginable way. I am sorry that I cannot find my words to cover better the exceptional impression that The Stamford made on us. The only drawback is that you don`t have wi fi included in the room`s price. But after all, who needs web all day long:)) The conclusion: perfect in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: AussieChris_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 nights and could not fault this hotel except for the lifts - they could be very slow. Our room was on the 26th floor with a view over the harbour. Being on the 26th floor gave you privacy so our curtains were never closed. We had a magnificent view of the harbour and Marina Bay Sands every night being able the watch the light show from Marina Bay Sands, and watched sunrise every morning which is around 7.00am. Our room was not overly large but, as we were there to sleep and shower it was quite big enough with a king size bed, decent size bathroom, flat screen TV, what more do you need. We had breakfast every morning in the hotel. One of the highlights of travelling to foreign countries is the selection of breakfast fare and there was no shortage here. The wait staff are very friendly, helpful and attentive. The location of this hotel makes it ideal for exploring Singapore. It is situated on top of an MRT station. What a train system! Maximum time for waiting for a train - 4 minutes. This underground system takes you anywhere you want to go in a matter of minutes and for very little cost.

Reviews.Title: “A magical stay at the Stamford”
Reviews.Author: theredone
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Swissotel Stamford was perfect from start to finish. I chose the hotel based on reviews on tripadvisor and was willing to splurge a bit more as it was a present for my mother's 50th birthday. My funds only went so far so I booked a regular room at the hotel. On arriving to the hotel our luggage was quickly whisked away - something us Finns have a hard time getting used to - and we were greeted and checked in by Aldo. He was extremely professional and friendly and surprised us with an upgrade to a Harbour view room thanks to my mom's birthday. The room itself was surprisingly spacious, us three ladies with a lot of luggage and even with an extra bed had plenty of space to move around. The view from our 56th floor room was amazing. That alone would ensure I will go back to the Stamford. The pool area was surprisingly nice, there were always plenty of chairs available and the staff there were very attentive and came around with cold towels and a complimentary glass of juice every now and then. The gym was well equipped and had a nice atmosphere with quality exercise equipment. We didn't dine at the hotel but instead used the food court in the mall attached to the hotel which catered perfectly to our needs. If there is anything I'd like to change, it would be the cost of the internet which many have mentioned before me. Also, more places to hang your towel in the bathroom would have been convenient. There was nowhere to place a handtowel for example. Overall the staff at the hotel was always ready to answer our questions and provided us with service we didn't see coming, exceeding our expectations. The hotel constantly managed to surprise us in a positive way, and I will whole-heartedly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Swissotel is great”
Reviews.Author: Loizides
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed there and would stay again. I stayed in the classic room which was spacious and clean. It was on the 56 floor so had a great view of Boat Quay and the city. The staff are all friendly, helpful and very polite. The pool was great with plenty of Sun beds. It is located 15 minutes by foot the main business section of Singapore. There are lots restaurants and shop in, around and under the hotel, along with the MRT (subway) system which is easy and cheap to use.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel a little tired”
Reviews.Author: D_M_Roach
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here many times with work. Singapore is very expensive nowadays. Most restaurants and bars in hotel are not cheap. The pool area is lovely. The hotel is attached to a shopping mall so all your needs are taken care of. Fast food outlets. Coffee places and restaurants abound. No free wi fi in hotel which is rubbish as it costs so little these days. The staff are friendly but this is a very very busy hotel so try not to catch the reception staff at the end of their shift. Beautiful bar on top of hotel so save up.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: anton36
Reviews.Content: Large and very clean room, awesome view to CBD (15min walking distance), shopping mall and MRT station at ground floor...a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “a good stay”
Reviews.Author: nokwin G
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in a very good location. Rooms very clean. Staff very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Tired, too big and impersonal”
Reviews.Author: Irishstandards
Reviews.Content: I have been staying in this hotel for many years however I have just had a 2 year gap. I was amazed to return to find that it was exactly how I left it....still stuck in a time warp. The lobby is large and well lit with natural light but incredibly busy all day long and the bell staff seem to enjoy cordoning off areas to dump huge amounts of luggage visible for all to see. I know I personally would not want my suitcases on display in such a manner where someone could rather easily snatch it. The front desk staff were efficient however not especially helpful or friendly however they did get the job done. The rooms I found to be very old. I unfortunately did not get a particularly high up floor (I was on level 21) and I was overlooking the Fairmont and pool area. But there was a large balcony which was pleasant enough to stand out in (but alas no seats out here to enjoy the views). The furniture was ancient with marks and scratches all over. The beds were comfortable however but my white bed sheets had really seen better days with stains all over them. The bathroom is in need of serious upgrading however and both my shower and sink took a long time to drain. I also found it incredibly irritating that there were no easily accessible power plugs near the beds to plug in my laptop. I did not use the Wifi as it was rather expensive and I could have received free wifi in the lobby. The thing that really irked me about this hotel was the lift waiting times. With 6 lifts serving my half of the building I would have expected a maximum wait of 60 seconds but so many times I found myself standing for up to 3 or 4 minutes waiting for a lift, even from the lobby up. At one point I arrived in the lift area of the lobby to see a line spilling out around the corner just to get into a lift. The pool area however was a lovely area. Shared with the Fairmont it was large with plenty of options for food. Also the spa underneath the pool area was perfect (although pretty pricey). Also the gym contained all the equippment you may need. I decided not to attempt room service or eating in the hotel facilities as the hotel is directly atop a fantastic food hall in the mall. I found a wonderful Dim Sum restaurant underneath which I ate in most days for lunch and ventured out for dinner most evenings. All in all there is a lot of potential in this hotel however I feel it is just too big. Great if you have a room with a view but if you dont, then there is not much to write home about. The staff are mediocre, the rooms are below par so it is really only the location that makes this place a winner.

Reviews.Title: “Very good but not the best in the city”
Reviews.Author: YS1_11
Reviews.Content: Great service, great breakfast, nice room. Even though I was on the executive floor, the breakfast downstairs (on the 2nd floor) was something to write about. Don't miss it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, not the best customer service”
Reviews.Author: FromNYinDC
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. My room was great and location is decent. I was just disappointed in the customer service - I left a couple of things back and it took many emails and days for them to respond back that they didn't find anything, which is still hard for me to believe. Also, it's easy to get lost at the mall downstairs and directions are almost non-existent to get back to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OK for business, look elsewhere for leisure”
Reviews.Author: radski
Reviews.Content: I traveled on business, with family in tow. We had room with fantastic view on 55th floor, presumably thanks to booking with corporate travel agent and super-comfortable beds. My parents were that lucky ended up on lower floor overlooking the backyard and got told they can't be upgraded/moved as they booked a room with wifi included. Rooms range from spacious (overlooking marina), to smallish (overlooking the backyard), clean well furnished, but bathrooms are looking tired. Wifi in our room was expensive ($30/day per device!), so ended up buying microsims from Singtel ($15 per week for 1GB, 3rd floor in the mall below). Everywhere closes really early for dinner - 24 horu McDonalds downstairs had to save more then one night. Pool area is just not pleasant at all; that was disappointing for my other half and the little one. The hotel is really well located, staff are friendly. Overall a mixed bag, I would gladly stay again on business, for leisure I'm sure there must be better places in singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Lucky upgrade”
Reviews.Author: Thalia8
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on its excellent location, not expecting much from the room after reading reviews on tripadvisor. However, the charming check in staff upgraded us - without being asked! - to a premier suite on the 61st floor. We had a balcony with amazing views of the city, a large well-appointed room with excellent bedlinen on the king size bed, a huge flat screen TV, a desk and armchairs. The room was extremely spacious, the bathroom with good toiletries, everything one needed. The carpet, however, had seen better days. The location atop the train station and shopping centre was great. We breakfasted at Starbucks downstairs where we could access wifi free.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location but rooms are pretty old”
Reviews.Author: ajcph
Reviews.Content: Was quite impressed with the check-in service the moment we got off the taxi. Facilities wise hasn't changed much since the last 25 years we were here. Was a bit surprised there was no key card holder to slip in your key card the moment you open the door so you need to walk in the dark room to get the lights on. But enough of the bad part, hotel services are very good. They address you name the moment they pick up the phone when calling from the room. MRT is just down below. Though located on the 43rd floor, elevators move super fast. Baby cot for our infant is also very nice. I would indeed like to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly!”
Reviews.Author: Messyhair99
Reviews.Content: We stayed in grand room 3370 and although a tiny bit worn we really thought it was great. From an efficient check in by lovely staff to the hospitality suite on the day of check out, it was wonderful. I will stress again how friendly the staff were! Good location! A shared pool with the hotel next door. Proper baby cot (not a silly travel fold one) was provided for our 16 month old daughter plus her own toiletries (baby wash, talc, wipes etc). Phone calls to room service, housekeeping etc were all answered quick and they identified you by name. Would stay there again. Next door to Raffles, shopping centre, stunted city etc. great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good!”
Reviews.Author: lurcher500
Reviews.Content: Recently I stayed again in the Swissotel Stamford and had a good experience. I was happy on check in when I heard we were being upgraded to club level but disappointingly the room given was much much smaller than the room I had stayed in on my previous visit. I would have assumed that an upgrade would mean same or better room but alas no....The room allocated was quite small....The upgrade did ensure however that we had the benefit of the club executive lounge which provided complimentary cocktails and nibbles in the evening and free internet access...this was nice but to be honest I would have foregone this for a decent size room...Swissotel take note! I made use of the Willow Spa (the steam room, sauna and jacuzzi) and this was quite pleasant although spa reception should provide more info...I had to probe for directions...Breakfast again at this hotel was superb! Overall conclusion....club level should have more comfortable bigger rooms....

Reviews.Title: “Great Tourist Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sandgropers2
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Stayed 3 nights. Situated around the Raffles Centre precinct and across the road from the Raffles Hotel. Connected by underground arcades to the Marina Precinct and Suntec centre where we were able to book all our tours on the Hippo Bus. Everything you need is available around the Swiss Hotel including a vast range of eating options. Visit the Equinox bar on the 70th floor in the evening for the best view in town. Staff were fabulous. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel Supurb location.”
Reviews.Author: debcox
Reviews.Content: We stopped off here twice on our travels and were very impressed with the service, standards and location. If you get a room high up you will get amazing views of the city and try to get one of the pavilion. The room was spotless and had everything you would expect of this standard and it is linked to a large shopping mall and mrt station and of course its only a short walk to boat and Clark quays. Breakfast is also amazing and buffet style so a vast choice to suit everyone. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “A tired well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Taymur M
Reviews.Content: This 70 story building spreads into a 4 story shopping mall with international brands, fast food chains, restaurants, money changer, ticket booth for cultural events, supermarket, foot massage (reflexology) Center and an MRT(underground train) station. Besides the undenial centrality of location, key areas of interest for you will be a few train stations away or a short walk. The link to a shopping mall and an MRT station means this hotel has constant foot traffic in the lobby which is tiny in proportion to the hotel. At any one time 10 to 15 people can sit in the lobby and there is no complimentary wifi in it. I suppose free wifi would attract many non paying guests in the lobby but it is a service offered by many hotels of this rating and calibre. My check in was swift, so swift that the desk did not mention the complimentary wifi with my room and briefs of many other services offered by the hotel. That said, my checkout experience was excellent as the desk asked me about my stay followed by a series of questions including 'Have you checked the safe deposit?', 'do you have your travel documents?' etc. The inconsistency of service is perhaps due to the constant hustle and bustle. I checked in at noon and checked out at 5 am. There might be two pools in this hotel but their pear shapes do not allow for laps, strange! The rooms were spacious, comfortable with a fantastic view but 'tired'. I predict renovations in future. Personally I value service more than many factors and thus If I were ever stay to again at this hotel then it will be for the location only with an expectation of experiencing a varied level of service.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: JennyKiz
Reviews.Content: Room is pretty old, but the location is great. Close to the business district and getting a cab was not a problem. Service was a little off - came back at almost midnight one night and found that the room hasn't been cleaned. Complained to the Manager and they were pretty apologetic and compensated by offering us a free car service to our next service - really appreciated that.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service and unreal location”
Reviews.Author: Katherine P
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here 3 times and always have been well taken care of! The staff are helpful but the best thing about this hotel is the location! it is a very large hotel and sometimes waiting for the lifts are frustrating, the views are amazing and facilities fantastic. Some of the hotel is newly renovated some I think is older, I have only stayed in the renovated rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Sweet for a stopover!”
Reviews.Author: jimjam76
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel for a two night stopover on the way back from Australia.Property is right in the heart of Singapore,right above City Hall MRT. It's the tallest Hotel in Singapore so you cant miss it! We stayed on the 26th floor and all rooms have open balcony which is quite scary but offers great views of the city. The rooms are clean and spacious and the facilities include a couple of pools in an 8th floor garden and bar area which is very relaxing after a days sightseeing. We only had breakfast in the Hotel and the food was of a good standard. The staff are all friendly and helpful but it's a busy Hotel so you may wait a while for bags to be delivered on check in.Loads to do in Singapore,I reccommend the 'Night Safari' and Universal Studio's is great for all ages. If you want some decent cheap authentic food head to Chinatown or Little India,great food and very reasonable it may look shabby but EVERYTHING in Singapore is clean so don't be worried and tuck in! Great stay but quite any expensive place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Old & ugly standard room, pay for Internet, Cockroaches”
Reviews.Author: Rem01234
Reviews.Content: We had first standard room 3365 which was very old styled and had some defects in the wash room. So we decided to ask for another room. We got standard room 3660 which only differences were the floor, a nicer carpet and no technical defects in the wash room... but cockroaches. Oh man.. never seen a bigger cockroach than that one. We first thought there was some other reason why the mini bar was empty.. but than we came to the conviction that this room must have been cockroach infected before. As the cleaning lady found the cockroach they immediately came to do some checking up.. . If you think this was all which stressed my nerves.. you are wrong. Here you need to pay 29 SGD for 24 hours wlan internet access. Your options? business center. The center is not in the hotel. You need to walk through the shopping center to the Fairmont hotel where you will find that 15 minutes cost 9 SGD..... ok. Lets pay for 24 h 29 SGD... connecting, connection.. at least back on floor 36 in the cockroach infected standard room number 60 you will have a very bad connection breaking up sometimes.. other options: none. The free Singapore wlan networks are blocked. bad stay

Reviews.Title: “Great place with lots to do”
Reviews.Author: jamesccasterline
Reviews.Content: Excellent location and is right by Raffles City shopping center. Numerous restaurants interesting lobby bar. Great view from Cityscape on 70th floor. Room decent with lots of amenities. Cruise line paid for room so suppose it wasn't too expensive. Good desk and bellman service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: TwoGoodFriends
Reviews.Content: Excellent location situated above the City Hall MRT and Raffles City shopping centre. Also opposite The Raffles and easy walking distance to Clarke Quay, Boat Quay, Chinatown, Fort Canning, Marina Sands Accommodation was spotlessly clean, beautiful view from my room, bed was a bit too firm (and I like a firm bed). Room is a little tired but still very comfortable. Pool area was very relaxing. Only complaint was wi-fi. Only available in public areas and only if you bought a drink. Wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. Staff were very helpful and allowed us a very early checkin (6.30am) and a late 2pm checkout.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good accessibility”
Reviews.Author: Anatomywoo
Reviews.Content: Very good location with good accessibility - just above the Cityhall MRT station. We went from the airport to the hotel in less than an hour and at S$2 per person only (S$3 for single ticket, S$1 refundable). Also the Cityhall MRT station is right in the center of the overall MRT system, i.e. don't have to "change-here-and-there". Very good view - Got an "upgrade" to the harbour view with a "relatively" high floor Food (inside hotel) Good - breakfast was good in location and variety Food (outside hotel) Good variety of food - two food courts in the shopping mall beside the hotel Good service - considering the height X no. of rooms X no. of guest X no. of request = the service provided by the staff was good Only negative point - no free Wifi and charges too steep for purchase Wifi

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: thesutex
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located perfectly just on top of the City Hall MRT station. A good place to use as base for exploring Singapore. Great staff and a nice bar at the top of the hotel (as well as a top level club) Downside: The rooms, which seems a bit dated and not that modern. Also that a hotel like this doesnt have free Wifi is silly, and even if you have to pay the prices are outrageous, better just use Starbucks wifi around the corner,

Reviews.Title: “Great location ;great view ; average rooms”
Reviews.Author: Bangalore-Gypsy
Reviews.Content: I choose Swissotel primarily due to the proximity to MRT station - city hall mrt is right below the Hotel. I stayed here for 8 days, daily commuting between Hotel and Changi Business Park. Checks all the boxes on convenience and location. Most of the food spots like Clark Quay and Boat quay are less than 10 minute walk from the Hotel; so is malls like Hunan , Raffles city mall etc. Rooms facing the harbor provide the best view. Its quite an experience to stand in the balcony- every room has one- and soak up the night view of the city and harbor .Hotel shares its healthclub ( Willow spa) with another hotel situated on the adjacent building. The view from the restaurants on 70th floor is quite stunning. Raffles city mall, which is right next to the Hotel, has quite an excellent food court ,as well as a 24 hour Mc Donalds. Found the breakfast/lunch options in the mall to be far more attractive than restaurants in hotel. Really a boon if you want to have a late night bite after serious bar hopping. However i found the room size and the interiors to be quite mediocre. Also in-spite of staying for 8 days at a stretch , there were no complimentary drinks or customer service status calls- something they could learn from premium Indian Hotels. Overall a very good hotel; but did not live up-to the hype !

Reviews.Title: “Good Views. Rooms Need Updating”
Reviews.Author: jlee434
Reviews.Content: If you want an awesome view of the city, this is THE hotel to stay in. I stayed here for about a week, and they gave a room on the 57th floor with sweeping views of the harbor which were spectacular. Service was excellent, and all staff I dealt with was extremely professional and courteous. The downside to the hotel are the rooms. In my room the bed and wall coverings seemed a little worn and the furniture and fixtures looked a bit dated. More importantly, the A/C was terrible and never cooled the room any lower than 73F degrees. It was so bad that I complained the first night and was moved to a different room on a different floor with the exact same results. Normally I wouldn't mind so much, but in the Singapore heat I like my room to be ice cold. Secondly, there was Wifi in the rooms, but it was outrageously expensive. I needed to use it for business purposes, but I've stayed in similar hotels where it's either provided for free or for half the cost. If a nice view doesn't mean much to you, I'd stay in a different hotel such as the Ritz or the Fairmont next door. If you want a good view, this is the best bet in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Very good service and experience overall”
Reviews.Author: Reklawed
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a couple for a week in Feb/March 2012. We chose Swissotel due to the location and because we got a cheaper internet rate and I'm glad we stayed here. Although this wasn't our first trip to Singapore, I completely agree with the recommendation that first time visitors stay in this hotel. The location is wonderful - on top of a shopping centre with food court, many restaurant choices in the building and nearby, an MRT (subway) station and walking distance from many popular destinations. My only criticisms are that there is no free wifi, and internet is extremely expensive to buy from the hotel (S$28 per day); the bathrooms do not have hairdryers or power points to plug in your own, and I found the bed very hard and there was no pillow selection. The pillows on offer were feather pillows and foam (I think) but both were very squishy. Apart from those minor complaints, I couldn't fault the hotel: the staff are excellent, friendly and helpful, the views are out of this world, and the location is so central. Next time I will bring my own pillow!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BobB53
Reviews.Content: Located right in the middle of the colonial area of Singapore, right next to a tube entrance, the Swissotel The Stamford is ideally located for those visiting the city. The rooms are large and have excellent views over the harbour, sea and city. The staff are truly wonderful - in particular the front desk, concierge and restaurant/bars. The hotel is well served with some excellent restaurants and bars which, being 70 floors up have truly magnificent views !!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service!”
Reviews.Author: bluetteberna
Reviews.Content: The family spent our Singapore get-away at the Swissotel The Stamford. The location is perfect for first timers...MRT, Malls, restaurants, sight-seeing, etc. all walking distance! The hotel staff are very friendly especially the Filipino staff. From the time you step foot on the hotel you will fell welcomed because the staff is very helpful and accommodating. You feel pampered all the time. Breakfast is wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Full Recommendation”
Reviews.Author: Keef54M
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in Feb 2012 - what a great place to stay, I would recommend asking for a view of Marina Bay Hotel (the ship), what an amazing view. The staff are exceptionally helpful and friendly, the breakfast offered a vast choice of English and Asian cuisine and also a chef designated to cooking any kind of eggs on request. The hotel is above a shopping mall with lots of designer stores, and an enormous dining quarter where the choice is vast. Taxi's are cheap and you're not too far from anywhere, actually opposite Raffles hotel where a Singapore Sling is a must (£12)! If you use the mini bar I reccommend popping down to the mall to replace what you consumed at a 1\4 of the price! The pool area is also very good, relaxed and HOT! Free wifi only available in the lobby. Singapore is a great place to be!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, everything works. Great for business and family alike.”
Reviews.Author: hunnybunx
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel for its' fantastic location .. The mall is just next door, with loads of food places(inexpensive, mid range to higher), an MRT station just down stairs. and everything else within walking distance -- Orchard Road, Marina Bay Sands(er, ok... a long walk but still walk-able!), the Esplande(Theatres on the Bay), 2 other malls, Suntec City (Convention halls), the IT Mall (Funan), Boat Quay, Bugis settlement, Arab Street etc. Rooms are comfortable, everything works. The view from the top bars are great.. Maybe a tad small is the pool for those with kids -- but it's there..and it's good enough for a splash before the family head off to nearby Sentosa for Universal Studios or the beach.. I'd always recommend 1st time business visitors to stay here -- it's a good jump-off point to the central business district(1 train station), and you have the option of seeing the touristy side of Singapore or the local everyday folks just a stone's throw away ..

Reviews.Title: “Really Good!”
Reviews.Author: Ducimus
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on business during the 2012 Singapore Air Show. While the hotel was definitely busy due to the massive influx of people attending the show, the service at The Stamford was superb. Our rate did not include breakfast, which was not a concern given the conveniently located shopping mall adjacent to the hotel. Further, after long business days, it was nice to be able to grab a quick bite. The public transit options and convenience to other Singapore attractions made The Stamford an excellent choice for any business traveller. The large rooms and excellent facilities are top-notch by any standard. I would definitely go again.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch, except no free wifi!”
Reviews.Author: KR_EDINBURGH
Reviews.Content: Great stay overall, room on 55th floor with superb views to boat quay. Spacious room with kingsize bed, very comfortable. Excellent location above Raffles city where we purchased breakfast food from 'Bread Talk' instead of eating the vastly overpriced hotel options. Also good for beer in the supermarket in the same mall. Staff very helpful and efficient and as we got a good rate it proved to be a pretty decent value stay. Also enjoyed the swimming pool with is shared with Fairmont hotel. Highly recommend Swissotel overall. The only downside is that the wifi is not inclusive - and costs alot. When will these hotels stop ripping people off and just allow people to use the wifi as a complimentary service?! That's why I won't give it 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay.”
Reviews.Author: motowninchapelhill
Reviews.Content: I was here on business for only one night but it was wonderful. Upon arrival, the doorman took out my luggage and with great slight of hand, flipped over my luggage tag, then greeted me by name, which he broadcast on his radio (i didnt notice that) until walking into the lobby, others already knew my name. Then I noticed they were all wearing earpieces. I was whisked to The Stamford Crest check in on the 65th floor where they upgraded me on the spot. I had a view of Singapore with two balconies. Its a shame i spent so little time in the room. Breakfast in the Club was superb and the staff were all wonderful. The hotel is in the perfect location. I would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Breath taking views”
Reviews.Author: keenor
Reviews.Content: Book the room facing Marina Sands and the view was breath taking at night. You can see the laser show and I reckon it is better than staying in the Marina Sand hotel itself. Room was great, very spacious with 2 double beds. Used the gym and there is a big swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: JenaliScotland
Reviews.Content: Check in took ages.  The staff were very slow and it took them 25 mins to get us checked in.  They offered us  to upgrade to the exec club rooms for an extra 110 SDG per night.  But the rooms was not available until 8pm. We didn't fancy waiting around so stayed with our existing city room.   The room was adequate but not of 5 star standard on comparison to other 5 star hotels in similar price range.   I would not recommend this hotel or stay here again.  Room looked a bit dated, TV controls sometimes worked, sometimes didn't. Minibar prices a real rip off, even by minibar standards. Wifi not free$9 for 1 hr or $30 for 24 hrs. Brekkie also a rip off so didn't take it. General snobby/condescending attitude of lobby area staff. Couldn't accommodate a late check out. Generally thought the hotel is perhaps riding on past reputation, it's certainly not up there with other Singapore hotels at same price point, so don't understand it's high regard on review websites.

Reviews.Title: “Best views in Singapore!”
Reviews.Author: takateazi
Reviews.Content: The new Marina Bay Sands hotel is an amazing building, so I'm not sure why people would want to stay there and look at other buildings when you can stay here and look at that building. I found Stamford to have one of the best views in Singapore (Second to Altitude). Rooms are large but have a dated decor. This hotel can be slightly expensive as breakfast is charged at an extra rate but with so many places to eat in Singapore you can grab breakfast just outside the hotel. With the MRT right outside and Raffles Hotel across the road what more can you ask for? Pool area is quite large however being such a large hotel, the deck chairs get filled up quite early. I would definately stay here again for the right price.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Jill101
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed in this hotel and both times have been impressed by its seamless service. This time around we got an upgrade to a harbourview room and had a spectacular vista of the new Marina Bay Sands hotel. However the real beauty of the Swissotel is its location. For early risers there is a great walk down to the Marina Mandarin and then across the new footbridge to the Marina Bay Sands, around the waterfront to the Fullerton precinct then back up through some parkland to the the hotel. The Swissotel is located above the Raffles City shopping centre which includes a supermarket. And it is right at City Hall MRT station, so for people who come to Singapore for the shopping it is a quick trip out to Orchard to visit the Ion Mall and the Far East Plaza, or over to Bugis for the shopping there. It is also convenient for getting to tourist spots like the Botanic Gardens and Clarke Quay. Rooms are very comfortable, staff friendly and if you have time, there is a nice pool. This hotel really rates for its high standard and location.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for business traveller”
Reviews.Author: CocoonHanoi
Reviews.Content: - Location: ideal location on top of MRT. Lots of food choice at Raffles City - Room is ok. The room with balcony with harbour view is really nice. The DGW tea provided is a nice touch - Service: efficient check in and check out

Reviews.Title: “Fab views! wow!”
Reviews.Author: Dee1828
Reviews.Content: This was a fantastic stay! We had great views over the beautiful city, from our balcony up high. A free bottle of red for our honeymoon, was a nice touch aswell! Buffet breakfast had lots of choice, and was very tasty! Room was clean, neat and large. Very comfortable bed! Lovely drinks at the top bar are a bit pricey, but what do you expect with a view like that. So no complaint there!

Reviews.Title: “Good location with great views”
Reviews.Author: kwan3452
Reviews.Content: As many reviewers have commented, this hotel's location is ideal for travelling around Singapore as it is located above a MRT (the Singapore version of the metro) station with two connecting lines. using the MRT is a rapid and comfortable way of getting around. It's also connected to a number of malls via underground air-conditioned malls which keep you out of the sun and high humidity in tropical Singapore. You could spend most of the time shopping and eating within a kilometre of the hote. I definitely agree that it is one of the best locations available in Singapore. For those who are into exercise and gyms, you have to proceed to the Fairmont Hotel next door as it's located on the 6th floor of the Fairmont. I find the internet costs expensive and suggest that you go to the Starbucks located on the ground floor of the shopping centre and accessed the free wifi rather than pay to use it in the hotel. Get a drink and watch the world go by as it's located outside the entrance to the MRT station.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, clean and comfortable in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Sassare
Reviews.Content: From the moment you enter the hotel you are met by the friendly and efficient staff, helping your jet-lagged body quickly through standard hotel routines and placing you and your luggage in a large room with a fantastic sea/city view. Included is a nice balcony, great bed and an excellent breakfast covering european, american and asian specialities (extra). We enjoyed a room on the 53rd floor and also the bar on the 71st floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Spacious rooms.”
Reviews.Author: heb999
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here many times and have always enjoyed my visits. The rooms are spacious and well equipped. On my two recent visits I was given a refurbished room on my first stay and an older room on the second. I really do not have a preference as they were both the same size and both in excellent condition. The views from both were fantastic. The hotel's major advantage is its location as it sits on top of a subway station and a shopping mall with a large food hall and supermarket. Raffles Hotel is next door. You could not ask for a more convenient place to stay. The pool and gym are great and the in-house restaurants offer the most fantastic selection of good quality food. Service is efficient but not over friendly. The only negative could be that the lobby is very, very busy with the atmosphere of a railways station but, hey, this is Singapore, a very modern fast moving city, it is all part of the vibe.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Amazing AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: DJ807
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel - my room was to die for and being an executive floor room we had access to the lounge with daily canapés and drinks. The staff were absolutely wonderful and nothing was a hassle - even checking in early in the morning due to flight delays etc. The beds are super comfy and everything in the room was immaculate as expected.

Reviews.Title: “The staff at Stamford Crest is the reason I return at least once a year.”
Reviews.Author: Melvin0822
Reviews.Content: The Stamford Crest suites are large though slightly old. Good facilities & quality amenities. But it is the staff of the Stamford Crest that really makes the different. Thank you Eddy, Siti, Nicole & a few others.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, but tired decor”
Reviews.Author: Allymac62
Reviews.Content: From check-in to leaving the staff were exceptional. Nothing was too much to ask. We had an early check-in at no extra cost and a late check-out for a nominal fee. The view fron the room was magnificent, but the furnishings and carpet wer a bit tired. I did not that there were new carpets being installed in the next door room, so I was maybe just unlucky The location is perfect for most sights and pastimes in Singapore using the City Hall MRT station which is located below the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: grettontraveller
Reviews.Content: This hotel is big but dont let that put you off as I found service to be excellent. Rooms are large and well appointed although higher floor rooms have been upgraded/refurbed.The pool area is lovely and the spa/gym is fab. Breakfast was a good experience with a nice choice from the buffet and great service. Wifi is availbale (chargeable) in guest rooms. Only downside were the pillows which were hard and lumpy. Would certainly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay with little complain”
Reviews.Author: Frans G Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel, right in the middle of business area, I like the connecting way to the mall and MRT, will never get lost will all the sign in place. We stay here during x-mas season last year at Grand double room, the room looks like very tired but still a nice room for stay. Also like the view from the two balconies. Had two days in row when water ran dry during my stay and cost some delayed on my schedules for the day. But the hotel management tried to make it up to me and it works, I knew they'll make it up!! Food was great! We had breakfast on the 60th floor every morning and noticed that sometime the food pan ran empty and the people had to wait before they get their food and continue their breakfast, off course some of them are complaining. Swimming pool are great, my kids love it very much! Overall, I like this hotel and hope the management could read this message and addressed the issues. Would like to stay in this hotel again someday.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Views & Service! Higher the better!!!!”
Reviews.Author: iTrailBlazer
Reviews.Content: GENERAL: Hotel is located in the heart of Singapore and everything is pretty much within walking distance. There are fantastic city wide views of the Marina Bay area as well as the Financial centre of the city and out into the seas beyond. ROOMS: Very spacious and comfortable. If you are lucky enough to stay in the suites up on the 54th floor you have simply the best experience. Super beds and bathrooms and an amzing large lounge in each one! A balcony, even at this height is simply amazing to watch the city below you change. SERVICE: Nothing is too much trouble for any of the staff in my experience. Though when the hotel is busy at check in/out times they can seem a little overun with bags lying everywhere. FOOD: Excellent but Singapore has so much to offer that you are better off eating out then dining in! POOL: Didnt use but looks amazing. HINTS: Get a room as high as you can! The lifts are super quick so there wont be any long waits. The hotel also links with Raffles Shopping Plaza which is nice in the rain as you dont have to go outside.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: Gabbi D
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to get a room upgrade to one with a great view. Staff were very friendly and provided great service, rooms were large, clean and well appointed. The hotel is linked to a shopping mall which is very convenient. Excellent buffet breakfast. Make sure to head to the top of the building and have a drink in the bar - the views are amazing!

Reviews.Title: “A Good Valuable Choice, Not Cheap, But Worth”
Reviews.Author: Mister B
Reviews.Content: A good solid hotel with great View from 55. Floor. Unfortunately we had no chance to use the swimming pool at 8. Floor. Our days were too packed..

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mihailrus
Reviews.Content: It was our fist time in Singapore and of course we loved the city. And one from a lot of reasons of it was Swissotel Stamford where we spent 4 beautiful days and nights. 1. Hotel generally The hotel is located in the heart of the Singapore city, nearby from Marina Bay (10 minutes on foot), Singapore Flier, Singapore river, etc. It's really tall 70 floor building, wich you will see from different city places. Hotel has few bars and restautans, 2 pools, tennis courts. In the underground floors there are plenty of shops, fastfoods, and food supermarket. 2. Check-in and room We checked-in about 19-20p.m. and there wasnt any problem with it. We get standard room on the 61th floor with view opposite to Marina Bay (it's view to pools and Carlton hotel). Room with view to Bay was extra $50 per night, we refused it. If you will get the same side room I'd like advice asking floor as high as possible. Higher floor is better because building next to hotel (you can see on photo) about 50 floor and it worsen city view. Besides that building has powerful, huge fans on the roof, wich we heard even on 61th floor balcony (not inside room). The room was very comfortable, but standard, with no luxury. AC, TV, big balcony, bath, big wardrobe, etc. Internet in the room was too expensive, as usually. 3. Food and restaurants We liked breakfast in hotel, it was delicious, varied, always fresh and abundant. There was always fresh fruits, hot backery, egg station, different types of national cousine. Also we've been in Equinox restaurant on the 70th floor, and it was amazing! Fantastic view to the city, exquisite dishes, attentive staff, it was adorably! 4. Pools and amenities In this hotel there are tennis courts and two round pools (you can see them on photo). Pools belong not only to Swissotel but also to hotel in the next building. I've been there in the morning and I think it was enough spaciously. So we have no bad things in Swissotel and would be glad to come back in this city and this hotel. And if you need good hotel in the city center I think we'va been there!

Reviews.Title: “Typical business hotell”
Reviews.Author: OsloWorld_traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights. I have recommendet the place for several friends. The staff is helpfull, the breakfast is good and the location is spot on! The rooms are what you expect from a typical business hotel and are prety large. Even though most of the staff was helpfull, they are not happy when you decide to have breakfast 10-15 min before it closes.The pool deck is also nice with a nice view, but the view is still nothing compared to that at the helipad or new asia restaurant in the top of the building. Whats wrong with this hotel is the same as many around, why do they charge for internett, even when the speed is fairly bad? Overall the hotel over average

Reviews.Title: “Good location with surprisingly nice service”
Reviews.Author: C_Y_Wen
Reviews.Content: If you would like to travel in Singapore by very reasonably priced public transportation system, Swissotel the Stamford is conveniently located just right above the City Hall Interchange and most of the attractions of downtown Singapore is within 4 metro stops from City Hall. The view is pretty nice over the Marina Bay especially at night, which is huge plus when we were standing on our balcony to enjoy the Marina Bay fireworks right in front of us on Chinese New Year's eve .The room service and facilities are state of the art, and room AC and temperature is extremely comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic view.”
Reviews.Author: M_C_9
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my son, aged 6 and 18 yr old Niece. We upgraded to the harbour view and tha was worth every penny. A totally amazing view from the 50th floor. The extra bed for my son was provided speedily and there was plenty of space in the room. I really could not fault the staff all of whom were friendly and efficient. The location was perfect and we had a great 3 night stay and felt adjusted to the time difference ready for the final leg to Brisbane having had a totally relaxing stay in a very comfortable room. We had breakfast included and again I could not fault this, a fantastic range of quality food. I really think there would be something for everyone here. I would like to particularly mention the breakfast staff who were extremely friendly and managed to make our stay in a very large hotel feel personal. We took a bus from outside the hotel to the zoo, so again very convenient. Just on that we found it cheaper buying a combined ticket at te zoo rather than buying on the bus and there wasn't any queue for tickets so don't feel under any pressure to buy on the bus. Was great to be able to go fo a dip in the pool and the poolside bar had a really nice range of interesting and refreshing drinks. Quite pricey but most definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Tallest hotel in singapore”
Reviews.Author: RajeshUS
Reviews.Content: As per my knowledge Swissotel is the tallest hotel in singapore. I stayed at Swissotel for 2 days and I stayed at 42 floor. I offered a great view of Marina bay. View in the night is hard to express in words. Hotel is truly blend of quality, Service, hospitality and luxury. I will remember my stay at Swissotel all my life .

Reviews.Title: “Good Location & Service”
Reviews.Author: TPGBeijing
Reviews.Content: My family of 6 stayed here for one night on our way through Singapore. We have stayed before as the location is good - it is attached to a mall with shops we like and is close to the Marina Bay Sands where there are some great restaurants. The welcome was very friendly and efficient although our rooms were not ready when we are arrived - which was a little early. The rooms were nice enough, clean and a reasonable size. The carpet was a little old and tired - clean, but old. The hotel pools are great - a shallow one for kids and a deep one for those who like to swim, the water was cool and the pool surrounds were clean with new furniture. I find the hotel a little expensive but perhaps that is just how things are in Singapore. We were charged for an extra bed in each room plus access to the internet was extra. For me internet access charges are very irritating as access to the internet is not really an extra it is a necessity. I do not understand why the hotel behaves like a budget airline and charges extra for something that cost them very little. If the rooms were cheaper there may be a case for the internet charges but at the current rates they should be included.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect every time”
Reviews.Author: BHNZ
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel numerous times and it has to be the best in Singapore. Stayed in the mid ninties and annually in the last 3 years. I think it has got better with time. The pool area is still beautiful and everything is very well maintained. Also a great gym. The location is perfect and better than Orchard road- From here at City Hall you can get the MRT train (cheap, clean, safe and very easy to use) to Sommerset and Orchard but also handy to Clark Quay, the business area,and right on the F1 track. Have stayed in 3 room types and all are of the same very high quality. Twin rooms are spacious as are the Doubles and the beds are very good. All rooms have a balcony and the Grand Rooms have 2 Balconies. The views are brilliant! The higher the floor the better so ask for the highest possible. There is a Supermarket in the basement mall - cheaper than the restaurants(but prego restaurant is worth a try). The pool bar is very relaxing and the Equinox bar on 70th floor has to be tried as is the highest in Asia. I would rate this hotel above all others in Singapore, even the new Sands, as the location is better here and Swissotel service is second to none! Check out the Singapore Airlines Stopover deals I have used them London-NZ with a stop in Singapore. Very worth it and good value. I will be back here!

Reviews.Title: “Bit outdated”
Reviews.Author: Helike75
Reviews.Content: Visited Swissotel for 3 nights at the end of December.We're a family of 5.We booked 3 rooms, one king size bedroom and a two double bed bedroom. There were a lot of check in counters, everyone seemed well groomed and friendly. Rooms were big with a wonderful view but with not wonderful amenities. Everything seemed to be outdated with a very very dirty carpet! Rooms smelled old and odd. Location was fine, we went to see the city by walking.

Reviews.Title: “Staff made such a fuss of our children and they loved it”
Reviews.Author: Welltravelledlady
Reviews.Content: Arrived late at night, and we were offered the chance to upgrade to the Executive Floor, and I am so glad we took it. The lobby is not much to write home about, busy and in need of an upgrade, but apart from check in and check out, we didn't see much of it anyway. We had 2 double beds in our room (I'm sure thats what they were), we were told they were queen. But that is where my complaints stop. The view was AMAZING, we even had outside balconies (thrilling), and the room was very nice. The staff in the executive lounge were absolutely lovely, we had exemplary service every time we went in there, and they made our children feel extremely welcome. The staff downstairs also were always very helpful too. The location is fantastic, and very easy to get to the more touristy areas like Orchard Rd. We have very good memories of Swissotel the Stamford and would be happy to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service & Location Made It Great For Us”
Reviews.Author: Panna
