Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Swissotel; we stayed on 57th floor pre Christmas and 63rd Floor early New Year. The customers’ service at the hotel was second to none. The agent we booked the hotel through messed up our pre Christmas booking totally the reception desk, allowed us me to ring the UK using their phone to sort this out. Once the UK agent admitted their mistake we were given a room with an amazing view of the city that included Marina Bay Sands and the Singapore Flyer. Our room was spotless and the bed was really comfy. The cocktails were excellent in the Equinox bar/club and the DJ from the UK played some great music. If I had to be picky I would say one of breakfast room was faded Ikea styling, not what I expected when everywhere else in the hotel was of a high standard. The breakfast served there was very good though. Location: superb - We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Swissotel The Stamford”
Reviews.Author: MohsenID
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. Our stay at the Swissotel The Stamford was truly a memorable, The service was first class, and the staff were very friendly and helpful (Special Thanks to Mr.Adil Mubarak) We stayed on the 51th floor with great view of Singapore !!! The beds are very comfortable & clean, and breakfast was great. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: MattBarcelona
Reviews.Content: From the friendly, efficient welcome, to the fabulously comfortable, spotlessly clean room, the excellent location, the delicious breakfast, great gym, and the brilliant staff, this hotel was an absolute pleasure, especially after a long flight. Easy to get to/from the airport on the metro, walking distance to Chinatown, waterfront (Raffles hotel is next door) etc. Can't wait to stay here again and (obviously) would absolutely recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “the service is excellent but not all rooms”
Reviews.Author: hoteldiary
Reviews.Content: Has as every Grandhotel in Singapore a huge shopping mall underneath and not really a nice lobby. The hotel is located very central, you can go everywhere by taxi or with the very clean tube. My room was very oldfashioned which was disappointing (lots of brooken things like lamp shades), but I heared there are others. The harbour view was aweseome. The bathroom was big enough with good storage, but not as clean as it should be, I found several hairs. The staff is extremly friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet extraordinary. There seemed to be a private party from some teenagers on the second floor of the bar. The security there did treat us very brisk.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: SarskyLicious
Reviews.Content: I was here for chinese new year holiday last week. I spent 4 days 3 nights staying at Swissotel The Stamford with my family (and baby) and we all love our stay there. Although it's not on Orchard Road, the MRT to take us there is just downstair. When we're hungry, we just have to go downstair to the mall with many choices of restaurants that are mouth-watering. The staffs here are very helpful and the housekeeping keep coming every afternoon to ask whether we want more mineral water and towels (plus giving us chocolate). We don't have to go buying pack of mineral water outside. Bottomline is, all of us love this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Distinguished by outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: Sean962
Reviews.Content: We stayed on a long-weekend family getaway in December 2010, and my wife on her own on a short visit in June 2011. The hotel itself is in a great spot, on top of a nice mall well connected to transit and with a great view out over the city, or if you're lucky Marina Bay. Our kids liked the pool, which is shadowed by the Stamford and adjoined Fairmont, so sometimes not so sunny. Our room had two queen beds, ample room for our two 3/5 year old sons in one, us in the other, and enough space in the room that we did not feel cramped. Table big enough for us to eat take away together. What really sets this hotel apart for us was the outstanding service. Every time you turn around you find a polite, well-spoken employee with just what you need. Of particular help was the concierge desk staff, with all kinds of recommendations and helpful directions for activities around town with the children, and they have excellent handout maps. We did a lot of shopping for perishables that are not available where we live, and the hotel was great about storing these in freezer and fridge until time to depart (even after we had checked out and they were just storing our luggage ahead of our flight). We encountered a minor medical issue on one stay and had to stay an extra night - the hotel helped with changing our flights, extending our room, etc. while we dealt with that. When we got back to the same room, our bags had been brought back up already and we had a message on the phone informing of the new flight details. There is also a hospitality suite which you can use while awaiting your room, or having already checked out due to night time flights so you can grab a cuppa, shower and freshen up before heading to the airport. It is cleaned frequently so no problems with sharing it with other guests in similar circumstances. All in all, we found it great value for the location, and the service is exceptional. A big thank you from us to the Stamford staff.

Reviews.Title: “amazing view & great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: DeepaIyer
Reviews.Content: One of the best places to stay in Singapore with amazing view from higher floors. If you a single traveler you just cant get bored staying here. Shop, eat, walk around. very good service. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Still some way to go to reach excellent”
Reviews.Author: ngvm
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 spent the weekend before Chinese New Year on a one-night stay at the Executive Floor on a complimentary voucher offered through our Feed at Raffles membership. Its location on top of the Raffles City Shopping Centre and next to the neighbouring Fairmont Hotel offered excellent choices for shopping and dining. The Executive Lounge which we had access to was relatively pleasant to have afternoon tea/coffee in, and had a nearly 360-degree view of the city. Our room on the 57th floor offered a magnificent harbour view, which any guest staying here must insist on. The room was clean and made our sleep quite comfortable. Nespresso coffee, TWG brand tea and bottled water were also complimentary. On the flip side, some areas which need improvement were the rather warm corridors and lift lobby. We hope it was not a long-term cost saving initiative. Some of the room fittings, especially the bathroom had signs of aging, and needed some sprucing up in order to command such premium prices, if we were paying for it. Some of the towels were also stained. WiFi needed additional charges to our disappointment, considering that it should have been part of the premium room rate. Breakfast selection at the Executive Lounge was rather average, and the place felt relatively packed, giving it that non-exclusive atmosphere no different from having breakfast at the coffeehouse downstairs. As the hotel car park is part of the shopping centre development, prevailing rates of about S$25 per day applies. Given the wide availability of public transport, it is better to go there by bus or MRT if travelling light. Lastly, though our children were able to find their own means of enjoying themselves, there could have been some kids activity or momentos representing the hotel available to make their experience more memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Breath-taking View from the room & roof bar !!”
Reviews.Author: djarum
Reviews.Content: We stayed on 65. floor and our room had an amazing view of Singapore !!! Room was big and very clean. Breakfast was normal for being at Swissotel. The best thing was their New Asia Bar on 71st floor. They were very kind and helpful that they managed to find a table just next to the window when we mentioned that we will be staying only for one night. Their coctails were great and normal priced. (you can find their drinks menu on their webpage) The last Thursday of every month provides a coup de gras party with internationally renowned and celebrity DJs taking centre stage. Operating Hours Happy Hour: 3.00pm to 9.00pm (Daily) 3.00pm to 1.00am (Sunday to Tuesday) 3.00pm to 2.00am (Wednesday and Thursday) 3.00pm to 3.00am (Friday, Saturday and eve of Public Holiday)

Reviews.Title: “large and beautiful hotel in heart of Singapore”
Reviews.Author: crvaranasi
Reviews.Content: Swiss Hotel Stamford is one of the largest and best hotels in Singapore located within the city , it is biggest hotel where I stay in my career with 1261 rooms, My room was on 47 floors when I enter my room I was surprise when I open my room window the outside picture was very nice and amazing, we can see real seen of Singapore , the room was also very beautiful with all modern facility, the location of swiss hotel is very nice, it is just 10 minutes walking distance from Metro Station and 45 minutes drive from change international airport but in office time it will take more time approx one hour or more, the hotel swimming pool is very nice , the hotel is part of Raffles city complex and nearest metro station is Raffles city, room service available for 24 hours I enjoy the restaurant of swiss hotel , the food quality was very high with fresh fruits and Indian& Thai foods, the swiss hotel have 16 restaurants an you can enjoy various country foods , we travel Singapore with help of Map and instruction provided by travel desk in swiss hotel and it is beneficial for travelers , we use metro rail for travel Singapore and mono rail for sentosa, we do a lot of things in Singapore. It is home to a number of shopping areas where we buy branded signature clothes and accessories. The Orchard Road Shopping District is one of the most populated shopping areas in Singapore; you can buy almost everything there. It is visited by shopaholics from around the world, we saw famous Lion statue Singapore after walking distance from Swiss Hotel , we fully enjoy Singapore and Swiss Hotel with great memory and we are soured we will come in future

Reviews.Title: “fantastic new year”
Reviews.Author: lesley w
Reviews.Content: wonderful hotel great staff and fantastic location, loved it , singapore is a lovelly city to visit ,safe and clean,

Reviews.Title: “Stunning views”
Reviews.Author: fhmm1
Reviews.Content: Wonderfully comfortable, lovely staff, great location for getting around. 5-10 mins walk to sightseeing buses, ducks, trams. Stunning views. Two minutes walk to raffles hotel. easy access to shopping mall from hotel (open late)

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing, but great views”
Reviews.Author: Nordic_Mike
Reviews.Content: The Stamford Swissotel once boosted the record of being the world's tallest hotel. The uniqueness of this building enables you to have the most stunning and breathtaking views of Singapore, if you request for a high floor room, typically 50th floor or higher, and added hereto, if you request harbor view, the Marina Bay Sands and Boat Key etc. is at your feet. Further, the hotel is one of the few which has added a tiny outdoor balcony to each room, much enjoyable if you want to inhale the fuzz and buzz of Singapore into your lungs. Finally, with a location right on top of both an MRT, a big shopping mall and the famous Raffles hotel across the street, you'd believe to be in for a great treat. However, having said all this, I must say that the rooms, and the hotel, is terribly outdated, though spacious, and is in serious need for a renovation or upgrade if Stamford wants to be competing in the luxury segment. I was put in a room with a dirty carpet and a distinct smell of stuffiness which just didn't go away even though the A/C was at full speed. I believe that Swissotel brands themself as luxury resort, sadly enough that Stamford falls far below the radar.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, good size room, gods room service food”
Reviews.Author: Lambo024
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a king size room, with great views for five days. The room was spacious but sparsely decorated and a bit dated but very clean. The room had two balconies. room service food was excellent and restaurant quality. A nice range of dishes available. Concierge and front desk very courteous. Breakfast in the restaurant was good quality and excellent staff. It is built on top of a shopping centre and mrt station so very handy. Its about one kilometre to clarke quay and the central business district. Its also close to Raffles hotel. It had two large pools which I did not try. Views at night are great! Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great views and attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: mrmichael1981
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night while travelling. Singapore in general is pricey when it comes to accommodation but I got a good deal on this on one of the last minute sites. It's a vast building, I stayed on the 43rd floor. Loved the complementary kits that were available. All in all, what you'd expect from a luxury hotel - and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravellers62
Reviews.Content: This hotel has wonderful views, from your hotel rooms no matter what angle. When you arrive your greeted with a friendly floor lady and door man. They walk you bags in for you and then take you to the front desk. Your are checked in and explained everything in the hotel and then shown where the lifts are service with a smile so nice makes you feel welcome. The conceirge desk men the bring your bags and check if you need help with anything around town food, pubs.They ever offer to find you tours it was so relaxing knowing they always want to help you. We had our daughter with us whom wanted shopping so we walked around corner to under ground walk ways which linked us up to the suntec city fabulous shopping and so easy to catch the train to any where in the city all airconditions so nice to walk along and check out all the shops also there is lovely food court just below hotel for easy food subway and burger king also there and dome coffee . Singapore is such a clean city and safe its always so easy to walk to the merlion and water front also we where able to walk to the marina bay sands so easy .I say congrats to a wonderful hotel and city

Reviews.Title: “Great location but dissapointed with service.”
Reviews.Author: SimonB1104
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night on the 27th December en route to Melbourne to break up the journey as travelling with 3 children. The hotel location was great for exploring Singapore but when we got up the next morning there was not water in the entire hotel so we were unable to shower before checking out and setting off for our flight to Melbourne. The front desk were courteous etc. but no proper explenation as to why there was no water not were they very apologetic or offered an solution. Also disspointed that there was no offer of a part refund, free breakfast etc. as compensation.

Reviews.Title: “Got what we paid for...”
Reviews.Author: LadybugGrasshopper
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, food fine at breakfast, fabulous views, the top floor bar was a great place to unwind & be social. Singapore is a fabulous city and this hotel always provides great value and access to all that Singapore has to offer. Visited the Zoo, too many shops & Bintang Island which was a treat. Pool at the Stamford is fine for what it is used for. Plenty of food options nearby & far. Right next to Raffles to enjoy a Singapore Sling & eat some peanuts! Business & pleasure trip. Plenty of upmarket hotels to try but the Stamford never lets you down. This is one of many times I have stayed here & would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive People Skills”
Reviews.Author: Pestyjnr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Swissotel as part of a large group for nearly two weeks. From the moment we arrived there was attention to detail. The greet was clearly part of a well run organisation: the staff made an effort at the taxi to find out names and from then on gave the "personal" touch. The views are fantastic and whilst the rooms are getting a little older are well maintained. Another insight. Two things went wrong. The taps made a noise and the staff made an error on the tab. Both were dealt with very well. A complimentary bottle of wine and apologies were made the very next morning and the problem fixed. The bill error was followed up via email and they quite rightly accepted our explanation. It was a small error one we could have just paid. Much better to have the hotel tested and found it handled it very well. A plus for the hotel is the excellent JAAN restaurant located at the top with magnificent food and views.

Reviews.Title: “Lounge staff need help”
Reviews.Author: Stephen_Lloyd
Reviews.Content: As a preferred hotel on my new firm I have stayed here again a few times recently. The hotel has upgraded some of the equipment in the rooms although they remain "warm and cosy" more than "new and sharp" - which is not a bad thing. The only problem I can see is the size of the executive lounge.On my last visit the lounge was so full I struggled to get a seat (took over 5 mins to find a free one, perched on the edge of a group) and could not get served on my first visit mainly due to large families. The staff were flat out so no blame to them. That was Saturday, I did not bother to try on the Sunday. Weekdays it was fine with nice food and good selection of drinks. Staff in he lounge are warm, friedly and efficient, it's just the size that is constricting them. I know there are upgrade plans but Swissotel need to implement them fast as the lounge is a long way behind local competitors. It has put me off weekend stays in the hotel, which is a shame as everything else is good. Except the view! My 60th floor room was above and looknig down on Raffles City Tower office block, so watching the heat and exhaust rising from the vents on the roof, across from my room, did make me wonder about health

Reviews.Title: “Great location, ideal for brief holiday”
Reviews.Author: irishkiwitraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my adult son on the way back from vietnam. We found the location excellent, being beside a shopping mall, a MRT station located nearby and excellent restaraunts and bars very close. It is close to raffles and can easily walk to the merlion. The buffet breakfast was sumptuous and was on a par with the breakfast at the Versace hotel in surfers which I had previously rated as the best. We had some snack food at the lobby bar and a couple of beers, but found it to be expensive. what do you expect though as outside the valet were moving the ferrari to make for a lamborghini. On a previous visit we had used the spa which was excellent. All in all an excellent location away from the shops, but a cheap cab ride to the down town shopping centre. there are a lot of nearby shops and restaraunts to try out which made it a more interesting trip. also a visit to Newton Circus was stunning. The food was great, sitting outside at night drinking reasonably priced bers and chilli crab was a highlight.

Reviews.Title: “Disapointment!”
Reviews.Author: abqaiq
Reviews.Content: We arrives at the Stamfort extremily tired after Flying Jett Air, sitting alongside a badly coughing passenger, who continued to cough all through the night. On arrival at the Hotel, very early in the morning, we asked for a temporary room, or someplace to sleep for a couple of hours. The answer was, that there was nothing available and we would have to wait until 10:30 am. We fell asleep sitting up in a chair in the Lobby. It was a very poor start and very little emphaty for tired guests. We will stay next door in the Fairmont, during our next visit. The staff there were courteous and understanding. The room at the Stamfort was clean and comfortable,however, we found that the staff only did what was absolutely necessary, to make visitors welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AMVPerth
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 weeks at the Swissotel, The Stamford in Singapore and what a fantastic time we had. The room was well appointed with a great bathroom (very important!) with a view towards Marina Bay Sands and the harbour. There is nothing to complain about - great location with walking distance to Clarke Quay; fantastic shopping right underneath the hotel; great food courts, also under the hotel; the MRT at your doorstep and a fantastic swimming pool. Check out the day spa also girls - the pedicure is a must! I can confidently recommend this hotel. You will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Short visit”
Reviews.Author: Family_travellers_RU
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Swissotel Stamford with 2 kids on a short visit to the city. It was the only hotel to provide us with comfortable accommodation with kids which we were happy about. The hotel is very well located in the center, close to the metro. The beautiful city center to explore is also within walking distance. The room was very clean, the hotel is great. Very good breakfast with 2 restaurants for your choice. Tea service in the room. If you plan to go to the Birds Park, the shuttle stops at Stamford in the morning. We were on 40th floor, with view on the city. If possible, take a room with a harbour view. We went to the rooftop bar and the view is stunning. The bar is nothing special, surprisingly. Overall very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Refreshing Break in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Musicaltourist
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Swissotel in December, breaking up our journey from the UK to Melbourne with 36 hours in Singapore. The Swissotel proved to be an ideal hotel for this - we were delighted when after a long flight we were able to check in early (before lunch) to relax and shower before going off to explore. The Swissotel is situated in a really convinient location for exploring the city with easy MRT access at City Hall and many attractons within walking distance. The room was clean with an amazing view of the City and a decent sized bed. Staff were freindly and helpful at all times.

Reviews.Title: “A high quality, well located family hotel in the heart of City Hall/Raffles area”
Reviews.Author: Strae
Reviews.Content: The Swissotel is 1 of 2 hotels located at the Raffles City mall complex (the other being the Fairmont). The hotel is showing it's age a little, but the accomodation and furnishings are still very servicable and in our opinion, the convenient location, generous room size and great views (at higher floors) make up for the fact that rooms are not exactly brand new. Service is very good for a hotel of this class and noticable since we stayed at another hotel (Grand Hyatt on Orchard) during the same trip and the Swissotel was clearly superior from check-in to check-out in terms of service (a slight surprise given the price difference...) Practically, the good service translates into efficient check-in / check-out, excellent bell service (12+ bags sent correctly to 4 different rooms) and one of the most efficient and thorough cleaning / turn down services we have experienced in this class of hotel. It may have been due to our timings, but we never had to inform house keeping of our comings and goings and always arrived back to find the room spotless, tidy and with amenities refreshed (water, towels, chocolates on pillows etc). In particular, one of the rooms was an attached room for children and was heavily used by 2 sets of grandparents, our 2 year old and ourselves, but always felt comfortable. The hotel was running at full occupancy while we there, and while the lobby was always busy, our floor was reasonably quite and room noise was nevery a problem. And as discussed above, we never felt that service suffered due to the high occupancy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for exploring and relaxing in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: AusScotTravels
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Swissotel, The Stamford for four nights in Dec 11/Jan 12. We had never been to Singapore before, and struggled to find a room where we could have two double beds in the one room (we have two young children and I was not comfortable having 2 separate rooms). Qantas Holidays were able to help, and we booked into the Swissotel. Granted, the rooms are a little tired, but they are clean and comfortable and perfect for what you need them for - a bed at the end of the day! We stayed on the 43rd floor and had a view of the city, which was a shame seeing it was NYE (the fireworks were on the Marina side) but again given we had 2 young kids, it was probably a blessing as it was quiet. We had breakfast included in our package which was a buffet style in Cafe Swiss and it was excellent. The food was delicious and varied - we even had curry for breakfast one morning (well, when on holiday and all that...). There is a bit of a queue to get in, but it moves quickly. The pool facilities are shared with the Fairmont hotel, and were a nice place to cool off after a day of sightseeing around Singapore. The cocktails were great too! All in all, this is a great central hotel which is good value for money, has friendly, courteous staff and good facilities. (PS - try the dumpling/noodle shop downstairs in the Marketplace for dinner - awesome food).

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, well located but our room was damp”
Reviews.Author: JulzE
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located between two shopping centres and close to the MRT. A short walk or cab ride gets you to boat quay and lots of interesting restaurants. The view from the hotel was great and there was a nice big bathrrom. My complaint is that the hotel room was damp and musty, so damp that the carpet felt wet. I think it was because the airconditioning had been adjusted so low that the moisture from the air condensed and "rained" all over the room. There is no need for the air conditioning to be turned down so low in hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Past its peak..”
Reviews.Author: ShanghaitoAsia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the STS in Singapore for two nights through new year 2011/2012. While this must have been a nice hotel a few years ago, the current appearance is run down with a 70ties like interior design gone shabby. Check In.. While New Year might be busy, the check in took about 40 minutes, which is my personal record in Asia. Room.. The room was smelly (the rotten aircon smell of old hotel rooms) and the cleaning crew arrived well in the evening to clean up the until then not cleaned room. This included some ' left behinds' from earlier guest I do not want to identify. Flushing the toilet needs muscles - if it works at all. Lifts...'travelling' from the pool to your room and back might take some 20 minutes, so if you need to get to the airport in time, calculate some time for the lifts. Breakfast..Is like the lifts. If you go during peak season, it can take up to 45 minutes to get a table. Even with both retaurants in service. The breakfast-while expensive- is very good and a perfect start of the day. If you do not want to wait, take the food court at the City mall below the hotel. Personnel.. makes good for almost everything else. A concierge who was a true 5star guy, babysitter whom our girls loved, waiters at the breakfast restaurants who accomodated a group of 8 even amidst the turmoil of more than 40 people waiting. Like experienced so many times in Asia, a friendly face makes the real difference. While it is difficult to recommend the STS, I still can do it for their staff. Marina Bay Sands across the pond is a nice hotel while the service can not compete with the STS.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: sandycolondam
Reviews.Content: Location: great, strategically positioned between suntec convention centre, city hall and bugis park. Took MRT from the airport and the line go straight to the city hall MRT without interchanges. Room: I got standard room, which was okay. pay extras to get rooms with marina bay view, perfect for new years eve fireworks. Amenities are complete and the complimentary 4 sachet TWG teas are great!. I stayed 3 nights and it seems they only tidy up the room without changing the pillow cover and the blanket. The bathroom ventilation doesnt really work, it gets really foggy on even warm water. King bedroom was comfy. Breakfast: Buffet. They have two choices, swiss cafe and kopitiam. Swiss cafe is too western for me, but kopitiam buffet is good! really love the edible honeycomb, waffle with lemon butter sauce and some indian dishes. Overall: great location, room was just ordinary and breakfast is great. My Room Number was 4069

Reviews.Title: “Great Value on discount rates”
Reviews.Author: BrisbaneNewDad
Reviews.Content: If you can get this hotel at a decent rate it is my pick for Singapore. I first stayed here over 20 years ago when it was a Westin and have been back many times since. The views from the rooms are no doubt the best in Singapore (far better than Marina Bay Sands). I find the rooms comfortable and of a decent size. The location is what always sells me. The MRT station is right underneath and is often faster than a taxi ride in peak times to some parts of the city. When there's a tropical downpour walking 2 blocks to your (other) hotel really sucks. This is why I love the direct access to the train. The Singapore MRT is one of the best subways anywhere. You may find the restaurants/bars at the hotel expensive. This is typical Singapore. I am afraid and my only other issue is the pool area. The fairmont hotel adjoins as one complex and the hotels share a pool area. If you could imagine 200 people in the one pool and it would be overcrowded. Lash out at the Equinox on the 70th floor with 360 degree views of Singapore for a 5 star meal (and price of course). The hotel is also within a major shopping mall so there is a huge variety of other eating options as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room”
Reviews.Author: s1as
Reviews.Content: First impression, the hotel was very busy, hotel lobby was really packed, but someone help us with our luggage straight away, also at the reception, we didn't have to wait long, only a few minutes, then our room is ready, even we arrived early around 10am. We stay for 2 nights in the Grand room, it's decent size. Got free newspaper in the morning, also 2 bottles of mineral water, although in Singapore the tap water is safe for drinking. We got not so high floor with the view of the city, it's not too bad. We loved the hotel location, which is just above a big shopping mall (Raffles City), with a supermarket, and lots of restaurants, and right above the City Hall MRT station. I recommend you to visit the Equinox restaurant area of this hotel on level 70, it has amazing view of Singapore, they have a few different restaurants and bars, but you have to dress smart casual, I saw some people in shorts and sandals who got turn away by the staffs.

Reviews.Title: “Always loved this property right from the days when it was called Westin Stamford”
Reviews.Author: SandeepBalaji
Reviews.Content: First knew of this hotel, since it was the tallest hotel in the world at some point. And my uncle used to be the General Manager there. Loved going back to this property and enjoying the various nightclub lounge options - New Asia and Equinox, enthralling great views of Singapore. The rooms are quite nice and this time during the F1 partied in one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Stafford Crest Suite”
Reviews.Author: ackteo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the suite for the weekend of the singapore marathon. The hotel is located above the Raffles City shopping Mall and MRT station making it convenient to get around the city. There are also many good restaurants and a food court in the shopping mall. When got to the ground level front desk to check in, we were pleasantly surprised to be ushered to the 65th Floor and the check-in was done in our room. The room was big and the room amenities were excellent. We also requested for an additional bed so the four of us didn't need squeeze into the king size bed. No charge. The view was fantastic!! The Crest is almost a hotel within a hotel with it own service staff and reception on the 65th floor. It also has its own gym and a "living room" where u can have breakfast and read the paper. The only downside is that the "living room" is not for kids. So we had to go to the 60th floor for our breakfast. Also, the room rate was on the pricey side but if you want to splurge on yourselves, this is certainly the place to do it. We enjoyed our stay and also participating in the singapore marathon.

Reviews.Title: “Tallest hotel with incredible view and top service”
Reviews.Author: au_syd_traveller
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here for 15 days business trip in December 2011. This hotel is located above the City Hall MRT station and a stone throw away from Raffles shopping centre. It is also the tallest hotel in Singapore. I was given a classic room on level 44 with direct and totally unobstructed view of the Marina Bay Sands Resort. Check in was quick and seamless. Staff were polite, attentive and helpful. The room was spacious with King bed, work desk and large flat screen TV. Bathroom has shower over bath and fair quality of amenities. The balcony is a wide and narrow one. There is no pillow menu but bed is very comfortable. Laundry service is a bit expensive - costed me SGD$150 for two loads of washing of about 10 pieces of garment. Internet is approx SGD$25. Breakfast has two choices - Swissotel Cafe or Kopitam within the hotel. From memory, Swissotel is about SGD$35 for full buffet. I have eaten at both at least twice and I prefer Kopitam as the cafe doesn't seem to have air-con. Overall, it has been a very pleasant stay. The location and view are absolutely unbeatable. The only not so good comment I have is cost. I have stayed at other international 5 star hotels at Singapore and they throw in breakfast and in-room internet for free - this could be a saving close to SGD$60. I also echo previous comments re poor mobile phone signal - I was roaming and locked into Singtel. Often I had problems with calls. I strongly suggest the hotel to get in touch with Singtel, StarHub and M1 to implement famtocell technology - communications is absolutely critical for business travellers. Will I come back here again? Yes, for the location and view but I need a bigger travel budget.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy stay + great location”
Reviews.Author: Gorgota
Reviews.Content: What I like: * Did not hear any noise at all from adjacent rooms or corridor * Friendly reception and valet * Complimentary 2 bottled water replaced daily * Bath robe and slippers * Spacious room * Only a few minutes walk from Suntec shopping mall and Esplanade * HBO and a very large tv * Shower gel, body lotion and shampoo with special flower extract * A view of the city and swimming pool, plus balcony * Shower head with three setting options What can be improved is definitely the carpet, which is dated. The paintings as well as the wallpaper can also be changed to remove the old-fashion atmosphere. Hair conditioner can also be added to the amenity. Overall, a very good experience and will not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Jemi D
Reviews.Content: Been there 3 times in 2 years. Great place to stay. Nice rooms, great or good views. Good staff. Great buffet breakfast. Fast elevators. The hotel is a 70 story hotel directly over the City Hall subway station and an underground walking and shopping area of perhaps 1 mile long. It is also a short 20 minute taxi or subway ride from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place”
Reviews.Author: Rahulsaxena_63
Reviews.Content: We had gone to Singapore in Feb'11 for holiday and had stayed at Swissotel. Had a pleasant stay there... Hotel has a nice location in the heart of the city next to MRT station and Singapore Eye being a longish walking distance.. Equinox their rooftop restaurant has a fantastic view being at the top of 74 floors..it is extremely pricey though.. 300$ for a couple dinner on Vday !!! Staff is courteous they were able to arrange for an early check in as well.. They had a nice breakfast spread which was quite good.... but not too good for Vegies.. Secondly, if you a looking for some some Indian food in their menu then you would be very disappointed... They had Parantha and daal for breakfast which seemed quite incogruent ... All in all would definately recommed the hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in all areas. Couldn't ask for more.”
Reviews.Author: Ezra-Oz
Reviews.Content: I stayed there 2 nights since the deluxe room we booked was unavailable they gave us an upgrade to an executive room with a free wifi and nespresso machine. The room is spacious and spotlessly clean. For the shopaholic Raffles city shopping mall is right on the doorstep of the hotel and City Hall MRT station is adjacent to the mall. There are two outdoor round pools for swimmers.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay in heart of Singapore”
Reviews.Author: alshili
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for first time for 4 days with family. Hotel is located in the heart of Singapore and conveniently next to a mall and subway. Although we didn't enjoy our stay there, Hotel is listed as a five stars but the service and look of the hotel is 3 and half stars. Room were huge but not much of amenities and service were provided. Went to check the view from the 77th floor lounge, view was breathtaking and amazing at night were you can view Singapore's skylines and city on a clear night.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here again and again”
Reviews.Author: Jangtravels
Reviews.Content: First stayed in this hotel in 1988 and again in 2002 so this was our 3rd staycation. Good service, good rooms, good views and good location. This time round, found that the toilet is starting to feel old and tired. Location and service were good and really enjoyed the stay. Leaving the car w the valet was also better than erp parking as it allowed multiple entries through the day. Pool was a bit small n shared w fairmount but good for a relaxing dip. Gym was top class. Look forward to staying here again. My kids love this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent. Our favourite hotel in Singapore.”
Reviews.Author: VanessaAdele
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights. This was our third visit to this hotel and we were again impressed with the standard of service. The staff are uniformly excellent. The food, especially breakfast, was very good. The pool was a perfect temperature and I was the only swimmer at 8am. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service No1.”
Reviews.Author: Jamitravelling
Reviews.Content: From arrival to 5 am check out two days later my family of 2 + 2 never once felt we were not the hotels top priority. Yes, Singapore has customer service sorted, but the Stamford was exceptional. No staff avoed you or looked the other way. At their beautiful breakfast spread resteraunt manager and executive chef both checked on us with real interest in our opinion. Prior to an 8am flight my 3yr old daughter woke with a severe fever and we were quickly helped with a call in doctor. The night manager intervened, with our best interest at heart, to suggest we travel to the hospital 10 min away (as it would be far cheaper and best facilities). The doctor arrived in ten minutes and efficiently diagnosed and dispensed medications with an offer of phone follow up internationally. The hotel placed the 3rd party bill on our account to minimize our transactions. Room. Transport options, view over bay and pool with second kids pool made this hotel a great pick.

Reviews.Title: “excellent view and location, room a bit old”
Reviews.Author: winton_of_jakarta
Reviews.Content: I come to singapore normally for business and this hotel is one of my first choices. The location is great with integrated shopping mall, restaurants, and access to MRT. The view from the room is awesome. I could see the beautiful singapore city from the room, the espalande, the marina bay sands. It's just the room is a bit old but clean. Standard amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good facilities, but a bit shabby in places”
Reviews.Author: ATPTour
Reviews.Content: Excellent location at Raffles City Mall and MRT station, the hotel shares its restaurants, spa, outdoor pool and a very good gym with the Fairmont in the same block. Views over the harbour towards Marina Bay are excellent and the top floor bar is well worth a visit. Service was good throughout. The classic rooms in the middle third of the tower are a little dated and the lower floors (which seem to be even more in need of sprucing up) seem to be for large groups of students and air crew. The hotel is enormous and, helpfully, visible from space so easy to get back to if you get lost whilst sightseeing. Marina Bay, the Merlion and the business district are all walkable (with an umbrella!).

Reviews.Title: “I am sure one of the best in Singapore..”
Reviews.Author: r_sarda
Reviews.Content: I keep returning to this hotel and have found no deterioration in last six years, 2005 being the first time I stayed here. I do not know why this property is languishing at 20+ rank in Trip Advisor. Something seems to be wrong with Singapore's ratings!! Hotel is excellently located, above MRT which connects you to most of the places in Singapore. Centrally located hence taxi fares are also reasonable from major attractions. Next door to a good mall. Rooms are large and not many words to describe the breathtaking views from the harbour facing rooms' balcony. I am sure you cannot get a better view of the Marina Bay even from Marina Bay Sands hotel. Premium paid for harbour View rooms is worth every penny. Try staying on higher floors. Staff are very well trained and service is faultless. The breakfast spread is unbelievable and even the vegetarians (read Indian vegetarians) have a large number of choices. However the rates have risen a lot in last couple of years which makes it a bit pricey hotel now. But if your budget allows it then look go no further and go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Great”
Reviews.Author: merk_kl
Reviews.Content: Managed to secure a very affordable rate one week before I travelled via their website. All emails were prompted answered with perfect explanations. This hotel is located within the Raffles City shopping mall with the City Hall MRT 5 minutes from the doorstep of the hotel. My family and I was promptly checked in within 8 minutes and we were given a room on the 37th floor. The view from the room was great! (overlooking St Andrews Cathedral and MBS). The room was clean and the amenities provided was more than adequate. However, the flushing system of the toilet seems a bit peculiar where it takes a couple of minutes to fill up before I can flush again (maybe its only my room) but this is only a small issue to me, no biggie. The room was very quiet with good sound insulation from the hallways as well as from the rooms next door. Visitors who are driving should be aware that there are not complimentary parking for guest (like most of other Singapore hotels) but they do charge a nominal rate per 24 hours with multiple exit and entries (Valet service). Great place! Will be definitely back the next time I am in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “sneak peek week end”
Reviews.Author: Geeze1649
Reviews.Content: My sister and me spend 2 night week end in this hotel. A great location for people who enjoy hoop and hoop from MRT to the mall. We got a great services from the customer relation. I will recommend this hotel to my friend and will come and stay again if have a chance.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and great service”
Reviews.Author: ChannelOfPeace
Reviews.Content: i travelled with my family, 2 adults and 3 children. we booked a kids room. on arrival we had to wait for an hour before the room was ready. Being in Rafles city, we went down to the shoping arcade. on our return the rooms were ready and were given keys for 2 rooms in floor 56. the kids room was well presented, with a kid activity corner. great view of the city and close to all amenities. the pool was excellently maintained. room service was beyond my expectation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: D_DAV
Reviews.Content: I have been staying with the Swissotel Stamford frequently for nearly three years. While some of the rooms themselves may be a little tired and the lifts a little slow, that's where the concerns of quality stop. The hotel staff are are nothing short of excellent, the food is superb and the fitness facilities are unbeatable. The main benefit however is the location, situated right above the City Hall station line you are a few stops from anywhere and the Marina Bay/Clark Quay are a short stroll if you feel up to facing the humidity.

Reviews.Title: “Convinient”
Reviews.Author: openseas
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Grand Room from 27th November until 30th November. As I am not new to this hotel, there were no surprises to me. This is not so good at all. The fact that very little, if anything, changed since my first stay is not really an achievement. This is in terms of hardware, if I may. Rooms are still furnished with old and outdated furniture, bathrooms still relatively small and very average in appearance. I'd really appreciiate a serious renovation. Better sound proof windows and balcony doors would be needed,too. The problem is also with the mobile phone signal quality,both Singtel and M1. Previously I used to stay on higher floors and I blame that fact for the very poor reception and frequent loss of the signal. This time I stayed on the 34th floor and the same thing happened. Although hotel can not be blamed for this, maybe something can be done to enhance signal levels. On the other hand, hotel's staff is fantastic, given the size of the venue. Although front desk personnel sometimes looks inexpirienced and frightened, maybe tired, they manage to give you a cordial smile. Check in and out is ussually smooth. This time I was offered an upgrade to the executive room, but declined due to the fact that offered room is significantly smaller. It is not clear to me what was the advantage of the offered upgrade and after asking the receptionist it was not any clearer. The major problem of this venue is it's size but this obviously will not go. This fact reflects on queues for breakfast, super busy front desk during "rush hours", slow wired internet (no wireless yet) difficulties to get the taxi but I am of the impression that personnel is doing well to cope with all this and help patrons feel better. As mentioned in most of the reviews, hotel's location is superb in terms of the access to the underground (MRT) transportation as well as pedestrian, unnderground link to the Suntec Mall, Marina Square Mall with endless shops along the way. Under the hotel is anoother fine but modest mall where one can find all sort of restaurants, eateries, caffes... Very convenient. I should not forget fantastic view from almost every room, regardless the floor, although higher is certainly more dramatic. Despite the things I don't like here, I am quite sure I wiill return. I feel very comfortable in this hotel and I will certainly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “the asian market restaurant”
Reviews.Author: syedsarosh
Reviews.Content: the time was august 2011, and we had a buffet there, the couisine included almost everything from asian side, seafood was delicious and included almost all specialities, dont miss squid there, only non alcoholic drinks are served there whn i went, so pretty entertaining place, the sweets were very dofferent, and not to miss the fruits, i tasted dragon fruit there, and really memorable taste.

Reviews.Title: “Big hotel , nice views, convenient location, good service”
Reviews.Author: Giraffe777
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really at an MRT station, and connected to malls, so good location. The view on ghe marina is very nice. Unfortunately, all the firniture is very old, needs refurbishing. Old carpet also . The service is very good, despite the hotel is big they remember yout special needs, very appreciable. The two double beds room is not as good, the beds are small, not queen size, and the matresses ate very hard. Te king bed was better.

Reviews.Title: “Good service”
Reviews.Author: Ice_88
Reviews.Content: Excellent service from the moment you step into the hotel. Check-in was fast and staffs are very efficient and helpful at the front-desk. The location of the hotel is superb as it is located above a MRT station and a big shopping center. The room size is ok and the bed is comfortable. Room service is efficient and the food is good. The pool area is shared by another hotel so it is very crowded - make sure you go early to get a nice spot. However, there are 2 things i do not like about the room - the lighting near the study desk area is very dim and the bathroom is a bit small.

Reviews.Title: “A picturesque View from Levels 20 and 22”
Reviews.Author: SusanP196
Reviews.Content: In October 2011 we had two stopovers in Singapore and chose to stay at this hotel. So lucky were we that we had a room on both occasions on levels 20 and 22 with a truly magnificent view over the newly built marina area of Singapore. All you had to do was stand on the balcony and take the most awesome shots early morning, during the day, and night. The rooms are a good size and well equipped with large balconies and sliding door to step out in to the humidity of Singapore. The bathrooms are a good size but very "average" and their towels are a little thin but you can overlook that when you have the advantage of the great view and you are still in air conditioning! We couldn't get a king size bed to cosy up, but the two large doubles were okay!! If the hotel upgraded their bathrooms there would be no complaints from this traveller. The hotel is above shops, including a Robinsons Dept Store which always seems to be having shoe sales!! You can also get good quality meals from the lower ground floor food area and the MRT is also in the area. We arrived from Paris early one morning prior to the designated check in time and the reception staff were most accommodating in getting us to our room after a long flight. We have stayed in many hotels in Singapore and this gets a big tick from us for value, service, cleanliness and most of all great views.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury on the 64th Floor. Best view of the marina and financial district”
Reviews.Author: ajibiju
Reviews.Content: The staff are friendly, efficient and go out of their way to satisfy. I asked for a room with the best view of the marina and city. At first I was given a satisfactory side viewing room but was ultimately transferred to the best room in the floor (6456) with great views of marina bay sands, the flyer, esplanade, merlion, financial district, Singapore river, Clark and boat quay. The Stamford Crest suite is really a wonderful experience. I almost didn't want to get out of the room anymore! The living room on the 65th floor is a welcome retreat for breakfast (no need to queue at the crowded breakfast venues) and cocktails with its exclusive access. And the mini bar (with Nespresso) and internet are complimentary! Thanks to you guys (Katherine, Mitch, Poon, Jonathan, Serj, and the rest)! Will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in SIN”
Reviews.Author: danwallace
Reviews.Content: Superb hotel right in the heart of Singapore. Within walking distance of restaurants, shopping and visitor attractions. Right beside MRT station to airport. Staff are extremely friendly and helpful, rooms are perfect with all requirements. The gym is superb once you find it and is shared with another hotel. There is a hospitality room for guests who are leaving after check out, in order to rest and shower before flight. The views from the hotel top floors are amazing of the harbor and city.

Reviews.Title: “still good after all these years”
Reviews.Author: nick_ng
Reviews.Content: The first time I stayed here was 20+ years ago & I was pleasantly surprised last week that this is still a high quality hotel. I like this place & suggest that you focus on the positive reviews that have been written. The 70th level is a nice place to get a great view of Singapore. I stayed on level 37 & that was high enough to have a fantastic view (see pics).

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice in Central Singapore”
Reviews.Author: APP75
Reviews.Content: Excellent efficient check-in. Decent rooms with excellent view across harbor. Central location 3 blocks from convention center. Breakfast is average and crowded. Overall good business hotel for Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: GotheCats
Reviews.Content: This was a really nice Hotel.. The bars are nice and the view is spectacular. Singapore is just a great place. This is really good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Well Connected”
Reviews.Author: Naviance
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of those that sets a high expectation and then meets it. Not brand spanking new but in great shape. A fantastic location close to almost everything and always someone on hand to help when you need it. Shop until you drop, stroll to the Quay or simply step out on your balcony and soak up the Singapore atmosphere. Take a ride to Equinox on the 70th floor for a drink or a meal, both at reasonable prices. Or try one of the many restaurants or eating halls very close by. I liked the service it was 5 star but unpretentious, the room was clean, comfortable and well appointed. The hotel came recommended to me by several people and I am happy to pass on that same enthusiasm for this hotel. BTW right next door to Raffles if you'd like a Singapore Sling or High Tea in this icon of Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Tallest, but not the best”
Reviews.Author: mundanemuser
Reviews.Content: If you want to have a good view of the "sprawling" city of Singapore from your hotel window every day of your stay and if you don't want to stay at the "ubiquitous" Marina Bay Sands, then Swissotel is the next best hotel to stay at in Singapore. It does have a pretty plain facade, but the rooms are quite spacious and comfortable to stay in. Of course, the best part is the location: There's a MRT station right under the hotel; the entire colonial area is just nearby; the latest attractions of Singapore such as the Esplanade theatres, the flyer and the bay are at walking-distance. Even all the new malls next to it are all inter-connected through the underground; so if its raining, which it does very often in Singapore, you can just hop on from one to another without getting out. So if you are in Singapore for a short trip and want to be in a strategic location, then Swissotel is a great option otherwise there are better options out there.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: trailblazer88
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Swissotel last night. It is a very big hotel. Tallest hotel in Singapore. What I liked: 1. Speedy check-in 2. Free internet 3. Equinox - Club with nice marina view on the 69th floor 4. Bed is comfortable 5. Clean room 6. Good service - housekeeping, friendly concierge and front desk 7. Good location near shopping centre and MRT station 8. Nice toileteries 9. Late check-out at 4 pm 10. Quick check-out What I disliked: 1. Shower is old - water pressure slow 2. No hand bidet I would recommend this hotel for business travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Swissotel The Stamford...nice but lacking in some areas”
Reviews.Author: lurcher500
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for three nights in Swissotel The Stamford. Starting with the positives, the hotel is in a top notch location in Singapore, very close to City Hall MTR station and connected to a really good shopping centre. The world famous Raffles Hotel is pretty much across the road. The hotel rooms are very big, the balcony is not worth having as it is so small but the views from our floor were fabulous. During my brief stay there, while I appreciated many aspects of this accommodation, I still felt that some areas were lacking especially in light of the price paid to stay and the five star rating. The first thing I noticed on my way to the room were marks on the corridor walls, the floor looked like it needed to be repainted, the second thing and much more disappointing was the complete lack of tea bags available in the tea/coffee box. It was evident that housekeeping had not bothered to check if there were sufficient supplies remaining after the previous guest and so we had to ring to get some sent up. Little things like this alarm me because it means a routine is not followed when a room is cleaned...I have worked in housekeeping before during college summers!! The following day no hand towels were left for us in the bathroom when I returned after breakfast, again another slip in housekeeping and one requiring another phone call! On one of the nights there we came in late and decided to order room service. We phoned downstairs and the person who took our call was only too pleased to tell us that the room service menu was limited due to kitchen renovations and asked did we not see the letter in our room telling us so? Now we did have a letter from the manager advising us of the limitations in service but we had forgotten about it. To have a member of staff so blatantly happy to point out the error of our ways was disappointing, when our revised choice finally appeared (close to an hour later) the fries were cold! And this is a 5 star... I do have to say that the food at breakfast however was lovely. A final niggle relates to the information book that one finds in every hotel. I was delighted to see a listing of the various international telephone codes one needed to know when phoning outside of Singapore. But to my dismay I could not find Ireland on the list!! I checked under Ireland and checked under Republic of Ireland but could not see it! Am I blind, did I miss it or is it just not included...? I'm still wondering as the letter we received from the manager re the limited food menu had an Irish name on it!! I'm happy to be corrected on this point...!! Overall nice hotel but my overall impression was the place is so big that individual guest needs are being overlooked....if you can get a good deal stay there, otherwise maybe look for somewhere with better customer service....

Reviews.Title: “Could do better”
Reviews.Author: vwhk
Reviews.Content: Swissotel The Stamford is not bad, but it pales in comparison to its sister the Fairmont, with whom it shares the same complex. Location in the heart of the colonial district, is super-convenient for business and tourism. The CBD is within easy reach, as is Orchard Road. The City Hall MRT station is just down the stairs. The hotel's taxi station also seems to enjoy more consistent traffic than is typical in Singapore. Dining and shopping options are abundant in the Raffles City mall, and the lovely Chimes just across the street. The rooms are large and bright, with good windows and balconies up to the top floor (50+, vertigo guaranteed) and views to boot. The one I occupied, however, had evidently not been renovated in recent years years: it shows both in the decoration, which is tired, and the equipment, which has fallen behind par. The service felt 4-star rather than 5. The staff is not unfriendly nor rude, but it is a large hotel, and they are not always available to address guests requests as promptly as one would expect. One instance was aggravating; I requested a DVD player to be installed in my room and had to wait half an hour to be informed that I would be charged S$200 for the privilege, which is ludicrous (you can buy the DVD player for that price). Internet access is slow and not always straightforward. On the plus side: the large outdoor swimming pool, offering a resort-like atmosphere in the middle of the city. The Stamford occupies a super-prime piece of property; it could be a much better hotel if they renovated the rooms and beefed up the service level.

Reviews.Title: “Old rooms, good view, no wifi”
Reviews.Author: globbaaja
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Stamford for one night; our last night on our 3-week trip in Singapore/Malaysia. We were hoping to get some luxury and speciel treatment in this 5-star hotel. The lobby area was nice and the reception personel were nice and heplful. When we got to our room (a Grand room on the city-side. It was on the 47th floor if I remember correctly) we first noticed the great view over the city. The next thing we noticed was how old-dated the room was. Sure, everything was clean and tidy (and quiet!), but the room looked like it had stayed the same since the 1980s. This was a bit of a disappointment. The other disappointment were the 2 "balconies"; the balconies are less than 1 meter wide. You can just and just fit the chairs on the balconies. And the last disappointment was the fact that none of the rooms have a wifi (how can this be, in a 5-star business hotel?). Pool area is nothing special: one pool for children and one for adults and one pool bar (not in the pool). But the view and the location of the hotel are great! I do recommend this hotel to people who can find a good deal on this hotel, who don't need internet, who want to enjoy the great view and want to stay in the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location”
Reviews.Author: AussieFamilyFunHols
Reviews.Content: Had stayed at the Stamford when I was younger and wanted to bring my own family back here to stay. The location is excellent - the MRT station is very convenient, and you can walk for a long time in the underground malls without needing to go out into the heat. There are so many food choices downstairs - we didn't pay for the hotel breakfast. We had a room on the 27th floor - after reading previous comments I had hoped for a room higher up but we didn't complain and the view from our room was still magnificent. Only two problems for us - I had hoped for 2 x Queen beds for 2 adults and 2 children, and had requested this prior to our arrival. However we were only given 2 double beds and this was a bit of a problem for us. Also, the internet connection for the room was VERY expensive. We paid for the convenience of having the internet connection within the room, as we utilise this a lot with children and to have the ability to research our surroundings. The internet connection was great though - I had read in previous comments that it was patchy but we did not find this a problem. The only other thing I would say is that if you want ice, apparently there are only ice machines on the rooms above the 40th floor - we survived without it though because we didn't want to be calling room service for ice constantly !!!

Reviews.Title: “Still Standing TALL amoung others”
Reviews.Author: NitinUniyal_jet
Reviews.Content: I have been to Swissotel couple of time now and what do i like in this hotel?... EVERYTHING "Best Location" "Best View" "Polite and Helpful Staff" "Night Club for Party people" "Great variety of Food" "Very well Maintained rooms"...... I don’t think someone want anything more than this from any hotel. But don’t judge any hotel with anyone comments but I would highly recommend to try this hotel once and then you can make your own opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Interestingly inconsistent”
Reviews.Author: aussieexpats
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Stamford a number of times over the years, the last 2 times just recently. Oddly enough on every occasion there has been some hiccup with the booking.This time we had booked for 2 nights but they had a record of only the 2nd of the 2 nights. Fortunately I had a printout. On returning after time in Thailand our non-smoking room had been smoked in and was quite unpleasant. They were initially unable to give us a similar room (we had paid for a king bed harbour view room) but after a bit of a stand-off, they found a room just one floor below the original one.The fridge didn't work but they replaced it quickly. Quirky though, the first time we were on a floor which supplied hair conditioner. When we came back and I asked the maid for some hair conditioner, her reply was that we were not on a hair conditioner floor. Didn't know you had to book the right room type to get conditioner! I also think that free wireless internet is an expectation these days. We expect hotels to be at least as well-equipped as our homes and for many of us, email access is a necessity. However as others point out, the location and views are excellent and the rooms are a generous size. It's just a bit too big to be consistent.

Reviews.Title: “Needs to improve”
Reviews.Author: Steve_Th
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Swissotel several times over a period of 15 years. The location is excellent for MRT and congress at Suntec. Raffles City Mall provides many eating options and shopping outlets that allow you to remain cool and dry. The hotel is comfortable and the views from most rooms are impressive. The décor however has not changed in many years and is rather plain – but great if brown is your favourite color. Despite the claims, I do not consider Swissotel to be 5 star. The bathrooms are small’ television reception is poor quality with limited channel selection. I found the internet access slow (and expensive). Although clean, I was disappointed in the housekeeping service during my stay. On two of the four days my room had not been made up by 5pm despite vacating it before 9.00am. Errors were made during my check in that resulted in credit card problems. The type of room booked was not honoured and was provided with a downgrade before complaining and then the type of room booked suddenly became available! Should you decide to stay at Swissotel request a room away from the elevators – from past experience you can hear the ‘pings’ all night long. High floors provide better views and also suffer slightly less noise from the busy roads below.

Reviews.Title: “Needs major improvements”
Reviews.Author: FrenchGlobetrotter
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Stamford Swisshotel for 5days/4nights Pros: - location, everything you need is at your doorstep (MRT, shopping center linked to the hotel, restaurants both in the hotel and in the shopping center, supermarket, etc), steps away from the business district - views, whether you have a Marina facing view or enjoying the views from the roof top restaurants, it is simply breathtaking and you won't be able to get enough - room service quality of food is quite good (but you'll pay the price for it), dine out or in the hotel restaurants for the same prices but with the Marina views Cons: - hotel feels like a warehouse, tons of groups & airline crew. Which means hell at breakfast, very long waiting time at the lifts (the hotel is seperated in two groups of levels each with 6 lifts, it's not unusual to wait 10 min for a lift). - swimming pool and gym are shared with the Fairmont hotel, again very crowded. Not enough chairs at the pool side, piles of dirty towel on the floor. - rooms are old, beds are uncomfortable (mattress is rock solid), pay a closer look at details and you will find broken tiles on the balcony, stains on the bedroom walls, air condition is poor, etc - 4-6 poor sofa in the reception area for a hotel of more than 60 floors.... - waiter service at breakfast is appalling: they will drop food on the floor and not pick it up, towels, cutlery, juice, it is extremely noisy and rather dirty. - arrival at the hotel can be quite hectic, between the dozens of tour buses, car parked right in front of reception, taxi stand. The bell boy are just standing there without redirecting traffic, so you could wait for more than 10 min just for one car to move! Overall and for the same price tag your much better off in an other hotel in Singapore and for that you'll be spoiled for choice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Oakies
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 nights in November and wished we could have stayed for another 7 nights, our room was fantastic, Classic Harbour View, with breakfast included. Great view of the Marina Bay Sands. The staff could not do enough for us and made us feel right at home, they were extremely friendly to our son and made him feel most welcome. Nothing was too much trouble for any of the staff, and the staff in Cafe Swiss, Kope Tiam and Out of the Pan are a credit to the Hotel, not to mention that the food was Fantastic. We are very much looking forward to our next holiday and would stay nowhere else except at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Views”
Reviews.Author: Beto201
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! The best of this hotel are the views from your room, directly to the singapore flyer and Marina Bay. When I arrived there, my room wasn't ready, they told me that the hotel was at full capacity. My rate didn't include the breakfast, so they gave me a complementary breakfast and one drink because of one hour delay to get my room (consider that it was a couple of hours after the check in time). I understand this kind of situations and I appreciated the perks, which by the way, I didn't have the breakfast so I cant comment on it, but the intentions of giving customer satisfaction is what it matters for me. The rooms are spacious with it owns balcony (check the views in the attached pictures). Also, it are clean and well appointed. The location is good, not the best as per my opinion, but still good. There is shopping mall that you can go inside through the hotel if you want and the metro station is just few steps outside the hotel. If you want to walk to marina bay it will take you around 25-30 min and another 15-20 min to clark quay. Special thanks to the staff at the front door, they carried our bags and were very polite. We exchange few jokes too. Last, they have a refreshment lounge if your flight departs late, they allow you use it. 2 small details they missed: 1) I stayed for 2 nights, and they just provided the bottle of water for the first day. 2) All the bathroom floor will get wet when you are taking a shower

Reviews.Title: “great view from the balcony...”
Reviews.Author: whereisfatboy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights for the Singapore F1 weekend. Chose this hotel simply for its location beside the race track and also the view from the balcony. As it was the F1 weekend, the prices for the room was on the high side. I paid SGD1100 for a room on the exec floor, with view of the race track. I guess rooms with view command a premium price !!! The plus side, is unlimited access to the club lounge for free drinks and snacks all day long and complimentary breakfast too. As it was a leisure weekend, i spend time lazing around the pool, which is packed all the time. Thankfully there are 2 swimming pools here as Swissotel share a common recretional facilities with its sister hotel, Fairmont hotel which is just next door. In fact the gym is located in fairmont hotel, and there is a nice spa here too. Great sauna after a workout in the gym. I had lunch once at the hotel Kopitiam and the singapore chicken rice that i ordered was a big letdown. I also had a Swiss Burger at the hotel lobby lounge, and this was okay. Ordered room service once, beef fried with kuayteow and this is okay too. So, foodwise, it is just okay, nothing to shout about. However, the complimentary food served at the Club floor is much better. I enjoyed the evening snacks during cocktail hours and also the nice breakfast spread. In conclusion, this is a fine hotel to stay during normal times, the location is great, inside a shopping mall, MRT at doorstep. But be prepare to pay more if you come during F1 weekend. But then again, all hotels in Singapore charged a premium price for their rooms too during this week, so if you want to be near the F1 circuit, (Gate 3 entrance is just in front of hotel), and want to have the luxury of watching the race from your room balcony, then Swissotel Stamford is an excellent choice !!

Reviews.Title: “Middle of the Road”
Reviews.Author: Peponi
Reviews.Content: We visit Singapore once a year and for the past few years have stayed here on the executive floor (60). Previously the convenience of the location, executive package and overall comfort and service made this hotel stand out. Now, however, it is rather losing its edge. The rooms are still comfortable with impressive views across the city but the hopelessly outdated decor of the entire hotel really let it down. Service overall is still very good but staff are painfully over keen and it is irritating to have someone almost permanently hovering at your elbow to whip away your plate while you are still chewing and the forced cheeriness, especially first thing in the morning, grates. Anticipating guests' needs is one thing, making a nuisance of yourself with over attentiveness is quite another! At the same time, the buffet, previously with some quite exquisite and delicious offerings has clearly become a victim of cost cutting. There's plenty of sausage and processed meats in various disguises and everything on offer is rather tasteless and bland with a lack of variety and the same dishes are served up day after day. Vegetarians have to pretty much make do with an overcooked pasta dish and a salad of leaves. Breakfast bread and pastries come in different shapes but all taste the same and there is nothing to be had that offers the palate a taste or texture sensation of any kind. And all of this rather reflects the hotel's overall expression: apart from its optic nerve jarring violent 70s carpets, everything is beige, beige and beige. Convenient : yes, Comfortable: pretty much ok, Outstanding in any way: Definitely Not, Stylish or luxurious: Forget it!

Reviews.Title: “superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: gopaal_1000
Reviews.Content: Hi...I am Mr.gopal dutta,a musician by profession(drummer of indian playback singer SHAAN) SWISSHOTEL is superb because of its classic connection to malls ,shoppin center and food courts from inside the hotel, and its on a very nice location ,i stayed there on 3/11/11 on 39floor,for 2days...morning breakfast was so tasty and just so many varieties of food..The staff members at the gate are always so cheerful,well its a cool hotel to visit...have fun..

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for business travellers”
Reviews.Author: kimmie1711
Reviews.Content: - Incomparable service (shout out to the Filipinos who work there!) - Very convenient to get to and from major tourist, business, and shopping areas - Giant floor-to-ceiling windows with balcony: not sound-proofed, though! There was a guy who's either too stupid or too arrogant who revved his motorbike for about 2 minutes along the road - - - I could hear his damned bike from 30 floors up the Stamford building. - In-room safe conked out 3x during my stay. First time I discovered it wasn't working was when I first arrived. After calling for help, the security staff immediately addressed the issue. The second time the safe malfunctioned was on my 2nd day in the hotel when I was trying to re-secure some items in the safe before I left for work. Third time, thankfully, I had my important documents out of the safe, but when the security staff tried to fix the safe, they managed to finally lock the safe but couldn't re-open it. Security staff was efficient in coming and fixing the problem, and profusely apologized for the inconvenience, but the safes really ought to be upgraded/changed since the staff mentioned that the some other guests have experienced the same problems with the safes in the past.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel to stay”
Reviews.Author: preritahuja
Reviews.Content: hotel was very clean, good and food was also good. when even you are planning try to get top floor and river view room. Its a little bit costly hotel but worth it when you are going Singapore for relaxing & enjoying with your family. one of the best hotel in Singapore. hotel was very clean, good and food was also good. when even you are planning try to get top floor and river view room. Its a little bit costly hotel but worth it when you are going Singapore for relaxing & enjoying with your family. one of the best hotel in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Changes needed to keep this a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelAl2010
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Swissotel Stamford for many years, and the biggest drwaback was always the older rooms. now that most have been refreshed, there are positives and negatives. Positives: the beds are fantastic, and all other main amenities (bathrooms, etc.) are clean and modern. The balcony and view is also fantastic - not many other hotels that you can step outside 60 floors up. Wifi has also been recently added, which was badly needed. The location is great - right above a shopping center and supermarket. Negatives: the refurbishment missed some minor, but important areas (phones are old and crackle, useless for business calls), plus some bathrooms have a tendency to leak into the main living space, creating a wet floor (note that management were very understanding and did what they could to help, which was appreciated). Overall though, with some small changes this could return to a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just not good enough”
Reviews.Author: Nigel B
Reviews.Content: I stayed on the exceutive floor for a week at the end of October 2011. Very expensive but then everythinbg is in Singapore. No hot water for 15 hours, WiFi no way up to the job, (admitted system not good enough!). Kids on exec floor computer, so I was sent down to the businbes centre where my free use of the internet as part of my package was not respected without threatening to call the Manager. Breafast Buffet on Exec Floor was adequate, no more, and often only tepid in temperature. That said Staff were always smiling and helpful, Particularly the Conciege! I suspect Management need a kick, you know, where, to maintain standards. Going somewhere else on the next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected bad experience from a hotel with 5 star rating”
Reviews.Author: bobomath
Reviews.Content: We reserved 5 double rooms for our family and extended family. Check in itself was a nightmare largely due to the rude lady who handled our check in, who, we felt was bent upon giving our family (including children), smoking rooms, which she said, are the only ones available. Moreover, even though we reserved in advance, they did not put us in the same floor. We experienced terrible leaking taps, water less WC etc in the bathroom of 2 of our rooms. To make it worse, they did not bother to fix the problem till the time we checked out after our 3 nights' stay with them. Only good things we experienced were the location of the hotel in Raffles city, and the Breakfast which was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely will come back”
Reviews.Author: MsGraceberry
Reviews.Content: This is our 2nd time staying in this hotel. Great location, great service. It's located right above MRT station, so very convenient transportation access. On our check-out day, our flight was pushed back to 10 pm, so we asked if we could have a late check-out at 4 pm. The front office staff, Alvin, was kind enough to grant us that. Thank you, Alvin! We are so grateful for that. We recommend this hotel to everyone, and definitely will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Location!”
Reviews.Author: Bernardo T
