Reviews.Content: Find the rooms old fashioned - but the view (Harbour side) is amazing. Room Service good.

Reviews.Title: “good, nice but....”
Reviews.Author: Rafalicious80
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Swissotel Stamford last year. Great service throughout, unremarkable!. Location wise was ideal for me in the CBD with great city/marina vews from the hotel room. Close to shopping centres for Ladies :) with direct access from the lobby. Opposite a Hop-on hop-off bus stop if you want to travel around. It's the tallest building in Singa so great views and you will always find your way back :) breakfast was good, i liked the variety and always a proper coffee, cappucino or hot chocolate served (for free! - for some reason they charge extra in Sydney Swissotel for a coffee, unless its an insant coffee, bad!). In regards to the hotel room, it was nice, however the room and bathroom in my opinion need some renovation. In conclusion good place to go, however similar hotels in the area offer slightly better standard of rooms. Wifi would be also appreciated! Enjoyed the stay and would still recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “BEST EXPERIENCE IN SINGAPORE”
Reviews.Author: ronmatt528
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights last October 18-21, 2011. I checked in late at night but my room is is clean and ready for me. Check in process is so fast given the fact that I checked in late. I had a wonderful view of Singapore as if I am at the Singapore Flyer. I am not a breakfast person but I want to make a point that breakfast in a hotel offers wide array of international choices. I'm not really a fan of their breakfast choices. But I think it is the standard of Singapore hotels. There is a smoking and non-smoking area for breakfast. My friends stayed at Marina Bay Sands during that time. They say that MBS is over rated and it is just the infinity pool. nothing more, nothing less. They wish they were staying at Stamford @ Swissotel. The location is so near to anything. Suntec, train station, esplanade mall, etc. I definitely recommend this hotel. Would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Had a very nice experience”
Reviews.Author: Jituvaxhish
Reviews.Content: Swissotel is really a heritage as it is the tallest hotel in the singapore and It organizes the stairs marathon every year.Rooms are really spacious and location is too good as right in the heart of Singapore. Views are awesome. Hotel staff is really very cooperative.Because of shopping mall right next to it some people find it more crowded as well but my experience was really good.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff - worst bed ever - not really the promised perfection”
Reviews.Author: gabgeneva
Reviews.Content: First the positives: the room on the 47th floor has a gorgeous view, is clean and at first sight seemed reasonably well equiped. Now the rest: Bathroom is small and not especially luxurious. Bed is hard like a floorboard (it's many a year that I slept quite as bad...woke up with a neck and back pain this morning). Hairdryer didn't work and it took two calls and over 20 minutes wait to get a replacement...making me seriously late for a meeting. Staff at the reception is exceptionally welcoming and well trained to deal with complaints. Because complain I did...not that it helped much, since all beds in the hotel seem to be of the same tough quality. Most business travellers would probably agree with me: there is nothing more important than a comfortable bed...something that is dearly missing in this hotel. Breakfast room reminds me of a swiss cantine...not much ambiance...but then maybe travellers from other countries find this charming. Here again, the staff did much to aleviate my deception. An especially friendly cook (judging by his outfit) actually offered me spontaneously a bigger spoon, seeing that I had only a coffee spoon to eat my cereal...I thought that was really great. Finally, what also makes me angry is the corporate speak about "a taste for perfection" and "sustainability together", which is not much more than empty words. I always hang my towel up, because I really don't need a new towel every day...of course the towel was changed. I am stuck here for a few more nights since it isn't apparently possible to easily move to another hotel... oh well. Next time I know better.

Reviews.Title: “A Trip to Remember”
Reviews.Author: abhijit_k2003
Reviews.Content: Swissotel at the Stamford is one of the best place I find at Singapore, Its like being at home, The hotel has excellent view you can see harbour front, Marina Bay and the lovely sea The MRT is well connected and shopping never ends, you can find Indian Food joints and enjoy local food courts too Best part is the rooftop view...... you must visit once to experience all this

Reviews.Title: “Good quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bristraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed on 2 occasions whilst travelling on our Honeymoon - both times fanastic welcome on the driveway from the attendants and a fast checkin. Both times got a late checkout of 4pm(rather than 12pm) and free bottles of wine in the room. Hotel is clean, and in a fantastic location right in the middle of the raffles shopping centre. Hotel is quite busy with airline crews,but they have their own seperate checkin area near the lifts, and are very unobtrusive to staying here, not a big deal as some of the other reviews make out.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Internet Connection = Dealbreaker!”
Reviews.Author: Daniel H
Reviews.Content: Sorry, I wanted to like this hotel, but the fact that the internet cuts in and out constantly means that I can't respond to business emails in the evening, so I refuse to stay here again. I can't wait to check out and go to the Marina Bay Sands, where I know the internet connection is reliable and fast. I would consider Swissotel if they make a stronger commitment to respecting the business traveler's internet requirements and invest in the necessary infrastructure. It's 2012 people, we should not have to spend 30 minutes a night 5 nights a week getting IT at the hotel to fix the internet for us, only to have it crap out again after 30 minutes. For $128/wk for internet, I demand much better. Sorry guys...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Mulgan
Reviews.Content: The Stamford is a big hotel which is popular with business travelers. So how did a family with 2 young children get on? Fist of all entering the lobby we greeted by the staff asking how they could help us. This is a nice touch - there are plenty of staff floating around the lobby helping people who are either arriving or go out somewhere and need assistance. The check in very quick and friendly - up to our room in a few minutes. Why do other hotels take so long to check you in? Especially when they have most of your details? Asked for a room on a high floor - great views of the Marina area from the 58th floor! The room was clean, light and comfortable. The only problem we had was with the bathroom. The shower (over the bath) has a small glass door which does nothing much to stop water going all over the bathroom floor. This must be a problem in all rooms, as we came back for one more night after staying a few days on Sentosa. One good feature in the rooms (which other hotels could learn from) was the electrical sockets. By the desk the sockets accept all plugs from around the world. No need for adaptors. They also have a couple of 120w plugs for American tourists. The hotel is in a great central location with malls and MRT underground. We didn't book breakfasts at the hotel as there are plenty of cheap choices downstairs in the mall. Next time in Singapore we would happily stay here again, especially as most hotels in Singapore don't accept bookings for a family of four.

Reviews.Title: “stay here only for the VIEW!”
Reviews.Author: amadeusgalileosabre
Reviews.Content: upon arrival at the hotel, at about 6pm, we were checked into the wrong type of room. we were downgraded literally. we booked a harbor view room. after we brought this matter up with the Duty Manager, we had to wait for over an hour for the new room. after a bad start, things got worst; chip tea mugs, moldy bathroom and no hot water until the 10am the following day. had two cold showers, made more complaints, finally it was fixed. we did receive a credit for the no hot water issue. over the next few days, the chip tea mug returned to the room. I couldn't be bothered to complaint anymore. we stayed on the Executive Floor, with breakfast in the morning and pre-dinner drinks in the evening; which was all excellent. service was a bit hit and miss. the hotel is just under the City Hall station which is very convenient to travel around. we visited the New Asia Bar during day time; the atmosphere is more like a night-club. we didn't bother to try any of the restaurant in-house. overall, it was an expensive hotel but it got the best uninterrupted view. it is an old hotel too. smallish bathroom, no walk-in shower stall but they have Nespresso machine which is awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Awful old dirty faulty rooms”
Reviews.Author: Fly241
Reviews.Content: I stay here almost weekly wih the airline I work for. We get put in dirty old smelly rooms. Faulty dripping showers, no hot water, blocked sinks and broken taps. Broken balcony doors broken air conditioning dusty rooms stained carpets and sheets. I hope the hotel read this and realise word of mouth outside the crews that come can have a impact on other future bookings. Because we stay there every time we come to work why shouldn't we have a nice room like any other guest.

Reviews.Title: “Great, as ever”
Reviews.Author: webmonkeyuk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night on a stop-over between London and Sydney. The staff were helpful, the rooms clean, well presented and the rooms have fantastic views. It's well located too with shopping, tourist sites and MRT stations right on the doorstep. We were slightly unlucky in that there's some building work going on nearby at the moment and they seemed to be running the site through the night. Noise from the building site didn't wake us up but was noticeable as we tried to go to sleep. I appreciate that there's little or nothing the hotel is able to do about this.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: JJLR
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week and were very satisfied with this hotel. The service was excellent, rooms were very clean, tidy and well equiped. Below the hotel is a shopping centre where you can eat and shop to your hearts content. The hotel is close to Suntec shopping centre but away from Orchard Road although the train system is very close and efficient to get you there.

Reviews.Title: “"Good location, great views, friendly staff"”
Reviews.Author: Youngrose
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent location; the MRT stop from the airport is practically outside the door and you can also easily walk to areas such as Marina Bay and Singapore River. The hotel staff are very friendly and efficient - our check in was quick and we were pleased to be given an upgrade to a superior room with fantastic views. We were only using the hotel as a stop-over so didn't have chance to use facilities such as the pool and restaurants. As we were departing on a late night flight, we were grateful to be told we could have a shower when we came to collect our luggage. We were given the key to a room but found the bathroom full of used towels and several dirty coffee cups left in the room. On phoning reception, this was swiftly dealt with. (Users of the room are requested to phone for arrange servicing as they leave but clearly many people don't bother to do this.) Maybe naively, we hadn't realised the room was communal and were rather surprised to be joined by a family of four soon after we arrived. Perhaps this could be mentioned at reception; I'm sure we're not the first people to obliviously wander round semi-naked!

Reviews.Title: “Dizzying Views!”
Reviews.Author: SydneyKate_40
Reviews.Content: I didn't really need to leave my room to see all the major sights of Singapore, I could view them from my balcony! We were given a room on the 50th floor and could see Marina bay sands, The Esplanade, Singapore River, Merlion, the City skyline and more, it was awesome. The room was nice and clean (not overly luxurious). The location was great not just for views but for practical reasons with the City Hall MRT downstairs and the Esplanade MRT across the road but easily accessible through underground connections. Raffles City shopping mall is also downstairs and connects to the City Mall shops and Suntec City. If you are craving a Singapore Sling then "Raffles Hotel" is just across the road. We didn't try many of the Hotel restuarants but did enjoy having breakfast by the pool at the "Alligator Pear cafe". The hotel pool and spa is also lovely and worth a mention, even if you only use the complimentary spa pools and steam rooms. The Staff were always polite and helpful.I would certainly stay at the Swissotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with Great View”
Reviews.Author: Jason C
Reviews.Content: The location is great, within walks to all the downtown attractions and tons of restaurants/shopping malls, and the City Hall MRT interchange is just a stone throw away. Check in process was quick and pleasant, room was clean and spacious. Did not try the hotel's restaurant and the pool. The night view of the Marina Bay Sands is unbeatable!

Reviews.Title: “It was a memorable stay”
Reviews.Author: Visakan
Reviews.Content: This place is located right in the center of the city. Its sits over a shopping mall with lots of options for eating and shopping. The check-in process was delayed in-spite of, requesting for an early check-in. Truly felt high priced for making us wait and delay our itinerary by 4hrs, costed us missing the visit to the ZOO It was our anniversary and requested some help on planning to have something done in the room, but sadly it was missed and we managed to enjoy outside. Had to wait in the lobby for 2 hours early in the morning after a overnight flight, seemed like they were running full. Anyways we were really happy with the room we got on the 22 second floor. It was clean, spacious room with big bed, TV, french window, the view of the harbor was mind blowing. At night the lights and the sound of super bikes and cars lets you connect to Singapore. but then there was not much place to sit out and enjoy the view. The pool is shared with the neighboring hotel and was extremely crowded and no one from swissotel's side was there to ease you. the other hotel had employees attending there own guests. The travel desk was really helpful in booking our trips to universal studio and even guiding us with MRT and bus options to zoo and sentosa. There was some official meeting at the hotel at the same time and I saw the most expensive cars in the world roll in, it was worth the watch all lined up. It is sure a luxury hotel to stay with a taste of economy in it. The breakfast buffet was OK. Not great, too oily and rich to taste. Kinda got too much to take by the 3rd day. Was given entry into a room for late check out and found that it had to be shared by 3 other couples, Imagine getting ready in front of 6 people inside a room meant for 2. Last minute packing of the things just bought and the rush added, it was the most stressed out time. Would definitely recommend staying here for its comfortable rooms, great location and easy access to anywhere (Malls, MRT, clark quay by walk...)

Reviews.Title: “Great view from floor 45”
Reviews.Author: Eddy V
Reviews.Content: we first arrived by mrt at 10 pm after our plane landed we then went to the very neat and tidy lobby once we had checked. The view was superb and the room was clean and modern. The mall downstairs was very nice but a bit pricy.

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: pinaygaro
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my husband and 3-year old son at Swissotel The Stamford for 2 nights and it was a pleasant experience. We mainly chose this hotel due to it's location, right next to a mall and an MRT station. The hotel lobby was big but it seemed very busy and quite impersonal, but the efficient service more than made up for it. We booked a standard classic room. Upon check-in, we were informed that we were upgraded to an Executive Room. This comes with full access to the Executive Lounge, free breakfast and cocktails, and complimentary internet access. It was really a pleasant surprise. We were also offered welcome drinks, which we enjoyed in the Lounge. We were given a room in the 58th floor with a balcony with an awesome harbour view. My husband, a photography enthusiast, had fun taking shots of the Marina Bay. The room was spacious and had 2 big beds which was perfect for us. The bathroom was big and clean. Housekeeping arrived late afternoon, and since the room did not need fixing yet, they just offered us chocolates, to my son's delight. We tried the early evening cocktails and it was already a light meal. Breakfast was also nice. They had a good mix of food available and since we are having breakfast at the Lounge, there weren't too many people around. Service was excellent. Staff were approachable and helpful. Check-out was a breeze. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great location.”
Reviews.Author: RhondaMJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel twice in the past six weeks, once on our way to Europe and once on the way back. Because of our having a midnight flight we booked an executive club room. The extra price was well worth it as we able to avail ourselves of a late checkout on both occasions and also having the use of the club room after checking out. Breakfast is also in this room on the 60th floor. Great views while you eat. It is the staff that makes this hotel. It is possible to forget the dated decor (the beds are firm and comfortable and the place is spotless) when you have such a caring and friendly staff right from the ones who deal with you directly to the ones you meet casually in the lifts or corridors.. Before our midnight flight we were able to have drinks and a meal at the Happy Hour in the club lounge and after our long flight from Europe were welcomed with drinks and a small meal. My suggestion is to upgrade to the executive rooms as the service, free use of internet and the Happy Hour snacks and drinks (which is really an evening meal and made use of by guests with young families) make it really well worthwhile. We will stay here again becuse of the location right above the shopping centre and Metro and mostly because of the kindness and friendliness of the staff. One even made sure a nervous photographer felt safe while taking a photo from the balcony on the 60th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: tigga23
Reviews.Content: We booked into the Swissotel during a stopover on the way to Australia. We had to book two nights, even though we only actually stayed one - just to keep the use of the room for the second day (flight out was around midnight). Check-in was easy, and staff polite. We had booked a smoking room, and although given a smoking room, there was no ashtray, so we called the desk, and one was delivered reasonably quickly. We decided to treat ourselves to a beer each from the mini bar, before heading down to Clarke Quay - to find our mini bar was stocked with one beer only, and nothing else. Another phone call resulted in a vist from the Room Service attendant, who re-stocked the mini-bar, but with warm drinks. I had a feeling there would be issues with this on check-out, and I was right - when checking out I was presented with a bill which included the one cold beer (which we did have (shared)), plus some red wine. I thought it odd that the bill was only for one additional item, when the entire minibar had to be restocked. The bill was amended, and we paid it. I had requested a room on a high floor, and we were given a room on the 43rd floor, with amazing views. There is a taxi rank at the front of the hotel for guests, and when we left for the airport, we were given priority - I assume because we were going to the airport? Next time we stopover in Singapore, we'll probably stay here again, is it is a nice hotel, and it is in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Tired Hotel, past use by date”
Reviews.Author: Martin S
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel about 16 years ago, under previous owners and thought the views were fantastic and with the addition of the new Marina Sands opposite they still are fantastic. Unfortunately the views were the only thing that compared favourably with my previous stay. The check in person was cold and robotic. I had booked a Grand room and in size it was grand but the decor was dated and furniture was grubby. The lounge suit was so soiled on the arms that it really belonged at a rubbish tip. The TV remote only worked if you held the button down for a prolonged period. Unless you have a company credit card I suggest you stay away fron the restaurants, again fantastic views but the food was average at best and the prices were obscene. For the price of one glass of a mid range Australian red I could purchase 2 bottles of the same drop at home.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, average room”
Reviews.Author: melly192
Reviews.Content: Went on a weekend getaway with my husband just this weekend and decided to stay at the Swissotel The Stamford for the location. We were in Singapore for only a little over 24 hours and didn't want to waste time walking to the MRT station. The hotel, for a 5-star chain hotel in Singapore, is just OK. Lobby is a little on the small side, and consequently, quite crowded. However, service was very good with staff always quick to assist. Our room was on the 27th floor, with views of the War Memorial Park, Esplanade, Marina Bay Sands, and the Singapore flyer. The view at night was quite amazing. The room is outdated, but the bed is comfortable. What I didn't like was the foldable glass shower wall that had a small gap for the hinges, which meant that the floor beside the shower/toilet would flood a little when you shower. Location is superb. The hotel is adjacent to the Raffles City shopping centre with a foodcourt just below the hotel. Also below the hotel is the City Hall MRT station and an underpass to the Esplanade. Overall, it's quite pricey for an outdated hotel. It's great for short stays, but for longer stays I prefer other newer, quieter hotels on Marina Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Swissotel The Stamford”
Reviews.Author: BastiBas
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in! A very comfortable room with a great bathroom, big balcony and a very good bed. The service and staff are very professional and always helpful, nice atmosphere. There is a free wi-fi in every room. I really recomend to book a room with breakfast. It's varied, fresh and you can find a lot of typical dishes. This hotel has also a top location and you can book a room with a very good view on the high floor

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location with gorgeous view”
Reviews.Author: PackToGo
Reviews.Content: This property used to be The Westin Stamford and still offers a very convenient location with The Raffles multi-level shopping mall below and access to the super efficient subway system without even crossing a street. In addition, a network of below ground air conditioned walkways inter-connect to adjacent office buildings, hotels and other sites in the Marina Square area. A definite plus when it is pouring rain or baking hot outside! Some of the hotel rooms are a bit dated with Westin-era furniture but still offer a comfortable enviroment and jaw-dropping spectacular views from its private balconies. Request a high-floor room facing the Singapore river or the new Sands casino. The Orchard Rd shopping district is only a five minute subway ride away!

Reviews.Title: “Impressive”
Reviews.Author: Desalves
Reviews.Content: Hotel is at a perfect location. I enjoyed my stay so much. When we arrived, there was a lady in red cheongsam and the doorman with a cool hat who greeted me by my name and the reception already knew who I was. I had a room on level 55. Housekeeping was superb too. We came back always to a clean room. Everyday we would pop by the Concierge. Their suggestions were always with taste. I remembered particularly the concierge- Shahari who on one of the evenings, made us a booking at the ship looking hotel for dinner and he was there again the next morning to check if we enjoyed the dinner!! I will be back again next summer!

Reviews.Title: “Maybe not the best known hotel in Singapore but certainly one of the very best!”
Reviews.Author: Dubaibob23
Reviews.Content: I originally booked into the Intercontinental but then was recommended to move to the Stamford, and am so glad I did. I often find service is not great in Singapore, not poor, but not to the very best standards, this Swissotel changed my opinion! Whoever manages this hotel has worked extensively on ensuring that their staff have the confidence to give travellers the service that they require and this does not mean that everyone wants the same service which is what most groups tend to assume. The hotel is in a great location next to Raffles and within walking distance of most of the main attractions. There is a great selection of restaurants within the complex as well as an excellent bar and night club up on the roof. The rooms are well appointed with an interesting mix of styles and I would recommend upgrading to the club floors on the upper part of the hotel. Certainly will be my first choice when I go back to Singapore, hopefully in the near future!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I've ever stayed at!!!”
Reviews.Author: perthG
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in July 2010 for 5 nights. We booked an Executive Suite, which I would highly recommend. As part of the deal you get full access to the Executive lounge on the 60th floor where you can have breakfast and evening drinks and canapés which are more like a meal than a snack. Not even once we needed dinner after enjoying a wide selection of warm and cold dishes + deserts and drinks at the Executive lounge! The best Executive lounge ever! The service is also amazing! The room + bathroom was specious, stylish and really comfortable. I didn't want to leave! When in Singapore, don't bother looking for any other hotel, you won't find anything better than this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad”
Reviews.Author: julie r
Reviews.Content: The rooms at this hotel are very nice. Good size room, well appointed work desk,nice size bathroom, overall the room and facilities are very nice. the locations is excellent to get to anywhere in central Singapore. Direct link to the Raffles Shopping Centre was a bonus. On a negative note the in room dining was terrible. The food was disgusting, cold and tasted old, like it had been kept warm for hours. On one occasion I complained about my toasted sandwich being cold and the chips old , cold and greasy. They send another tray but there was no difference and I did not eat any of it. I could prepare a better toasted sandwich than this hotel. The food was disgusting and overpriced and I really resented having to pay so much for food worse than a fast food outlet. When I was checking out the receiptionist asked me if I was happy with everything. I replied "no" however I believe they just ask this question of everyone but really aren't interested as she wasn't even listening to my answer. I also thought the WIFI rates were very expensive. I would return to this hotel for the location and the rooms but would not eat there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great service - terrible restaurant”
Reviews.Author: PortlandQuay
Reviews.Content: After two weeks in Italy, the contrast with Italian hotels was dramatic, with a brilliant welcome and sense of arrival, both in terms of service and the facilities. Room was excellent in every sense - everything you would expect in a five star hotel in a great location with great service. Our only mistake was to stay in the hotel for lunch, we found the Schezuan Court Restaurant to be a real disappointment, friendly service staff let down by really terrible (and I mean terrible!) food. This isn't an issue for other travellers, just make sure you seek out one of the many other restaurants surrounding the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Stamford again”
Reviews.Author: voyager-liese
Reviews.Content: We stayed again in “The Stamford” for 5 nights. Tallest building of Singapore with more than 70 floors. We had an executive-club room on the 59th floor, Marina Bay View, which is simply great. Take the the long bank in front of your bed, put it outside on the small balcony and enjoy the the buzzing and humming of the night and the illuminated view of the town. On our last day they had started the preparations for the F1 and we could see the racing course illuminated – whow!. The hotel is not really 5 stars, but the room is big enough, the bathroom could be renovated, there are no towelholders, the scales in both rooms we stayed in showed 5 kg less than at home and made me happy, but acually they were totally rusty and useless. The entrance of the hotel is 100 footsteps from the MRT station CityHall which is a great advantage. Often long queues at reception. For the club rooms you ask some of the staff to let you up to the 60th floor so you can check-in there(elevators require your keycard to function and give access only to certain floors). Breakfast and snacks in the evening in the executive lounge is good, the service is friendly and attentive. The prices are rather on the high side.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: AdelaidianTraveller
Reviews.Content: The Swissotel Stamford is a well located hotel in Singapore. It's near the Raffles Place shopping center and the MRT station. The rooms are modern, comfortable and well appointed. The rooms on the Marina Bay side of the hotel building offer a great view of the Marina Bay, including the Sands casino, the cricket ground, and the city skyline. It's a good place to staty for viewing the F1 car race, as the race can be viewed from the balcony. Highly recommended as a good base will staying in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice in singapore”
Reviews.Author: p750777
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in september to coincide with our wedding anniversary. This is a large hotel and home for many airline crews including ba and qantas. Spite the hotel being large and busy the efficiency at checking was superb. I was recognised by name at the door and whisked straight to a checking desk and helped by a gentleman named Daniel who had noted that this was a stay for my wedding anniversary and gave us a lovel room on floor 39 (there are 70 floors) overlooking the harbour. The rom was not especially modern but was in excellent condition with fabulous views and is of a good size. The location of the hotel is superb right next to city hall mrt and a short walk from clark quay. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location and views and thats it!”
Reviews.Author: tracenjimmy
Reviews.Content: I have written a previous review about this hotel and have since stayed there numerous times and feel that I have to update my view. The location is great, right in the middle of Singapore above raffles place mall with fantastic views from most rooms and the service has improved slowly but surely. My last stay here was during the GP where the hotel was absolutely full, I noticed that in the lobby quietly sitting on the couches were seven scantily dressed asian prostitutes waiting for customers! I was shocked! I thought to myself that maybe they are there waiting for a party upstairs and gave them the benefit of the doubt but then saw one of them being propositioned by a customer and whisked of to a room. It's as if during GP week the Swissotel turns into a high class version of Patong.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: j0anna45
Reviews.Content: I only spent one night in the Stamford on my way to Malaysia and was lucky enough to get an incredible deal, including breakfast on the Secret Deals, Wotif website. As I know Singapore very well being very regular visitors, I had always wanted to stay in the tallest hotel in Singapore. From Changi airport I took the MRT to City Hall, and as the hotel is on top of the MRT station, is only a very short walk to the hotel. Checkin was fast and efficient, likewise checkout. My room was spacious, although outdated but paying such a cheap rate I didn't mind that for the one night. Staff are very friendly and accommodating, as I had an early evening flight to Malaysia, I even managed to get a late checkout. Breakfast was excellent, with the breakfast room nice and bright, with a very good selection of everything. I would definitely stay in the Stamford again, although I would request a brighter room for a longer stay. The location could not be better and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Large room, good mall(s), well located ... & tall”
Reviews.Author: Mavrikke
Reviews.Content: The title covers most of it but the Swissotel is one experience we always remember fondly. Clean hotel, warm lobby, spacious rooms, good food and prompt service. Need we say more? Fantastic view from our room (48th floor) from where you can see several landmarks. The bar on the top of the building is a must visit. The entrance to the MRT station is conveniently located and there are several malls within walking distance. With several options for recreation and easy accesibility to any part of Singapore you wont regret choosing this one...

Reviews.Title: “What more could you want”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn M
Reviews.Content: What more could you want ? The Swissotel on Samford has it all. Location Location, Style, comfort, great food with variety plus, awsome views, fantastic staff, who are an absolute library of information, fabulous additional facilities and a quality of service that is platinum. My father (84years) and I always stay at this particular Hotel when we visit in Singapore, it has everything one needs for a great experience in this beautiful city. It is extreamley well located for all of your holiday activities Congradulations to you all at Swissotel on Samford forgoing the extra mile to make sure your clients are so well taken care of you are unique. We will be back for Christmas. Thankyou, Ted and Carolyn

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: beabb11
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night only in September. Check-in was efficient, staff were friendly and we were upgraded to a newly renovated room. Room was great and a good size for a Singapore hotel room. It even had a small private balcony from which we could see the pool, Suntec City mall, and Marina Bay Sands building. Pool was lovely, cool and clean, it appears to be shared with the Fairmont hotel but we didn't find it too busy. Buffet breakfast was extensive and excellent. The hotel is in a very convenient location, right on top of an MRT station and a shopping mall, and easy walking distance to several other malls including Suntec. Overall it was an excellent stay and we would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Executive floor a gem”
Reviews.Author: PandaBennettaway
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Swissotel the Stamford in February in an executive club room. It is more expensive, however included a lovely buffet breakfast, refreshments all day and the fabulous evening drinks and canapés which served as a light dinner on 2 evenings. We arrived on an early flight and the fabulous Suraya (our executive floor concierge) arranged for breakfast for us and a hospitality room to shower and freshen up so we could begin sightseeing. She was also very helpful with local tourism information. Our room was on the same floor as the lounge, very convenient, the view was amazing and the room was spacious and comfortable. There was a lavazzo espresso machine in the room and staff were more than happy to bring extra milk when required. Overall, such a wonderful experience we are returning with a group of friends in 2013 and can't wait to stay at the Swissotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but a litle pricey”
Reviews.Author: JMMcE
Reviews.Content: The Swissotel Stamford is a very efficient, modern style hotel. Room was excellent, breakfast was average and pricey. Equinox buffet was excellent and also pricey but worth the money which the ordinary breakfast wasn't staff. Location is very good, staff are efficient and professional rather than friendly and overall a good hotel but moderate value for money as you are paying a good price for the quality.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms bit old”
Reviews.Author: applecart3355
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Good for value. Nice breakfast. Adjacent to big shopping mall and MRT Station. Actually the nicer version is at Fairmont, which is slightly more expensive. But Swissotel has Equinox restaurant that you must try for a great view over Singapore island.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: MaxineH
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a beautiful room on the 53rd floor and had views of Singapore's amazing skyline and harbour area. It is directly above a shopping complex and a MRT station. (City Hall). We found the rail system very easy to use. We bought a tourist pass and had all day use of bus and rail lines. You are given a $10 refund when you hand ticket in at end of your use. We took a rickshaw from front of hotel to Clarke Quay for dinner. Amazing food and quite reasonable in price. Restaurants try to outdo each other offering free drinks ect. Chairlift to Sentosa Island is fun.

Reviews.Title: “Week end surprise”
Reviews.Author: richardhorsan
Reviews.Content: location of the hotel is excellent, near the MRT , Malls , Restaurants, you name it!..Staf also friendly and very helpfull { the one named "Syukur" is one of the best} We stayed at the Swissotel for 3 nights. Check in on wednesday, August 17th and leaving on saturday , 20th..The view from room 6257 is very nice . From the very first day of our stay at the hotel , I noticed water dripping from the ceiling above the bath tub., because we did not know if it is clean water or dirty sewage , we decided not to use the bath tub. We also decided not to complain because we did not like the "fuss" changing rooms. Then on Saturday , i decided to report the leak because its getting worse! A man came and took a look and said thats its water from above ( i can see its from above ..yes). then my daugther took a bath and just as she was finished the whole ceilling above the bath tub collapsed missing her by inches , the whole bath tub was filled with debris and material from the ceiling..Can you imagine the shock and anxiety that we had if it had hit her ?.Well all the fun and peace that we had in Singapore was gone in an instant.I did not expect it to happen in a 5 star hotel or even lesser hotels, then came the hustle of changing rooms taking a bath and hurrying of to the Air Port, i was so upset that i left my wallet in our room , so i made the trip to the Air Port twice..luckyly the Plane was delayed 10 minutes. There goes our holiday!! I AM SORRY that it has to end on this note! Well finally 1 question, on my credit card bill says Swissotel FAIRMONT AND I STAYED AT Swissotel Stamford?

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great views”
Reviews.Author: tcanyon
Reviews.Content: Clean, luxurious, great location. Definately recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great views”
Reviews.Author: Awahed
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel in Singapore. Conviniently located as you have a shopping centre adjacent to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good tourist-class hotel”
Reviews.Author: Liteh
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Swissotel The Stamford hotel for 5 nights from Christmas Eve 2010. This was my third or fourth stay at The Stamford over the past few years. Pros: · unbeatable views in virtually all the rooms, even on lower floors · direct access to multiple metro and bus lines (metro system stop under the hotel) -- and underground walkway to various other business and tourist points · clean · comfortable beds · good shower pressure · excellent fitness facilities (but you have walk across the way to the sister hotel to enter) · access to shopping mall under the hotel, with food courts · on my first stay, some years back, I'd arrived early in the morning before the room was ready; I was offered a rest in a lounge where I was able to take a shower and watch tv while waiting for my room to be readied · for Christmas, staff went around Christmas eve and left gifts in all the rooms (not mine as I didn't want to be disturbed) -- a nice touch Cons: · reception staff can be very impersonal handling so many guests coming and going; for guests staying in regular rooms, it's easy to get a feeling of being herded like cattle sometimes while waiting to check in and check out (there are staff equipped with earphones like security agents, who direct guests from the queues to various desks depending on the guests' needs) · a couple of days I had trouble getting a consistent internet connection (with attempts at both wired and wireless access) using the hotel's access point -- this was very annoying because I had paid the additional fee for internet access; I notified the technical desk but didn't get very far, so I ended up using a mobile hotspot access I'd bought outside the hotel · I was given wrong information about how to reach the fitness facility on my most recent visit, and I ended up getting lost in the hotel in the process (I was pretty sure the info I had been given was wrong, however, because I'd visited the fitness rooms on previous visits) I am somewhat surprised to read some of the negative reviews of The Stamford here on tripadvisor. I've been fortunate in never having had any problems with seriously faulty plumbing or air conditioning, unpleasant odors, or decrepit furnishings, and I'd absolutely return when looking for a comfortable mid-level budget room. But don't expect glamor or luxury at The Stamford. It's the kind of hotel that airline crews regularly stay at. For luxury, there are many better choices in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Close to CBD n Mrt”
Reviews.Author: Ajaxajs
Reviews.Content: I like swissotel, it gives me miles per stay... + it's cleaner than fairmont :D Stayed here only once but liked it! Fairmont's neighbour but I liked the service more... But it shares it pool with fairmont... I got lost once n cudnt find my room! Lol...

Reviews.Title: “Great location, big room”
Reviews.Author: Nicinici
Reviews.Content: City hall is a perfect location for stay in singapore as it is easy to go to everywhere. Free wifi was included in our room rate and I downloaded the map and bus route from my iPad for my daily trip. I prefer bus than MRT as it is more enjoyable and good for sightseeing. It is always a less than 5 minutes walk from hotel to go to nearby bus stop. Also loves the supermarket in basement and do some shopping in Robinson department store downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “terrific hotel”
Reviews.Author: alice k
Reviews.Content: loved swissotel, very spacious room, 2 queen size bed. efficient check in and check out. friendly and polite front desk. but the carpet seems to be a little old. the breakfast has many varieties to choose from. terrific location, close to the mrt, easy access to food.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel and view”
Reviews.Author: Helene C
Reviews.Content: We planned this holiday at Singapore as my husband and I were celebrating our 50 th and 60 th Birthday , On check in, the hotel up graded us to the 61 st floor in the executive level and also gave us a birthday cake . The view on the balcony was amazing and the room was very comfortable and spacious. Each evening they turned down the bed and left you a chocolate on the bed. The view was amazing and we watched the laser light show on the river from the casino. We would recommend this hotel and found the staff very friandly . Our room also included breakfast which was a buffett style and had a great variety of hot and cold foods . The service was first class and were happy to help you in any way including directions on how to get to your daily destination .

Reviews.Title: “Great location but needs some attention”
Reviews.Author: PHOAustralia
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located perfectly if you enjoy shopping. The quality and service is a little tired. It's busy and full of business people who are not staying there for 5 star luxury, and neither were we. We spent little time in the room. The better part of the hotel is where you can enjoy the gym, pool area, spas, saunas and steam rooms in the change rooms. Overall there is nothing wrong with the hotel, it is just in need of some care in some places....for example the frayed towels in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for shops and transport”
Reviews.Author: sandrajc
Reviews.Content: We had no problems with our stay here. I was meeting my parents here and I was pleased that our rooms were on the same floor and next to each other. My parents arrived late at night and I requested that they be facilitated at check in because they would be tired. This happened. My own check in was also prompt. I was met as I came into the foyer and escorted to the counter. I was surprised on arrival at my room that there were 2 checks within 10 minutes as to whether I had any problems. Checks were obviously not coordinated but not of concern to me. It is clear that the hotel is trying to ensure guests are satisfied (although probably too early to tell within the first 10 minutes). There was another satisfaction check the next day. The room on the 10th floor had a musty smell but not too strong. I quickly became used to it. I found it clean and tidy. The view was not exciting - tennis courts - but then I didn't pay for a seaview. The bath was great with a good showerhead. The room contained 2 smallish double beds. I had a small amount of trouble with the air con - it seemed to only work on high or low. Anyway, I settled on low and found no need to seek assistance from hotel technicians. Couldn't work out why there was some sort of dryer machine going the entire stay in the hall near the elevators on the 10th floor. Bit of a mystery. Just perplexing rather than disturbing. The hotel is very well located for access to the MRT and shopping. I went up to Orchard Road but then found most of the shops I was interested in were located in the Raffles Shopping Centre. Plenty of food shops around including a foodcourt at the top of the Raffles Centre. We didn't pay for breakfast at the hotel and found plenty of choice around the hotel. Didn't check out the swimming pool or the business centre. Check out was smooth.

Reviews.Title: “Corporate hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: mvo168
Reviews.Content: This is a purely business/corporate hotel. The location is very central and convenient - it's within a shopping mall with a large food basement and a food court on the 2nd/3rd floor of the shopping mall. It is also right next to an MRT station (connected via underground so you don't even have to step out of the building).

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient hotel for business and leisure travellers”
Reviews.Author: frappeo
Reviews.Content: The crowds (main families and airline staff) waiting in the lobby area attest to the popularity of Swissotel The Stamford and their competitive room rates. Although the hotel was busy when I checked in, the front desk staff werecommenable for their speed and friendliness. As I stay at the Fairmont more often than the Swissotel Stamford I did not expect special treatment at the latter. The hotel was having a busy day so I was pleasantly surprised when the lady checking me in recognised me from my last visit few months ago, welcomed me back warmly and upgraded me to a Swiss Premier Advantage room. The room was recently renovated and had one of those new fangled coffee machine that saved me a trip to Starbucks every morning. (See photos posted separately.) I liked the big glass desk and the great wifi speed. As indicated by other reviewers the bathroom looked a little dated but its cleanliness and spaciousness more than made up for the dated decor. What matters to me is that everything is in serviceable condition. Water pressure was great, as were the fluffy towels and quality toiletries. If one is partcular about bathrooms, pay a little more to stay at the Fairmont Hotel in the same Shopping/office/convention centre and ask for a South Tower room. I was offered a late check out based on my flight itinerary without having to ask for it - exemplary attention to detail by the front desk despite this being a large hotel catering to many airline crews. I eventually checked out at peak time of 1pm and was surprised an Indian male staff at the front desk took the trouble to ask me about my stay. I shall definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “In desperate need of refurbishment - no longer a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: o2bblonde
Reviews.Content: We will not stay at this hotel again as it is just getting too old and desperately needs refurbishing. My husband who is very relaxed and never comments about hotels, said we have done our time at the Stamford and won't be coming back. We have stayed here three times in total and always have trouble with leaking taps, showers that do not work properly, damp smelling rooms and basically it is just old and run down. We had to change remote controls 3x and had the technician in twice for the poor TV quality/sound but nothing was fixed. We tried to watch two movies but had to ring and ask for them to be cancelled on our bill as the sound quality was so bad you could not watch it. Both the lady on the phone and the technician said they would get back to us....and we are still waiting! Upon check out we were questioned several times about two bottles of water (which we had not used) and sign a piece of paper with the price on it for the Evian water, saying it was not us. Surely something as simple as stocking the minibar correctly is not too much to ask before guests check in. We happened to be there over the weekend (27/28 August) and trying to get in for breakfast was a challenge as you have to fight the locals who have also come to the hotel for breakfast. We must have waited 15-20 minutes to be seated. The positive - the staff are very good and the location is superb but it is no longer a 5 star hotel and should not be rated as one until it is renovated.

Reviews.Title: “Not 5 Star!”
Reviews.Author: Jon T
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for the last two days of our Honeymoon around SE Asia. We selected the hotel for its location and it was an ideal place to stay for that. However, we found cockroaches in the bathroom on our second morning.....we were offered a 50% room discount and free meal but then the free meal was awful in the Swiss Cafe and my wife could not eat any of her burger. There are surely far better 5 star hotels in Singapore for the same money.

Reviews.Title: “We'll certainly be back!”
Reviews.Author: Bifey
Reviews.Content: We got a room at 62nd floor... Nice view.... Great location... Surrounded by shopping area: raffles city, city link, marina, suntec... Excellent service....

Reviews.Title: “Big and impersonal. Problems with plumbing”
Reviews.Author: JeffPink
Reviews.Content: I travel internationally often for business. I do not have many good things to say about this hotel. I had reserved a king bed room for 3 nights and then needed to add another night so I ended up with 2 separate reservations. Upon check-in they could only offer 2 twin bed room, not a king. The check-in clerk was very rude when I told him that this did not match my reservation. When I went into my room the toilet was dirty (like someone forgot to flush #2). Come to find out that over the course of the first night everyones toilet waste ended up in my bathroom (let's just say I know someone had corn for dinner). I complained the next morning and was offered breakfast (which was included in 1 of my 2 reservations) and a room move (which was negotiated the previous day due to the bed configuration being wrong). I spoke directly to the manager and did not raise my voice or act rude in any way. They offered to move my luggage when the new room was ready but the previous room smeeled so bad with all the human waste in my bathroom that I just brought them down. The next day the desk left a messaqe offering a free bottle of red wine. They must have discovered how awfull the room was that they put me in the first night. As I was in Singapore on business I did not reply for my complimentary bottle until the next day. No luck, no one knew what I was talking about. So no free bottle of wine. I saw several other people complaining whenever I went to the front desk. Many were not as nice as me and just yelled at the front staff. When I complained I asked for the manager and told her I was dissappointed. She took me aside so that others would not hear. I thought that would earn me some service and respect but I do not think they are very organized and they certainly they do not care very much. Even the second room I was in the plumbing made gurggling noises a lot. I was lucky I did not end up with everyone's waste in my bathroom for the second room/night.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel t stay in singapore”
Reviews.Author: rini t
Reviews.Content: friendly staff,very past check in and out,excellent service..spotless room and close to everywhere u want to go,easy to find food because there is food court in the ground level of the hotel, definitely will come back and stay here again everytime we in singapore:))

Reviews.Title: “Most central hotel in Singapore!”
Reviews.Author: thegaltravels
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel because it is most central Singapore. It’s located just next to the MRT which connects to all routes throughout the island. It is also connected to a mall that houses shops worth a visit. Many tourist spots are also within walking distance. I stayed on one of the higher floors and got to enjoy an aerial view of the old Singapore – where life was built around the Singapore River. Rooms were as expected, nothing exceptionally great, but that of a 5 star quality. The rooms are styled mostly for business use. I like in particular the nice touch of having TWG teabags in the room, giving it a taste of luxury. The pool is surprisingly small, given that it is a huge hotel. The gym though small, is luxurious and I had an enjoyable time working out there. On separate occasions I have also dined at the Asian Market Café and it’s a great place to enjoy local fare buffet style that is relatively inexpensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, shopping centre and underground train downstairs!!”
Reviews.Author: burleyboys
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel 6 time now. For convenience it would have to be the best hotel in Singapore. The rooms are large, have a balcony and are very comfortable. If your budget allows stay in an executive room, a little extra service and nighly cocktails and canapes are well worth it!! Having the shopping centre on the ground floor of the hotel, with great shops and even better cafe's and foodcourt, life could not get any easier. The pool is lovely with a resort feel to it. Gym is excellent. My only gripe would be the breakfast. But hey, we don't pay for that anymore, with McDonalds and Gloria Jeans on the ground floor, and plenty of other options why would you?? Don't hesitate, this is a great hotel. And the bar on the 72nd floor, could quite possibly be the most romantic bar going around.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for the busy traveler!”
Reviews.Author: IndigoTravels
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the DELUXE room of the hotel and it all met our expectations. Check-in was hassle-free as the receptionist was highly trained and new exactly what she was discussing. The room was just right for two having all the facilities that are needed to make the stay comfortable. The room was spacious enough to move around in. the view from the room was good. I had a balcony which allowed me to step outside for fresh air. My only comment is that there was no blowdryer which was really surprising for a 4-5 star hotel. At any rate, I was happy with the service and facility. The location of the hotel is convenient to shoppers as it is right beside (access from Hotel) the Raffles Shopping Center and a few minutes walk to Marina Square (mall). Also, its almost across RAFFLES Hotel which is frequently visited by most tourists. This hotel is also very near the MRT station which can bring you to several parts of Singapore. For food lovers, Chijmes - plaza-like bldg that houses restaurants serving various cuisines, is walking distance from the hotel. Its also a 5-dollar (singapore) ride to the Marina Bay area where there are a lot of tourist spots to choose from. An easy MRT ride to Orchard is easily accessible as well. It's not a bad deal for the price paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but dated decor”
Reviews.Author: trekker065
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel many times whilst working in the airline industry. We chose this hotel due to its great location and fantastic views from the high floors. We weren't disappointed by either of these. We booked a 'Grand' room which is a large corner room with 2 balconies and panoramic views from the 40th floor however....the decor has not changed since I stayed there in the early 90's, its not shabby just very dated. Some rooms must have been renovated as the photos on the hotel website do not show this older style room. The other negatives were: the mattress was extremely hard and the shower which is over the bath did not drain sufficiently so that by the time you were half way through a shower you were standing in about 20cm of water. The water in the shower took about 15 minutes to heat up in the morning so we just had to let it run before we got in. These bathroom problems were around years ago when I stayed here. The check-in area is quite small for such a large hotel and check-in/out can take some time. The staff however were friendly and helpful so if its location and view's you want then I suggest asking for a renovated room...hopefully the bathroom problems have been sorted out in them.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Boby038
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Swissotel was a pleasant one. The staff was friendly and yes the place is forever bustling with people. What we liked the most was the easy assess to the mall, supermarket, Starbucks , MC Donald's etc. It's a convenient place to stay and get everything under one roof. The rooms are spacious but the ambiance is not exactly 5 star. The housekeeping services were good as they see to it that rooms are always tidy and clean. The pool and spa facilities are good. My children enjoyed their time in the pool cos they made lots of friends there. The view from our room was excellent. we were at the 61 st floor, the balcony was spacious and safe for children to stand. Loved the late night talks with my kids on the balcony watching the pretty night lights of Singapore. Especially the breakfast spread is excellent, good variety and friendly staff who would always see to it that we were well seated , comfortable and enjoyed the food. Over all a fine hotel to stay with family. We would definitely recommend the place to others.

Reviews.Title: “Failed on important details”
Reviews.Author: travelstyling
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Stamford for 2nights. Having read the previous comments I was already alerted to potentially not getting the best room. When I arrived I was upgraded to a Junior suite however the room is in urgent need of a refurbishment. The furniture and carpet are very old and there is virtually no sign of being a 5 star hotel in Singapore; there is no charm or ‘soul’ in the room. Although you I was not staying in the room often I wish to return to a comfortable environment at the end of the day. The size for a Junior Suite is acceptable however considering the old décor I would have preferred a smaller room but refurbished. Bathroom is extremely small and the shower has no hand held shower head. Wifi is not available in the room and the wired connection is chargeable. Minibar was not refilled during my entire stay, in fact when I arrived I found half a bottle of whiskey in it. View is great and with two balconies it offer great views on major landmarks. Check in was very impersonalized and slow. I had to queue for about 5 minutes until it was my turn. Early check in was requested and granted. Thank you. Lobby is extremely busy and the tour busses and massive amount of people do not make you feel welcome. All in all a good hotel to stay in if you are on business and expect a four star service and accommodation. The worst experience however was Room Service. The quality of food is very poor and the presentation is not appealing at all and for that the value is not there. I did not bother to go to one of the many restaurants. For a single business traveler Room Service is very important; a bite at the end of the day while doing some more work until late night from the room does not allow many people to go out and therefore Room Service becomes the only option. I am afraid The Stamford failed on that important detail. Summary, an acceptable stay however I will most likely not return due to little details which were not delivered and therefore are pretty annoying if your are traveling on business.

Reviews.Title: “Very average”
Reviews.Author: Eur0Canadian
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Swissotel Stamford for over two weeks in July and August 2011. The property is fairly nice with decent sized rooms. The pool is nice and it's well located for the MRT and the shopping mall. Unfortunately staying there for two weeks is too long given the lack of service and amenities for long term bookings. Oddly the rooms don't have very much storage space so many clothes had to stay in luggage. The hotel is extremely large and so it seems to always be busy and difficult to get service. There doesn't seem to be a direct way to get a hold of the concierge to get advice or service and the telephone never gets picked up when calling the operator. The two biggest issues I had were the ridiculous prices for internet service ($180 per week) and they still use the old card in door system which doesn't work. So every day I had to stand on line for 15 minutes to get a card replaced and be told I carried the card in the wrong place (obviously, blame the guests!). Top tip to avoid the lines are to go to the crew desks in the back corner where there are loads of service personnel and limited customers! I hope to not have to go back. Would rather try other hotels in Singapore although the views from Equinox are nice.

Reviews.Title: “Something is missing for a 5*…”
Reviews.Author: Holeekow
Reviews.Content: …Could it be that the bathrobes are worn out? that the shower always splashes water out of the tub and one had to mop up after every shower? that hot water is iffy in the morning? that there is no water at all one morning? none of this is serious enough but all together they add up to less than 5-star rating. You will get 10 bonus points if you can find the gym without asking for directions. On the plus side, the location is excellent. Three subway lines can be accessed through the underground paths. The hotel is connected to hundreds of eateries from fast food to fancy restaurants, hundreds of shops. Name any luxurious brand for watches, purses, dress etc… and chances are you can find it without having to walk outside. The rooms are also well sound-proofed. You can hear door closing but only faintly.

Reviews.Title: “More 4* than 5*”
Reviews.Author: Bebej1976
Reviews.Content: The company I work for has a long term corporate contract with the swissotel and I have been visiting the hotel for ten years.  All in all it's a nice place but I would probably not use the word 'luxury' in describing it.  In the ten years I have been visiting the rooms have not been refurbished. The only change I've noticed is the addition of a more modern tv. Saying that, the rooms remain clean and well maintained. All rooms have tea and coffee in the room and a balcony. And as the lowest floor with rooms is the 8th level you are pretty guaranteed to have a view. Service is pretty good alround, more efficient than friendly.  The pool area is very nice.  The gym is fantastic and very well equipped. The spa facilities are fantastic also. As others have mentioned the hotel is directly linked to a large shopping mall with food courts and shops galore.  There is also a 24hr Starbucks and 24hr mc donalds within the complex.  It is already directly linked to City Hall MRT station.  The hotel itself has over a thousand rooms so always seems to be bustling.  Personally I would prefer somewhere a little more smaller and intimate but if the price was right (and I was getting a refurbished room!) id consider the swissotel again. But I think in fairness it is more four star than five star.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel ,Nice rooms and grounds ....Location super !”
Reviews.Author: F_B_SSydney
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in the Swissotel the Stamford many times over the last 15 years with the Business i work for I can strongly recommend this Hotel ....I like the staff and the size of the rooms ....Its location being so close to the M.R.T station (Underground Railway) and the hotel being in the same complex as a large shopping center with Supermarket and food court make this hotel so User friendly and easy to get around from ......The Gym ,Swimming pool and tennis courts are great and so if you want to just chill out in the Hotel there is plenty of room to do so .......A 5 star set up ...please Enjoy !

Reviews.Title: “Amazing City Views”
Reviews.Author: MEEJ11
Reviews.Content: The views from our room on the 53rd floor were the best in Singapore without having to pay a cent. The balcony is a little scary with kids though. The room itself was OK but not great, we had 2 double beds for 2a and 2k which were on the small side especially when the room is big enough for 2 queens. There is a shopping centre within the building witha supermarket which is a bonus. It is opposite Raffles Hotel and is on the further side of the city for sightseeing and Orchard Rd.

Reviews.Title: “No wow factor for a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: caulirick
Reviews.Content: My wife and I did a staycation and expected better service from a five star establishment. The flow of hotel guests appears to be high and this has probably compromised their service standards. Hotel staff appear to be detached and disconnected (overworked employees perhaps?). I've also inserted a comment in my reservation that I'm celebrating my anniversary but no special surprise was done at all. The rooms are also tired and remind me of an early 2000s hotel. Only plus point for us is the bed and pillows which were comfortable. All in all, not value for money. If not for the summer special discount, I'd gladly stay at the Ritz Carlton Millenia by topping up $100 for the better service (they care to celebrate my anniversary with a cake during my stay there previously) and breakfast for 2.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money and shopping”
Reviews.Author: Ria12
Reviews.Content: Its in the heart of the happening part of the city - very close to the casino, excellent shopping, restaurants etc. Rooms are very large, spacious, equipped with everything you would need. great service, polite staff.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location....and a good sleep make a great stay”
Reviews.Author: Syd_Hotel_Boi
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at this hotel at the beginning of August for 4 nights. Check-in was very quick and efficient, and given the size of the hotel the staff do a good job to get you into your room as quickly as possible. My room was on the 22nd floor (a slight disappointment..I was hoping for something high up. Odd that level 22 feels so low down!). Two separate lift shafts (one for Levels 1-39, and a separate lift for levels 40-70) ensures you are never waiting too long for a lift. In fact, the longest wait I had was only about a minute. The hotel has 1,261 rooms (and over 2,000 rooms if you count the adjoining Fairmont tower) yet never gives the impression of being that huge due to clever design. I never saw another sole whilst walking to my room from the lift. Rooms are very large and offer large flat screen TV, good work desk and ergonomic chair. The bed is a bit hard compared to all those pillow top beds that are all the rage but still offers a comfortable night sleep. There is a pool, gym, tennis courts and several bars/restaurants but I unfortunately didn't get time to sample any of these. I had room service breakfast each morning due to time constraints, but would praise the promptness and quality of food. Only problem is you have to choose between fruit or fruit juice. I had ticked both and was charged SGD10 for a small orange juice - so continental breakfast cost SGD45. Ouch. I've had issues in Singapore before of waiting ages for taxis but had no problems at the Swissotel. There was usually always a queue of them parked out front and that is probably due to the Raffles convention centre and shopping centre being attached to the hotel. The MRT can also be accessed from the hotel via the shopping centre. A good centrally located property. If you are looking for a deluxe property I would recommend the adjoining Fairmont hotel, but the Swissotel offers everything you need for a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not 5 star - dont go”
Reviews.Author: Gandini
Reviews.Content: How is a hotel with dirty bathrooms and wifi only available in the lobby 5 star??? They also gave us the wrong key so we had to go back to reception and the whole floor smelled weird. Especially the lack of internet makes it useless for business... Disappointing especially considering the price...! I wonder who wrote all the other reviews... THere are so many better hotels in Singapore for that price level!

Reviews.Title: “Very good and well located”
Reviews.Author: sleser
Reviews.Content: Hotel service was excellent, very nice and polite staff. The hotel is within short walking distance from Marina Bay and directly connected to good shopping centers. Very very practical! If you need something, just go downstairs, you have it. The neighboring Raffles Hotel is also lovely, with a nice bar and interesting shops. I would definitely stay there again. Why haven't I given it 5 stars instead of 4? Well, it is a five star hotel in Singapore in 2011, so I expected to have free wireless internet everywhere. I had to pay a lot for cable internet in the room and ended up buying a usb stick from SingTel to work from the hotel. The breakfast in Kopi Tiam costed extra about SGD 40,00 and all you get for coffee or tea is a cup with filter coffee or black tea in it. A definitely NO-GO for me. But that's me. Would I stay there again? Yes, of course!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely room”
Reviews.Author: ausamanda11
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in May with my husband who was here on business. Great location to head out and explore along with the New Asia bar up on the 70 something floor which we frequented most evenings. Room was clean and serviced every day along with a great pool for the much needed relaxation after shopping. Handy shopping mall attached to hotel with everything you may need plus MRT station.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: travelers_have_fun
Reviews.Content: We were staying here at the end of our vacationtrip through Asia. It is a huge business orientated hotel but the staff we found very helpfull and friendly. We had a nice room on the 54-floor with an nice view of the city. The room was large, clean and is soundproof. As in most business-hotels food is rather expensive but the are several foodcourts and supermarkets in the immediate vincity. We saw several airlinescrew in the supermarket under the hotel just after their arrival at the hotel. The hotel is located on top of the 'City hall'-MRT station so you don't need to take a taxi from/to the airport. MRT-fee from airport to hotel is 2,9 singapore dollar. Our flight out of Singapore was late at night but we still could use the pool all day and they have a hospitality-room you can use so that you can take a shower and fresh up before leaving. It's central location also makes it easy the discover the city by foot. We found several nice,cheap restaurants in the banking-district. The restaurants along boat quay didn't look attractive and the personel is rather aggressive. We also have our doubts about quality/price there. At our next visit to Singapore we will go back to the Stamford.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed.”
Reviews.Author: ppqq
Reviews.Content: There's no doubt that The Stamford is conveniently located in the heart of Singapore. However, despite having heard good reputations of the Swissotel The Stamford in Singapore prior to our stay, we were disappointed with the cleanliness of our hotel room. For one, even though we requested a non-smoking room, we smelled cigarette smoke in our room throughout our stay. What was more unpleasant was the fact that the dirty, molded bathtub mat in our bathroom was never replaced during room service. Besides the bathtub mat, the walls in the shower stall were molded as well. For the aforementioned reasons, Swissotel the Stamford was a major letdown. We liked the Westin Hotel at this original location a lot better.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: guptamanoj
Reviews.Content: i stayed in the hotel for 30 days . Hotel is in center of city near to all major visit points and top of that it have metro connectivity . which makes travel with in city convenient. Break fast has quite a good spread. I recommend hotel for business and leisure trip.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good location and Service”
Reviews.Author: Airel
Reviews.Content: This Spring, we took our 11-month old boy to Hong Kong and decided to take a side trip to Singapore for 5 days. I did quite a few researches on hotels and eveutually picked this hotel due to its location and reputation. We got a room on the 41st floor, there is balcony in every room and it's very nice to be able to view outside, despite the fact that it was like 35 degree celcius outside. They provide two free bottles of distilled water everyday. We brought our hotel package with a Hong Kong travel agent, and the hotel package also included a buffet breakfast. We really like the breakfast there, they have a great variety of dishes, such as Chinese dim sum, Western, Thai and Indian, a egg booth to cook make to order ommelet for guests. On top of juices, they also have a number of different smoothies to choose from. It saves us a lot of hassle to find a place to feed our baby boy in the morning, so we just got him congees, cereals or buns and fruit as breakfast there. We also requested a baby crib and they also gave us a bag of baby amenities such as diapers, face cream and shampoo for my baby boy. For location, we find it very convinence as the hotel sits on top of the subway station, the City Hall Station and the Raffles City shopping center. There are underground tunnels to other shopping malls, food courts and attraction. The staff are very friendly and helpful. They also smile at you. One drawback of the hotel room is the bathroom, it's kind of wear out, their circulation is poor and the glass curtain for the bathtub is so small that water always spilled to the floor. The water in the tub took long time to go away and you have to push really hard to flush the toilet. The Singapore Zoo is a must for kids, my boy really loved it and he could see the animals up close. They are renovating for a River Safari and will bring in more animals soon. We also took him to the duck tour and Flyer and he really enjoyed them. For transportation to/from the airport, we took the airport shuttle at S9 per adult.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful, conveniently located, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: irun_11
Reviews.Content: We spent in this hotel for two days and two nights in late February 2011. We drove into him on purpose, because I wanted to live downtown in a nice hotel on the top floor with a nice overview of the city. Category harbor view room on 53 floor of a 100% met our expectations ... Stunning panorama day and night in Singapore ... the balcony did not want to leave. The hotel itself is built around 80 years, in very good condition, rooms are large, spacious, etc. etc. Encouraged by the presence of the guest rooms at the hotel where you can spend time waiting for the check-in, if you come before 14:00. Very conveniently located in the city center, metro station is 100 meters from its entrance, as well as the shopping center, in a passage that led directly from the hotel reception, and MDM are plenty of eateries, supermarket and so on. Breakfast at the hotel are magnificent. Great selection of food, juice, fruit. Dishes of Chinese, Japanese, Malaysian and European cuisine. It was very interesting (and most importantly, delicious) taste different dishes unusual. A small but nice addition: across the street from the hotel is one of the most famous and luxurious hotels in Singapore - Raffles Hotel, the bar which was once invented a cocktail Singapore Sling. After a hard and busy day festivals in Singapore was very pleased to have a drink before going to bed at Long Bar Raffles Hotel portion of this cocktail. Swissotel The Stamford hotel very much. I recommend when booking order number category harbor view. Slightly more expensive than usual classic, but it opens the windows of the hotel scene is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AlleyOopDinosaur
Reviews.Content: This hotel has great service, friendly staff and very clean. My room was spacious and had a great view overlooking the city & the New Marina Bay Sands Hotel and Casino. Hotel is next to a shopping mall that has a great food court, lots of other restaurants, mrt station etc. and very close to Raffles Hotel. My mother loves the hotel, it's location...everything and will only stay in this hotel whenever we go to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Where are my coffees?”
Reviews.Author: G H
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay here for 2 weeks after reading many impressive reviews. However I'm dissapointed with the service that was provided. I had complimentary breakfast daily in the hotel. 3 out of 14 visits, they forgot to bring my coffee. Someone came knocking at my door 1 day despite the privacy sign turned on, asking if I need my room serviced. The doorman kept stealing taxis. There is a place at the side of the hotel where people queue up to get taxi. I queued up there for quite a long time one day to get a taxi because the doorman kept stopping most the taxis for guests who were checking out from the hotel. Meanwhile the rest of us were standing in the queue under the hot sun, staring dagger at the doorman.

Reviews.Title: “"We loved the Hotel and location, We will stay here again"”
Reviews.Author: Ozzial
Reviews.Content: Whilst in Singapore it was indeed a pleasant experience to stay at this hotel.
