The hotel is located in central Singapore city and is adjacent to "Raffles Hotel", The room was spacious and elegant, the view form ou rin the balcony was stunning especially at night, when the view was studded with a spectrum of coloured neon. The room also came with its own personal single cup espresso machine. Although this was a bonus, the coffee supplied was a rather tasteless, The staff were curteous, helpful and friendly and your problem seemed to be their solution. Many tours and local services are available through the hotel. Just ask at the front desk and I am sure that you will find what you desire.The location of the hotel gives great access to central singapore. Transportation to and from the airport is available from the hotel in various forms, upon request. There are many restaurants located within walking distance of this hotel, which supply an abundance and variety of great tasting food. Singapore is a clean, modern and very beautiful holiday destination and if you do visit Singapore be sure to take the Round Island & Har Paw Village tour supplied by Tour East and also be sure to ride the Singapore Flyer. I highly recommend Singapore as a holiday destination and while staying there I recommend, Swissotel The Stamford as a prefferred hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Shellom
Reviews.Content: I've been to Singapore quite a few times and although I've tried a few different hotels I usually end up going back to Swissotel the Stamford. Location wise it is so convenient for the MRT and being able to walk straight into the shopping mall, with a small supermarket is great. The reception staff downstairs are not super friendly or super efficient, however, the staff on the 60th floor executive club are very good. Also worth a mention are the bellboys, especially the older Chinese men, who are so obliging and go out of their way to help you. The buffet breakfast downstairs is very extensive, although the tea and coffee is usually terrible. The Swissotel the Stamford is not a cheap option and it is more expensive than the Swissotel Merchant court but it is in a great location. Also be warned it does get really busy as it is one of the Singapore Stopover hotels. All in all a good hotel to stay in in Singapore if you are looking for somewhere that's easy to get around from and has shops really close by.

Reviews.Title: “Loved my stay and the view”
Reviews.Author: travelbean88
Reviews.Content: Located above the City Hall MRT and next to Raffles City shopping centre, this hotel is definitely the most strategic location to stay in SIngapore. Close to CBD area and taxi is always available. Service was really efficient. I sprained my ankle just before I depart to Singapore and require ice pack and the concierge kindly keep my icepack in the freezer and deliver to the room whenever I need it. Room is spacious and I managed to get the view overlooking the Marina Bay and Flyer. Breakfast was excellent. Very broad selection and definitely satisfying (if only I have the time to enjoy my daily breakfast). A very enjoyable stay overall.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CarrickGirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel on a two-night stopover in Singapore en-route to Australia and it was absolutely fantastic. The hotel is twenty minutes from Changi airport, right in the heart of the city and next to Raffles. It was my first time in Singapore but I was ready for the heat and humidity that hit us the minute we left the airport terminal having been warned by some friends who had been here before. On arrival at the hotel by coach early in the morning after our long flight our room was ready which was a real bonus. First impressions were great especially when we saw the amazing view from our balcony and the well-appointed, smart room. We ventured down to the fantastic shopping centre under the hotel and popped over to Raffles for a Singapore Sling. That afternoon there was a thrilling lightning storm that went on for hours which added to the exciting tropical atmosphere. The following morning we received a friendly greeting from the girl at the hotel's SwissCafé where we had a tasty breakfast with lots of choice and good quality food. The hotel is ideally located for sightseeing and that morning we headed first to the Botanic Gardens where we walked through the beautiful orchid garden and then past Little India to the Merlion, Singapore's symbol. From here we could see some of the city's newest developments in Marina Bay. We then went to the Thian Hock Keng temple in Chinatown before heading back to Raffles for the afternoon tea which was great. Back at the Swissotel Stamford we had a drink at the New Asia bar on the 71st floor which was a bit pricey but well worth it for the views of the amazing city as the lights came on. We had an early start the next morning but really enjoyed our stay here and would return in a heartbeat. Well done to all at the Swissotel The Stamford!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Not The Place If You're Driving”
Reviews.Author: Strat77
Reviews.Content: We drove up from Kuala Lumpur and stayed here for two nights. Pros - Check in was quick despite the sea of people swarming the lobby area. The rooms were large and still had ample space even after fitting in a baby cot. There is a balcony for you to enjoy the view. The children's pool area was large enough which brought my kid immense joy. Gym, although not state of the art, was complete and provided towels. Hotel was right next to an MRT (rail transit) station and malls aplenty. Apparently there are some really nice restaurants and bars in the hotel but we didn't get the chance to give it a try as we were out most of the time. Perhaps the one most worthy of mention would be the hotel having really friendly staff. Always smiling, helpful and ready to strike up a conversation with you. Cons - Despite the size of the room, at this price, you would have expected a much "newer" looking room. The furniture, the finishing, the deco were all still very much trapped in the 80's. The lobby was almost always packed with people. If you were planning to just chill by the cafe hoping for some peace and quiet, don't bother. Lastly, and possibly also the most frustrating part of this experience was NO COMPLIMENTARY PARKING. We either choose to park the car below the mall at an hourly rate (chargeable 24 hrs) or pay SGD25 (multiple entry per day) for valet services. I think that is very unfair to your driving guest. I was informed that an agreement has not been reached between the parking operators and the hotel management. Fair enough, but get your valet to charge your in-house guest at a cheaper rate. I paid SGD50 to park my car in a hotel I was paying to stay in. That's absurd. So, will I come back again? If I was driving, a BIG NO. Although to be fair to your valet team, they were professional and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “"We absolutely loved it and will definitely be back"”
Reviews.Author: AucklandSweet
Reviews.Content: We brought our accommodation through WOTIF as a mystery deal and for considering what we paid and what we received we were definitely the winners. The Swissotel has the most friendliest staff you could imagine. The girl (i didnt get her name) on the door at Cafe Swiss was very friendly every morning when we went for breakfast and even knew our names. Also the cleaning staff, Guest services and reception staff can attribute to the hotel's great reputation and the hotel can thank great staff like this for patrons returning to this hotel. The hotel is situated at the most convenient places, on top of a mall, food court and also the MRT is right at your door. Very convenient to Merlion, Marina Bay and all other attractions in Singapore are right at your door step. The rooms were spacious and very clean and had the most amazing views. I will not hesitate to stay at Swissotel Stamford again as it lives up to its reputation as a quality and luxurious hotel. Congratulations to Swissotel Stamford, from our experience with your hotel we will always stay with you when we travel abroad.

Reviews.Title: “Warm Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Pujatripathi
Reviews.Content: It was our first visit to S'pore, and we wanted to put up near the main attractions i.e. Merlion, suntec city mall and Singapore Flyer. We decided to book this hotel based on its rankings and reviews on TripAdvisor. We have stayed at many of the 5 star properties over the years, but the experience and impeccable hospitality experienced at Swissotel is memorable. The staff at the hotel is very courteous, rooms are comfortable & spacious and the location of the hotel is excellent. We suggest everybody to visit "Equinox" restaurant to have one of the best asian foods with best panoramic view of S'pore. Swissotel stamford is a place you would definitely come back to and recommend to your friends. Thank you very much for making our stay so pleasant!!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: SHELEE49
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I stayed here for the Netball World Cup in July. The rooms were a good size for two (with shopping!!), it was very conveniently located, and I just loved having a shopping centre (Raffles) attached!! A great food hall there as well. We were located right on the MRT which meant getting around was easy and convenient, although we mostly caught cabs everywhere as they are so cheap. The service we received from staff at The Stamford was superb, nothing was too much bother and everyone was so polite. The concierge was the best I've ever encountered - she gave us great advice on everything from tours to shopping. Loved the breakfasts, such a great variety. Thanks everyone for making our stay so memorable!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay at the Stamford”
Reviews.Author: Anika005
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a lovely room on the 44th floor, with views over Marina Bay. Great service from the staff. The hotel is centrally located and connected to a shopping complex with plenty of eateries to choose from. Will holiday again at the Stamford.

Reviews.Title: “Top Job - Fabulous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MrsWickerSwansea
Reviews.Content: Absolutely fabulous hotel - we absolutely loved it! Absolutely perfect position right next to the Raffles Shopping Centre and a quick walk to Raffles Hotel for the legendary Singapore Sling. Room was spacious and had an awesome view across to the Singapore Cricket Club. Perfect location for bars and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel let down by pretentious restaurant”
Reviews.Author: CastawayKnight
Reviews.Content: The Swissotel The Stamford in Singapore is one of the tallest hotels in South East Asia and the view from the Equinox restaurant is one of the finest in the city - it's certainly the most stunning view of the Marina Bay Sands complex across the bay. However, Equinox confirms the old adage: the higher the restaurant, the worse the food. I was there with a party of colleagues and customers and not one of us truly enjoyed our meals. The menu is full of all the current chef cliches (avoid any restaurant that used the words "jus" or "foam") and almost seems deliberately designed to be off-putting. The main courses always have dubious sounding ideas and ingredients alongside the protein. The truth is that Equinox is an over-priced pretentious restaurant where the chef clearly has no self-control and no-one dares to give him production or guidelines. Chewy duck, soggy potatoes and snooty service. I took the same group to the Newton Food Centre the next evening and for a tiny fraction of the cost we had unpretentious, beautifully cooked food served friendly and fast. The other issue with Equinox is that the restaurant is part of the "Equinox Complex" which also includes a nightclub. If you don't get to the restaurant before the nightclub opens, you may accidentally find yourself in a line of young adults waiting to get into the nightclub, not the restaurant. NOT a very friendly or easy-to-navigate system. All of which is a great shame, because the rest of the hotel is first class. From the very friendy greetings by lobby staff, to well-furnished and comfortable rooms, the Stamford is a worthwhile option. The Cafe Swiss provides a copious breakfast buffet with very friendly and efficient service. Even more curious, therefore, that they can get it so wrong with their high-rise restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel to Explore Singapore”
Reviews.Author: ArienAbdisa
Reviews.Content: This luxurious Hotel is located strategically at the heart of Singapore, easy access to explore singapore by MRT and other public transportations. I stayed at the 56th floor, so I could see all of the Singapore from top..

Reviews.Title: “An OK business choice with very good view and location”
Reviews.Author: ATKok
Reviews.Content: Good location : - citylink next to it - with raffel convention center linked together - a shopping mall linked together with supermarket and food court - 5 minutes walk to Explanade Good view @ room : - i stayed at room 54 of the high level, it's a wonder view (day + night) of Sands, Explanade, the lake and some seaview - with balcony Facilities : - only wifi @ lobby (need to ask the front desk to collect the password) - in-room internet connection is not free - the keypad of in-room-security-box sometimes will be mis-sensed the number... - the buttons of the elevators will sometimes auto-off ... - good security settings at night time (need key card to open the doors of elevator-waiting-area - the gym room, spa and swimming pool had not been visited this time - no queue at the reception and the taxi station, sometimes might cause some arguments Price is fair. Decor is a little bit old-fashioned. The breakfast-buffet is included, and the Cafe Tiem is quite good for me. Conclusion: an "OK" hotel for business and meeting, with very good view and location. but not "leisure" enough for relaxing-trip.

Reviews.Title: “lovely stay and Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: laura-david-abbie
Reviews.Content: This was our 5th time staying in the Stamford Swissotel normally we stay on the 69th floor and pay for an excutive room allowing you to use the lounge area with free refreshment, snacks and wifi/business facalties we have always really enjoyed our stays here and found the staff to be very friendly.This time as it was only myself and my partner we stayed in just a standard room on the 9th floor for 2 nights now i have to say the view was non existant looking on to a glass roof top of the mall and a back garden used by staff but the room its self was around the same size as the excutive and it was very clean and tidy so over all i found this to be of great value!! i did miss the wonderful views of the city and free snacks but overall this was worth every penny for the location and service provided.

Reviews.Title: “5 STAR LOCTION IN SINGAPORE”
Reviews.Author: OMIDREZA
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for six nights in last week of July. Our room was in 44 level .the view of our room was fantastic it was Marina Bay. at this level you can see all attraction about marina square and you think that you are in a flyer. The room was big enough and clean. There was a balcony in front of the rooms which was nice to visit all places around of you. I think the location of this hotel is one of the best in Singapore because : 1- It is near to the marina bay and flyer and sky park in top of marina hotel. 2- the metro is under of this hotel (city hall station) which connect you to everywhere in Singapore especially to the airport. we bought 3 days" the Singapore tourist pass" from this station (34S$) and with this pass you can use all MRT in Singapore. 3-there is a good mall and food court and supermarket under to this hotel which you can buy everything from these. In finally I can say that I will come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Big and modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: RozAus
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights on the way back from Europe. We arrived at mid day and checked in as at 2pm but they still had our room ready which was good. The room was really big with a massive bathroom and great harbor view (level 31). The room was quiet with a good sized TV (ample channels), desk, chair and big wardrobe with safe. A nice touch is the electronic room door bell and privacy indicator. The hotel has some really nice (and really expensive) bars and restaurants on levels 71 and 72 which are well worth a look. Awesome views. This is a BIG hotel with loads of aircrew and tour groups staying so avoid if you are after really personal or intimate service. The service is great but scripted rather than being natural. I saw some MASSIVE queue's to check in also as the hotel is so big. WIFI was only free in the lobby which was annoying. All in all this is a nice hotel just like the many others like it in SING.

Reviews.Title: “WE LOVED IT AND WE WILL BE BACK!”
Reviews.Author: RaizoRein
Reviews.Content: Great place, great location, awesome view of the city! one of the few tallest buildings in Singapore with a fantastic balcony rooms where you could chill and watch over the Marina Bay and the Padang! lovely !

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, location and friendly staff but not enough staff at peak times!”
Reviews.Author: akc1985
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in late July and were very pleased with the quality of the rooms and the hotel in general. Its in a fantastic location, close to all the main attractions in downtown Singapore and a great base for exploring the city by foot. Rooms were clean and well appointed, good selection of TV channels from many languages. Great views even from the lower floors- we were initially on floor 9 which is the bottom level of guest rooms and still had a lovely view of Marina Bay. The staff were all very friendly and polite but we did experience significant waiting times for things like speaking to reception staff on the phone (and in the end we couldn't get through so had to go downstairs) and the taxi line is a joke. Waiting times were up to half an hour even during the day. None of the hotel staff seem to take any notice of the taxi cue and try and help to direct taxis there. My advice would be to go around the corner to other taxi cues. The reception staff were very helpful once we could speak to them. We wanted to extend our stay one night and asked what the rate would be directly through reception- they advised to also look online. We did and received a great rate directly from the hotel website, so I'm not sure why they do that but the staff member saved us a lot of money! We initially booked through expedia and got a great rate there but we did book at least a month in advance. I think the hotel is so busy because it is connected directly to Raffles City shopping centre and other hotels which makes for easy access to these services but also makes the hotel lobby an extremely busy place.

Reviews.Title: “Needs some touch up”
Reviews.Author: mschoe64
Reviews.Content: Great views, but hotel starts to look aged compared to other Singapore hotels (like the Fullerton); and the lack of air conditioning in the halls and in the executive lounge didn't help either.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, fantastic views...”
Reviews.Author: benblinkau
Reviews.Content: as the title says, we were on the 63rd floor, overlooking the harbour... very pricey, but worth it for something different! the pool and cocktails were great!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent family hotel, top location”
Reviews.Author: Familymack
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of May on a stopover to NZ. We weren't sure what to expect because of mixed reviews but we really enjoyed our time here. We arrived quite early (3 adults & a 10 and 7 year old boys) and early check in was arranged with no problem and very quickly. Needless to say the rooms had fantastic views. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel but made great use of the location on top of an MRT station with 2 foodhalls in the shopping mall. The boys loved the pools which were well used. If you're fussy about decor and the perception that you're not staying in a cutting edge 21st century establishment then you may be disappointed. However if you are looking for a central comfortable hotel with friendly service then this could be for you. Oh and we got quite late check out as our flight was a late one at no extra charge

Reviews.Title: “Ok room, so-so bathroom, amazing view”
Reviews.Author: uncovery
Reviews.Content: Room was ok, Phone was broken, general outfit seemed aged. Staff was very friendly and food in restaurants was good. Bathroom was clearly too old. Need two people to push the toilet flush! Very loud noise from flushes and sinks in other rooms. Amazing views however of the area.

Reviews.Title: “My third stay in 3 years and the experience was just as good.”
Reviews.Author: chelsea91
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in December 10 for a girlie week with my daughter and had a ball. Hotel was as I remembered and the location is just fantastic. With the Metro just below it is so convenient to everywhere. And so many places to eat in the Raffles City complex! Great hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stopover”
Reviews.Author: KandKAustralia
Reviews.Content: SwissHotel provides a very comfortable, relaxing and high quality stay in Singapore. The beds were great, everything was clean, plush and well appointed. There is a shopping mall below the Hotel. Only criticism that the restaurant was very expensive; however so many other restaurants in close proximity. Public transport is easily accessible. All in all a wonderful place for a stopover.

Reviews.Title: “Great view with all you would expect from a top hotel”
Reviews.Author: smilingtraveller_10
Reviews.Content: This ticks all the boxes of what you would expect from a large and quality hotel. What makes this hotel an excellent choice are the views of the city and location for exploring Singapore. Underneath the hotel there is a shopping mall (Raffle's city) where you can find all that you need on the shopping front along with an excellent food court. The hotel also has an MRT stop within the immediate vicinity. If you have the opportunity I would recommend going to the Equinox restaurant (70th floor) for lunch. It is a semi-buffet where you select a main course from the menu and explore high quality starters and sweets from the buffet. It is excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Honest Review”
Reviews.Author: linfjy
Reviews.Content: Pros: Location - Right above City Hall MRT station and Shopping Centre - Quick taxi ride to most places Service - Relatively quick check-in-and-out Bed - was comfortable enough Cons Room - A bit dated especially the bathroom Price - Better value elsewhere Room booking - ask for a high level room got the lowest level - reason - room given away as I check-in late due to flight delay Overall, would I stay here. Probably not. Definitely not a 5 star hotel in its current state and with the price they are charging it was a disappointment. Should I stuck to my preference of staying with Sheraton Brand of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service”
Reviews.Author: graciem
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Swissotel during a stop over on the way to Europe. Our daughter wasn't feeling well so they upgraded us to higher standard room. We had two rooms next to each other both with two queen size beds. The rooms were very attractive, clean and quite spacious with lovely bathrooms. The views were great also. The service at the front desk was excellent. The location of this hotel is great as it is right above the MTR train station so it is very easy to get a train to Orchard Road or anywhere else you want to go. It is also above a shopping centre which has a supermarket plus a variety of other stores. There is also a food court so you can easily get a snack or meal anytime. Would definately stay at the Swissotel again if returning to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for better location..”
Reviews.Author: Lookingaround
Reviews.Content: Amazing room.. amazing harbour view.. great service.. whats not to love? So well connected the MRT (city hall) is right below the hotel. Raffles place is just across the road which has so many great dining options. Loved it! Breakfast was great. They seem to take the effort to cater to an international palette.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic accomodation - great staff”
Reviews.Author: Pahbs
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Swissotel Stamford was great. The staff were very friendly and eager to please. Our room has a fantastic view - 54th floor. Initially we were on the 52nd floor but after a slight mishap with the plumbing we were quickly and efficiently moved to another floor. The breakfast each morning was to die for, so many choices. I would certainly recommend breakfast as a package during your stay. The hotel is right on top of a massive shopping center and next door to a train station. So easy to come and go and right in the middle of things. The pool area was great equipped with a bar and 2 pools. Staff at pool provided cold towels and small non alcoholic drinks throughout the day. Plenty of chairs and towels available at the pool. There were lots of places to eat both within the hotel complex and around the area so food was never a problem and due to the hotels closeness to the train station you could easily hop on a train and go wherever you liked. Roslyn the concierge at the hotel was brilliant. Nothing was too much trouble and all done with a smile. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Orphellia
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at The Fairmont last time that I was in Singapore, I was expecting that their 'sister' property would be of a similar standard - not the same standard, but similar. I was disappointed. I consider myself pretty easy going when it comes to hotels, provided they are clean and safe I'm usually ok, but for some reason I was just unsatisfied with the Swissotel The Stamford. Perhaps it was because prior to Singapore I had been in Thailand where I had experienced twice the quality (and service) at half the price, but in this instance, Swissotel The Stamford fell short. Don't get me wrong, there were good points - a wonderfully comfortable bed with silky, soft linen and lush pillows, there's an incredible view of Singapore from the balcony and the hotel is located centrally above the City Hall MRT station, but the decor was very worn, and I would say that they are well overdue for a refurbishment. My main issue was with the bathroom - whilst having a shower, the water would not drain properly so that you would be standing ankle-deep in water - not ideal. To flush the toilet, I would have to lean my full body weight on the button in order to get the strength required for the button to be pressed - completely unacceptable. You could also hear the people upstairs when they flushed their toilet or ran their water. On one evening we asked downstairs at the bar if we could have a cup of milk to go with the coffee upstairs and we were advised that they 'didn't do that' - I would have expected this to be a very small ask. Whilst there were the standard amenities in the room (coffee and tea, iron, ironing board, slippers and robes, in-room safe etc), and everything was presented nicely, I found the rooms to be very worn and in desperate need of an update, and for the price paid and the advertised standard of property, the issues experienced should not have occurred - I would have expected issues such as these in a three star property but not a property ranked as five star. There are definitely better choices in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Puzzledprez
Reviews.Content: As part of the Swissotel chain, this hotel has lived up to its standard in terms of its service. However, I thought the room was only reasonable in size (I had expected a bigger/more spacious room). But I love the room I was given, as it overlooks the city. It was definitely a room with a view. The best thing about this hotel is its location. It is conveniently located next to and connected with Raffles City shopping mall. There is also a huge food court there with plenty of selection for your taste buds. For Muslims looking for halal food, don't worry as there is the Asian Cafe that serves halal buffet. The staff at the hotel are very friendly and always there to help you. Some of the flaws: 1) there are not enough seats/sofa in the lobby. I had to stand for almost 30 minutes while waiting for my transport to come. 2) Wifi is not free in the room. They claimed there is free wifi in the lobby but I could not get it nevertheless. 3) The lobby can get too crowded. I dont think some of them are hotel guests as the hotel is located next to the MRT station and shopping mall, and public can use the entrances there to get to the mall. Hence, the seats/sofa in the lobby are always full.

Reviews.Title: “A 3 not more”
Reviews.Author: PhTravelling_Guy
Reviews.Content: Currently staying at a 48th floor city view room at the Stamford. The cons seem to win the day over the pros. Cons: (i) dated decor in my city view room, it positively screams early 90s!, (ii) the porcelain of the tub is cracked, (iii) there's grime on the edge of the washbasin, (iii) the tub's facuet drips, (iv) I was given frayed bath towels on my second night, (v) personal safe is old style, will not fit a laptop, (v) mattress is a bit firm for my tastes butI have to admit that it hasn't stopped me from sleeping relativley well, and (vii) a musty smell assaults you everytime you enter the room, it fades the longer you're in the room but still. Also, no free internet, no WiFi in the room and cable channels are all standard definition and the TV, while an LCD/Plasma, isn't exactly the newest model on the market. No stationery and no pens (only pencils). The bathroom is fine for what it is. I would have liked a separate tub and shower. Not the case. I would also have loved a rainshower, also not the case. And the flush button for the toilet requires the application of a not inconsiderable amount of force. The pros: (i) good breakfast with a good range of choices (if expensive at SGD44 per pax), (ii) very strong water pressure, (iii) great views in the high floor rooms - even the city view rooms, (iv) fairly complete in-room amenities (personal fridge, slippers, ironing board, iron, emergency torch, etc.) and (v) location, location, right atop the City Hall MRT Station. The restaurants are very good as well well, with the Equinox complex earning top stars. OK, so the Stamford isn't the worst hotel I've ever stayed in but it certainly isn't anywhere near the best.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: sanchak75
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with a harbour view .excellent location. The night club is good for all ages,spectacular view.amazing breakfast spread. Nice mall at the basement.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, go somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: pek1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on the Executive Floor and it was more than enough! The Executive Floor staff were friendly, but everyone else in the hotel didnt care about customer service at all. Rooms are very old and the only nice thing is the view, if you are lucky enough to get a high floor. Had meals in 3 the restaurants, including Cafe Swiss, Equinox, and Szechuan Court. Service was extremely slow in all three. I had to hunt down a manager on more than one occasion just to get a cup of coffee. Its a pity that you have to pay $70 SGD in order to be treated like this! If you are expecting a doorman to assist you with taxis, you came to the wrong hotel. There is an unattended taxi line, where you fight over cars and then explain your destination to the driver by yourself. This is the first 5-star hotel I have seen that goes to this extreme, its like you are at the airport (except you are paying close to 600 SGD for the pleasure). Overall, there are much better hotels in Singapore that know what luxury service is and are happy to provide it at lower prices. I suggest the Fullerton Bay Hotel, I cant wait to go back. Its only 100 rooms and all the staff treat you like royalty. Would not send my worst enemy to Swissotel Stamford!

Reviews.Title: “Just excellent”
Reviews.Author: Wolfman91
Reviews.Content: Not much to say, other than this hotel offers just about everything, and is the perfect place to stay in Singapore, if for overnight, or a few days. Have stayed in Singapore before, & we rate this as the bestt yet. Congratulations, we say 10/10.

Reviews.Title: “The best views and perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: skelly3055
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for it's location in Singapore and the views from its balcony. Located in the heart of Singapore with a subway station (MRT), shopping mall / foodcourts and a supermarket below, we couldn't be happier. Taxi from Changi Airport cost around $14. But getting around on the MRT was easy and saved us time and money once we got our 3 day MRT pass. We took a taxi a few times, but the traffic was proving to be a hassle since we only had a few days and wanted to see as much as possible. Thank goodness the signs are in english, after a wk in Vietnam we were happy to travel alone with confidence. Chinatown, National Museum, Vivo City, Suntec Plaza and Orchard Rd all via MRT. Check-in was quick and we found ourselves looking at the best view on the 44th flr. We have visited/compared other hotels when we arrived and agreed our harbour view is a must if you want to see the old and new contrast of the Singapore skyline and it's river. The magic happens when you return in the evening after shopping or sightseeing and see all the lights displayed outside your balcony....WOW! The laser/light show from Marina Bay Sands, the colours from the Flyer and the Fullerton hotel bridge by the river was unbelievable. The famous Raffles hotel was just next door and we walked over to visit it's museum and meet their celebrity doorman before trying the sling too. Our room decor is dated and needs serious upgrades, free wi-fi in the lobby area, the bathroom can use a makeover too, however we were in Singapore to explore and found our room suitable for the short visit. The breakfast buffet was amazing, a good selection of local and western fares provided enough choices for everyone along with their exotic fruits to sample. Each staff member we encountered during our 4 days were ready to help us with any questions we had. The bar/lounge on the 70th flr was amazing during thier happy hours, great views again!!! If you want convienence and don't mind the dated room, you found the right hotel while in Singapore. Other hotels do not have an MRT underneath them, so after a long day of walking, we were happy to be back after a quick trip up the escalators. We will stay here on fututre visits to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth It”
Reviews.Author: ms_Dewijakarta
Reviews.Content: Old Hotel and over priced rooms. Beware of the fine prints before you choose to stay at this hotel. The hotel connects to a mall which is the only good thing about it

Reviews.Title: “excellent , Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: TheGravers
Reviews.Content: After travelling through asia for nearly a month , Singapore was our last stop. We had five days at The Stamford and two at The MBS. We should have stayed at the Stamford for the full 7 days. Everything was of the highest standard and nothing was too much trouble, which is very comforting when you are travelling with two very young boys away from home. Excellent service unlike the MBS , but you can read my review on that later. Thanks to all the staff. The Gravers.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DinkyandBoy
Reviews.Content: We have been to Singapore many times on business and for pleasure. We generally stay in Swissotel The Stamford when we are there. It is a great hotel in a really good location. The pool area and pool bar (which is shared with the Fairmont) is lovely and I have spent many hours lounging by the pool. There are shops within a couple of minutes and restaurants & nightlife all around it. A quality hotel and good value too. our most recent visit was in September for the Formula 1 - we booked a room with a view and what a view - amazing experience! Even without the grand prix the views are pretty good - right down to the CBD and to the quays and across to the Marina Bay Sands. Will defintely be back whenever we are visiting Singapore again (soon I hope!)

Reviews.Title: “Great location for shopping, eating and nightlife, hotel could use a facelift and friendlier staff”
Reviews.Author: petitfille
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights in May with colleagues. I had to change rooms after the first 2 nights due to availability and the second room was on a lower floor with a depressing view of the basement. The first room had a view of the city. Great place to stay as the shopping centre is connected to the hotel and there are plenty of places to go for breakfast/lunch/dinner for all budgets. The rooms are tired and could use a facelift. In my second room there were broken light switches and the TV didn't work. Not a bad hotel but depending on which room you stay in will determine whether you enjoy it or not. Staff at front desk were rude and unhelpful when I enquired about internet. The Spa is amazing with steam rooms and spas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jason_bleibtreu
Reviews.Content: Location is very good. Nice mall and subway station adjoining. Located in good section of town. Large rooms with balcony and windows that open. The hotel is a little dated but is nice because the fixtures, doors and furniture are solid. Most of the wood is real and solid, not artificial or a veneer. The free Wi-Fi in the lobby is just OK, it is much better and free as well at Starbucks which is next door. If you can get a deal on this hotel in the range of S$250 nett then go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, all you'd expect from Swissotel”
Reviews.Author: Marie890
Reviews.Content: Had a lightening visit to Singapore and stayed for 2 nights. Great location within Raffles City complex, opposite the Raffles hotel , within walking distance of most areas and close to MTR. Huge beds and the best linen ever, gave a really comfortable sleep. Happy hour around at the pool bar and in the New Asia bar (70th floor gave with outstanding city views) were a bonus!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Tebet
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel with very good location. Only 1 minute too City Hall MRT Station.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and amazing views”
Reviews.Author: carlyw5
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Stamford with my husband and two children for 7 days. I was a little concerned about choosing this hotel after mixed reviews but for us it was perfect. We had 2 x double harbour view room, which was quite spacious and the view was amazing, we looked over the water towards MBS and could even watch the laser light show from our room. We had room service once which was tasty and reasonably priced. The buffet breakfast each morning was fantastic, the choice was huge our favourites were the cinnamon buns and eggs to order, the staff here were also very welcoming, the kids loved their hot chocolates each day. The location is the biggest plus, the MRT is under the hotel, there is a good mall attached that has a great food court and supermarket both of which we used especially when the kids were too tired to go out for dinner. You are walking distance to the flyer and Marina precinct, and even Clarke Quay if you enjoy walking. Overall a great hotel in fabulous location.

Reviews.Title: “Quality and Value”
Reviews.Author: Jmkel
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in a number of hotels in Singapore but was really happy with my time at the Swissotel The Stamford. The staff were really helpful and obliging and the rooms were very clean, a good size and not overcrowded with furniture. This is a great hotel for relaxing and being central to Orchard Road or the Marina. I found it a pleasant change from the hustle and fanfare of many other hotels... it just has a nice feel about it! But if I had one criticism... at times over the weekend the music played from the poolside bar was bit too loud and "funky" for those trying to enjoy some time out.

Reviews.Title: “Book it!”
Reviews.Author: Chambm
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a suite and it was stunning. The only reason we couldn't sleep was because we couldn't stop looking at the view! Exceptional in every way. For a bustling city this hotel is right at the heart and offers everything you could possibly need. So many facilities, all at a very high standard. A superb hotel for business or pleasure right next door to Raffles and major shops. I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC service and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: KristinaR007
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 10 days for business in June. Location is excellent - above subway, connected to mall, short walk to Marina Bay area etc. View was great - even from the 39th floor. Concierge was superb. Not only helped me plan and book arrangements for trip to Night Safari (totally recommend) for a group that started at 7 people and ended up being 39, but was extraordinarily patient. Also gave me restaurant and shopping recommendations. Had a small issue the first few days with the bathtub drain not working properly but was fixed in less than 1 hour after I reported it. Room service breakfast good and not obscenely expensive. Room decor could use a makeover, but fantastic service and excellent location more than made up for it.

Reviews.Title: “The best view!!”
Reviews.Author: Sueda3116
Reviews.Content: Terrific hotel, terrific location, the best view of Singapore with the exception of the SkyPark! Step out balcony, big beds, all the mod cons, bathrooms are quite small. Service is excellent!!!!

Reviews.Title: “mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: buckets-3eyedfish
Reviews.Content: We are currently staying here on 59th floor and after the first night this is what I have to say... Perhaps being spoilt rotten for the last week on the executive floors next door at the fairmont, I am a little dissapointed with our move to the Stamford for the final two nights of our stay in Singapore. It is not all bad though, our checkin was super smooth, concierge transferred our bags from the fairmont and even though we had only booked a 'harbour view room' I think the fairmont may have had a word to them prior and was pleasantly suprised to recieve an upgrade to the executive floors 57-60 - great view, although a little uneasy at times when looking out on the balcony at the sheer height. On arrival to our room, one could not help notice the heat in the corridors - very uncomfortable (perhaps the aircon is broken). I am trying hard not to compare the two hotels but the decor in the stamford is inferior to next door and has a 'upmarket 70's porn set' feel to it, a lot of carpet everywhere capped off with wallpaper. The beds are super firm and the bathroom is very small - couldn't swing a cat !! There is a combined shower in the bathtub with a steep step up into it (not good if you have mobility problems) and more so getting out - no hand rail for support. Free wifi in the room and great coffee machine. The club lounge on level 60 had some outstanding desserts (hubby smashed the waffle cones). the hot canapes were average and the cold selection was so-so. The lounge was ok, once again trying not to compare with the Fairmont but was not a patch on theirs - even though they are sister properties. The staff in the lounge were very friendly, professional and not intrusive. All staff I have encountered so far have also been very professional - so kudos to management for good staff training and selection. We had room service last night, and was impressed with the timely delivery along with the quality and portion size for the price. Went to breakfast on level 2 half hour after they opened and few items were still not out. A manager asked me if everything was ok and I said no, I asked when the buffet would be fully set and he said what is missing - I said there are no waffles, pancakes along with missing indian bread - he replied that someone will be there soon. As there was ample of other goodies to choose from it didn't bother me too much, but would like to note that by the time we had finished, the waffles and pancake chef was still not there - some 45min into breakfast service. Perhaps they do not think 'the early birds' want that so early in the morning ! At the end of the day, whilst this is a 5* property, I feel that the main selling point of the property is the location, being right above a great shopping mall and MRT station it doesn't get any better for getting around Singapore. With that in mind you could do a lot worse in Singapore for more money than the Stamford.

Reviews.Title: “Been staying here everytime I visit Singapore”
Reviews.Author: woot
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at the Swissotel every single time since 4 years back and I make a trip to Singapore at least twice a year. I really have nothing to complain about the place as every visit I go through very fast check in and check outs even at odd hours or busy times as there is always someone there to attend to you. Staff are always friendly and helpful to point you in the right direction or where to get what you need. From late check outs to different pillow preferences, staff is always there to assist. Rooms are always very very clean and the higher you go the better the view is and I'm always impressed by the views no matter which direction your room faces. The aircon works great, not too cold, not too hot and it doesnt smell. Some of the rooms on the higher floors are seem to be layed out slightly differently and looks more modern so I can only assume some of the rooms are renovated. Best part about this hotel i would say is the location. It's at City Hall stop and you have City Mall just below with tons of good restaurants, fast food, grocer, food halls so you'll never get hungry here. Shopping is equally good although compared to VivoCity or Ion Orchard , the later would definitely have more choices. If i have to name a bad thing about the hotel would be its parking. Some years back we used to be able to have discounted parking at City Mall which is the mall's parking but now guest are only offered to jockey park in front of the hotel which may be quite expensive for extended stays.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Stopover”
Reviews.Author: AussieNat24
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel as it appeared to be a luxurious place to pop our head for the night, before continuing back to London the next night. We werent disappointed - the beds and pillows were comfortable, the bath was lovely and the service was impeccable. The service at checkin/checkout were great - people trying to help us and the complimentary use of the hospitality suite to freshen up before the next flight was a great touch. The hotel itself is huge and there are a lot of cabin crews who stay here and the bar at the top has an AMAZING evening view of Singapore and I am disappointed we werent able to stay longer to have dinner in the top restaurant overlooking the city. One criticism and its very small was that a lot of flights in Singapore land late and by the time you get a cab from the airport and checkin it was 10.45 when all the restaurants in the hotel close, so it was disappointing that we could only have room service, but many hotels are the same, so its a minor point to consider. The other critisim and a bug bear of mine is no free wifi for guests. It was $28 overnight, which means it would have cost me this much to simply do online checkin for my flight the next day.

Reviews.Title: “The importance of location.....”
Reviews.Author: Douchebag00
Reviews.Content: As a business traveller this hotel had everything I could possibly need: - A good quality room (however note that the Swissotel is not one of these uber-modern places). - Located above an MRT station (City Hall) which is a multiple line hub and will get you to and from Changi airport with just one quick change at EW4 I think. - Has a variety of food choices in the hotel. - If the immediate variety isn't enough then you have an abundance of choice in the underground Raffles City and connecting network to Suntec City and Marina Bay. Basically, if you don't have enough choices you are the type of person who will never be satisfied! - A gentle Singaporean walking speed will have you at the boat quay in 10 minutes or less, an extra 5 minutes will see you in the redeveloped Clarke Quay area with its many drinking, eating and retail options. If you a company that is willing to spend a reasonable sum per night on your room then you can be treated to arguably the best views over Marina Bay and the financial district. SGD350 rewarded me with 59th floor views in a very comfortable room with king size bed, large flat screen TV, iPod docking stereo and I was given free internet for the week (cabled only available in room, Wi-Fi is in the lobby and bar areas). All-in-all I'd recommend this to any business traveller for the sheer convenience of being at the centre of everything you are likely to need. You cannot beat the location.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Not Worth It, Avoid !”
Reviews.Author: GudduKolkata
Reviews.Content: Hi Friends, We stayed at this hotel by taking the universal studios package and were hugely disappointed. We had high expectations given the positive reviews on this site and the fact the this hotel cannot be missed in singapore. The pros and cons below : Pros : 1) Excellent location right at the metro 2) Amazing view from the top floor resturant 3) Shopping mall next door Cons : 1) After a long flight we arrived at 7 in the evening and were told that the rooms are not ready. Infact, the people at the reception started to argue despite knowing its a mistake on their part 2) We had specifically requested for a non-smoking and high floor and again it was not alloted. Again the lady at the reception did not even acknowledge our mail and in a way hinted that we were lying 3) The layout of the room is quite outdated. I know its an old hotel but its just not maintained. The rooms just do not have a refreshing feel. Definately not 5 star 4) The lifts had smelling and dirty mats all the time 5) There was always too much rush/luggage at the reception 6) Also I thought there was preference given the guests staying at an higher category rooms. They do not bother if you are in the base category (There was racial discrimination to an certain extent also) 7) Quality of house keeping/room service not up to the mark 8) Much more expensive in comparison to its peers After coming back to India we filled in a feedback form and to our surprise the manager from the hotel called us up to get more details. There are so many better options in Singapore (Pan pacific, marina mandarin etc). No reason to choose this one. OLD IS NOT GOLD ! Happy Travelling Gautam

Reviews.Title: “Nearly perfect, recommended!”
Reviews.Author: jakboy
Reviews.Content: I booked 3 rooms with 2 double bed in this hotel via agoda.com, the rate was not really fantastic, because for me it's really expensive. But when I saw the review is good so I booked. When I arrived and I checked in the receptionist said that they only got 1 room available for that time, so I have to wait for 3 hours to get another 2 rooms, it's ok with me, because I can walk around the hotel first, like in Raffles City mall, Marina Square, and Suntec City. The room was very good, clean, spacious, and got a really nice view of the city. I got the 2 double bed I wanted before, and a connecting room with my other room. All special request that I requested before was fulfilled. But compare to Marina Mandarin hotel, this hotel looks more classy, and Marina Mandarin is more modern, but that's ok with me, though I can sleep well when I stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel , would defintely recommend it”
Reviews.Author: C00lwave
Reviews.Content: It is a fantastic hotel with the nice big clean rooms. The location is also good and shopping malls and metros are easily accessible. The food is brilliant and I really enjoyed the breakfast buffet. If you stay in one of the rooms on the higher floors the view of Singapore is fantastic. The bathrooms are spacious and clean. Whether on business or with family and friends definitely a great place to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Back again”
Reviews.Author: MaggiePerthAustralia
Reviews.Content: We have used the Swissotel The Stamford quite a few times but this time just for a holiday break from Australia. The check in was quick and smooth - I asked for a high room and was told we were already "half way to heaven". The staff were great, appeared quickly if you needed help. The room was clean, well appointed with all the littlw things you need. I prefer to be able to use the fridge and you can here - not like others in Sigapore that charge you the minute you lift the beer from the fridge. We like the shops, the food market below and the convience of the MRT station. And the view was wonderful Peter B

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: PiaShome
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Swissotel for a business trip in December, 2010. I was given a room on the 30th floor. It overlooked the Marina Bay Sands and that looked amazing. Food was good but the rooms needed to be furnished better. The decor is not modern and looked dated. The television is still the old model, hence i was not particularly impressed. However, we went up to the 72nd floor where they have City Space...that was simply superb. Great view...great food and much better than even the roof top for Marina Bay Sands

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! breakfast served till lunch!”
Reviews.Author: realnaget
Reviews.Content: I have to say i thoroughly enjoyed my stay here. the pulling point for a sleep-inner like me is that they served breakfast till about lunchtime - which means it accommodates lazy morning people! LOVELY! the rooms are spacious and very comfortable - i came with my husband who was there for work so i thoroughly enjoyed the fact that i could stay in and have breakfast till about 1pm! it is VERY centrally located - right in the CBD - lots of shopping and food around - its directly above one of the best shopping complexes around. theres a good foodcourt in the basement of the shopping complex and a mrt (subway) station right there. McDonalds right up the lobby and good hairdresser even! Stay here, you wont regret it.

Reviews.Title: “A Singapore Delight”
Reviews.Author: Minigirl24
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights on our way to Europe to break up the trip. Arrived late on the Saturday and we were quickly shown to our room which was on a high floor as requested with great views of the harbour. The room was spacious and had two balconies and a good sized bathroom with a bath. Loved the bed, the tea in the linen tea bags, the location, the pools, the gym and the option to dine at Prego's which is part of the adjoining Fairmont. The breakfasts at Prego's were sensational. Fresh juice of your choice an amazing buffet and the best baked beans. The hotel provides easy access to shopping and the MRT which are both directly downstairs. My only criticism if any were that the carpet was starting to look a little tired. The staff were great, helpful and pleasant. Our departing flight wasn't leaving until late one evening and we were offered our room at a half price rate which we really appreciated as it meant we didn't have to check out and then hang around all day. The Swissotel Stamford is a great option if you are looking to shop, relax and sightsee in Singapore as it is in the heart of everything. Also a drink in the Equinox bar is worth the price for the views alone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: FranNewZealand
Reviews.Content: We actually ended up staying here by accident as were meant to be staying next door at The Fairmont but due to some mix up ended up here instead- think it worked in our favour!! Because of the confusion we ended up getting breakfasts included & a complimentary late checkout. The receptionist who attended to s could not have been more helpful. We paid extra to be upgraded to a room with a great view on 56th floor & it was well worth it. View was fantastic. All staff helpful & friendly & restaurant breakfast plentiful & varied. Location central & attached to Raffles Shopping Centre - also not too far to an MRT station. Will stay again & thoroughly recommend

Reviews.Title: “We keep coming back”
Reviews.Author: MalenyTraveller
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several times, the first time was a business trip but we like the hotel and all it provides so we stay here everytime we go to Singapore. We find the location ideal as it allows us walking access to the MRT and the many shopping and tourism facilities which surround the hotel. We have stayed in many different rooms on various floors and we could only say that they surpassed our expectations, always clean,comfortable, spacious and somewhere to look forward to after a long day out. The staff Aldo & Miriam (reception), Jose and Thiba (breakfast restaurants) as well as many of the other staff are both courteous and attentive, and this year we were introduced to Mario who treated us like a friend of the family. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location. Superb Service. I keep coming back.”
Reviews.Author: vishal_bhatnagar
Reviews.Content: This was my third consecutive stay at the Swissotel Stamford. All three trips have been for a different purpose. First was for our company conference, the second last year was for a holiday with my family and this time was for a 3-day business trip enroute to our annual conference in Bintan, Indonesia. On my holiday last year, my wife and i were accompanied by our 2 young kids, both under 5, and my father who is in his 70s. We were overwhelmed by the warmth and the thoughtful service that the folks at the hotel extended us. Help was always at hand and the smiles all seemed genuine. For the current trip, although our travel agent had got me better deals from other 4/5 star hotels like Hilton etc, my experience from the previous ocassions swung the decision in favour of Swissotel Stamford. I did not regret the decision. Amongst the host of other reasons, the two reasons i recommend the Swissotel Stamford to my friends and colleagues is the outstanding Service and the excellent Location. The hotel sits bang in the middle of the shopping, leisure and Business districts. with kids we did not realise how good the location was as i we did not walk much and took a taxi for most excursions. However, this time since it wasn't a particularly busy schedule and we walked for a lot of the meetings and for leisure visits. We walked to Marina bay Sands, Suntec, Clarke Quay, Orchard road with breaking into a sweat. These places are a comfortable 5-15 mins walk from the hotel. On the other hand the lobby and the entrance aren't quite as grand as some of the other Hotels in this same range and the breafast buffet spread isn't as generous as some others offer. but then on working visits neither of these are deciding factors for me. Although as a return guest, i would have liked some feel-good personalised gesture from the hotel. Also, another reviewer had mentioned that guests are charged for using of health club facilities. This is not true. My colleagues and i used the gym and the Sauna/Steam rooms daily with no extra charge. The Spa Willow Streams was quite good with polite and friendly staff. The Pool and Spa are shared with the Fairmont hotel next door. All in all, an great hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff. Clean, comfortable room. Amazing views!!”
Reviews.Author: erandall
Reviews.Content: My husband arrived a day before me and was greeted at the door of the hotel lobby by name,and shown to the check in desk. Staff were attentive and friendly throughout our stay. Upon arrival my husband found chocolate dipped strawberries in the room. The room was spacious, very comfortable, and clean and tidy. The view from our Grand room was spectacular. We had two balconies, one overlooking Marina Bay and the other, east across the city outskirts, toward Changi Airport. The hotel is located above a shopping centre and MRT station, so everything you need is at your fingertips. It was a short walk to Boat Quay, Marina Bay and to the bottom end of Orchard Road. The Singapore Attrcations Express will pick you up and drop you off at the hotel door for the Singapore Zoo and Night Safari. We spent a few early evenings at Introbar, enjoying "happy hour" (which is from 3pm to 9pm) half price drinks befor heading out to dinner. We had room service on our last night while we packed and it was delicious, hot and delivered quickly. There is a great selection of restaurants to choose room service from, catering to all tastes. We also went to the night club on the 70th floor, New Asia. The view up there is amazing, music is great, drinks are a bit expensive (even for Singapore), but its worth it! The only problem we had was with the hot water in our room. We generally had to run it for 3-5 minutes to get it hot. We complained twice, the first time they sent someone up, who just ran the water until it was hot. The second time we waited to be called back, then ran the water ourselves, showered and went to bed - turning on the "privacy please" light. When we woke the next morning there was a note under the door saying they had called to fix it but had observed our request for privacy. We mentioned all of this at check out and the staff member (who turned out the be the manager) was not impressed and was very apologetic, offering her card for us to contact her should we want to stay again. Overall, I would definately recommend Swissotel The Stamford for your stay in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “describes the flavour of singapore”
Reviews.Author: shrutivora
Reviews.Content: One of the best lounges Equinox ...stunning view....superb decor...... the rooms , lobby as well as food are excellent... they also have a mall connecting the hotel...which is very convenient. the spa was also extremely relaxing..infact one of the biggest fitness centre in ASia

Reviews.Title: “Great views, handy location, staff need to be more friendly”
Reviews.Author: tracenjimmy
Reviews.Content: Views from the Stamford are fantastic especially if you are facing the casino. Can get a bit noisy however on the lower floors. The rooms are fairly large and stocked with plenty of amenitys. Location is above the City Link Mall which makes shopping very easy if you cannot stand the Singapore humidity. A MRT is station can also be found below the mall with a walkway connecting you to Suntec Mall. The only thing that prevents me from giving Stamford five stars is that the front desk staff can come off as being very arrogant and snobby. Its like they are too good to talk to you if you are dressed in t-shirt and jeans. Otherwise a very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great views, dated rooms, high price”
Reviews.Author: JohannesF
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a few nights in Jan 2011. - Awesome views: we had a high up room, with fantastic view over the Marina. Especially nice as my GF was in SG for the first time - Room was very big, bed was fine. The furniture is dated and needs a makeover (like other parts of the hotel). Little balcony (not very useful though) - No free Wifi - ridiculous rates for internet usage, even in the business centre (which is hard to locate) - Break fast was good but just for one person when booking a double room - what a joke. Also, the hall has the feel of a cantine. - Good location with access to MTR. - Overall expensive for what you get - even with a corporate rate. I would not return unless I'd get a better rate or would know that the hotel has improved. Can get more for your money in other high end hotels in SG. Views are superb.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Location, Good View, Decent Rooms, Shopping & MRT in the premises”
Reviews.Author: akdangra
Reviews.Content: Very centrally located in the smallish country. Those who like to walk can reach any location - Merlion Park, Boat Quay, Clarke Quay, Esplanade, Museum, Parliaments etc. on foot. Also close to the CBD. MRT can be accessed directly after getting out of the premises. Rooms are decent but nothing flashy. Faucets/Taps were creaky. Service was slightly disappointing. Sometimes the On-Call Valet didn't pick the phone at all. Other times one had to remind and even after 30 mins surely the response was "Sorry, it's on the way". The complex has number of restaurants around with all kind of options. If pure veg be cautious to double check on eggs & fish. Shahi Maharani was a good Indian restaurant though costly at around SGD50 for a full meal. Kopi Thiam restaurant food was good and service was excellent. Try the lychee juice with fresh lychee pieces also in the Juice. On the costlier side with room rate of SGD300++.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: YashG
Reviews.Content: Recommend this hotel for your business or leisure stay in Singapore. Best part is the location of this hotel. Above an City Hall MRT & Raffles Mall, this is the best you can get in Singapore. Great options to eat. Walking distance to Funan Digital Center. Swissotel @ Stamford has a good SPA and spacious rooms. I found the hotel to be expensive, but Singapore is an expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “Good Old hotel with good services”
Reviews.Author: R_Maharani
Reviews.Content: We stay at 31/5 till 2/6,for some mix up they say didnt received any reservation,I used booking.com.i asked for renovated room,they didnt give me,very decepointed. Our room 3967&3970 is outdated but everything function well. Concierge service lousy,i asked for arrange birthday cake for my daughter birthday they seems not pleasantly accomodating,very decepointed,the cake arrived as i reserved but after i fuss and call several times. Not what i expected,no personalize service like i read from several review. Seems i had misleed myself to hope a warm friendly gesture for my daughter 10th birthday . Hotel good location & will reconended for a big old outdated room.

Reviews.Title: “Love the view and convenient location!”
Reviews.Author: GoGoRicea
Reviews.Content: Room and service is good, lovely Singapore view, It is easy to get food around the hotel, and the hotel is also located right next to a shopping mall, so for those who are in singapore to shop, its very convenient, Right under the mall runs the MTR, subway, which makes it even more convenient to explore or travel. I had a pleasant stay!

Reviews.Title: “great location, comfortable room, spectacular views”
Reviews.Author: ifenwick
Reviews.Content: Located beside a mall, but doesn't feel in the mall. Lots of food stores, etc. Great location for restaurants and for business. No complaints at all

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view”
Reviews.Author: MystiqueWanderer
Reviews.Content: The first thing you notice about the hotel is the height. It's a tall building and given its location I say that makes for an awesome combination. I had a room on the 51st floor, giving me the view of the Bay, top view of a church and a stadium. In short it was breathtaking. The room was elegant and spacious, nicely done up. For travelers it had a converter pin in the drawer of the the lovely wooden desk, something only a business traveler will tell you how much they value. Back to essentials, food!!! The breakfast buffet was quite elaborate providing a mix of Indian, continental and Asian cuisines. There was something for every taste. The hotel is well located and its easy to get around. You should and I specially recommend this take a walk down till the theatre and try the roadside fares being cooked up by the roadside vendors. Then come back and head to the disc at the top floor :) Oh and I almost missed it, for the shopaholics. The hotel is in a building which has a very nice mall. You could spend hours there. So go ahead, have a good time :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for seeing singapore”
Reviews.Author: niceguy09
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay, very nice room, great views, efficient staff, not cheap, but a treat for us on our first visit to Singapore. Wonderful breakfast with a great variety of foods from around the world. I would normally have given the hotel 5 stars. Only a couple of things that let this hotel down, the internet- not only is the charge way too high, but even when paid the connection was horrible. Secondly the "hospitality room". I have never felt so uncomfortable in a hotel. We had a late flight and wanted somewhere to sit and get changed before our flight- we walked in to their "hospitality" room that was more like a cramped bus, people milling around all waiting for a chance at the bathroom, kids running around our feet, people sitting in entrance hall and along the wall. A mother struggling to wash her babies bottles in the tiny sink.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotell with excellent breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Tarru
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in this hotell and we must say say that the hotell had a great breakfast! Fresh fruits, juices, waffles, all kind of food, cheese etc. all were great. Service was good and staff friendly. Well we had only "Classic room" but it fit out travell well, because we didn't spent much time in hotell room :) Our room was on the 43rd floor and the wiev was nice. We saw the both the town and the river. The hotells restaurants were very expensive so it was (for us) better to go eat somewhere else. The Italian restaurant was quite expensive and the food was only average. Bath ameneties were good, every day they bring us new tooth brush, shampoo, shaving kit, body lotion and shower gel. But no bath foam! Well a shower was enough, but for example they didn't have bide there att all.To go up to the 70th floor cost 25$ per adult (inc. a drink) in the evenings but in the day time you can visit that floor in free. Quite silly - I think. If you are a guest of this hotell you should have free entrance to the 70th floor in the evenings too!! The location was very good - very easy go to the metro, by walking you can go the sky flyer or to the Singapore river. Taxis were very cheap - so it's the most best way to the Little Indian for example. Anyway, we liked this hotell very much and can recommend it to the couples who wants to sleep well in a huge hotell middle of Singapore. If you want to spent time more in the hotell, choose better room than classic - it was made only for sleeping and have a shower - well in a gentle way. But the best was BREAKFAST:)

Reviews.Title: “NOT WORTH THE MONEY”
Reviews.Author: chilliPerth
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this Hotel is the location, the room we had on the 54th Floor was really disappointing, carpet was dirty, large iron mark right in the middle of the lounge room floor, just generally old. Have stayed at many Hotels but would not come back to this one. The pool area is tiny and apparently is shared with an adjoining Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views!”
Reviews.Author: tipsyreviewer
Reviews.Content: This has to be the best hotel i have stayed in my life. Never felt like stepping out of my room during the whole stay. Can see entire singapore & all the high rises ,just lazing around in the bed. (checkout snaps from my room) Jaw dropping views in the night! Amazing sights of singapore cricket club,sands hotel/casino, mmarina , the marilion lion etc etc. Just make sure you try to get a room in higher floors(higher the better) ,facing the marina. Also dont miss out the trendy nightclub at the top floor ,probably the highest viewpoint in singapore. Amazing 360 deg views ! This hotel has 2 huge shopping malls in its lower floors,so unlimited shopping and dining options to cater to all tastes and budget.Right next to sgp's transit & public transport station. Excellent spacious luxurious rooms with all the amentities expected from 5+ * star hotels . Loved the gym and the pool .However when you stay in such massive hotels,the staff loose out on the personal touch & attention.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, excellent food - but not the best”
Reviews.Author: Santanu76
Reviews.Content: I liked staying at the Swissotel in Singapore. The rooms were spacious, unlike most other hotels. The location is great - it is close to Clarke Quay as well as the Marina Bay Sands Hotel. Loved the lounge bar on the 70th floor with a stunning view - also, a trip to the Marina Bay Sands was very enjoyable. However, the place looks a touch costly and the rooms look classy, albeit a tad tired. In sum, full marks for the location and the lounge - the service and rooms are par. Worth staying if you have deep pockets.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: MattieG75
Reviews.Content: We arrived quite early (7:45am), however they had our room ready by 10:15am even though we weren't due to check in by 2:00pm! The location is absolutely perfect. Numerous underground shopping/eating venues at your doorstep and conveniently located right on top of City Hall Station (MRT). The in-house restaurants are quite expensive, but you pay for the view. Easy to get everywhere around Singapore from this location including the airport. Highly recommend for the perfect shopping holiday. No WIFI in rooms though, you have to go down to the lobby, but its free.

Reviews.Title: “sts”
Reviews.Author: marge1017
Reviews.Content: had a great experience w/ this hotel, although we arrived 2am kidz room was ready and very clean w/ great view of the city...my 2 kids and mother were very impressed..don't miss the swimming pool..great location.taxis are out front, mrt below the hotel, shopping mall is beside, supermarket,food court & money changer below the hotel..its all there..

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay let down by no WiFi in Room”
Reviews.Author: notuslimited Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Nice stay but cannot believe that in this day and age a supposedly five star hotel does not have in room WiFi. Real pain in the you know where having to go down to the lobby to use my I-Phone for surfing. On the same visit I stayed in the IBIS on Bencoolen and even they had in room WiFi.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good rooms.”
Reviews.Author: ClaireFromAustralia9
Reviews.Content: The best thing about Swissotel the Stamford is its unbeatable location. It is right above Raffles City shopping centre and a nice food court, and just a very short walk away from Marina Bay, the Singapore Flyer, Chinatown, Hawker centers, plenty of restaurants and other amenities. It is right above two intersecting train lines, with most attractions (eg Orchard Rd) being just a few stops away. We stayed 6 nights. We checked in around 10pm the first night and were told there were no renovated rooms left. Tip: email them in advance to request a renovated room. They said we could ask for a renovated room the next day when other guests had checked out. We did and were transferred into a better, renovated room. The level 13 unrenovated room we had on the first night was quite good. Plenty of space and mostly clean. I had a bath, however, and when I lowered my head I was disappointed to see a lot of black mould on the underside of the soap dish and a lot of black stains in the tile grout. The level 44 renovated room was much better. Very roomy, even better view and the tile grout was clean in the bathroom. There were some nice touches, such as scales in the bathroom and a mini bath fizz tablet. The beds in both rooms were comfortable but a little too firm for my liking. Apparently it is customary in Singapore not to use top sheets. Instead there was an all-in-one duvet. Housekeeping promptly supplied an extra blanket when I requested one. The service was good. We needed an overseas electrical adaptor which the hotel lent us with no dramas. The front counter staff were courteous. The concierge gave us concise and accurate directions. It was great having the asia bar on the 71st floor at our disposal. We discovered they sell most cocktails for sg$12 until 9pm nightly. Overall we had a very good stay and would recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Quality and comfort in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Mbett1
Reviews.Content: Stayed in an Executive room on the 58th floor of the Swissotel The Stamford. Check in was carried out in the room and was swift and efficient. Room was a little dated but had all the amenities expected, including a firm but very comfortable bed with good quality pillows. The bathroom was more dated but was spacious and had all the necessary extras including a decent shower over the bath and a folding glass screen which prevented the room from flooding. There were no problems other than a safe which refused to open with passport and money inside, however the hotel were quick to send someone up to resolve the problem. Only surprising item was that I received a parcel from the UK. After unpacking it, I placed the discarded box by the door for removal - however it remained for three days. The exec lounge was somewhat Spartan but served an excellent breakfast. Only surprise on the bill was the amount of tax levied by Singapore Government! - however hotel cannot be blamed for that.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother!”
Reviews.Author: ssm747
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel often for work, as it's a preferred hotel. If I was paying I wouldn't touch it! The renovated rooms are passable but the unrenovated rooms are disgraceful..In fact I've stayed in better rooms in my backpacking days at hostels. The rooms often smell musty and the bathrooms smell even worse,the old shower curtain being the main culprit.Room aircon is also hit and miss. In general the rooms are poorly maintained, with mould often found around the bath tub. My biggest find though was on my last visit, and that was someone else's toe nails next to the bed! The fitness centre is good and the staff there are friendly. Generally I find the rest of the hotel staff very average and perfunctionary at best. The Pan Pacific,The Conrad or the Shangri-La are much better options.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: AddAdrTA
Reviews.Content: Good hotel. Had a nice and large room at a top floor with a nice view on the bay and the city. Very crowded/busy hall room. Same is the restaurant for the breakfast (noisy). Nice price for the quality. Can recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great views, service and food, rooms slightly dated”
Reviews.Author: Carlene04
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two weeks while my partner was working in Singapore, we were lucky enough to stay in the Executive Rooms so had beautiful views over the harbour 57 floors up. Bed and little couch were very comfortable. Disappointed no wireless internet and the leads for the internet were a bit temperamental, sellotaped to wall with masking tape. Room smelt a bit stale and must have been a smoking room at some stage as can still smell it a bit, but they do come and spray your room every day. Room also very cold which you cannot adjust if you are out all day as you need the room card in to adjust temperature. And carpet dated and stained. Also the shower door allows water all over the bathroom floor, we often had a facecloth to try and block some of the water otherwise your bathmat always ended up saturated.
