Executive Lounge was fantastic, food was excellent - both breakfast and evening drinks and nibbles- although disappointed once again with the overpowering smell of cigarettes, which is not always the nicest smell first thing in the morning. Staff in Executive Lounge always very friendly and helpful. We only discovered Cafe Swiss only in the last few days of our stay and once again the food and service was fantastic, disappointed we were not aware of this earlier in our stay. When we checked in the Front desk very quickly went over breakfast and the hours and Executive Lounge, this needs to be more explicit - have something in the room detailing the hours and usage of staying in Executive Lounge. We didn't realise we also had use of Cafe Swiss - we had to ask! Cleaners were excellent, very friendly and often gave us extra water which was fantastic. Pool area was nice but often very crowded with people leaving towels on the loungers but not returning, so we didn't often have a chance to use the loungers. I think there should be some sort of rule to not be able to reserve loungers if you are not going to be there for more than 20 minutes. Spa was fantastic, very relaxing - the steam room was very hot! Gym was great, well equipped although disappointed the yoga was so expensive - so didn't try it out. Went up to Equinox floor on last evening, but bars air conditioning was very cold and music very loud, disappointed we couldn't have a drink in the restaurant next to it without having food, as much more pleasant to have a relaxing drink - we ended up heading next door for a drink at Long Bar in Raffels - which was fantastic. Great location with MRT and shopping malls all at the base of the hotel. Expensive for the price - needs a bit of a refurb - comfortable and great views

Reviews.Title: “Absolute pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Coopsnz01
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff and a very comfortable hotel. Good location. Awesome dj gig on last Thursday of every month with cocktails on the helipad.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view”
Reviews.Author: sleepy38
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for work trip and had a harbour view room with one of the best views in Singapore. Service and facilities were of a high standard as always. Breakfast variety also impressive.

Reviews.Title: “Great view, perfect location but some staff are not well informed and room service is too slow!”
Reviews.Author: ciaobella_bambina
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in April. The bed was comfy and although dated the room was great. We were upgraded to a classic harbour view room on the 43 rd floor! We also enjoyed complimentary wine but had to ask for it as it wasn't set up in our room nor mentioned upon check in. However reception did congratulate us on our anniversary. This is a very busy hotel. The operator is clueless when I requested their help to retrieve my voicemail as the password wasn't working. I gave up after they failed to help me the fourth time I rang them in 12 hours! And some front office staff are also misinformed or clueless about how to retrieve my voicemail. They gave me the wrong info but eventually I figured it out. Also room service is terribly slow and moves at a glacial pace. Our bags took 20 minutes to come up to our room. Our wine took 30 mins and they forgot to provide a corkscrew to open the wine. It took them another 30 mins to deliver a bottle opener to the room. Very frustrating. City space bar on the 70th level has lovely night views but cocktails are pricey and are weak. Staff are friendly and accomodating. Even towards an obnoxious Jewish American guy with his Asian girlfriend. He was loud and rude to staff. Constantly complained about the lack of alcohol in his girlfriend's drink. Overall I would stay in that location again but might try the Fairmont. Tip- DO NOT try the Singapore Sling at the long bar at Raffles. It's overpriced and waitresses treat you like dirt if you're staying at the hotel. Plus they allow young kids in at the bar past 10pm. Not impressed at all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rikipok
Reviews.Content: I stayed 6 nights in this hotel with my colleagues. Check in was a bit long because the lobby seems to be a very busy place? Rooms were big, I wanted a king size bed but they couldn't change my room during my whole stay (6 nights...) so I sticked to 2 queens Too bad you have to pay for Wi-fi in your room..for the price they charge it could be included!! Breakfast is good, lot of choice. Will try the neighbouring hotel next October

Reviews.Title: “No complaints from us.”
Reviews.Author: Taylorsmum
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through the Wotif mystery hotel deal and was quite apprehensive when it turned out to be the Swisshotel the Stamford after reading the reviews on this website. I honestly don't understand what people were complaining about. The check in process was fast and efficient with very polite friendly staff. The room was modern and very clean. All the facilities in the room worked perfectly. We didn't hear any corridor noise which can often be a problem in hotels so the guests were either very quiet or they have very good soundproofing! The breakfast buffet was excellent. The location was ideal, being close to everything. We only ate breakfast at the hotel as it was included in the package and enjoyed cheap, tasty food in the foodhalls the rest of the time. The foodhall downstairs had plenty of choice and the only problem was deciding which stall to choose from. I would have no issues recommending this hotel and will certainly stay again when we return to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at Swissotel - great service.”
Reviews.Author: Isa043
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Swissotel the Stamford again and again was very impressed with the service and facilities. Nothing was too hard for them to do for us. High Tea at the Equinox was an experience and would recommend it to all. Apart from the good price, the variety of food was great. OF COURSE the views are exceptional!

Reviews.Title: “Hassle free hotel”
Reviews.Author: SurMen
Reviews.Content: The first thing that attracts you is the location of the hotel. It's right across the city hall metro station and adjacent to the Raffles Place mall. This provides you easy access and mltiple dining options. The rooms are good and the view especially from the 27th floor that I stayed was good. The swimming pool and Tennis courts on the 8th Floor is another attraction. I stayed for 5 days and I would have preferred that the rooms were maintained a bit more cleaner. The bathrooms wore a somewhat old look and I did hesitate to get to the bath tub. The bedsheets was fresh the 1st day...but not the other days...maybe they hadn't changed it during the whole stay.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT FAMILY ACCOMODATION! LOCATION PLUS!”
Reviews.Author: sweetpkiwi
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Singapore and we fell in love with the place! This was a stopover for us on the way to London, 2 nights was just not enough! We had a wonderful stay at the Swissotel. I did plenty of research before booking to ensure that we had the best location, so we could just take the kids and walk to the sites. We certainly saw a lot in our two days! It was perfect and so handy to everything. On arrival we discovered that our crew from our Qantas flight were staying there also which confirmed we had made the right decision. As we were travelling with two children 7 and 11, to cut accommodation costs we booked a room with two beds, which in turn ended up being two double beds and a fold out sofa. This was slightly disappointing as I thought we would have two queen sized beds so the boys could share one and we would have the other. We were up-graded to a balcony room though, so that made up for it as we were on the 36th floor, so the view was awesome. The room was pleasant and clean. Not overly flash but we were in Singapore to see as much as we could, not hang out in the hotel room!! One thing I definitely wanted included on our stay was breakfast. WOW was this worth it! We all found the Cafe Swiss fantastic, with the most amazing selection of standard breakfast items and included Japanese, Italian and just about anything else you could think of......as well as fruit we had never seen before and enjoyed tasting!!! The kids were in heaven...and well so were we!!! I found the staff very helpful and with children, who are very gorgeous, I found we got treated very well, if not spoilt, everywhere we went! They went out of there way to make sure we enjoyed our stay. We woke up the next morning a went to the information desk, bought tickets to Universal Studios and we were off!!! What a totally thrilling, exhausting day that was! All in all we loved Singapore and the Swissotel. The only comment I could make is to ask for extra bottles of water if there are more than two staying in a room. They only supplied us with two bottles each day and the mini bar prices are crazy!!!!! $8 for a bottle, if I remember correctly!!! Highly recommend for families!

Reviews.Title: “Soulless”
Reviews.Author: ozmadmax
Reviews.Content: Checked in after 10pm and this place was like Grand Central Station at rush hour. No concierge / bell hop to bring luggage to room (too busy perving at the local talent!). The rooms are quite nice, and view from room was excellent. The breakfast was average and over-priced. Singapore is no longer the cheap stopover or business destination it was in the past and the standard is declining with many new crappy hotels springing up to cash in on the tourist and business vistor alike. There are obvious exceptions to this and the Swisshotel should be one but isn't. At best its a wannabe and at worst it's a has been. The front desk were nice but perfunctory, the restaurant pretty but unattractive. The location is good and if you can get a deal (there are lots available) then this is not a bad choice. This is a good hotel that could be great but there is a gap between what it claims to be and what it should be.

Reviews.Title: “Has seen better days - try Conrad instead”
Reviews.Author: Kintung
Reviews.Content: Well, this palce has definitly seen better days. You will notice that many things are worn off, are out of date - simply dont make it into the premier league. The hotel is ok if you just want to sleep there. The view over Singapore is great from most the balconies. The breakfast restaurant will remind you of a place in the swiss alps (dont expect any asian look and feel in the entire hotel). If you can afford a few bucks more, try the Conrad, very close by, but significantly better.

Reviews.Title: “First time visitor, very pleased”
Reviews.Author: traveller_au97
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I stayed at this hotel, normally I would book myself into the Fairmont next door. My initial impression was that this hotel seems a lot more busy in the lobby/reception area compared to many other hotels, I suppose this is because of a large number of visitors coming in and out.... The checkin was quiet quick and efficient, I was being looked after bya trainee with a supervisor by his side. I was very pleased. During checkin I polietly requested a high floor rooom looking out at MBS which I received..this is a major plus. The late checkout was also quickly confirmed. I did not have the time to make use of the hotel's facilities so I cannot comment. The room was nice and clean, away from the lifts. The room keeping service...I thought arrived late in the morning compared to what I am used to but this is really nothing to complain about. Just an observation. Overall, fantastic hotel, good price and great location as well as service by all staff. Big thank you to the concierge outside the hotel for helping me get a tax, this was the elderly gentleman...big thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Only if you are very rich”
Reviews.Author: BandBAdventures
Reviews.Content: Well me start with the front desk,after check in I noticed our room was on the 12th floor,I requested a room on at least the 30th floor 7 months before our arrival,the girl said they did have a room on a higher floor for $50.00 U.S. more,when she went to get our room key,I asked another desk clerk about a room on a higher floor,she said let me look and see.She found us a room on the 38th flloor for nothing extra.The breakfast buffet is $44.00 a person,the Internet at the Bussiness Center is $10.50 for 15 minutes,they do have Internet in your room but no wireless,the TV does not have any weather channel,and I do not go on vacation to watch TV but I do like to have a weather channel so I can check the weather where I am at that time.Onlt thing I did like was the views from our room and the MRT(subway) was in the basement of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, excellent Staff, surpasses expectations.”
Reviews.Author: Carrathool
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights and were given a room with a harbor view on the 38th floor. Check in was very friendly and efficient. Full marks for this hotel. We usually stay at the Orchard Parade Hotel but not any more. First call will be to the Stamford next time. Could not fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Big Disappointment for a "5 star"”
Reviews.Author: SmithsinTaiwan
Reviews.Content: The location is great and the initial registration experience was efficient - too bad that summarizes most of the good aspects of this highly over-rated property. The lofty expectations were quickly dashed when we got to the room which looked like it had been stocked by going out of business sale furniture from the 1980s. The air conditioning was marginal, we never really felt comfortable, it was inadequate and/or poorly maintained. This probably helped foster the locker room like smell which permeated the room. The obnoxious aroma was further enhanced by what appeared to be rather poor drainage in the bathroom. Another curiosity was the desk and computer support in the room. It was pointed out when we got into the room that an electrical adapter was provided, how thoughtful. Unfortunately only wired ethernet was provided via what looked like an ADSL modem powered by a small AC adapter that used the only AC outlet anywhere near the desk. So, to plug in my laptop, I had to move the desk into the center of the room, unplug the TV on an opposite wall and use that outlet for my laptop AC adapter. Picture the desk in the center of the room, wires strung from here to there - what a pathetic scene. This hotel is on my company's favored hotel list for Singapore - hopefully not for much longer after I cut and paste this into the feedback section of our hotel booking app. On our last day we left for the airport an hour earlier than we needed to preferring an airport lounge to another minute in our room. Even at half the price this place wouldn't be worth your money.

Reviews.Title: “Once again a brilliant stay - Crest Suite was amazing”
Reviews.Author: calekids
Reviews.Content: Apologies for lateness in the review. But once again we were thrilled with our stay at the Swissotel Stamford. Our suite was amazing, beautiful and spectacular. We felt like royalty. The services that accompanied the suite were fantastic. The hotel is convenient to everything. There are cabs out the front, trains under the shopping centre, food courts, shopping malls, supermarkets. Everything you could need all within minutes. Breakfast was delicious, and plenty of options to choose from. Beds were comfortable, room was amazingly clean and views spectacular. We have stayed at this hotel before and we will again. Highly recommended and perfect with small kids as the rooms are big enough (even without the suite) for 2 adults and 2 kids. We really enjoyed our stay and look forward to going back again down the track. We have recommended this hotel to friends and even had some stay with us on this trip. They were also impressed with its location and cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Rather disorganised”
Reviews.Author: SeanNZ
Reviews.Content: Swissotel is a good hotel. No doubt about that but for a chain that want to be five star they have a fair bit to go. I would say a 4 star hotel low 4 star. Some rooms need renovation and they desperately need to do something about their overcrowded and chaotic reception area. Separate normal shoppers using their entrance is a good idea to. However Swissotels shortcomings is good for those looking for a special price, since Swissotel frequently have rooms selling for under 200 dollars. Arriving at Swissotel is a scene of chaos. Cars and minibuses parking wildly and disorganised in up to three lanes while dropping off and picking up passengers. No german has organised this we can rest assured of that. Two poor men in nice uniforms dont stand a chance to keep track of 20 cars despite really trying their utmost. This is the same at virtually any time outside the entrance and almost comical at times. I would suggest anyone thats looking for a taxi to walk to the right from the hotel entrance. 20 meter down that road is a regular Taxi stand. If you ask for help from the poor men working for Swissotel they tend to be busy serving the crowds and you are made to wait. The crowd isn't usually hotelguests but instead customers that's visited Raffles shopping mall and using Swissotels entrance. (Something the hotel seriously need to fix I dont like seeing 8 shoppers get service while me, a paying customer has to wait. And thats not the error from the men working the entrance thats management. Checking in is also rather chaotic. Always busy and they have one or two ladies with mics trying to make it smoother and form a queue from the sea of people otherwise waiting adhoc. Thats good, without them frustration would be tenfold. people always try to pass this queue and form their own line but the ladies are fast onto these queue-jumpers. One might ask if this couldn't be done better though? I mean its solvable at other hotels so why not at Swissotel? Separate line for check in and check out. separate places even better, many solutions to this definately and management needs to wake up and fix it. The rooms in themselves are ok. After 22 i think you need a card to get into the elevator room. good because crowds going to the roofbar are big and they dont stay in the hotel. Some more security on this would be appreciated I had a group of harmless drunk Asian women laughing outside my hotel going up in the elevator trying to get up to the bar using those elevators only to realise that didnt work... Flat screen TV, decent bathrooms. however my bathroom and I have stayed there twice the last month have shown some brown where the sink in the bathtub is and the wooden door has been rather old. Also they do lack some TV channels their competitor have. Football channel for instance for us premier league fans. Dont remember if they had a childrens channel. (their offering is the usual Murdoch Hotel deal, not good, not bad. Apart from that things are fine and hosuekepping is done properly. But WHY oh why do they have a special rule asking us to throw the towels thatw e want changed into the bathtub? All other hotels asks us to put them on the floor. the cleaning lady saw mine on the floor and asked me if i wanted them changed, of course thats why I put them on the floor. Ah Swissotel asks you to put it in the bathtub as shown on a note but i understood you wanted them changed and just double-checked with you. Good housekeeping, very professional, but towels in the bathtub is plain stupid. Can even end up being smelly and extra damp and this for a change! Makes no sense at all. Concierge and the assistance there is excellent. I have spoken to a larger Chinese lady a few times and she is a miracle. Nothing she cant arrange or find info on. A great help even for businessmen and tourists alike. She knows Singapore. The food at the venue is surprisingly poor. ordered roomservice, had dinner at floor 70? and tried the cafe next to the reception. nothing stands out and to be honest, I wouldn't eat at any place in the hotel unless I really have to. prices are high and food rather poor. the view from the bar at floor 71 is great though. have a drink enjoy the view. the cafe next door is rather special. they have promo-signs outside for tiger crystal and same in the elevator. When I ordered one they said that promotion ended 2 weeks ago??? i was about to say your problem dont display a sign but thought that the poor girls working in the cafe wont have a clue so I didn't. but come on two week old promo and still signs. Give me a break that's youth hostel class. Check out went smooth, had an issue with an extra payment that the first lady asked for but she immediately went to the supervisor that corrected her mistake. no malicious just an honest mistake and she apologised a 100 times. Thats good. All in all, good location, busy hotel good service but the lobby and food is plain bad. However good sleep and if you get a decent deal by all means stay if not choose another hotel in the same price class. And for business, nah dont even think of it hehe so many places where quality is far superior. Overall if a decent rate ill stay there or i want to walk to raffles, Suntec or just enjoy the cricket club. Apart from that i would probably choose a better venue.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Loulabell_10
Reviews.Content: Swissotel The Stamford, Singapore hotel is a standard five star hotel, what makes this hotel exceptional is the location. It is next door to Raffles hotel and on top of a shopping mall which has everything you will need. The food in the Marketplace is fantastic and very reasonably priced. There is also a lot of restaurants near by which are great as well. The hotel is also in walking distance of a lot of the tourist attractions or is only one/two tube stop rides away. I would defiantly stay in this hotel again when I go back to Singapore and would recommend this to other travellers

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Anandspeaks
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights and found it a good hotel for business trips. The hotel is interconnected with another hotel and a big shopping mall along with couple of restaurents. It has good bars and pubs around it and is conveniently located. In terms of room quality, it is average and Fairmont is better as it needs some overhaul. But overall experience at hotel was good.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with fantastic veiws”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel88888888
Reviews.Content: The moment we walked into the room we thought wow. Great location with the MRT station just below the hotel the trains are amazing compared to Sydney. Also conected to a shopping centre with everything you could want or need plenty of places to eat. Staff were great greeting us everytime we came back from a day out two of the girls at the front were wonderful kristel and cathrine made specail efforts to make my girls feel special. Great hotel would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: Renaoh
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights, from March 17 to March 19, 2001. We booked the Kids Room Special, in our room there is aconnecting room for the kids. My 9 year daughter loves the Kids room. It is well decorated with plush toys, pillows and books etc. The beds were soft and comfortable and the fridge is well-stocked with drinks and tit-bits. Everyone was friendly and a special thank you to the friendly hotel concreige on duty on March 18, 2011 who arranged our City Tour during the day and Night Safari for the night. Both tours were very interesting and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Business Conference & Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: prabh1602
Reviews.Content: The Swissotel addresses the needs of any large conference in every detail. I was present as part of a regional event with over 500 members, and the hotel hosted us with great comfort. Along with excellent venues for events and breakout sessions, the hotel offers great and diverse food catering to the needs to attendees from all over Asia. But the highlight for me was the breakfast, which was made up of the largest collection of food I had ever faced down. In hindsight, instead of getting you off to a great start, you're liable to eat so much that all you want to do is get some sleep all over again. But with its location in south-central Singapore, the hotel is well connected to neighboring attractions while providing a self-sufficient platform for conferences. Though I am sure the comfortable rooms would be a great fit even for the lone business traveler.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing hotel.”
Reviews.Author: nicolebrowner
Reviews.Content: My daughters aged 7 and 11 and I stayed here last week for 7 nights and had an amazing time. Perfect location and shopping centre is joined onto hotel. Very good service was given by all staff and you were always welcomed back after you had been out.. A special thank you to Benny who always came up to talk to my kids. I will definetely be staying at the Swissotel The Stamford again on my next trip to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Always happy to return to Swissotel The Stamford”
Reviews.Author: DLim1021
Reviews.Content: Been staying at this property in Singapore for the past 7 years. Seldom have any problems on high level rooms. However sometimes I have been allocated lower level room where the water in the bath tub does not drain properly so in the middle of a shower the water is knee high. Advantage of lower level room is free WiFi, hotel charges like S$40 to use internet 24hr. The hotel recently renovated their rooms with flat screen TV's. The hotel staff are friendly and helpful in all aspects. Location is great, Townhall station and a shopping plaza is right downstairs. Returning to Singapore tomorrow for 2 nights and looking forward to a great hotel, Cheers

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: TFK79
Reviews.Content: The Fresh-up Room for the lAst day before flying back was just a regular room which we had to share with other people. One regular toilet and shower were in, pealple had to lone up for refreshing. Heardryer no Deo, no Hair gel, and no other items were provided.I'm used to other services, even at a 4* hotel. When paying, they tried to charge me 160 S$ for minibar, from which I haven't taken Anything at all! There was a free shoeshine service, I called the valet, but after one day waiting I refused. So no free shoeshine service for me during this trip. They charge for the Internet exorbitantly much. I payed for 7 days 180s$. For 24h is it even more expensive. No wifi, not a nice place for iPhones and co. The bet were made very late, sometime I came back from Office at 4pm and the room was still not made. No room refreshment at the evenings. I think this is very poor

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for business visitor”
Reviews.Author: WorldWorthEnjoying
Reviews.Content: Nilesh Shah - Mar 2011 The hotel is located at such a center location where many business centre are close by and saves time in travel as well as goo location for outing too. I stayed in this hotel for more than two months and found a right choice to stay for such long duration. This hotel is one the tallest in Singapore and excellent view and service. The location of hotel is such nice that from room itself you will get to see so many places and attractions of Singapore you feel pleasant after coming from office and staying in room. For Indian food lover hotel has one excellent Indian restaurant. The best thing in hotels are: 1. Indian restaurant of hotel is one of the best in Singapore 2. Bar on the top that 70th floor where you feel like in Sky 3. Excellent option in breakfast Right choice for business visitor

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed enough with internet cost and quality to take it down to 3-stars”
Reviews.Author: srizvi1
Reviews.Content: If I could, I would give the hotel 3 and a half stars but seems I can only do 3 or 4 - and this definitely isn't a 4. The big killer for me was internet. At this point, internet should be included - I don't understand why it continues to be a charge on fee in most cases. So that's an automatic half a star off. But the killer for me was the 1) cost of the internet ($20+ USD) for 24 hours, 2) it's ridiculous low speed, and 3) it being an ethernet connection and not a wireless connection (although fwiw - if I could have gotten my computer to properly share this connection over the airport, I would have preferred this). As a result of the wired connection, I had to share it with my wife to her computer over bluetooth making it slow for her. So yes, because the internet was so terrible, I am taking it down to 3 stars. Otherwise, location was great. Easy to walk to the subway, mcdonald's right below, nice mall attached to here. The views are fantastic too. We were on the 52nd floor and able to see a lot (see the pictures attached - I wish I had taken some nighttime pictures). Also the gym was very nice with three minor complaints - 1) more spacious please, felt a little crowded and fans would have been nice, 2) there was a station where a variety of pull ups and chin ups could be done - but no close grip chin ups, and 3) no dip station (had to use a roman chair). And a minus one star to sleep quality because I like flat pillows so it would be nice to have a mix of pillows.

Reviews.Title: “Great views from upper floors”
Reviews.Author: dana_christian
Reviews.Content: The room was big. The breakfast was good with a great variety The hotel is located just above a shopping centre and a subway station which makes it very convenient and provides great access to the city. The bathrooms would need a makeover though.

Reviews.Title: “Large spacious rooms- City centre”
Reviews.Author: Blue10122
Reviews.Content: Excellent for work related trips. The location was right in the heart of the city. Walk away from MRT and taxi stops below the hotel. Food is average. Service was good. I arrived early at 7 am and they arranged a room before the check in time. Also arranged for hospitality lounge access. Very good front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Its a very good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rajesh_in
Reviews.Content: Swissotel , the stamford is a good hotel with fantastic location. Bay area, shopping all near by. The rooms are good with efficient service levels. Breakfast spread was good . Family also enjoyed the stay here. I have stayed here both for business and leisure.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS SERVICE, EXCELLENT ROOM”
Reviews.Author: SharWal
Reviews.Content: We had just got off a cruise and arrived at 9am just to ask them to look after our luggage til check-in time. Were met by Owen who was lovely on the front desk. We were originally booked into a Classic Room but he upgraded us for an extra $150 to a Crest Suite on the 66th floor with immediate check in. These suites have free cocktails and nibbles between 5-8pm and breakfast buffet all in the 65th floor Crest suites exec lounge, the views were spectacular. Rhea our waitress was so friendly and welcoming. After staying at the Hard Rock on Sentosa pre cruise then coming here there was no comparison. Our room had two balconies and 3 tvs even had one at the end of the bathtub. We also had access to our own private gym. My only complaint was the lack of information about what was included. I read on the net when I got home that the mini bar was complimentary, and also complimentary internet, we asked for internet at concierge and were directed to a net cafe down the street. Also there was complimentary access to Willowbank Spa but were not aware of this til we came home. I would most definitely stay there again. The service from all staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Heartfelt Stay :)”
Reviews.Author: Abbyskr
Reviews.Content: Made my booking for the Classic Room & was upgraded to the Harbour view room which was UBER FANTASTIC! My room was situated on the 40th storey & its breathtaking! Loved the scenery! Was actually celebrating my 11th year anniversary & the staffs were kind enough to take those small details & made an effort to decorate our room with rose petals. I was surprised! I didn't see it coming at all. Apart from that, I ordered for a Choc cake to be sent up to room as a surprise for my Fiance & they delivered it on time! Hassle free! I didn't even have to order them around. The in room dining guy came over to deliver the cake & voluntered to take a photo of us together with the cake. How niceeeee! Liked that gesture - where people take the effort to the extra mile :) We also got a free entry to the new Asia Bar & it was ok. The view was great too & the atmosphere was cozy. The next morning, had our breakfast at the Swissotel's Kopitiam & the buffet breakfast was amazing!!! They had a good spread of breakfast and trust me, it did satisfy out tummies with so much love! The staffs were very friendly. Came to us & engage in small conversations like "how was your b'fast?" etc. Good move right there! We were given a late c/o too :) Oh well... How else can I describe my stay? It was the best eva! WHEEEEEEE! :))) Thank you to all staffs in Swissotel for the welcoming, friendly & warm service. We shall return again to experience another round of heartfelt service from y'all!

Reviews.Title: “Central great buffet breakfast very kind staff”
Reviews.Author: ElisaDP
Reviews.Content: Hotel is quite central and if you get a room on a high floor you can have a spectacular view of Singapore. The breakfast buffet is quite expensive ($ 42.AUD) but you can eat a lot of different foods, from western to indian, malaysian japanese etc. The room I think needs refurbishment. It would have been quite smart probably 10 years ago but now looks a bit aged and we do have been charged $250 per night! Staff is very polite and very efficient. Overall good.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, relaxing stay. Loved the view and position.”
Reviews.Author: yorkites
Reviews.Content: Check in was easy, all our requests were met. Porters to take bags up to our room. Lovely room. Clean, beds really comfortable and great pillows. Fantastic view, 37th floor. Everything we needed was provided for, even the adaptor for Australia appliances that we had forgotten to take. Room service was swift, hot and yummy. Restaurants at the hotel were great. Loved the poolside dining at any time of the day. All staff polite and curteous. Thankyou for a lovely time for our first visit to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “View and Location is best for Singapore”
Reviews.Author: drleo66
Reviews.Content: Rooms are ok , but you must be stay upper floors and bay view rooms, want to renovated room at check in , rooms have balcony and you can smoke at balcony. easy acces to clark quay, orchard road, china town by taxi 5 minute app 6-8 sgd here to airport 16 sgd and zoo 16 sgd also, hotel have a shopping mall, many stores and starbucks with free internet connection , pool is not mazing but cool. equinox is fine dining restaurant but atmosphere and foods are fair , just price is fine dining price, and view is cool like our room its in floor 70, highly recommend New asia club , its in floor 71 , good music , nice view and value for money , little bit pricey but ok, check in and check out is very fast because they have alot of reception desk and staff, thak you swissotel stamford.

Reviews.Title: “A good option close to some great parts of Singapore”
Reviews.Author: TravelAddicts05
Reviews.Content: We generally had a fairly positive experience staying at the Swissotel. The staff were pretty good and tried to offer us help when we asked for it although during the peak check-in and check-out times, they were stretched pretty thin at the desk. Nevertheless, they always greeted you with a smile and gave good advice on places to go in the nearby area and were very helpful in helping us work out how to get there. The breakfast buffet was excellent and whilst always busy, there was plenty of food and outstanding service. The food itself was both tasty and nicely presented. We did not eat any other meals in the hotel as the Swissotel is right above a decent mall and the food court there provided heaps of cheaper options. In regards to health, the gym there is amongst the best I've seen in a hotel. It is both spacious and very well equipped. The private change room sections for men and women and the jacuzzis and plunge pools inside were very nice (at least they were on the male side). The swimming pools were nice in terms of size and facilities but they tended to be in the morning shade and so therefore were pretty cold. The room we stayed in was on the 57th floor and stepping out onto the balcony to take in the amazing view, despite the horrific thunder storm was worth it. The room was big enough for us, as was the bathroom, but we were hardly in it over the three nights we stayed there. My only complaint would be in regards to the bed and pillows. They were both really hard and very uncomfortable and not at all what I was expecting. Needless to say, our sleeps were not very enjoyable. Despite all this, the hotel is in a good location and is a nice one.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel We Have Ever Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: mj_sel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just so fantastic. We have stayed in alot of hotel over the last year and this is head ans shoulders above the rest. As soon as we jumped out of the taxi the staff took our bags and escorted us to check in. We checked in quickly and made it to our very lovely room with an amazing view of the Marina Bay and the rest of Singapore. We were there for New Years Eve so this was a perfect place to enjoy the fireworks at midnight from our balcony. The room was spacious comfortable and clean as you would expect from a hotel of this class. King size bed, flat screen tv, desk and chairs and heaps of storage for bags and clothing. The bathroom was opulent and clean. There are numerous restaurants on the premises and we ate at the Swiss Cafe for New Years buffet dinner which was very nice. We also had the continental breakfast in the foyer cafe every morning which was very nice also. We used the hotel booking service to book a tour which was very simple and just a simple to cancel when I feel ill and couldn't complete the trip. The staff were very helpful in getting a doctor to me and anything we required along with a late check out of 6pm on our final day. If I was going to get sick it was the place to do it as the staff really helped to aid my fast recovery. The location is perfect as it is attached to the Raffles Shopping Centre and close to all attractions in Singapore. It also is attached to the Raffles Hotel and the Fairmont Hotel which both offer a charge back system to the Swissotel. The pool is beautiful and the view from the pool deck is amazing. Wouldn't hesistate staying here again and recommending it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great room but Worst Breastfast i ever experience”
Reviews.Author: Pen002
Reviews.Content: Overall we have a great stay at the hotel...the room, cleaness, loction and ect was great. The only real dissappointed area is the Breakfast. I don't enjoy my breasfast at all cos we are seated at a place facing the sun. I feel like doing suntan as i am having my breakfast. My girl keep say vy hot....so i requested to change my seat to a cooler area but the staff say there was a long q, they cannot change the seat for us. I was real dissapointed. This have never happen to us thru out our stay at other hotel. At the end, we have to quickly finish our breasfast and left. My advise is to request for a seat cooler place if you want to have a good breakfast and not under the sun.

Reviews.Title: “ANY BODY WITH YOUNG CHILDREN SHOULD ONLY STAY WITH SWISSOTEL THE STAMFORD !!!”
Reviews.Author: Sachet
Reviews.Content: We had a very Beautiful Time!!! We Travelled with 2 Kids 8 and 2 and best of all they also enjoyed !!! The Hotel is very well Located, very near to the Orchard Road and just Adjacent to Raffles!!! The Taxi takes just about Sin Dol. 5.5 to Musatafa Centre !!! And the Taxis are very easily available !!! The Staff is Very courteous and Helpful at the same time !!!! V WERE JUST DELIGHTED !! I WOULD SAY JUST STAY THERE TO EXPERIENCE IT !!! The Concierge are very very helpful !!! SPECIAL MENTION THAT THE LADY USED HER CREDIT CARD FOR US to book our Trip to Universal Studios!!! GOD BLESS HER. SHE WAS VERY HELPFUL. WE HAD A 2 YEAR SON FOR WHOM WE REQUIRED A LOT OF OF WATER TO MAKE MILK for him, THE STAFF WAS VERY COURTEOUS TO HELP US WITH REGULAR SUPPLIES OF WATER !!! ETC., ETC., ETC.,

Reviews.Title: “The hotel's excellent reputation is well deserved”
Reviews.Author: Ileach
Reviews.Content: We have holidayed in Singapore many times but this was our first opportunity to try out the Swissotel Stamford. It turned out to be a very wise choice for our six-night visit. Unlike some other hotels, where a room request may or may not be met, staff at the Stamford seem to take pleasure in "delighting the customer". We requested a non-smoking, refurbished room and were given a lovely room on a high floor with a spectacular view of the harbour, complete with a surprise welcome gift. The staff really are wonderful, from the reception clerk who was still cheerful when checking us in at 1am, to the chatty room service staff, the chirpy doorman, and so on. It was noticeable that all staff seemed eager to engage you in meaningful conversation, even in the lifts. It makes such a pleasant change from the perfunctory "Good morning" that you otherwise expect. The only slightly negative note was that we found the beds a little firmer than we are used to, but it wasn't a "show-stopper" by any means, we still slept OK. On our last day we were really pleased to receive a complimentary late checkout because of an evening flight departure. This meant we had a chance to properly pack our last-minute shopping and to freshen up before going to the airport. Take a bow, Swissotel Stamford staff, you have all done very well. Especially Ms Osman and Ms Tan, who went well above and beyond our expectations to ensure our stay was a memorable one – brilliant!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, and an Amazing Stay”
Reviews.Author: rafatabedin
Reviews.Content: The room was huge, had an awesome view of the marina, but i thought that shopping is better near orchard.

Reviews.Title: “5 Wonderful stays before but now no more Swissotel”
Reviews.Author: KTMSYD
Reviews.Content: 6th stay at the hotel, the 5 stays before were great but this time i was in for a disappointment. Requested a king size bed and a smoking room both requests were not met was told by the receptionist just go to the balcony and smoke, well if i wanted to do that i would not be requesting for a smoking room would i ? and to make matters worse woke up during the night feeling thirsty and guess what?? the mini bar fridge in the room was empty!!!! talk about being 5* called the front desk and got a blunt reply saying the floor i was staying on all rooms had empty mini bar fridges guess they expect the guests to replenish the bars the bathroom looked like it needed total refurb and the shower-head looked like it had been there since the 80's. Next time in Singapore will be a different hotel for sure

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Staff”
Reviews.Author: Andrew10026
Reviews.Content: We stopped at the Stamford for 4 days onto our way to Zurich in September and were a bit disappointed with the hotel, we have stayed previously on a number of ocassions and felt the standard was not the same. On arriving in Europe my wife discovered her wallet wirth credit cards, money etc was missing. We cancelled the cards etc and thought that it was gone. On our return back to NZ, we stayed at the Stanford again. My wife explained to the staff that she had lost her wallet previously. We were very happy to say that hotel staff had found the wallet and it was being held by security. Everyting was in it and the staff were very helpful. That is the type of service that makes a hotel more enjoyable and we we had a great yime before leaving. The hotel was also undertaking a refurbishment so we will definatly stay again and the hopefully the hotel management are proud of their staff, especially the front counter staff

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING IN EVERY WAY”
Reviews.Author: TheGFamily04
Reviews.Content: In a word this hotel is magnificent. The staff from the ground up to management were welcoming, warm and friendly and utterly professional in every respect. All staff were willing to help in ensuring our stay was a memorable and relaxing one. The club lounge and rooms are amazing and the location of the Hotel could not be better with many cafes, restaurants and shops within walking distance. You must try the newly refurbished Asian Market Cafe attached to the Hotel. Outstanding array of international cuisine. A special thanks to Abdullah, Serene and Amanda. We must commend Swissotel Stamford Hotel Managers Norman, Nicole and Miriam for an outstanding job. These persons are definitely a huge asset to the Hotel that makes it the high standard it is today! Congratulations on a job well done and we will definitely be seeing you again soon! A special thank you to Norman for your hospitality and kindness.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay”
Reviews.Author: Learlita
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Swissotel Stamford last Christmas 2009. Location of the hotel is perfect because it has a shopping centre below it along with easy access to the Rail network. It was very easy for us to travel around Singapore. Hotel itself is well maintained with its very friendly staff who are always happy to help you out. Breakfast buffet has a wide selection with your choice of 2 restaurants. Overall - Perfect stay. Look foward to staying at his place again.

Reviews.Title: “Swissotel Stamford”
Reviews.Author: bmgf300z
Reviews.Content: Rooms are wonderful and extremely cozy. Hotel is a hop skip and jump away from many shopping malls and local dining destinations. To get to other attractions it's quite easy to take a taxi, but would recommend calling to have a taxi booked can cut down the queues during busy hours. Going to Malaysia for the day is very convenient as they helped me to book the taxi to the border ($50 SG). JB Town has many malls to choose from. I would recommend having a picture of anything specific you are looking for to cut down on the treasure hunt.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: dani73Melbourne
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay at the stamford. After reading other trip advisor reviews i sent an e mail requesting 2 renovated inter connecting rooms. The hotel responded that this request was noted and would be acted on. Check in was very smooth. The hotel is very busy as it is a stop over hotel for airlines. Service was amazing and any small requests that we had were dealt with promptly. We did not eat in the hotel as it is connected to a mall which has a huge food court and obviously is much cheaper. The train station is 2 minutes away and really easy to use. The hotel rooms were very comfortable and EXCEPTIONALLY clean. The hotel maid actually stopped us and asked if we were happy with her cleaning! Definately pop up to bar asia its unbelievable to have a drink and look down on singapore! The gym was fantastic and the pool very nice

Reviews.Title: “From moment you arrive made to feel special”
Reviews.Author: 187069Steve
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Singapore as stopover for visit to Australia and spent 3 days on way out and two on return. I would particularly single out the greeter "Angel" and reception staff for the efficient, warm and welcoming way I was greeted. Arrived very early flight and room was not ready on arrival and we were given complimentary voucher to enjoy coffee in the Lounge Area. Room was brilliant two large beds, plenty of space, excellent facilities including air conditioning 9much needed in Singapore). Facilities in hotel superb - range of restaurants, dining experiences including a food hall and shopping mall in the lower hall. Everything you wanted to relax after long flight from England - even complimentary hospitality suite for showering and changing prior to departure. Well Done the Swissotel on Stamford - staff are a credit to you.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic view and great location”
Reviews.Author: Nvios
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Stamford for two nights 7-9 January. Had a Club room on 58th floor with a harbour view - absolutely amazing. The Club Lounge was wonderful - well worth taking a Club Room for the amenities and food/drinks. Our room was very clean and modern. The only hiccup we had was we had no turn-down service on the second night, and were expecting at least some fresh towels. We ended up getting the turn-down service at 11.15pm that night, and the only reason we insisted on it was we had a late check-out the next day (4pm) and would need fresh towels for the following day. Miriam, who worked in the Executive Club Lounge was wonderful - she was very helpful regarding some travel arrangements. The location is fabulous - walking distance to most major attractions and shopping centres, and the hotel is right above MRT station which connects to all other parts of Singapore. The must do is to go to the 70th floor and have a drink at the bar - the views are awesome! This was our second stay at this hotel and we weren't disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Not as pictured”
Reviews.Author: newyorkertraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel doesn't really have a lobby. It's sort of like a shared entrance with the adjoining mall. The good thing is location and there is a mall connected connected to it...also the metro is around the corner. The bad thing is that it is definitely NOT a 5 star standard hotel. The lobby is always filled with people, tourists. There is only one set of couches so people have to stalk seats as it is clearly not enough for the amount of people traffic. There is also no free wifi like most big chain hotels...you can buy something at the cafe on the ground floor to get a wifi code to use only at the cafe. Rooms were below average to average. Feels dated and old. Doesn't feel extremely clean but clean enough to not feel gross sleeping in it. If you can get a good rate, it is ok. But don't expect anything fancy. It is dated and average. It definitely does not look like the professional photos posted above.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible. Shame for the brand Swissotel”
Reviews.Author: LMashunia
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 1 night and was deeply disappointed. The only good thing about this hotel is location but it's hard to find hotel with really bad location in Singapore. Hotel needs serious renovation. When we were making the booking rooms at the photo looked quite nice, with stunning view on the harbor. In reality, view is the only true thing. Rooms are shabby, with old furniture. First room they put us in smelled cigarets like a proper bar. We asked to change the room, which they did but forgot to activate new keys so we had to deal with it in the middle of the night. Definitely not 5 star hotel. Next time will stay at Raffles or Marina Bay sands

Reviews.Title: “Generally very good but some rooms need urgent attention.”
Reviews.Author: gwokypoodle
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times and most recently this month for three days on the way down to Sydney and three days on the way back. On my way to Sydney I had an excellent room, large and immaculate, very comfortable indeed and with everything in full working order. On the way back it was a completely different story. It could have been a different hotel even though the same rate was paid. My room was some kind of a corner room, much smaller and no chair other than the desk chair which made room service impractical. The carpet was covered in various different stains, two of the speeds were not working on the air conditioning and the shower pressure was dreadful. This hotel has over a thousand rooms and although the rooms are decorated the same in neutral colours and similar furnishings it is a bit of lottery as to the size and servicability of the room. There are lots of bars and restaurant outlets in the hotel and the service in these is excellent as is the overall quality. Not cheap though especially with the rate of exchange at the moment. I love Prego, the Italian on the ground floor and Cafe Swiss on the first floor. The Equinox complex on the 70th floor is sublime but the restaurant in there is EXTREMELY expensive and the portions are ridiculously small. Someone should explain to them that nouvelle cuisine went out a long time ago. Reception staff are very efficient but not always friendly. The swimming pool area is very pleasant and clean and the gym and spa are excellent though spa prices are very high and sometimes you are left waiting for an unsatisfactory length of time as you wait for your treatment. All in all a very pleasant and impressive hotel which is attached to a major shopping centre and right opposite Raffles hotel. It's a fantastic location, the service I reiterate is amazing in the food and beverage outlets but I urge the hotel to spruce up some of the rooms. It is not satisfactory when you check into a five star hotel to HOPE that you will get a good room.

Reviews.Title: “A little dated”
Reviews.Author: poptartlr
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Swissotel over NYE for 5 nights. Although it is a 5 star hotel, excellent service, it is looking a little bland and dated. On the positive side, the breakfasts are amazing - the buffet has to be seen to be believed. The service during check in was great too. The view was amazing from the 41st floor balcony - could see right across the harbour. The room however was a bit dated looking, nothing really out of the ordinary. The bathroom certainly was not 'luxe'. Amenities like toiletries were not great - the hairdryer was the most outdated one I have seen, and took 20 minutes to dry my hair, no conditioner (which for someone with long hair is a pain). The airconditioner was hit and miss. And the internet charges were incredibly expensive! It's not a bad hotel by any means - it's just not the standard I was expecting.

Reviews.Title: “would not pay to stay”
Reviews.Author: traveller8896
Reviews.Content: Would not pay to stay in this hotel. Mould on the roof. Used condom on the floor under the bed sheet. bed leg broke. service was average. took a while for opperated to answer phone.

Reviews.Title: “Research other hotels before staying at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: leilani-scottie
Reviews.Content: The service at the reception desk was very average and not welcoming at all. The room was old and not pictured on the website at all. The carpet's were quite dirty and the bathroom was not up to a 5 star hotel standard. I've stayed in a 3 star hotel that was much better than the room we recieved in this hotel. The air conditioning didn't work either. The location is good as the hotel joins onto Raffle's city and is only a 2min taxi ride to Clark Quay and Orchard Rd. I will say that we had a fantastic view of the Singapore flyer and the Grand Marina Sands from our balcony but overall I will never stay here again as it was too expensive for what I thought was 2-3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I had a superb short stay in The Stamford”
Reviews.Author: bagaglio
Reviews.Content: This was my second time in The Stamford, and I've thoroughly enjoyed both visits. I should say at this point that I visit Singapore regularly, around 8 - 10 times per year, and have stayed at a number of hotels in the city. The Stamford is fast becoming my favourite. Why? The location is superb. If you don't mind a 10 minute stroll you can get to most places of interest very easily: The Marina Esplanade; Orchard Road; China Town; Little India; Boat Quay and Clarke Quay are all within a 10-15 minute walk. Don't like walking? Then you are right on top of the excellent Singapore MRT (Subway) system, and of course the ubiquitous Singapore taxis are readily available at any time right at your front door. The staff were always very, very helpful and were never short of a smile or a friendly greeting. I found myself in the Lobby Coffee shop a number of times quite simply because the staff were so attentive that I was only too pleased to sit down and relax there. I never tried the other restaurants, though I did venture up to the bar/night club on the 70th floor, and whilst it was less than half full, I enjoyed my couple of beers. The rooms were very comfortable, everything worked, and for a hotel with 70 floors, the elevators seemed to work very well. One tip to share with viewers: the mini bar prices are as high as the bar/night club I visitied in the hotel. Pop into the shopping mall which forms a (very non intrusive) part of the hotel and buy your goodies at the Cold Storage supermarket. You'll save a small fortune.

Reviews.Title: “No complains except lack of good vegetarian combination buffet meals.”
Reviews.Author: J_Majethia
Reviews.Content: The room & bath area is spacious with a long balcony. The room service, housekeeping reception & concierge staff did a good job. My son fell ill upon landing & the next day I lost my wallet in a taxi. I must mention Jon at the reception (night shift) for his follow up with the cab company. The hotel has a shopping complex, two pools & all that you can expect from a five star. However, I was particularly unhappy with the breakfast menu as we are hardcore vegetarians from India. We usually prefer 5 star properties only for its choice of multi cuisine buffet meals. But here they neither had a good combination nor were they forthcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 5 star service, amazing view and fab food!”
Reviews.Author: AnnsoH
Reviews.Content: I went here with my partner since he had a job interview. So important to say, we did not pay for this hotel and would probably not choose it it we would have to. But Stamford is really amazing, they butter you up constantly making you feel like the most important guest they ever had. Our room was of Executive standard and very nice with a balcony and amazing view. It was always very clean and welcoming. Perhaps not very cozy and charming but definitely very good standard. We also had a dinner at the top restaurant which is well worth a visit with its view over Marina Bay and Business district's impressive buildings. We could see the Merlion from there and later went for a walk to enjoy it more close up. If I feel like spending money again I'd definitely go, and the restaurant is a must to visit again. It's perfect for a weekend holiday to stay central and get the good view. Spa also offerd me one of the best massages I ever had, expensive but worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant -”
Reviews.Author: Europeoz
Reviews.Content: I booked a "waterfront" view room and on arrival (very late due flight delay) was upgraded to the Crest Suites, which was on the 65th floor. Sitting room, with bedroom and seperate bath and toilet. Balcony overlooking the padang, harbour and new casino. Great service from the onfloor team for bookings, breakfast and afternoon snacks and drinks, I couldn't fault them. Great location above the City Hall MRT, easy to get around. Would highly recommend both for the Crest suites but also normal rooms as I have stayed here before. One negative is the cost of internet service which is very high per day and needs review.

Reviews.Title: “great location & excellent view”
Reviews.Author: basaa
Reviews.Content: we planned a new year holiday in Singapore months ahead. this hotel was third in the choice. however, we have returned home quite happy. the reception staff (Yvonne, particularly - there are 2 Yvonnes currently & both are marvelous) was extremely helpful in getting us 2 rooms on the same floor. the view from the rooms was great although we did not get harbor view rooms. breakfast menu was excellent with a wide choice. the bathrooms need a bit of redoing as the basin tops look outdated. another irritation was a unbolted door which kept banging (most probably, as we never found out) on the floor just above ours. this was the refuge floor. it definitely affected our sleep at night. hope, the maintenance got it rectified.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: carolepMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Stayed a week and had a great time. Would recommend to any traveller, staff very friendly and helpful. Fantastic breakfasts. Will stay again on next trip

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at a decent location”
Reviews.Author: deepdebroy
Reviews.Content: The Stamford Swissotel shows a bit of age on the walls and furnishings. Other than that, the rooms are quite good, spacious and comfortable. The Raffles City mall down below, the MRT station and connection to Suntec City via underground walkways makes it really convinient from a location perspective. The policy of charging an internet cost per machine from each room was a little disappointing. Make sure you try out the Equinox restaurant's high tea from the 70th floor!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, somewhat charmless rooms”
Reviews.Author: Bear_Eskimo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Swissotel for 2 nights on our honeymoon. We were very impressed with the service (the staff were excellent, especially the cheerful lady at the Concierge desk!) and delighted with the wine and congratulations we received as honeymooners. A much appreciated personal touch. The hotel is in a very convenient location - we enjoyed being able to walk to Chinatown and around the city. The breakfast buffet was a sight to behold with a very wide range of options. The rooms are fairly standard - very clean and no complaints but more corporate than charming. Great view of the harbour though!

Reviews.Title: “UNBELIEVABLE”
Reviews.Author: nikowgcf
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights b4 heading off to 3 weeks in Vietnam. Upon our arrival we were asked if we wanted a room upgrade to which we agreed. I think it was about 50 S.D. or thereabouts per night. Room was excellent. We returned again 3 weeks later for 3 nights and upon booking in this time we asked to be upgraded to the same sort of room we had previously. Unfortunately none of those rooms were available. The offer was made for another room which we were told was a nice room. We agreed to the upgrade. We then went to our room on the 65th floor. We were greeted at the elevator and shown to our room. We were also invited to partake in happy hour on that floor. Upon entering the room I was gobsmacked. Without doubt the best room we have ever stayed in. I had a sleepless night wondering what this was going to cost us. Next morning we checked at reception and were informed that the upgrade for the 3 nights was complimentary. UNBELIEVABLE this sort of thing always happens to other people never to an ordinary couple like us. It was the highlight and topped off a great trip. The room was sensational the friendly service also sensational. Breakfast down stairs was fantastic. I have nothing but praise for the way the Swissotel treated us. We are at the age where we are now doing a bit of travelling and I will make sure if there is a Swissotel where we go, we will stay with them above any other Hotel. Special thanks to Jon and Polly. You have given us a trip we will always remember. We have told the story to all our friends and will keep telling it. Simply UNBELIEVABLE.

Reviews.Title: “great for families”
Reviews.Author: dbanksy
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for a week, with three small kids and the service was great. everyone was so friendly and helpful. it was at a great location, with a shopping centre and railway underneath. we musnt have got one of the newly refurbished rooms, but with three small kids we were ok with this. the room was still sufficent for our needs and we had a beautiful view of the harbour from our balcony. the kids pool was a great size for the kids and it was never busy when we went. we would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location is the Best Feature”
Reviews.Author: selliot64
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located above the Raffles City Shopping Centre and the Town Hall MTR interchange so it's location is it's best feature. The airport is a 30 minute MRT ride away costing only S$2.90 We were lucky to be upgraded on arrival and were given a "Grand Room" which had a separate living area and wonderful views. The room had all the expected features so nothing to complain of there. Our main problem was that breakfast was far from a relaxing experience. Long queues and a crowded area not pleasant. Also not pleasant was that any hot food was placed in ceramic bowls only - not kept warm by gas flame. So if you arrive at breakfast at 8am food has been sitting there since 6. May explain the vomiting and illness picked up when I had only eaten at the hotel and drunk bottled water. Might stay there again but not bother with the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Certainly again”
Reviews.Author: voyager-liese
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in this hotel, highest hotel of Singapore. The hotel is perfectly situated with only a few meters to the Underground-Station “City Hall” and directly connected to “Raffles City” (big city mall) and the Fairmont Hotel. Pool, Spa and big Gym are used by both hotels. The pool area is relatively small for two hotels of that size. We had booked a room on the executive floor. The lounge was on the 60th floor, breakfast there was good, service okay, internet available. The room was standard size and standard interior, a nice “extra” and certainly not usual with such high buildings was the small balcony from where we enjoyed the warm air and great view especially at night.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value for biz traveller”
Reviews.Author: infinitium
Reviews.Content: Great location in Singapore - smack next to a major upmarket shopping mall (Raffles City), and easy access to MRT right outside (including the CityLink underground mall). Lines of taxis waiting outside. Doormen and reception service is brisk and generally efficient. This is more of a biz-class hotel I'd think, as the volume of travelers checking in and out each time is quite significant... the lobby's always full of people walking about. I've stayed here 4-5 times on biz in the last 4 years, and it's always been a satisfying trip for me. The rooms offer an amazing view of Singapore (ask for a high floor), BUT some rooms are showing their age (dated paint flaking in some places, creaking, sometimes discolored bathroom fittings, old-looking carpeting). Water pressure is good though. Breakfast at the Swiss Cafe is good w/a wide spread. You may have to wait a few mins to get a table during peak breakfast hours though. Still, service is fast and efficient. Meals are easily available - forget the hotel restaurants and head opposite to CHIJMES, a charming colonial-style square full of yummy restaurants and pubs w/wide selection of beers and spirits. At night, head upstairs to their Skybar on the top floor for a drink. Getting a table can be tough - limited couches are available. Order a martini, grab a bar stool, and knock back as you take in the amazing Singapore skyline... :)

Reviews.Title: “Uninspiring and univiting - try alternatives instead”
Reviews.Author: AusBusinessTraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Singapore for two days of business. Room very 1970s style and was for a group of people instead of one person. Air conditioning was poor, which is a major negative for Singapore. Complained to front desk and was told there was no alternative room. Breakfast and service was basic to sub-par. Recommend the Fullerton or Ritz Carlton Hotel instead, which are slightly cheaper given that the corporate rates there include breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Swissotel The Stamford - Truly Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: Anuttam
Reviews.Content: I went to Singapore on an office trip and stayed at Swissotel The Stamford. We were a large group of 150+ people. The hotel is exceptional in quality of service and elegance. Stying at rooms at dizzying heights, partying hard at the rooftop night-club, shopping at the top-claa mall - the experience is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at a gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sporthead
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night in late November. I'd already purchased non refundable accommodation at Novotel for a couple of nights. I needed to stay an extra night in Singapore and the Novotel was going to charge me double so reluctantly I booked a single night at the Swissotel Stamford. I felt my decision had paid off instantly when we entered the grand lobby of the hotel. It was very obvious that this hotel was in a different class! Set on top of what must be one of Singapore's finest shopping malls with an MRT station to boot the location of the hotel was perfect! You are greeted by name, everytime you speak to the staff on the phone or in person. Every request was attended to in a timely manner. The staff really treated us like royalty. The pool was great, and the buffet breakfast was the best we've had in Singapore! The price was very reasonable (i got a special deal by taking advantage of their price beat policy) and at the end I almost felt guilty about what I was paying in respect to the wonderful service we'd received. Our only regret was that we were only staying in the hotel for one night only! I would not hesitate recommending this hotel to any traveller!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for the business traveller”
Reviews.Author: guru_magellan
Reviews.Content: We were originally supposed to stay at the Hyatt and were at first a little peeved when we were told we were being put up at the Swissotel Stamford. As we finished our check in formalities and moved into the elevator to the delux room on the 63rd floor, our apprehension was quickly removed. Walking into our spacious twin bedroom facing the amazing view of the Singapore skyline overlooking Clarke Quay and Boat Quay as dusk descended, was quite exhilarating. The room was quite large and even with laptops, working paper and other paraphernalia strewn around by us, it did not look cluttered. The toilet was spotlessly clean but could do with a face lift. The balcony facing the The World was the most impressive (and well used by us) feature. The bed linen was also extremely comfortable. We had no idea that this well appointed hotel stands above the bustling City Hall mall and MRT interchange and it was a quick MRT ride to our business destinations. We also did a bit of sight seeing around the hotel with the wonderfully restored Chijmes complex which is an old orphanage converted into a trendy shopping destination with delightful bistro cafes. The Merlion park and Theatres on the bay are walking distance away (if you are brave enough to face the humidity and sudden torrential rain) as are the magnificent Raffles Hotel. A short MRT ride will take you to the other must see destinations close by - Clarke Quay, Boat Quay and Arab street. The Holy Grail for shopaholics, Orchard road is also 5 mins by MRT. The hotel has an impressive buffet breakfast. We did not have much time for a dip in the pool but it looked welcoming. There is a nice lounge bar where we had a relaxing sun-downer on a couple of occasions. We did not try the lunch or dinner at the restaurant because there were so many alternatives very close by. Service is very professional without being intrusive. We did not order room service but going by the standards of the other services am quite sure this will be upto scratch. I was quite excited to note that this hotel stands on the F1 circuit and can quite imagine the view of the races from our floor. I would say this is one of the best locations for the business traveller strapped for time who might get a day's leisure to take in the sights and sounds.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel will stay again tops all the way”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravellers62
Reviews.Content: Well when we arrived greeted with a smile and wonderful baggage service.The hotel called to see if we needed anything else and then they came and checked we knew how to operate all the buttons and things in the room. Ohh and all the extra things in room where great in the bathroom. The view from our room was wonderful we could see the new hotel marina sands sensational.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic holiday”
Reviews.Author: OZCCMelbourneAu
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to celebrate our 40th wedding anniversary in Singapore. We have stayed in many hotels in Singapore over the years, but for the last ten years we have stayed only at the 'Swissotel the Stamford'. The rooms are a very comfortable size. In fact their 'Harbour View' rooms, at 360 sq feet, are now my 'gold standard' for when I judge the size of rooms in other hotels. In our opinion, anywhere from level 20 upwards provides a great view. This time we were on level 32. Last Christmas we wanted to spoil yourselfs, and we stayed in their Executive rooms (level 58 and above). The view was the same from the very high rooms, except that the people on the ground look very small indeed. We are comfortable on the balconies - they have secure walls and balastrades. Breakfast each morning in Swiss Cafe is a highlight of any stay. The staff are fantastic and the range of food includes Indian, Chinese, cooked-to-order eggs and a huge range to cater for all tastes. Before we leave Singapore, we are already planning our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Close to shopping”
Reviews.Author: Snowie4
Reviews.Content: Very good service, clean rooms and very close to shopping areas

Reviews.Title: “Classic busines hotel”
Reviews.Author: babagul
Reviews.Content: This is the classic business hotel, located i downtown Singapore. It is perhaps the tallest building in Singapore; certainly the exterior facade is imposing and would be recognizable to most visitors to Singapore. The hotel always has a 'buzz' surounding it and is a meeting place for business meetings, conferences etc. Would suggest that leisure travellers avoid this hotel, but business travellers must certainly consider it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: FRARO
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel after a long disappointing cruise with Ocean Village (now P&O) but the stay in Singapore was a great ending. The hotel was so much better than we expected after our problems with OV. Checking in was a bit strained but that was more down to OV chucking us off early rather than the hotel, they dealt with us irate customers with a smile (even though we didn't all deserve it, myself included). The view from our room was amazing (we had a harbour view), the room was huge (especially after being in a cabin for 3 weeks), the breakfast was a buffet and had something for everyone. We didn't have time to check out the gym or spa etc but what we did see of the hotel was excellent. We went up to the City Scape bar for a cocktail and the service was excellent and the views amazing (but we did have the same view from our room). the hotel is in a convenient location for exploring Singapore and we will definitely be back!!!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, with professional staff in great location”
Reviews.Author: AlandeWalden
Reviews.Content: I stayed on the 56th floor with superb views of the city. The room was clean, comfortable and well equipped. The hotel is superbly placed for visiting the city. I recommend going for a swim in one of the circular outdoor pools; do it from 06:00 before dawn. It's very atmospheric. The staff were always helpful. Only one grumble: what on earth are you doing to the sausages? Were they boiled or steamed? Guys, in a frying pan, don't stab them. Cook until the outside is brown all round. That said the rest of breakfast was top quality.

Reviews.Title: “This really is a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Intangible_1
Reviews.Content: This was a special trip that I shared with my sister and my fourth stay at The Stamford in the last 4 years. We had a 4 night stay here on this occasion and I have never been disappointed with this hotel as the rooms are spacious, the beds are comfy, the view is amazing and the location is just perfect. I am a smoker but I will not smoke indoors or in an enclosed space, so the small balcony was great as I was able to indulge my bad habit without contaminating the room,and I never tired of watching life going on 40 plus stories below. In an ideal world the balcony would be a litle bit wider with a comfy chair to lounge in. In a hotel as large as this I don't expect the sort of personal attention you would receive at smaller capacity hotels such as The Raffles or The St Regis. However on this occasion I was pleasantly surprised and very much appreciated the lovely birthday cake that was delivered to our room by the delightful Christine (Concierge/Guest Services). I found all the staff helpful and friendly especially the reception staff but also the cleaning and Room Service staff. I find if you are kind and friendly to people.....more often than not, they respond in kind - a smile and a polite and friendly greeting costs nothing. I have seen some negative comments on here regarding the breakfast. Sure its a lot of money; as is any breakfast in any hotel if it is not included in the room rate. Personally i loved the breakfasts. There is a huge variety to suit all cultures. I thought the bacon was tasty if a little overcooked at times. I would love to get bacon like that here. A couple of the memorable little details I liked: the whole honeycomb - and the Duchy of Cornwall Lemon curd (unavailable here), French butter and the very friendly (they remembered you even after only one day - in a hotel this large that is impressive) and efficient staff performing breakfast service. I cannot comment on other floors or on any of the unrenovated rooms as I always book a harbour view room on a high floor. On this occasion our room was on level 45 room 57. Room 57 on any floor looks directly across to the CBD and Boat Quay. You can see the Marina Bay Sands, the Flyer, Padang etc. This to me was probably the best of views available. This room had the striped carpet that you see in the hotel photographs, all other times I have sayed here the carpet was a plain pastel (I am guessing unrenovated but just as comfortable). I cannot be certain but going by previous stays - If you have a single King bed size room you get a nice armchair to relax in but in twin bed rooms there is no comfy chair as the beds seem to take up most of the room. This hotel is where many airline crews stay on layovers so it is naturally busy all the time. It was especially busy at the time of our stay which coincided with the Qantas A380 engine incident. I do love this hotel and it has become familiar. The routine is to check in to the hotel/room and then go down to the little supermarket in the basement of Raffles City to buy drinks, snacks and milk. If there is one thing (well maybe two) that surprises me is this: There is no milk provided for tea and coffee, only creamer which I don't like. The tea is a very nice TWG brand, however if two people happen to like breakfast tea, someone will be disappointed as only one of each type of tea (4 different) is provided - the other will have to have Earl Grey or one of the green teas. The little mini bar fridge is not as cold as I like, but then I am sure the purpose of the fridge isn't to fill it with my own drink preferences. To chill our wine I just requested a bucket of ice each afternoon. I would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “YOG 2010 - Gymnastic International Federation Staff”
Reviews.Author: drozpierre
