Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 weeks. Everything was very plesant in this hotel, nice big rooms well eqiped. The only bad thing was the very expansive WIFI. Luckyly, it was free for NF staff but as I'm planning to come back, I will be very sad to pay for a service that should be free. We are in 21 century guys ! Breakfast (swissotel restaurant) was WONDERFUL. Staff at lobby was very helpful and friendly. The hotel situation and view is just unbelieveble! Thank you and see you again !

Reviews.Title: “too big...”
Reviews.Author: antan
Reviews.Content: Big is not nessessarily beautiful. This is what I thought when I stayed that this 87 floor high hotel in Singapore. To start with the positive things: greatest location: right there where one wants to be in Singapore, walking distance to many sites, and literally atop a subway-junction, easy-to-reach to and from everywhere, including direct line from airport. Moreover, the basement just doens`t have a few shops (like most hoteld do) - it is a veritable shopping center in itself. But thats Singapore: a huge mega-mall, with a built-in landing facility called Changi. Not to forget the (truely) stunning views from every room. I got `harbour-side` (apparently there is city side and harbor side, but whatever - every view is stunning. If you got a low-level room (less than 30-something) go and visit the the "Equinox" club on the top floor (free access for hotel residents!) - views reach from Malaysia to Indonesia. Now the bad sides: too big, lobby feels like a train station, very impersonal, effiicient but without any charm. The rooms are big too (a great plus) but have a little `character` just as the entire place has none. This is not Singapore (or perhaps: IT IS?) but could be everywhere. The pool for this 1000-plus room hotel is surprizinlgly small, and on top of ot it is shared with the neighboring Fairmont Hotel! To be fair: the `Willow-stream` spa is very perfect again: big (what-else?), but the gym is clean, effecient and even `cozy`. Would I stay again? not sure, Singapore has better stuff to offer, more `authentic` (yes, even Singapore has some `true` corners left where one feels one is - after all - in Asia))

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but dissapointed with the service rendered”
Reviews.Author: KinFysh
Reviews.Content: My partner and i love to go on a short trip to relax and enjoy a moment out of work and anything related to that. Went to stay at the Swissotel the stamford with high expectations (as i have many friends who have good reviews on this hotel). Stayed there for a night to celebrate our anniversary but once we stepped in and wanted to check in, it was completely unsatisfactory. The lobby was very nice and the ambience of the place is very decent, but the service rendered was not up to a standard of a 5 star hotel i expected them to be. The lady in the service desk was the first to assist me. I had booked through the hotels.com website and my booking was confirmed. And so i thought. They took about a total of 45minutes to just confirm again but ignored my queries, no eye contact at all. It was already 3.30pm and we still weren't given any answers. But after an hour or so waiting, we finally got a room. Their manager(i cant remember his name) was kind enough to apologize whereas the lady didn't even bother apologizing. When i went up the room, i find it really amusing they got my preferred room choice wrong. And so i had to make my way down again and told them i had booked a Grand Room. Took them some time longer to process it. And finally, at 4.40pm, i manage to get in the room. Tired and pissed off, the anniversary dinner that me & my partner had planned was totally ruined. We end up getting room service instead. One good thing that i liked was the convenience of getting around town and the paranomic view of the Singapore skyline was magnificient. Room quality was ok & the bed was superb to sleep in after the morning drama we had. Was thinking to come back to celebrate my partner's birthday in the next month right before New Year but contemplating to do after this experience. Would recommend this to you all but be prepared to come with full documents just in case somethings happens. Other than that, the hotel is alright with me.

Reviews.Title: “Good, could be better.”
Reviews.Author: GtotheRace
Reviews.Content: The pluses: great, convenient location, stunning views and very clean, spacious rooms with interesting and thoughtful design. The downsides: The quality of the sheets were not as good as one might expect of a hotel of this caliber. No free interest, $28 for a 24 hr wired internet connection. Two small (crowded) pools shared by the neighboring hotel. The long line at reception both checking in and out also seemed like something that could be fixed.

Reviews.Title: “Top Class hotel”
Reviews.Author: jklak
Reviews.Content: I spent with my family in Swissotel The Stamford 4 nights in August. We were upgraded to Harbour view room due to early booking. The view from 44. floor - amazing! Skyscrapers (this Hotel is not situated about 500 m from the CBD, so you can see them all from perspective), harbour, bay etc. The staff very friendly and helpful. Breakfast - one of the best I have ever met - wide choice of everything from cereals through cheeses and meat to fruits. Hot and cold, delicious. Location of the hotel - also great, just above the metro station with direct access (what's good in Singapore's climate). Just a few walking minutes from the Rafles, theatre, CBD and the Merlion. I fully recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel and location, average breakfast & service”
Reviews.Author: thechinesecockney
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights on a business trip, good location near transport and shops. The room are clean and spacious with great views of the city. One of the best hotel beds I have slept in. On the negative side, the "high speed" internet was ridiculously slow, the room was starting to show signs of wear, and the shower was pretty not great. Definitely have a drink at the bar at the top of the hotel, great views. The hotel was busy constantly while we were there, but generally the staff were friendly and efficient. On a few occasions however, they felt a bit abrupt and unable to help if it was something that wasn't in their 'standard' interactions. If breakfast is not included in your stay, then avoid eating at the hotel. It cost $35 for what seem like a large choice, but the quality was poor. For example, the bread was stale every morning. For the same price range, I would opt for an alternative hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Height of Good Stay !!!”
Reviews.Author: uditpahwa
Reviews.Content: As I mentioned, this experience was a 'Height' of good stay! I was given a room on floor 58. The view from the balcony (Yes there is a balcony with the room!!) was simply magnificent. I had the Merlion right across to my room. The breakfast is served on floor 60 which is breath taking ! The room was larger than most of the hotel rooms that I have seen toll date. The curtains were remotely controlled. The entire controls of the room (lights, aircon, wake up alarms, etc) were controlled from a small panel. Technology at it's best !! The food at the restaurants is also very good. I loved the bar and also the fact that it has happy hours at convenient early evening time. The MRT station is also in close vicinity as is the shopping mile of Orchard Road. Although my stay was just for 3 days, I loved every moment spent there and look forward to going back.

Reviews.Title: “Best location best service”
Reviews.Author: Garry27
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel a few times and have always been pleased with the service. It's clean ,well centralised and a general all round great place to stay So nice I have booked for March next year.

Reviews.Title: “The place for the view”
Reviews.Author: starryclouds
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for almost 9 nights during Aug 2010. We checked in at 9.00 pm and our room was on the 45th floor. I was taken by surprise when I saw the view from the room and more so to find a PRIVATE BALCONY. The view from the balcony is exceptional. If you are scared of heights, don't even bother to open the balcony door. It was a bit scary in the beginning but once you spend 5 minutes, you will be fine. I still felt it was a bit unsafe though. The proximity to MRT is the most advantageous thing about staying here if you are planning to roam around the city. The Raffles City shopping place is also attached to the hotel which makes it very convenient. The breakfast spread was excellent with good variety of fruits though most of the other things remained unchanged during the 9 days. I could have liked to try something other than the same chocolate chip muffin everyday. At the same time, it would have been nice to have some South Indian food also for breakfast, being the city which has lot of Tamilians. An average Singaporean has imbibed the Tamil influence very well yet here they seemed to totally ignore it. A must try is the Equinox on the top most floor at least for the view. A bit disappointing aspect was the usage of Business Center being chargeable at atrocious rates. Thankfully I found a nice Internet cafe right across the road which charges just $S3 for an hour. The service overall was very good.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding”
Reviews.Author: ziggWaW
Reviews.Content: I guess this hotel was the best of all I've stayed in so far. the warm welcome at the check-in, the lovely room with a fantastic city view (the bay view must be even better though), location unbeatable right above the City Hall subway station and all the attractions within walking distance. will definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “I would not rate as a very good hotel when it is compared to its standard.”
Reviews.Author: aghazali346
Reviews.Content: Compared to its standard stars, I did not find it very exiting as such. Even the services I felt are at par. Nothing extraordinary to attract you. The best part is its location. Located is right in the place accessible at your ease. This adds to your stay bit comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Favorably impressed”
Reviews.Author: Dinha_et_Erick
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have really enjoyed our stay in the Swissotel The Stamford. Usually, for our trips to Singapore, we stay at the Intercontinental. But this time, because of a promotion we decided to test the Swissotel Stamford and the view. Believe me, we have not been disappointed! The service is nearly perfect: - check-in was fast and flawless - the room was even better that what we expected - the house keeping made us welcome, she was friendly, helping and, very honest. We inadvertently forgot some cash on the desk. When the housekeeping lady realized that, she called the supervisor (I guess it is their standard procedure) to inform about this and to count the cash so that if, when we come back something is missing, the security can testify. Interesting, no ? - Check-out was fast and efficient - we used the concierge service to help us to find the address of a restaurant we had booked. She was more than helpful since she not only provided us with the address, the direction and even the floor - we used some other services and it was near perfection Location wise, the hotel is really well situated, just on top of the MRT. It is walking distance from China town, Singapore flyer, Funan electronic mall, Bugis street, Orchard road and even Little India. Nevertheless, I have few comments: - we were at the 63rd floor and we had to wait a quite long time to get hot water in the shower. - Internet was painfully slow. I call the internet hotline. They were quite good and helpful. I have appreciated that they said they will call me back and they really did it!. But they did not succeed in increasing the speed. Therefore I have cancelled my purchase. They have provided me with a cancellation number but I have been charged anyway. Now if we talk about the other facilities, I would recommend the Equinox bar, situated on the top floor. The atmosphere there is nice and friendly and they have good Champagne. And, the view is, for city lovers as us, wonderful. For the restaurant, we have only been to the Jaan and you can read my specific review about it. The Introbar, situated at the ground floor is welcoming, the service is good. But it is on the expensive side so I recommend to go there only during the happy hours (1500-2100 if I am not mistaken). We did not test their breakfast so I cannot comment on that part. My wife has loved their fitness center. She thinks it is one of the best she has ever used, definitely better than the Intercontinental's one. We did not try the swimming pool, but it seems quite nice. Last I want to mention the accessible balcony, which add to your enjoyment of the view Erick

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: iancc
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights here and 2 nights at Marina Bay Sands (MBS), as I was attending a conference at the MBS convention centre. It's only S$1 to catch a bus (#106 or 133) from the hotel to MBS. I noticed previous negative reviews about the check-in process, but when we arrived around 5pm, the doorman took our bags, a "greeter" escorted us to reception and even though we were next in line at the check-in queue, arranged for a counter to be opened and staffed so we could be checked-in immediately; so it seems they have positively responded to previous criticisms - well done! I also noticed previous reviews suggesting a request for a renovated room. Alas, we were told none were available, but were offered an upgrade to a harbour view room on the 62nd floor -spectacular (and even higher than the 49th floor we had at MBS). Yes, the unrenovated rooms are slightly tired, but the old carpet was surprisingly non-sticky or grubby to walk on in bare feet - so I presume they regularly shampoo the carpet (not like many hotels I've stayed at), the bathroom still clean and functional and there is a big flatscreen TV. Free (slowish) cable internet was part of the corporate package, otherwise one can go to Starbucks or McDonalds around the corner. If you don't have to be near orchard Rd then this is a great location; Robinsons dept store downstairs, Funan mall (for IT gear), Raffles Hotel & Bugis St nearby. Yes, it is a big and bustling hotel, as many aircrew stay here, but it's a great location, good value, decent amenities and importantly, a hotel that seems to positively respond to constructive criticism.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, Good location, food far too expensive.”
Reviews.Author: mdearlove
Reviews.Content: The refurbed rooms are good, views are good, staff helpful. I still don't know why hotels have to charge so much for food though. Food in Singapore is generally good value outside the hotels but certainly not in them. Luckily this hotel sits on top of a shopping mall with a good food court and a lot of good restaurants in the basement.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located and very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Peponi
Reviews.Content: Visiting friends and family in Singapore, we frequently stay at this hotel on the so called 'Executive Package'. The lobby of the hotel is somewhat off putting as it is always very busy, not particularly attractive and has the feeling of a train station. Indeed, there is a MRT station directly underneath the hotel which makes it very practical to get anywhere. While it does lack any old world charm whatsoever, the rooms are very comfortable and attractive and the 'Executive' deal offers a very generous breakfast buffet and a 'tea time' buffet as part of the package including alcohol in the early evening and wonderful nibbles, in fact so much food on both occasions that lunch or dinner become quite unnecessary! The view from the rooms is simply breathtaking and the hotel offers many very welcome facilities, from an excellent business service to a top notch spa, fitness centre and lovely roof top pool. Staff, in the lobby are helpful but not outstanding but again, once you are on the 'Executive' floor, you are extremely well looked after with personalised information at your finger tips at any time. We were staying here during the build up to the Grand Prix and so were the racing teams which added quite some glamour and fun.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and treatment”
Reviews.Author: djhdcj
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent both for the business and holidaying traveller. Service and attendance by staff from the moment of entry is first rate. Speedy attention to customer needs is a premium matter for the staff. The rooms are comfortable and clean, meals especially breakfast is comprehensive and there are plenty of restaurants on the premises to choose from. Proximity to the Raffles shopping center and to the MRT makes this a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, spacious rooms, great view(get a room on a higher floor) and moderately expensive”
Reviews.Author: VarunKhona
Reviews.Content: Swissotel the Stamford is one of the more affordable luxury hotels in Singapore with a stunning view. Try getting a room in a higher floor. Room is amazing. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Nettie49
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not cheap and I felt the service was a little disappointing considering this. Great location, as are many hotels in Singapore, and our room certainly had a wonderful view. One of the rooms was not ready on arrival and after waiting for it to be cleaned it then took ages for the room key to be delivered. As the family we travelled with were bed sharing with children the beds were a little small. An extra towel would be great. No free internet either. Small things but those little extras combined with good service make the difference.

Reviews.Title: “Takes the Checkered Flag for F1 Grand Prix”
Reviews.Author: SuperCarnitas
Reviews.Content: This is my new go-to hotel for the F1 Singapore Grand Prix. There were some flaws with my rooms and stay, so I'll get them out of the way: * Lack of wireless internet in the guestrooms, and similarly insufficient connectivity in the public spaces. This seems terribly backwards in this day and age. * An iPod/iPhone dock for recharging would also have been nice. * Some carpet stains showing sign of premature aging. * All things considered, it was a comfortable, no-frills room without 21st century gadgetry. Any of these issues would have been par for the course in many other cities. But in Singapore, home to some of the best hotels in the world, and standards-setting expectations in all hotel classes, they stand out as being glaring omissions. That all said, this was a *fantastic* hotel for my stay during the 2010 F1 Grand Prix: * Outstanding view of the track: I had an overhead view of the track between Turn 9 and Turn 14, from room 5359, as well as the Padang Stage where the headliner musicians performed. As if that wasn't enough, all of the rooms have balconies from which you can watch the action, hear the sounds, and enjoy the breeze. I believe all of the rooms classifed as "Marina View" will provide this, with the optimal angles being from rooms ending in -53 through -59. (See photos) * Absolutely perfect location: Adjacent to Gate 3, and also connected to the MRT stations City Hall and Esplanade, which allowed for easy 2-station transit to the other side of the racetrack. (My seats were in the Pit Grandstand area, at the eastern end.) * More love for the location: The attached shopping center basically puts all the necessary amenities right at the hotel -- Money changer, vendors for prepaid SIM cards, a supermarket, electronics (for the aforementioned iPhone cable), destination-worthy restaurants (Din Tai Fung, for one), and an array of stores for shopping. * Combine the above and you have a room far superior to any hospitality suite at the track: A private space in which to enjoy the race, with your choice of foods and beverages, supported by a capable Room Service team for anything you might need. (In our case, many buckets of ice for champagne.) Service is gracious and outstanding, as expected of such a hotel in Singapore, with the staff in smiles despite the obvious pressure they were under. I'll definitely be back. In fact, I just may consider the actual race tickets to be redundant.

Reviews.Title: “Superb - all the little extras that make it memorable”
Reviews.Author: cyn7180
Reviews.Content: I could not fault this place. Staff were friendly and attentive, room was beautifully furnished and a good size. View from 59th floor was magnificent and pool and gym were top class. On the advice of this site I spent a little more and got the executive package that gave me access to the lounge with it's gorgeous food and beverage selection and attentive staff with free Internet access. WELL worth the extra, as I ate the nibbles every night and did not need dinner at all! Breakfast in the dining room was also included, so I hardly needed to leave the hotel - just the kind of relaxing break I was looking for. Oh, and the lavazza coffee machine in my room which gave me fresh pod coffee on demand was just perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Top notch service and great views”
Reviews.Author: IBC35_Mike
Reviews.Content: We stayed in 6067 for 4 nights this week and were treated to excellent service from all staff. We felt very welcome and nothing was too much trouble for the staff. The service from all the staff in the Executive Lounge on floor 60 was well above average. Our room was clean and the view from the balcony was truly great. An open balcony on floor 60 - you need a strong head for heights. I have stayed here twice - this time with an executive room and it was worth the extra money. To the member of staff who got into our lift as we were going downstairs to check out who took it upon herself to help us and find a taxi during all the formula 1 disruption - thank you - that indeed was top service. I will stay here again when next in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but ask for a renovated room”
Reviews.Author: sermann
Reviews.Content: My best hotel experience in Singapore yet. This huge hotel used to be the tallest building in South-East Asia, giving you an amazing view if your room is high enough. Not all the rooms have been renovated yet, so make sure to get the hotel to confirm that you will get one when you book. The rooms are very nice, big, comfortable and well sound-proofed. Lifts are quite slow, maybe because of the number of floors. Plan a few minutes extra... The breakfast is amazing, but you might have to wait at rush-hour. Staff is very friendly, but the hotel is a little impersonal - it is so big... We did have issues with the room assignment for my colleagues (not everyone got a renovated room) and it took quite a while to sort out. Location is fantastic, very central. I will probably stay there on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “luxury for a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Judy06
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews on trip advisor my husband and I asked when we arrived at the hotel if it was possible to upgrade. We payed the extra price to be put in the Executive rooms. This included rooms on the higher floors (we were on the 59th floor) with full use of the executive lounge on the 60th floor. Our room was large and beautifully appointed with a lovely bathroom with the biggest range of products I have ever seen in a hotel including loofahs, shavers and emery boards. We also enjoyed the view over the harbour and that we could go out onto our own balcony. The lounge area was a good size with tables and chairs,comfortable sofas and chairs in front of a large plasma screen and another small area that could be used as a boardroom or private dining area with another large plasma screen. In the afternoon there was a coffee machine and cakes and cookies or cold drinks available. Between 5 and 8 drinks and food was provided. The drinks included a selection of mixers, wine and beer. The food was exceptional with hot food, cheeses, sushi and a selection of different sweets and was constantly being topped up. The staff was so friendly and were always offering to help with food and wine even though it was serve yourself. The next morning there was a full buffet breakfast served which was also delicious.As we were in transit from Europe to Melbourne and our plane to Melbourne did not leave until 9 that night we also appreciated that the package included a late checkout of 3pm. Even before we had organised the upgrade the service was outstanding so we knew it wasn't because we were spending more money. On balance the money we spent on upgrading was more than covered by the great room and the meals and drinks that were included. We found it an easy walk to Boat Quay with it's outdoor restaurants by the river and the next day it was not much further to visit the markets in China town. I really think the executive package was terrific value for money if you are spending a short break in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location and great service”
Reviews.Author: Twopees
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Swissotel for a 2 night stopover on the way back from our European vacation. Located across the road from Raffles Hotel and above Raffles City Shopping Centre and train station. Very attentive staff on arrival with personalised service to assist with checkin and what to see and do during our stay. Noted a Trip Advisors contribution and requested a renovated room as was allocated a large recently renovated, fully equipped room on the 28th floor overlooking the tennis courts and city. Large breakfast selection with chef to cook fresh omlettes or fried eggs, the waiter staff very exceptional. An easy walk to marina area and the new Marina Sands complex is about a half an hour walk or one train stop away. Internet at the hotel was very expensive as were a lot of things in Singapore, especially alcohol. Would certainly stay at the Swissotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: AndrewBana
Reviews.Content: This hotel really surprised me. The room was comfortable and offered a fantastic view of Singapore with a small balcony. The location was perfect, right next to Raffles mall and City Hall MRT. The breakfast buffet was excellent, but rather crowded. The only negative was that the aircon was dripping - the staff were quick to respond and fix the problem. Overall I had a great stay and would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “great view on the bay”
Reviews.Author: 112910a
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 nights in this hotel, room on the 38th floor, with view on the bay, excellent. There is a tiny terrace linked to the room, nice if you want some fresh air during night. The hotel itself is huge, mix of business people and tourists, a bit far from orchard road if you want to go shop there specific. Breakfast was really crowded and typically as other swissotel, good choice but could have some more fresh fruits. Staff is of very good quality, and comes up to all your needs. Price/value ratio is in my eyes although a bit out of balance, but then again this is singapore.

Reviews.Title: “A terrific hotel when staying in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: judyjetson
Reviews.Content: After much contemplation and advise about where to stay, the selection of Swissotel ( The Stamford) was the perfect location. After seeing Orchard street I was happy to be away from that intense area and much closer to what i consider intersting Singapore and the adjacent neighborhoods. Although the lobby leaves a bit to be desired, ( too congested and small), the room was wonderful, the access to shiopping and eateries perfect. The staff was pperfectly helpful, the food delicious in the breakfast buffest--something for literally eveyoen and every culture. The rpoximity to some of the best of Singpore museums and cultural and sightseeing spots made it perfectly situated. The concierge at the hotel was most helpful in assisting me to find cooking classes during a time when not many were offered. Bravo to the everyone at the hotel for making the stay fabulously fun and relaxing.One thing-- shame on the hotel for charging for internet access considering the cost of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed - Again”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneNikki
Reviews.Content: We have been travelling to Singapore for 6 years. We started staying at the Swissotel for its great location and fantastic views. After several dissapointing stays we decided to try the Fairmont (right next door). We thought that we would give it a try again as we were only staying one night this time. We had stayed at the fairmont the week before. We booked a grand room and was allocated a room on the 53rd Floor. Checkin was quite efficient - a big improvement from other times we have stayed. Room was quite large but smelt musty and old. The decor is tired and bathroom small and outdated. The porcelin in the bath/shower was chipped and unattractive. Whilst the views are spectacular the rooms need a thorough update. I know they do have some newer rooms but its really a jackpot as to whether you are allocated one of these. My main complaint was about breakfast. On check - in, I enquired about the start time of breakfast as we had an early flight. We were told they opened at 6am. I was not informed that breakfast was not included in the room rate. It was my mistake, but I thought that I had booked a room with breakfast... When we arrived at breakfast at 6.45am we gave them our room number and we were again not told that breakfast was not included. Whilst we were eating a member of staff arrived with a bill to sign for $90SGD. Now the buffet is quite nice but we were only having muesli and toast as we had an early flight and had to rush. We left the breakfast at 6.55am. So the 10 minute breakfast equated to $9SGD per minute. On check out I queried the breakfast charge and explained that it was not really appropriate to charge such a large amount when we had only had toast and muesli and only stayed 10 minutes. We also were not informed about the charge before we started eating as we would never have eaten there and gone straight to the airport instead. The receptionist who checked us out just stared blankly at me when I informed her of my complaint. She really didnt seem to care, just wanted us out of the hotel. Overall the service has improved in this hotel but some of the rooms are still not worth the money and breakfast is definately not worth the money. We probably wouldnt bother staying in this hotel again and just go back to staying at the Fairmont which has much better service and quality of rooms even if they dont have the same views. Its a real shame as it could be a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “location , location , location”
Reviews.Author: dawnDohaQatar
Reviews.Content: just spent three days and two nights at the stamford , what an excellent location, steps away from the mrt rail system and all the shopping a healthy human could need. Singapore is all about shopping and this hotel gives you the rail access needed to explore all the shopping malls and food experiences you could require. I found the staff all very polite and kind , sent me in the right direction when i wanted of all things "movie" posters for a teenagers wall ,Rooms were clean, large , with an excellent view from the balcony over the marina . Would recommend this hotel and i will be staying there again no questions about it .

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic !”
Reviews.Author: currieinc
Reviews.Content: Just had two stays at the Swissotel The Stamford and both were fantastic , the first was for 1 night then back 6 days later for 2 nights. Check in was fast and efficient, rooms spacious and well appointed , good use of space , very comfortable beds , everything worked , everything was professional and staff were excellent. Had breakfast in Cafe Swiss which is a great way to start the day , very busy but it has lots of choices and selections. The location is just fantastic ... 2 minutes walk into the Raffles City Shopping Complex, lots of restaurants nearby and it only took 20 minutes to and from the airport, plus a $6.00 taxi ride will get you to Orchard Road. Singapore was just great .. shopping is excellent and the exchange rate worked for us ... The Singaporeans are a very proud group of people and showed us the best side of the country , the city is so clean and well organised , its a pleasure to spend time here. in the best location with the best facilities you can't go past the Swissotel The Stamford.

Reviews.Title: “Great room views and location”
Reviews.Author: shantichop
Reviews.Content: Conveniently situated above a shopping centre and MRT. Great bar on the top floor!

Reviews.Title: “Very central with direct metro connection to airport and rest of city”
Reviews.Author: mrken22
Reviews.Content: I had one night in Singapore and had checked my luggage straight through to my final destination. This was the ideal hotel in the centre of the city and only a $2 metro ride away from the airport.- easy with just a carry on bag. City Hall station is just outside the hotel. My room was on the 56th floor with fabulous views of the harbour. The hotel was very busy because of the Youth Olympics but staff seemed friendly and welcoming. I was quite self contained during my short stay so didnt really have much interaction with staff other than reception on a arrival and departureand efficient. If I had to make one negative comment it was the fact that their was no evening turn down service.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to do a Singapore Stopover”
Reviews.Author: Torben22
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 2 nights in a lovely room with such a great view over the city. The hotel is quite near to the city centre and the next metro station is not far. The service is mixed. Some are really unfriendly but some are quite nice. The New Asia Bar on the top of the hotel is such a good place for partying and good drinks!

Reviews.Title: “Old hotel, staff seem to look down at you”
Reviews.Author: Indian_Abroad
Reviews.Content: I stayed for three nights and would never stay there again. The cost of the room was very high, compared to others I have stayed at in Singapore. The website promises great rooms, yet they are old and dated. The bathroom was in very poor condition compared to other hotels and had mould in the bath. The air conditioning was turned off by the staff during the night and it became incredibly warm in the room. The hotel lobby was chaos, and there is no privacy for guests. The staff do not have a want to help the guest. They are very rude, particularly the staff at reception desk and the concierge desk. I am a business traveller, and spend many nights away. I expect to be treated well when I pay money to stay at an establishment, not like I was treated at the Swissotel Stamford. Maybe people who do not travel very often may accept the run-down rooms and the poor service, however I expect value for money and did not receive it. The only saving grace was the location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice view, good location ...... rude staff!”
Reviews.Author: seanaussie
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Swissotel The Stamford for 4 nights for business. The Swissotel Stamford is in a good location for business travellers, however a bit far away from the shops of Orchard Road. There are two check-in desks, I inadvertantly went to the one near the lifts and was rudely told that it was for air-line crew only and that I had to check-in at the other desk. An air-steward who was waiting behind me said to me "Don't worry, they are always like that here" and showed me where to go to check-in. Check-in took a long time compared to other hotels I have stayed at in Singapore. The room had a balcony and seemed to have been recently updated. The views were great. The airconditioning was terrible throughout the hotel. In the room the temperature control did nothing. There did not appear to be airconditioning in the lifts and only minimal airconditioning in the Lobby. It always took a very long time for a lift, which was strange as there are so many lifts. The hotel has a great gym, however it was always too busy whenever I went there. The same went for the pool, never a seat available. We had several requests for our group, each time the staff seemed disinterested and unfriendly. The room service was incredibly over-priced. You had to pay for internet (it's 2010 !!) again, very expensive. I would not recommend it to other travellers, it is a very expensive hotel, and the staff there seem to see you as a bother, rather than a guest of their establishment. As a regular business traveller to Singapore, I can say there are a lot friendlier and more reasonably priced hotels both in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “I will be back”
Reviews.Author: MonsieurHomard
Reviews.Content: I only usually stay in this standard of hotel for business trips, as while on holiday the room is just a place to sleep. As long as it's clean and quiet I am happy to stay in a 2 or 3 star hotel & enjoy for an excellent dinner with the price difference. My stay at the Swissotel Stamford has changed my mind about this. I really appreciated the size and comfort of the room & bed. The city was buzzing but my room was an oasis of calm. As my luggage had been lost I appreciated the full range of toiletries provided. I wanted for nothing. Service was excellent from all staff. I checked out late but the late check out fee was waved. I agree with the feedback from others that the hotel is struggling to contend with the volume of guests at breakfast and in the lobby. I wanted to take breakfast in the hotel but changed my mind when I saw the queues. Location is excellent and the views from the top floor are impressive. Access to the night club on the top floor is free for hotel guests. With a visit if staying over a weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Experience”
Reviews.Author: Travelled61
Reviews.Content: When I checked in I was upgraded to a Crest Sutie. Needless to say, it was amazing to be on the 66th floor of this hotel. I have a separate living area, a king size bed, 2 balconies, 3 TVs, 2 DVD players, a coffee maker, Bvlgari toiletries, free breakfast and amazing views. The towels were the plushest I've ever seen. The rooms and linen were spotless. The staff were wonderful (including those unaware that I was in a suite). The pools were big and clean. The breakfast buffet included everything from croissants to curry. The hotel is located in the Raffles Shopping complex and next to the City Hall MRT. Definitley a five star experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with spectacular views, but watch out for officious staff”
Reviews.Author: David_in_Melbourne
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel mid afternoon and as we proceeded to the check-in counter, were greeted by a friendly staff member who directed us to a counter. Unfortunately, this greeter then recognised a guest who was a member of their hotel club, and then asked us to step back to allow the other guest to be served first. The greeter was apologetic, but it was embarrassing for us and the guest who was behind us, and I think entirely unnecessary since there was only a "queue" of 1 (us). The experience when we did check in was fantastic: the fellow who served us was aware of our request for a new room (the hotel was undergoing a refurbishment). We were given our room keys and directed to a wonderful room on the 47th floor, which although not new (it was a bit tired) was very spacious. We were more than happy with the outcome. The stay itself was brief (a 2 day stopover on the way home) and would have been otherwise enjoyable if not for an appalling experience trying to print an airline boarding pass. A supervisor (or manager) in the business center wanted us to pay to print out our boarding passes, a very small amount but annoying considering we had already paid for internet access (not cheap at nearly $SG30 per day). Her unwillingness to be helpful AND directing her juniors there not to be helpful lead to an escalation to the duty manager: he solved the issue in 2 minutes flat, but as it was the last contact point we had with the property, it left a poor impression and spoiled what would otherwise be a positive experience. The petty attitude was delivered with the comment "I am only doing my job", an outrageous way to defend an incredibly poor attitude as her staff knew what needed to be done and were willing to do it. I find it difficult to recommend the property as a result: it has almost unparalleled convenience, so if you are not there for the service, it has a lot to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Was expecting better service but the...”
Reviews.Author: CMESL
Reviews.Content: Was expecting better service but the amenities in rooms were not in ideal conditions. Had a non functioning fridge and an air con which is unable to adjust temperature.

Reviews.Title: “True comfort”
Reviews.Author: NileshSheth
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights with family. Its a luxury hotel with beautiful location. We were suprised to know it is connected a shopping mall and an underground metro station. The staff and service is good. The room has a plush interiors and booth room amenities are good. Each room is well equipped with basic necessities. Since we are vegeterian, choice of food is restricted and is not kept seperately from non-veg. food. Breakfast has a variety of choices. I would surely recommend my friends for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need and great views too”
Reviews.Author: PerthJo_Ann
Reviews.Content: We had three lovely nights here last week. Due to bookings we were upgraded to the 59th floor at no extra charge. The views are wonderful, the staff are very attentive and the food at KopiTiam is excellent. Don't pay $28/day for cable internet in your room; there is free wireless connection in the foyer.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, faultless staff”
Reviews.Author: JayJay1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Swissotel Stamford for 3 nights 8 - 11th July. We had a room on the 23rd floor, and it was worth paying extra for a harbour view room, as our room overlooked the new Marina Bay Sands Hotel. Location was fantastic, with Raffles Plaza next door, Suntec Mall two blocks away, Raffles Hotel on the next block. It was also within easy walking distance of the Singapore Flyer and the Merlion. Our room had two double beds and a stretcher bed for our teenage daughter. We liked the office style desk and chair in the corner of the room. Staff were fantastic. We must make special mention of Joshua at the front desk, who went out of his way to show us how to get to the Singapore Flyer. One little gripe we had was there was not enough capacity to serve breakfast, especially around 9.00am and Sunday mornings (we had to queue for around 15 mins), however our breakfast was very nice with many choices. A highlight of our visit was high tea on the 70th floor - fantastic views. We decided to dress up for the occasion and were a little disappointed at the dress standard of some of the other patrons, we didn't think that shorts and T-shirts were appropriate. We got to watch the National Day Parade rehearsal from our balcony - an impressive experience, especially the fireworks display at the end. (This was only a rehearsal!!) Overall we enjoyed our experience, and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic views, good service, great pool for the kids”
Reviews.Author: matt_d9
Reviews.Content: 13/7/2010 stayed 4 nights with two adults and two kids. Room was spacious with two double beds on the 45th floor. safe balcony for the kids with great views. Didn't eat there as the food court in the mall downstairs was very good value. The pool was great for the kids. safe, well equipped and a good break from the hustle and bustle. Very comfortable bed, great customer service. In roomm internet very expensive, but free internet at Starbucks downstairs, the fiarmont next door and at the pool area. The bathroom was looking slightly dated for the price but otherwise a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Package”
Reviews.Author: Canny
Reviews.Content: I had visited Singapore on many occasions in the past and this time the primary intention is to visit Universal Studio at the same time taking the opportunity to visit the Resort World Casino Marina Sands and its Skypark. I opted for the Resort World Partner Packages staying at the Swissotel Stamford. This is a very reasonable package as it does not only include 2 nights stay but also include : • 2 Adult Universal Studios Singapore Tickets • Resorts World Sentosa gifts worth around SGD50 (2 Universal Studio limited edition Base Ball Cap) • Resorts World Sentosa gift voucher worth SGD25 • Resorts World Sentosa F&B voucher worth SGD20 Despite encountering some challenges in redeeming the Resorts World Sentosa F&B voucher worth SGD20 at the resort itself, overall I truly enjoyed my day-trip at the Universal Studio. The Swissotel stay was alright and the room I was allocated has a great view facing the Marina Sands (Balcony door can be opened to offer a greater view of Singapore skyline). Overall, the staff were polite, courteous and service –oriented except during the check-in process that I had expected more pro-activeness. This hotel has a great location as it located right above the City Hall MRT Station in the Raffles City itself, it is also within walking distance to Suntec City, Raffles Hotel and Chijmes. However, the room cleanliness can be improved as I found hair strands in the bathroom (mainly in the bathtub and it surroundings) upon check-in besides 2-3 bits pieces of tissue papers found lying near the toilet bowl. On top of that, the right –hand side bed lamp control was malfunction that I was unable to switch-off provided I loosen-up the bulb and this situation remains unchanged from the day I checked in until check-out. No evening Housekeeping touch-up for my room.

Reviews.Title: “super views across Singapore”
Reviews.Author: nottyandnice
Reviews.Content: Not as great as when it was the Westin but still great...amazing views over the south china seas, extraordinary service even really busy ..Food is expensive but worth it..Rooms are good with all modern cons as expected ..Bars and restaurants specially rooftop bar is a must visit when in SIngapore...

Reviews.Title: “New Room but Outdated Bathroom”
Reviews.Content: Location: great, MRT & Raffles City Shopping Centre is just below the hotel. Room: newly renovated. Bathroom & wardrobe area is outdated. Twinning tea selections and coffee machine. Lower floor's rooms are not yet re-furbished, be warned! Air-Cond: the air cond controller doesn't seem to work, it is warm most of the time. Overall: it is an old hotel. I will not stay in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not worth it, good location and gym though”
Reviews.Author: megatms
Reviews.Content: I paid for full price (SGD 320++) and was initially given a high floor but twin beds. Once I requested for a king bed I felt I was downgraded to a "lower class" room which felt smaller on the lower floor. There had been a problem at check out with the discrepencies with the room rate, which I thought you would charge me a lower price instead of the initial price on the check-in for the initial room but that did not happen. Their business centre charges SGD 10++ per 15 mins of internet. I reached Swissotel at midnight on a Sunday and wasn't greeted at the lobby nor was helped out of the taxi with my luggage. Rooms were nice but the toilet and the hallway seems dated compared to many other hotels I stayed. Breakfast was good, large selection of local and international food. Location however was great, as the hotel was attached to the shopping centre and the MRT, plus there is a 24 hour McD's literally next door to stave off your midnight hunger instead of room service. The gym and spa was nice, in a weird 3 floor arrangement. The equipment seems complete eventhough they weren't really arranged in any particular order. 12 cardio machines in front of 20 television screens in the wall rather than 1 screen per cardio machine. Nice jacuzzi to cool down in afterwards. All in all, I would have chosen a different hotel if it weren't the fact that I had to attend a conference at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: GammelMont
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nothing special, a huge building with standard facilities and lacking charm. The room looked functional and was big enough but not particularly charming. I would describe it as a second class business hotel. Service was good and efficient but I have stayed at the intercontinental many times while in Singapore and really it is a much better place for similar prices. There are lot of good restaurants in the hotel, both the indian and japanese on the 2nd or 3rd floor were good. I also tried the 2 on the last floor. Skip the French/Japanese, took hours to be done with the set menu and cost a bundle. The other one (can't remember the name) was much better.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Experience - 5-star $$ , 3-star room & services”
Reviews.Author: ymca122
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at this hotel for 4 nights this week. We've paid SGD300+++ for a standard room per night but a 3-star rating room & services in return. The frontdesk was always in a mess. No proper queue was advised and the frontdesk staffs were not helpful and friendly indeed. They were not professional, with NO smile and acting SLOWLY! They should not be served as a frontdesk staff in a so-called 5-star hotel ! One of the male frontdesk staff even did not know what a hotel voucher is! He was holding my hotel voucher but he thought it is an air ticket! This is totally ridiculous! We were first being arranged with a room at the 48th floor. The room smells sting, like a smoking room without air-freshing. The furnishings are old and the bathroom shower was dripping. A/C is not working properly! The view is not good (city view) facing a tall building. I can't accept I paid SGD300+ for such a room so I requested to have a room changed. I have also asked if I can upgrade to the Executive room (I don't mind to pay an extra of course) however, the frontdesk manager showed a very annoying face to me and asked another staff to serve me. That staff just leaves me to another staff. Finally she said, she can only transferred me to another room in the same floor and no Executive rooms are available for the whole week! (PS : this is really unbelievable!) Anyway, I was so tired and hungry and I accepted the room changed. But then she asked me to wait for an hour for the room changed. When I came back after 1.5 hours, she asked me to wait for another 15 mins! Luckily, the room after changed got a nice view (facing Singapore flyer and the Esplanade). However, the air con is still not working properly. I turned the air con to HIGH and the lowest degrees, I was still sweating! Furthermore, the hotel staffs (room cleaning/services area) were frequently disturbing while I was in the room. I don't expect they will ring the bell and come in to check the mini-bar! and after 30 mins, another staff rang the bell to ask if you are satisfied with the room. So that means I need to have the "privacy" button switched on for 24 hours??? Actually I think the "mini-bar" is really important to the hotel otherwise they won't keep on asking you if you have ever used the mini-bar !!!!! Besides, the elevator area (also inside the elevator) is hot. Breakfast was average. At last, the most unacceptable thing is that the hotel charged SGD28 per day for the internet access! Come on, we are now living in the world of internet, I couldn't believe a so-called 5-star international hotel doesn't provide WIFI services! I was totally disappointed with this hotel. Don't believe the pictures in the hotel web, it is totally a different thing! Although the view is nice (if u're lucky to be arranged with that kind of room, otherwise, with the same price you paid, u may get a room with city view in lower stories.) and the location is good, the hotel should be rating as a 3-star. Poor services, noisy lobby, unprofessional staffs, old and dirty rooms ..... I will not stay in this hotel again! I am so angry to pay such a high price for this kind of room & services in a so-called 5-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A modern hotel ... without Free Wifi”
Reviews.Author: Hermanatorr
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights while my little family saw Singapore for the first time. Here are my 2 cents: Pros: - Definitely its location, we can get to most popular location eg Santosa, Merlion etc in less than 10-15 mins on a cab. - MRT just under the hotel. Cabs are never in short at the Taxi stand - Matrix is rather hard ... need to get use to. But once you get used to you can rest really well after touring Singapore with my little family for a whole day! - Pearlyn Ng, the duty manager, she is super super helpful and more importantly has the RIGHT attitude and heart to help customers Cons - Staff service in general is rather average. The concierge staff is not helpful (dont even smile when they greeted us) and we are lucky to have Peralyn saved our holiday! - No free WiFi... come on I thought we are in the internet age.. a lot of the guest scambled in the Starbuck to get free WiFi... not good enough. The internet is S$30 per night

Reviews.Title: “Not Again at Swissotel Stamford!!”
Reviews.Author: SydneyAaa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very old and tired, and definitely in need of a total renovation. It is in a great location, has a nice lobby but the rooms are run-down. I can only rate it a 3 star hotel and they charge exorbitant rates!! You are charged for every little extra. We recently stayed 7 nights at the Swissotel Stamford and it was a disappointment!! We booked a Grand Room and got a room on the 53rd floor. The view was good BUT the room had a dreadful MOULDY smell, furniture was OLD and good towards a garage sale, air-conditioning vents had moulds and awfully dirty, and air-conditioner did not function efficiently. The pictures and description on the hotel website were all too misleading!! You only get a Queen Bed in a Grand Room and not a King Bed as described. We complained and were upgraded to the Executive Floor in a standard room which was meant to be renovated and smaller. The coolest we could get from the air-conditioner was 23C even after setting to the lowest. Singapore's weather is quite warm and we were really disappointed the air-conditioning was not effective. An upgrade to the Executive Floor at this hotel does not include use of the Exec Lounge. Gosh, we were told we need to pay extra to use the Lounge!! You get better value staying at other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull Hotel, with impressive look over Singapore”
Reviews.Author: tschimper
Reviews.Content: If you have a room as I had, looking over the habor from 67 floor, then Singapore Flyer is a small wheel. You see plenty of ships in the straight of malaka, and you have a wonderfull view over singapre by night & day. The Bar in the top floor offers all kind of drings including real bavarian "Weiss Bier". The Hotel has a fine swimming pool and recreation area and sits on top of a Singapore shopping mall.

Reviews.Title: “Self-contained - Everything - market, MRT station, food joints, conference and 60 floor hotel - all in same building!”
Reviews.Author: VivekGoa
Reviews.Content: From the rooms on 60th floor of Swissotel, The Stamford,I could oversee the port, The Singapore Lion and view of the beautiful city and the view of its swimming pool on the terrace of 8th floor! Swissotel, located centrally, has first four floors for shopping plaza, where you get every thing in a phenominal ambience. If you are travelling by MRT (train service), the station is in the basement of the hotel. Other tourist destinations, viz Santosa island is 20 inutes by MRT from the basement, night safari can be booked from the hotel building itself. Variety of food in the hotel restaurants and in the market place on the first few floors. Money Exchangers are available in the market place inside the hotel, which the Hotel staff guide you, so that you don't pay a higher exchange rate which hotel charges. Rooms are very well organised and designed, with friendly room service staff.

Reviews.Title: “Poor management style of female manager, leadership is about motivation not to lead with fear”
Reviews.Author: Membranus
Reviews.Content: After many years with100 degree of travel in Asia, we chose this time to stay at Swissotel The Stamford. With regret, I must mention that I could not believe how we at our company ended up talking a lot about our different concerns about our stay in this hotel. All 42 of our employees were disappointed. They all had complaints ranging from showers that are leaking at night, employees not knowing basic information about the hotel, about giving out proper directions, dirty carpets, soiled linens on restaurant tables and generally the poor service and lack of effective leadership resulting to disorganization, two of my colleagues even told me they had dinner on a particular restaurant at the hotel where the manager looked as if they weren’t welcome there. After hearing this, I was shocked and was quite thankful nothing bad happened to me so far. But I guess I wasn’t spared because I had an interesting experience of my own. I went for dinner at one of the restaurants inside the hotel. After reading a lot of good reviews about the restaurant, I opted to give it a try. But sadly, my dinner was spoiled because of what happened that night. Never in my life, as a person who works for a Human Resource Management advisory company, have I seen such bad behaviour from a female leader. I’ve observed it myself where the manager – she just chooses the people she wants to talk to and to my surprise, she even talks badly to one of the employees there. I wanted to intervene the fight she was having with one of the staff but chose not to anyway. I guess it’s just my emphatic nature to help those who are treated badly by others. Unfortunately, with all these complaints, I don’t think we would like to make use of this hotel anymore especially when one of the reasons why me and my colleagues are here is to attend a meeting about human rights of employees with other Human Resource Management advisory companies around the world. Before signing up for this trip to Asia, I didn’t know it was a big issue until I sat on my table and watch a lady manager, and the other staff of the restaurant spoke really roughly to this little girl. I didn’t know why she was treated that way but still, it breaks my heart. I saw how the people at the other table also reacted to the scene. And they were smiling in awe, like all of a sudden the focus was drawn to what was happening around the table. I suddenly realized I am in a five star hotel...just wondering if this is a noble way to act and represent such high-ranking company. After my dinner, I went back to the hotel room and met up with my colleagues. We all agreed that this hotel may not be suitable for our next trips in Singapore. It’s a shame because I thought the food at that restaurant was decent but actually forgot how good my pasta was after the “fight scene” which helped me conclude how degrading the female manager was to her employees. The little girl didn’t say anything back. Maybe she’s afraid of getting fired; I don’t know, but my sympathy goes out to you. We can only recommend everyone here at TripAdvisor not to use the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Most memorable stay”
Reviews.Author: ATrvlr
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice and both times it has been the most remarkable experience. This is the tallest hotel in Singapore and the rooms are either harbour facing or city facing. I stayed on the 59th floor in a harbour facing room and the view was simply amazing. You could see the sea, the ships and the sunrise. The staff is very helpfull and efficent. The breakfast is elaborate and has all the major international cuisnes including Indian. The are multiple malls, shopping plazas, resturants just next to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience personified!”
Reviews.Author: RtravelIndia
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel for over 20 years. Its convenient location, proximity to the MRT, shopping and supermarket at Raffles City mall, restaurants and attractions brings us back to the hotel regularly. The personalized service and the luxuries accorded to us as Swissgold Elite members makes it a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Executive Club Level Saves Money”
Reviews.Author: Helen-in-Wonderland
Reviews.Content: We are in the process of moving to Singapore, and because of some event or other, could not find a room anywhere, so had a reservation made here, even though the cost was much higher than the daily lodging allowance we were allotted for temporary living. I've come to the conclusion that the Executive Club features are saving us money in the long run. Breakfast, which at the last hotel we were at cost S$38 each morning is included, and the variety and quality of the food is very good. I can print documents for no cost, although to scan I had to go to the business center, and it was a pricey S$4 a page. Each evening my husband and I enjoy evening wine or cocktails, without the excessive crowds mentioned in another review. The food provided during this cocktail hour(s) is usually enough for us for dinner, so we don't go out in the evenings, and as eating out in Singapore is pricey, we save probably over S$100 a night. Again the variety and quality of the food is excellent (and I'm a fussy foodie!) The cleaning staff is most doting, as is the Executive lounge staff. I did find the concierge service to be a bit useless for basic living things such as where can I do laundry without paying hotel prices. The room is comfortable and of a good size, well appointed, and with adequate places to store all the luggage we have in tow due to the fact we are moving. The view is spectacular! I didn't think I'd be comfortable so high up, but is was a great spot to watch the National Day show of military force, with fighter jets screaming overhead, tanks and other military vehicles filling the streets below, and Chinook helicopters flying by at eye level towing an immense Singapore flag. I enjoy the sunrise over the Singapore Strait, and the city lights at my feet at night. I was very disappointed in the last hotel we stayed at, and am very pleased with this one. I would recommend it for business or leisure travel.

Reviews.Title: “Fresh Room, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: zags
Reviews.Content: Since we booked our rooms back home we had informed the hotel staff that we would be coming with a baby and an elderly; we asked in advance if the hotel could provide a baby stroller and a wheelchair. Our check in went fine, despite the fact that we had to wait for a while because of the line. There are a few couches at the lobby where we could sit while waiting. We got the room we needed: non-smoking rooms with connecting doors. The rooms were always freshly fragrant. I was impressed when a staff came to our room with a baby crib, with clean sheets and a pouch of bottles of baby bath, shampoo, powder, lotions. Additionally we also got our baby stroller, and a wheelchair, all for free! Although the staff seemed very busy, they were willing to stop and listen and respond to our inquiries.

Reviews.Title: “Not like other 5 stars hotel, and very bad management style”
Reviews.Author: perlaetus
Reviews.Content: Everything is "looking very beautiful", but..... perhaps the management should focus A LOT on treating their employees well, the times we have seen Managers talk with employees, we have often thought about how violently they speak to their employees. It's just too mutch. Management has the motivation to do, not to create fear! We are considering whether we should stay there anymore, it's hard to be supporters of a hotel when Managers act like that. Very bad style!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful down to the last detail”
Reviews.Author: raincitysunshine
Reviews.Content: This was one of the more pleasurable hotel stays we have had. Actually we payed out of pocket unlike many of the guests on business trips but I feel like we got every penny's worth and that's more than I can say for some of the budget hotels we have stayed at that were one-tenth the price. Down to the last detail the hotel does a wonderful job catering to and expecting guest needs. Check-in was smooth, we requested a room with a great view and got it--56th floor overlooking the flyer and marina centre area. Front desk clerk named Jon was great BTW. I suppose we got somewhat lucky, based on the reviews of the lower rooms. I would have hated to have payed the same price and gotten stuck in a room that was not as nice as ours was. Balcony in every room was one of the things that cinched the deal for us, as there is just something really special about being able to step outside onto a private deck and have the whole world to yourself. Rooms are exquisitely appointed with no stone left unturned as far as I'm concerned. Really set up for a 5* experience from the killer power shower to the mattress, to the thoughtfully designed room layout that makes it feel more like a suite than a standard room. The room has nice little touches too such as National Geographic and some other fun magazines and a book on Buddhism to leaf through. Breakfast was included in our rate, which was convenient because there is really nothing that interesting to eat in the immediate neighborhood. However, the location of the hotel is one of its main strengths as it's right on the City Hall metro line and no need even to go outside to get on a subway. Hotel is across street from Raffles, which is a must visit for architecture and ambiance. But even the Stamford has good architecture--breakfast is in a classic IM Pei atrium room, with great atmosphere that wipes away any grogginess or grumpiness in the morning :) If I could make one suggestion to the hotel it would be related to the breakfast buffet, which does have a mass-produced food feel to it and undrinkable coffee that tastes like they scraped the bottom of a grill and poured hot water over it. However, the variety of food choices is decent (especially the nasi lemak and other Asian center) and so is the service. If I could make another suggestion to the hotel it would be to include free internet into the price of the room--charging for internet in this day and age is an outmoded business practice. Even Starbucks has recently relaxed its internet policy because they were losing money to other coffee shops. Besides that, though, the professionalism at Swissotel Stanford was superlative. They even thought so far as to have a freshen-up room for guests whose flight is later in the day. This way, even if you check out you can leave your bags, walk around and still have a place to shower and freshen up before a flight. Very cool! We didn't visit the pool area, we didn't even use the gym--too bad about that but we were very busy. If I can afford it I would stay here again for sure. In fact, our room was so nice I could live there! Thank you for making our stay memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Singhjee
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, great view, good value, excellent breakfast, good sized rooms, decent service. Need I say more?

Reviews.Title: “A very 'Tall' experience,worth enjoying.”
Reviews.Author: dipbanKolkata
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were booked into this Hotel along with others for a Strategy Discussion Conference. As we checked in,it felt like another Luxury Hotel which You find in any big City.You then hop into the Lift to wing your way to the room.It then dawns on you that the hotel is very tall for this City state.In the evening we were taken to the Rooftop restaurent for cocktails.It is then that one realises the enormity of the height of the Hotel.Every other structure around you is dwarfed into submission;leaving you with a lofty feeling. The Conference Room,where I ended up spending most of the time,was spacious and had all the gadgets that you will expect. It is bang in the middle of the hustle and bustle of the City.So,it is good when you are on a Business trip.There is a variety of Restaurants to choose from. The choice of wine is large. On the whole,a very good choice to hold Conference.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with many very efficient systems going.”
Reviews.Author: NamSheeTsim
Reviews.Content: Stay 3 nights in this hotel. The building is the tallest around the area. The lifts are of very high speed, but not hurting the ears somehow (by pressure changes). Rooms are big and clean. Got a room facing the war memorial park and the new Sands Casino - excellent view, the only complaint is the extremely busy traffic in view making it not so in keeping with the slower pace of a 'trip' though the purpose of my trip was for attending a conference. Staff at the reception are very efficient too. Breakfast is REAL good. Starts at 6 am! I had to attend an early session on the first day and i took the breakfast before sunrise! The choices are IMMENSE. If I am to try everything it may take 2-3 mornings to do so. The hotel is connected to the SUNTEC Convention Centre and the nearby shopping malls by the passages connecting the Mass Transit. On the first day there was heavy rain and we didn't have to get wet by walking underground, though it actually took longer to walk below ground than on roads - even if i include the long wait usually required at the pedestrian crossings. Staff are very friendly. I was just waiting in front of the reception for 30 seconds for making an enquiry and a staff in the lobby approached me for assistance. In the first morning we have problem locating a local and the conceirge staff helped us to call the person by phone. Next to the hotel is the BIG shopping mall with shops of all sorts and cater almost for anything you forgot to bring for your trip. This mall has several bars for drinks and chats with friends in early evening. The only issue is that the place is so busy that it sort of give you the feeling of 'home' - as busy as home (Hong Kong). A niece of mine is to visit Singapore shortly and I will definitely recommend this hotel to her despite the higher price.

Reviews.Title: “comment”
Reviews.Author: Magelan48
Reviews.Content: A very good hotel, excelently located. But: I would expect that such high quality hotel will propose internet connection as part of a service. Internet nowadays is as to charge extra if you you take a bath more than once. Not to mention that for 28 singapore $ (before tax) per 24 hours I would expect a perfect internet connection and not being disconnected every few minute. In order not to be too negative I appreciated the fact that the restaurant breakfast staff remembered my name and served with a smile my special demand

Reviews.Title: “Luxury standing tall at the heart of Singapore”
Reviews.Author: cashish11
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the tallest hotel in Singapore with top floors dedicated to equinox pub, offering great views of Singapore. My room was at the 51st floor and I enjoyed it a lot. I skipped my planned Singapore flyer visit, as I had already got a good view of Singapore from my balcony :) The morning breakfast buffet comprises of a large variety of stuff to choose from. There is a mall at the basement of the hotel along with a metro station. Will definitely stay again in this hotel next time i visit to Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: vyomesh
Reviews.Content: Excellent staff and great service. the delivered my b'fast to the room at 0445, for all the 15 days i was there at no extra charge, as I had to leave for work at 0515!! A nice smiling steward with hot eggs at that time of the day really makes your day!! The rooms could use a bit of doing up though, especially the carpets..really shoddy. All in all, a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely need refurbishment for a so-called 5-five hotel”
Reviews.Author: SukLing
Reviews.Content: With recommendation from a Singaporean co-worker, we decide to stay the 3rd and 4th nights at the Swissotel The Stamford which costs around SD$10 less than the Mandarin Oriental where we stay for the 1st & 2nd night. But wow, it makes a huge difference! We got a room on 24th floor with a city view that we found the room is quite 80's as the carpet colored in dark down, yellow-orange..... and the room is spacious but not quite user-friendly (large empty space but limited furniture for your luggage), the bathroom definitely is from the old hotel.... water faucet, swinging glass window of the bathtub and the overall setting is old and definitely not a five star standard. In fact, we did check on the hotel website before for a look of the room, but we can only said the photo retouching technique is excellent! In the middle of the night, we woke up suddenly as the speaker phone turned on (automatically???) at no reason. Then, it was the light, mins later......again, it turned on automatically. We had to go down at the front reception with my sleeping child, 3 yrs old, and request of room switching. We got a room, 45th floor, where my husband and I stayed up for the rest of the night. However, the room again need refurbishment as the drain opening of the bathtub is broken. My husband and I decided to move to other hotel in the early morning and looked for help from the duty manager, Arman. He transferred us to Fairmount hotel right next to Swissotel and escorted us to take a look at the room before we made our decision. And we are glad that we are settled down. Sweet, stuffed toys and follow-up note was offered and placed at the room at the afternoon. All in all, disappointment at the Swissotel the Stamford ( I had a wonderful experience at the Swissotel Nanki Osaka) but satisfied with the follow-up service by Mr. Arman Jumaat.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - but make sure your breakast is included!!”
Reviews.Author: Polly1308
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located above Raffles City shopping and train station and as such is in a good location. Easy access to all parts of Singapore and a well appointed room. The hotel organised a half day tour which took in the Merloin, little India, Chinatown and Orchard Rd and was professional and informative. We also used the hotels service for booking the Night Safari. I need to preface this by saying the Night Safari has been one of my most treasured memories from visiting Singapore some 15 years ago. All I can say now is what a disappointment! Being wild animals means there is no “action on cue” so to speak but seriously it was like being on a tractor and viewing rocks with eyes. It was too dark to see anything of substance and the only animal we saw clearly was a couple of goats! Anyway – the hotel was nice and well appointed. We had requested a non smoking room so upon arriving in the room that smell resembled an ashtray we asked to be moved but they simply came and removed the ashtray and sprayed air fresh…The upside of this room however was the magnificent view of the harbour, the new casino, the Wheel and Raffles. WOW – what a view – spectacular at every angle. Breakfast was not included in our room rate so on the first morning we ventured down to the hotel Swiss Café. Whilst the food is what you would expect from a five star hotel, we were somewhat surprised by the bill. Two coffees from the roaming pot, two bowls of cereal and two servings of toast came to (Singapore) $96 !!! GULP ! Wish we had more toast at that price!!! In summary, a good hotel in a good location with good facilities. The Bar on Level 72 provides breathtaking city views, but there are lots of other food choices available surrounding the hotel so unless it’s included – find breakfast elsewhere!! Otherwise a good choice to enjoy an exciting city!

Reviews.Title: “Had higher expectations”
Reviews.Author: MikeCMelbourne
Reviews.Content: This hotel was once the highest hotel in the world. It was run by various management and now it is managed by Swissotel. I always wanted to stay in this hotel as it would have a commanding view, it looks really modern and upscale. I finally managed to stay for several nights for some meetings my company organised. This hotel didnt live up to my high expectations. Well, this hotel had a very high reputation and naturally I was expecting exactly that. Good points first. This is still a good 5 star hotel. The food was good. Service was prompt Location was excellent and unbeatable. What more can you expect with an underground train station underneath? I cannot think of any better location for a hotel! Seriously! Good view from high floors Great restaurants nearby, within walking distances If you want to visit Universal Studios and the Sentosa casino, there is a free shuttle bus that pick passengers from the hotel Negative points: The room needs a bit more maintenance. Electrical sockets seemed loose. The shower head seemed to leak water. Unlike other 5 star hotels, you can go up the hotel without your key card. Not a good point if you are worried about security. Not really a big concern if you are worried about crime in Singapore. But if you are really worried about terrorism, then that is another matter. This hotel sits on top of a busy underground train interchange. I heard the restaurant Equinox is pretty good but I did not try.

Reviews.Title: “Respite In Singapore”
Reviews.Author: susie_phillips_28
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just spent 10 days on the executive floor of the Swissotel in Singapore. The hotel is large and we arrived close to midnight, we were given our room key and sent up to the 60th floor. It would have been good if we had been shown the room but we worked out the lift security and where the room was. However that was the only hitch in our stay. The room was spacious. with a spectacular view. Anything we requested was immediately provided. The service was very good and the executive staff made us feel welcome at all times. Breakfasts could only be improved if freshly cooked eggs were available in our breakfast room ( they were available on the 2nd floor of hotel in main breakfast room.) We thoroughly recommend the executive level of this hotel on service, friendliness, and high quality of food and beverage available. The proximity to MTR (underground rail system) make this an excellent choice for a holiday in Singapore. Frank and Susan Phillips

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Travelfreak9
Reviews.Content: From the first moment we walked in we felt welcomed and all the staff were very helpful and friendly. Great view of the River/Marina area. One of the best buffet breakfasts including European, Japanese, Indian and Chinese - both hot and cold selections. Very handy with the MRT station right underneath.

Reviews.Title: “Only stay in Swissotel The Stamford when in Singapore!”
Reviews.Author: OhSoHappyMe
Reviews.Content: I am sooo in love with Swissotel! My husband & I checked in over the weekend into their 63th floor room. The view is simply mesmerizing! To top it all, service & room has been tip top. I cannot find any faults during the 2 days. Everyone was all smiles, from lobby staff to corridor staff. The hotel seem busy but you can see everyone being quite alert, when you step into the lobby, staff will greet you & try to offer assistance if needed.
