During check in, I had informed the receptionist that we were celebrating my husband's birthday, wanting to find out about dining options in the hotel. We got a cake after that, without even asking it! We definitely recommend Swissotel to all who come to Singapore. We have since told all our friends how impressed we were. Try it & find out why we feel the way we do. We only wished we brought our camera to take the photos, as they were taken from our phone so not so clear but we WILL definitely revisit Swissotel The Stamford!

Reviews.Title: “If You go to Singapore don't stay at the Swissotel...!!!”
Reviews.Author: marco210380
Reviews.Content: Booked 1 king bed smoking room, got twin in non-smoking, kindly asked to the reception if possible chenge also if i should wait few hours, no way.....that's your room and must take it..... I also kindly asked the possibility the late check out, i thought they give me for repair the previsious mistake.......the answer no way......12.00 out from here...... The hotel cost me almost 200Euro, i got a room at the 8th floor, old, smelly, the amenities almost 0, internet 15euro per day. Honestly i was lucky i must stay only 1 night..... The position is good but here around you can find much better hotel for less money. For sure i will not be back and never suggest to anybody else, even if is a enemy.

Reviews.Title: “Best happy hour in the world!”
Reviews.Author: smryab
Reviews.Content: The hotel was excellent with great views and nice rooms. Location is great as well. The happy hour on the top floor was insane. Great crowd, one of the best views in the world and great drinks!

Reviews.Title: “Imposing and impressive.”
Reviews.Author: charliechair
Reviews.Content: Massive hotel, tallest in Singapore and very plush. Room large and comfortable although not lucky to get good view, but didn't spend long enough in there to worry. Bathroom fine, well equipped but noyt as plush as room. Breakfast was excellent, such a choice, excellent service, nice atmosphere with tables well spaced. Drinks and meals in restaurants, seemed very expensive, but I expect you were paying for the view. Shopping centre below the hotel was very handy and a real hub for young people eating fast food in the evening. The hotel was very well placed, just over the road from the back of 'Raffles' and close to the Singapore flyer - do go on this ( if you used Singapore Airways) take confirmation and you get a discount, and lots more things/places of interest.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel.. great rooms”
Reviews.Author: RajeshContractor
Reviews.Content: My room was on 53rd floor, excellent view, clean & well maintained room and bathroom. Breakfast and service at breakfast was also nice. Only we requested for connecting room well in advance but not get.

Reviews.Title: “love this hotel, beautiful rooms, excellent service, highly accessible.”
Reviews.Author: fuentz
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a Grand Room, which had a king sized bed, desk, couches and a flat screen tv. The bathroom was really nice, with a wide tub, not the usual sized one. However, the shower head was not the removable type. There were 2 pools, 1 for kids and a much deeper one for the adults. Its location makes it very very convenient for travellers. The MRT station is located just underneath it, you can take the train to and from the airport and to other key areas. A free shuttle can also transport you to Sentosa island. Taxis are available all day. All the staff were wonderful and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel ,good location”
Reviews.Author: Kurioustravlr
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here. We had booked a room for three. The room was large,clean with a good view and a balcony . Linen was clean . So were the bathrooms. Good location. The breakfasts were excellent. Staff was attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: FrequentFlyer123
Reviews.Content: This was a great choice for a corporate conference I was involved in organising/delivering. The banquet staff and facilities are excellent. Great meeting room, efficient and attentive staff, and the food was outstanding (amazing variety, quantity and quality). Loved the Nespresso machine! I also stayed in the hotel for 4 nights and found the room good (I don't think it was a reburbished room - the bath certainly needed a good reburbishment). I loved the gorgeous water views, really quiet room, fabulous bed and fantastic room service. Excellent location too. I didn't like the very expensive internet. In this day and age and for this room rate, it should be free.

Reviews.Title: “Spoilt by poor service at reception.”
Reviews.Author: TheRoaches
Reviews.Content: We had booked two nights in an executive room at this hotel, Tuesday night and Wednesday night. We were very late arriving (due to a late flight) and actually arrived just after midnight on Tuesday. (i.e. about 0030am Wednesday). I was absolutley astounded when the reception clerk said we had arrived on the wrong day and had arrived EARLY. When I protested he disappeared for a while, then came back and said it was OK. However, when I came to check out, the hotel wanted to charge me an early arrival fee! This was waived when I protested again, but should never have been there in the first place. What is particularly disappointing is that despite completing feedback forms for the hotel both on paper at the hotel and subsequently online (including my contact details in both cases), I have received no response from the hotel management. I know this is a small incident, but it did spoil what was otherwise a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Harbour View (Marina Bay Sands, Esplanade) and location, nothing else thereafter.”
Reviews.Author: catoutofbag
Reviews.Content: Checked in on a Fri for a night's stay at a Classic Harbour View Room (choice of King Size or Double Bed available). Had requested for a high floor during our initial reservation (we got 45th flr) but nothing special was setup (even though i mentioned that it was to be a night's stay to celebrate me and my then-fiance's marriage solemnization at a restaurant near the hotel). Well, we were abit disappointed but then my guess is such "reason for celebration" could have been a dime a dozen to the hotel. We arrived at the reception at 1 pm and managed to get a room allocated (even though check in was mentioned as 2 pm). Queuing might seem a touch chaotic as the "reception" serves both checking in and checking out guests but with no distinction of a normal queue (e.g. the usual ones where you queue at a main line and get directed to an empty counter). It seems like a free-for-all at the reception. Anyway, we were quite happy to get a suitably high floor (45th out of 68th). The view was superb from our room's balcony, overlooking the marina bay sands and esplanade. I would say this is the million dollar view to have if you intend to catch the new year's eve fireworks in Singapore (balcony can easily accommodate at least 10 pax). In terms of the room condition, i would say that much can be done to improve on the overall impression. Parts that can be improved: 1) Bed seems to be based on the "hard and durable" type, and in all my stay at the various hotels in Singapore or even Japan, this one has got to be the "toughest and hardest bed" that we have slept in. 2) The toilet flush seems to come out of a kung fu movie (the type where you have to deliver a "killer" punch in order to activate the flush system) and it would actually help to have a normal "push" button for flushing. 3) There was no "flexible" shower head (the type where you can unhook from the holder and maneouvre to shower different parts of your body). For the one present in the shower room, either you hope you are not too tall (as shower head is fixed quite low and my 1.8m frame almost knocked the shower head) or you are small enough to move around the bathtub for water jet to spray to your body. Keep in mind that there is no pressure system as well (just a knob to turn water off and on / adjust temperature) so you pretty much have to make do with the "default" water pressure. 4) The drainage plug seems to be damaged as well (you have to remove the whole plug to drain the water or let it "sit" sideways to create a partial drainage flow"). 5) The cupboard for hanging your clothes / safebox etc are located just beside the main door (i find it quite irritating to have to walk all the way to the front door area to keep items / hang my clothes when normally, it should just be a couple of steps away in the bedroom). 6) No free internet access is available and no WIFI connection as well (even if you want to pay for one). Other than the grouches i have mentioned earlier, room seems fine overall and is quite spacious. There is a mini sofa which is quite comfy for watching the night sky, and they do pack some rather nice TWG tea packs for refreshment (as well as complimentary bottle of water). We requested for late check out at 2 pm (usual is 12 noon check out) and our request was acceded. The hotel is also located at City Hall MRT (which is the interchange station) which makes it very accessible to Orchard Road (Orchard MRT or Somerset MRT) or if you are looking to go to more other areas (east side to East Coast Park (Bedok MRT nearest) or Changi Village (Paris Ris MRT nearest) or south side to Resorts World Sentosa / Universal Studios (alight at Harbourfront MRT and take a direct monorail system into Sentosa at Vivocity Mall)). Overall, i would go back for the view only (i.e. fireworks season).

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: EvaPerth
Reviews.Content: We had a one night stay at this hotel and at the The Fullerton. The price we paid at each hotel was exactly same (yes, we had a great deal as we arrived in SG just on the brink of peak season) but boy, what a difference! We stayed on the 11th floor on what must have been the older building of the hotel. It was old, we had no view at all. Our room overlooked another building and a bit of the pool. We saw just a peak of the city, barely. The room was just a let down, not to mention reception was busy as anything, so there was no warm welcome or service other then a simple check in. I wouldn't recommend it and would never go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at The Stamford”
Reviews.Author: VIAJEROSMadrid
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Swissötel The Stamford with my family in 2009 during F1 GP on the 40th floor. Staff were helpful and friendly. We went in harbour view room which was the best for the F1. The location is great, because you have everything on hand. The breakfast was luxurious with a large range of dishes. I highly recommended to stay at The Stamford, specially if you are travelling for an event like F1. Best choice!

Reviews.Title: “Top of town”
Reviews.Author: cahorsGermany
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one week in the Stamford in Singapore. When you book a room in the executive floors (some floors around 60th), you have a private check-in in floor 60, where also the executive lounge is situated. The rooms are quite large and the bed is very comfortable. Really special and surprising was the possibility to use the open balcony (seperate for every room) - you have an outstanding view from there. Breakfast is served in the executive lounge, which could be really crowded since it is not a very large hall - but the ambience is quite private. The choices of food is okay. In the afternoon (04.00-07.00 p.m.??) there is a happy hour with free drinks and some finger food - really nice. The most spectacular view is presented in the Equinox-Restaurants and bars in the top floors of the hotel - this is by far the best way to end a busy day and relax with some friends (and some cocktails...). The staff is friendly and helpful. The gym is well and modern equipped and there are really a lot of treadmills and other execise machines. One of large shopping mall starts direct in the ground floor of the hotel (Raffles City) and you can walk from the hotel underground to the Esplanade and to other shopping malls. Also Boat Quay and Clarke Quay are in walking distance (aboveground). All in all a really good and remarkable hotel in a remarkable city!

Reviews.Title: “Luck of the draw with Swissotel...”
Reviews.Author: bugsy12
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at the Swiisotel last year and had really enjoyed the rooms and views. However, this time, I booked a week's stay with young children and was given a room where the bathtub was chipped (in 7 places- am not exaggerating - has to be seen to be believed!). Similar to many reviews here, the room was old, drab and seen better days. I have NEVER been to a hotel where they will allow guests into a bathroom with chipped enamel. I rang to change the room and in their defence, the hotel very quickly changed our room and was very apologetic. It seems like the "luck of the draw" with Swissotel, as my previous stay I got a really nice room. There appears to be rooms that are newly furnished (which was probably what I got in previous stay) and rooms that are old. I think for anyone to call this 5 star and ask for S$300 (without tax) and hope and pray you get one of the newer rooms is really a pity. The pros of Swissotel are that the MRT is right downstairs, plentiful foodcourts, nice and friendly staff, GREAT breakfast buffet with Western,Singapore, Japanese, (one of the best buffets I have been to). The staff are also to be commended as being friendly and courteous. Taxis were so easy to get, right outside the hotel and guests have priority. Once we changed rooms, we had a really great stay as the hotel is actually really nice - just make sure you ask for the NEW rooms!

Reviews.Title: “A soft spot for a hotel I have been visiting for nearly 20 years!”
Reviews.Author: FSHK
Reviews.Content: I first visited this hotel on my first trip to Asia back in 1991 when it was the Westin and I have come back at intervals ever since. It is still THE most convenient in Singapore for business because it is linked directly to the MRT so one can get to Raffles Place (the main business district) totally undercover (it rains a lot) withouth having the hassle of waiting for taxis. It's a busy, but very serviceable hotel and somehow doesn't seem as touristy as some of the others although it's plainly also pitched at that market as well as business. The rooms are pretty simple, but with a good flat screen TV and if you are lucky, or ask nicely you can get one with a great view over the cricket pitch and towards the downtown area. All rooms (I think) have balconies although do beware as I inadvertently got locked out once! Breakfast at the cafe is pretty hectic. The bathrooms could do with a bit of tweaking but overall I keep coming back here.

Reviews.Title: “Smashing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KevinLondon
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel located in Raffles City next door to the Raffles Hotel, good location walking distance to Clarke Quay and the Singapore Wheel. The hotel is part of the Raffles City Shopping Mall and shares a pool with the Fairmont Hotel which is part of the same development. We mainly used the buses which were located behind the hotel site to get around at a cost of S$1, we prefer to be above ground to see the sites, but the MRT station is right by the hotel. Staff were very good and attentive the rooms were large and very well equipped we had the buffet breakfast which had a lot of choice, we did have to queue up one morning as we arrived at the same time as a couple of hundred guests using the convention centre. Overall a great hotel in a good location and one I would return to again.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not 5 stars!”
Reviews.Author: Alex_Tallinn
Reviews.Content: The company put me on the club floor of this hotel. The room was nice, with a good bed and 'helicopter views' from my 59th floor balcony. Then the frustrations began. After checking in, it took 2 hours to get internet to work. One day I had a small meeting in my room and asked for some extra chairs. The ones they delivered were filthy (see pics). In the middle of the meeting I called their ‘personal valet’ to ask for an extra wine glass. It took 30 minutes and 3 phone calls to get it delivered. This place is big on promise, short on delivery.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location... Amazing View”
Reviews.Author: fazzigucci
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended. I stayed at a deluxe room at this hotel for the new year and invited friends over to witness the amazing view and the fantastic fireworks over the marina bay area. Spacious room, toilets and good room facilities (large lcd tv, cable, writing desk, etc) with just an elevator ride down to Raffles City Shopping Centre which is just beneath the hotel, how convenient is that! Minor problem, air-cond was not cold eventho' we set the thermostat to lowest. Major problem for me is parking charges, if you're intending to drive here and parking your vehicle, you won't be able to get complimentary parking ticket to exit the hotel. Reason being, you are parking at Raffles City Shopping Centre basement carpark and they have nothing to do or have any agreement with the hotel. You will end up paying around SGD24 for an overnite park. That's ridiculous! They should really work something out. So far I've stayed at alot of hotels in Singapore but this is the only hotel where you can't get complimentary parking.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for touring”
Reviews.Author: NoOneWillAnswer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at end of New Year for Chingay Parade (have previously stayed at sister hotel The Fairmont). For us, excellent location for transportation, for sights & restaurants within walking distance, for access to the Raffles shopping complex, for signing privileges at all three hotels, not far from parade stands. Good pool (should stay open later), great views. Our room was freshly furnished, everything clean and everything worked. Every staff member we encountered was genuinely helpful and competent. Buffet breakast one morning at Kopi Tiam, varied items incl made-to-order -- that was our only in-house food purchase. Alert & attentive lobby security. Definitely recommend this hotel, I'd call it first-class, not luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, loved it”
Reviews.Author: Kushkins
Reviews.Content: The hotel has the perfect location with a mall almost a part of the hotel. The spa is excellent and the facilities are very well maintained. Loved my stay here and will recommend this on any day.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend for leisure, but not for business”
Reviews.Author: jujSF
Reviews.Content: I have very mixed feelings about this hotel. Overall, I would not stay here again on business travel, but I would recommend it for leisure travel. The primary reason being the poor accesibility to the internet. The rooms only have wired broadband connections, and my colleagues and I all experienced slow network speeds and unreliable service (the connection would occasionally drop out). The only wireless access is in the hotel lobby cafe, which is very dimly lit with small little tables (great for lounging but not for working!), and the network speed is only slightly better than what I had in my room. Four of my colleagues stayed at the hotel, and we all had rooms of varying quality. As other reviewers have noted, some of the rooms are in need of refurbishing. My first room had very dated furniture (reminded me more of a Howard Johnson, complete with teal-colored vinyl headboard) and a slightly mildewy bathroom -- not what you would expect at an "upscale" business hotel. My toilet had some issues (dirty water would drain into it over the course of a few hours, while I was away at work or overnight), so I requested to switch rooms. They were fairly accomodating about this, and my new room was renovated, and quite a bit nicer and more comfortable. However, the desk was cramped into a corner, all the more noticeable as I had to sit there much longer than I would like due to the slow network speed and reliability issues noted above. Positive aspects of the hotel -- the location is great, right next to the City Hall MRT stop, and attached to the Raffles City mall. The mall has fantastic restaurants in the basement along with a decent food court upstairs, and plenty of stores for necessary and uncessary shopping ;-). The rooftop bar is also worth checking out -- the views are really amazing, even as someone who's lived in Singapore for months it was still a treat. Again, if you are here on vacation, this would probably be a very enjoyable hotel, but if you are here on business and expect to work from the hotel, I would suggest finding a different hotel -- there are plenty to choose from!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, well located with great service”
Reviews.Author: TassieExpat
Reviews.Content: We checked in after a disastrous experience at another hotel and from the moment we arrived the service was superlative. The room was large and roomy and the bed kingsize with a lovely view of the city and parts of the river. The housemaid we were allocated was wonderful, service above and beyond the call of duty we thought and every experience we had with staff was pleasurable, the service levels are very high. The location was great - about 15 minutes walk to many things we wished to see, an MRT underneath and plenty shopping beneath this hotel with supermarket etc. We enjoyed our stay here and would stay again with no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “nice view”
Reviews.Author: EveSingapore
Reviews.Content: Stay in Swissotel, The stamford to relaxing with family, love the hotel/room. The view was nice. Our room was 50+ storey high, the room is clean and the service is also good altot the toilet was abit small. The bed was nice to sleep on...The spa was great, will stay here again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: TravelSmurf80
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3-nights in the hotel... our room was on the 28th floor. Staff were friendly and efficient - check in was smooth and we were shown immediately to our room. The room we were in was nice and had a lovely view over the city/harbour area. My only small complaint is no complimentary water in the room - the Fiji water in there is charged at a rate of $11 Singapore Dollars! I didn't eat breakfast/dinner in the hotel so cannot comment on the restaurants there. Pool area is nice - it wasn't too crowded while we were there and it has a pool bar which serves lunch, etc... check out was easy - although they did try to charge us for 5 drinks from the mini-bar that we had not had, when we disputed this they promptly removed them from our bill without question. Hotel is located in the center and is attached to a mall and an MRT station. I'll stay there again...

Reviews.Title: “Think twice!”
Reviews.Author: Critik
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is central and is probably its best asset. The Reception staff and porters were very helpful. All the hotel staff were good. However, the first room we were allocated on the 38th floor was in dire need of refurbishment with the bathroom of 3 star standard. After pointing this out to the Duty Manager he moved us to the 55th floor where the rooms had been refurbished. The bedroom was large and well equiped with a fantastic view of the harbour. Unfortunately, though the bathroom was much better it was very small for a 5 star hotel. We only tried two of the hotel restaurants which were very average with only a fair service. Overall we were disappointed with this hotel that we thought would be one of the better ones in Singapore. We prefer the Marina Mandarin or the Mandarin Oriental. KB

Reviews.Title: “For us a memorable stay”
Reviews.Author: prever
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed this hotel very much. I booked a room on the executive floors because I wanted to be sure to have nice views. And we got them! These rooms are situated on the 57th to the 60st floor and on floor 60 there is also the executive lounge where you can have breakfast and drinks and snacks during all day long. The lounge closes at 11 PM. Check in was very fine. Moona and her collegues were very very polite and professional and Moona said that she and her collegues would do anything for us to take care for a memorable stay for us. And so she did! What a delight to be there. Always friendly, after shopping it was a nice rest point, although the executive lounge was buzzy around 6 PM.. But they made our stay wonderfull. They gave us tips about the city, if we had questions, they didn't hesitate and checked things out to help us. They were polite and professional without having too much distance. Also staff downstairs was very nice and professional. I read other reviews about the rooms that needed being refurbished. All the rooms on the executive floor are refurbished and look very elegant, so I would advise travelers to choose for an executive room if possible. In my opinion these rooms are resonably priced. Housekeeping was also perfect. They made up the room in the morning and in the evening there is turning down service but they also make up the rooms / change towels etc. again. On floor 8 there is a swimming pool and a big spa and health centre. They share it with the Fairmont hotel. Swimming pool and spa are ok, but I found the staff less friendly. But service is ok. They provide free big towels and it's nice after a buzzy city day to relax at the pool or taking a sauna. Elevators are very fast. I don't understand the complaints of other reviewers. There are express lifts for the higher floors and in no time you are on floor 40 or above. I agree with other guests of this hotel: the location and the views are a big plus. What an amazing views and the location is simply perfect. But in my opinion is it not just these two plusses. I think the hotel and it's staff is extremely fine so I will definately consider choosing a Swissotel next time again.

Reviews.Title: “Needs to be brought into the modern era”
Reviews.Author: Hollywood1973
Reviews.Content: Whilst we often stay at Swissotels worldwide I regret to say that this particular property is not up to scartch with others. I have to agree with other reviewers when they say it need upgrading. Our room a "Grand Room King" was a larger corner room with two balconies that gave us a great view of the Chinese New Year fireworks, although a little daunting standing out on the small balcony 32 floors above the ground. The room needs new furniture, I believe the furniture my late grandparents had was newer than what I had. The bed was very hard and nothing like the Swissotel beds in Europe and the worst feature was the toilet and it inability to flush properly without constant attention to the flush button. A hotel of this standard should check these things out. The service was fantastic however and made amends for the some of the shortfalls. We dined at Equinox one evening and I must say the service was great and the food lovely (however the portions were very small even for fine dining). If you want a winow seat make sure you book in advance as it does get booked out. I believe it was on the 70th level and you do get a great view from up there. If this hotel was finished off like the Swissotel Berlin then you would have a fantastic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and good service”
Reviews.Author: jidoo
Reviews.Content: ......but like others have said, the room I stayed in was in need of a new rug and probably new furnishings. Bed was very good but the bathroom was good but again not top notch given the price. I don't know about adjoining hotels in the complex but they seem less over-run by tour buses and night life post teens. If you like that stay here, if not look nearby. Overall very nice with really great, million dollar views if you get the right room and high enough.

Reviews.Title: “Go for the executive suite!”
Reviews.Author: CabraViejo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife and young son based on the positive reviews by others and actually what some others found as a negative I found as a positive. My son is well behaved and really his only requirement for a hotel is a nice pool. This left lots of options open in Singapore. Note that the pools of this hotel are shared with the hotel next door. A little odd, but the pools are nice. One pool is more for kids with a shallow side and a deep side, the other pool is all deep and is more for adults. When I saw other reviews complaining about kids on the executive floor, I thought that it sounded perfect. The executive suite at the Stamford assures a room on one of the higher floors. We were on the 40th floor and it is so cool to be able to open your sliding glass door, step out onto your balcony and look down at the pool from about 1000 feet up! We got a rollaway bed for our son at no extra charge. The executive package gives you access to the drinks and munchies during happy hour as well as breakfast in the morning. Singapore has tons of amazing food but its very convenient to stumble out of bed down the hall and eat breakfast looking out over the waterfront from so high up. And the cocktails and tapas in the evening were first rate. There is a huge shopping center in the basement and the shopping complex attaches to the subway. The only hick-up with my stay was during the check-in process. The executive package is supposed to be able to check in up on the 40th floor over a cocktail. I guess they were busy because that didn't happen, but overall it was a great stay in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure to request Smoking or Non-Smoking Room”
Reviews.Author: jda_fortune500
Reviews.Content: Booked an Executive Room on the upper floors and was looking forward to the view. Upon opening the door to the room, the worst smell of tobacco rushed out of the room. After going downstairs to change to a Non-Smoking room, I was told there were none available and the manager was bent on getting someone to 'freshen up the room'. Finally after threatening to leave the hotel, a room magically opened up! Then I heard a few under the breath comments about how I should have specified a Non-Smoking room during the booking. Actually my office booked the room for me and they were never asked! Besides the awkward treatment, the room had great views and I was impressed with the gym. Also, great access to the subway, so two-and-a-half stars rounded up to three.

Reviews.Title: “service like in russia, greedy people everywhere in singapore”
Reviews.Author: ramirannikko
Reviews.Content: old and expencive hotel, great views, 70´ floor restaurant average and even hotel guest must pay if you want "window table"

Reviews.Title: “Dated... way dated”
Reviews.Author: Travelbynecessity_10
Reviews.Content: The furnishing is very dated. The room I stayed in is not really set up with the business traveller in mind. There are few wall outlets. The ones next to the bed are hidden behind a table. The intenet is glacially slow. It is one of the slowest I have experienced and I have been in countries that are nowhere near as developed as Singapore. Even the TV remote is weird. The off button is actually the on button. The phone operator who explained it to me apologized profusively. The few strands of grass they left in a basthroom vase is brown and withered. For the price of this room, I am very disappointed. If not for the fact that the view outside the room is of a well built cityscape, I would have thought that I am in a developing country. This is a shame and an embarressment.

Reviews.Title: “3 thumbs up!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lvndrgrl
Reviews.Content: Stayed at these hotel in Dec 2009 before and after our cruise. The location was fantastic...had a great time..

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic views but needs updating”
Reviews.Author: karenbeanpole
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the tallest we've stayed in. 70 floors in all, we were on the 54th floor city view. Very helpful and friendly staff from check in to departure. Room was very dated - seems like no refurbishment has been done for a very long time. Dated but clean and mostly adequate. Telephones weren't working properly. Only had 1 bedside table on one side, the other had none which was rather inconvenient. We were only there 1 night, and booked in there for the novelty of the height and we weren't disappointed. Go to the bar on the 70th floor - you don't need to buy a drink to take photos or just look at the view (you pay a premium for drinks up there). Probably will not return as there are plenty of hotels in Singapore better than this for the same money. We paid S$265 inclusive of tax for 1 night. Good experience though.

Reviews.Title: “Well situated and comfortable modern hotel with great views and excellent facilities”
Reviews.Author: LizaC-Medlar
Reviews.Content: The hotel was well situated - a 15 minute walk from the riverside restaurant areas; above/next to a large shopping centre with an excellent basement food court; across the road from Raffles; and handy for the SIA hop-on tour bus. All the staff were very friendly and helpful Our executive suite was all that one could expect from a large modern hotel, with a spacious seating and desk area by picture windows with a stunning view over the Singapore river. We took full advantage of the executive lounge for inclusive breakfast, afternoon biscuits and small cakes; evening cocktails, and internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious!! I can rickroll in my room :)”
Reviews.Author: asimplejazzlover
Reviews.Content: Swissotel is a great hotel. The thing I like most about the hotel is their extensive breakfast and their spacious rooms. The bathrooms are also very clean and spacious. Love the gym, spa, swimming pool, everything!! Get a room in the higher floor and you'll be amazed by the Singapore skyline at night. It is the tallest hotel in Singapore. The hotel is centrally located in the business district areas. Just above the metro station, Cityhall. So it is convenient to move around from the hotels to major attractions in Singapore. Try Equinox, the restaurant on top of the hotel. It serves a gooooood steak. And a glass of red wine while you enjoy the magnificent view from your seat. But this hotel can be very crowded during check in, especially in the day. Expect long queues, it would be better if the staff can sweep the lines faster. Other than that, I have nothing to argue.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more for the money”
Reviews.Author: Adam079
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a two night stopover in Singapore on return from India. We were travelling with a 5 year old so wanted somewhere with a little luxury, that would hopefully make our stay easy. We arrived off an overnight flight, and the staff were welcoming on arrival. We were informed we could take a 17th floor room, and when we asked if there were any higher, we were told we could wait for a 55th floor room to become available, so we agreed. On completing check-in formalities, it was necessary to remind the staff that we had a late check out (as printed on the reservation voucher), and we were asked for a $200 'amenities' deposit. Having lost a credit card in an ATM outside the Taj Mahal, not having changed money when arriving as we were heading to a fully booked and paid luxury hotel and having one emergency debit card left that I was unsure of the balance of, it would've been nice to have some warning of this requirement for check in. Of course, the hotel would gladly hold on to $200 cash until I checked out... After this was sorted out, I gently reminded the check in staff about the extra bed we had paid for through our travel agent and was advised to call the concierge to organise it myself. I know I sound like I must be carrying on about the smallest things here, but don't you pay this much so these things are dealt with and your experience is relatively hassle free? The room was newly refurbished and was fantastic. The view was an outstanding panoramic view of Singapore. However it took two phone calls to the concierge to get a rollaway bed. The luggage that was brought to our room wasn't ours. Again, more small things that you wouldn't expect to happen in this price bracket. They didn't in most of the hotels we stayed in while in India - and they were a fraction of the price. The complimentary breakfast in Cafe Swiss was quite honestly awful. You are better off heading to one of the food courts in a mall for decent food! To the hotel's credit, I did advise them of these issues in an online survey that they asked me to complete after our stay and they returned an email apologising and promising they would look in to it. I hope so, because I would really like to stay here again - but only for the view!

Reviews.Title: “Great view, will be back!”
Reviews.Author: travel_bugs_1975
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel with our 2 toddlers aged 1.5 & 2.5yrs, I was a little nervous booking this place with 2 such little ones. When we arrived we were very quickly checked in, given and upgrade and a longer checkout time, our bags were bought up quickly and overall a great first impression was made. We were upgraded to a king, corner suite which had ample space, a large bathroom and two balconies, the view was spectacular. The air conditioning was needed and did the job, the drapes blocked out the sun, great for nap times and we never heard another person walking the halls. The buffet breakfast had a large variety and staff were very patient with the my two who wanted to feed themselves! I will be coming back to stay here, we were very impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: unwired77
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Stanford a number of times now when working in Singapore and overall it is a very good hotel in an excellent location. The only drawback i have found is that some of the rooms are a little dated and could do with an update. However the views, particularly on the higher levels, are amazing, the breakfast is excellent and the staff are always helpful and courteous. I would recommend it for tourists and business visitors alike.

Reviews.Title: “must visit the restauarant on 70 floor”
Reviews.Author: puru24
Reviews.Content: well its a nicely built building but looks like 2000 types. it is really huge. got around 70 floors, i liked dining at 70 floor with music and my mate with candle lit and peeping out to the whole lit up city. u are with ur friend move right to the bar and more sophisticated dining move left to another restaurant. lifts are very fast. 70 floor to ground floor in 30 seconds flat. am sure ur ears too with feel the fall. and ya dress code is must to enter here. and there is extra charge for city view table but worth it. stay and all are ok, maybe coz its a old structure so dont expect too much out of it. enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Executive Club floor not woth the extra cost”
Reviews.Author: David_Albert_Park
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in Dec/Jan 2010 over NYE. The view of the fireworks was great and the room was good but the Club facilities on Level 60 were very poor. The first problem is even getting a seat in the lounge. We arrived on our first night at 8.45pm & there was just two seats free at a table of four. All the remaining chairs - about 50 - were taken & the seats & table were pushed very close together. We tried again on the second night but at 5.15PM, drinks served from 5PM, same problem. No seats & very crowded. We gave up after this and prefered to go to a proper bar and pay for our drinks & avoid people squeezing past all the time. Club floor members are meant to get special check in facilities. When we arrived they were busy and we were just given our key on the ground floor & found our own way to the room. Unlike some other reviewers we were happy with our room. Bathroom was not large but had everything we needed although I hate having the shower over a bath tub rather than a proper walk in shower. When we arrived in our room at 7.30PM there were two staff members still cleaning it. However they omited to check behind the curtains were we found a empty drink bottle. The lounge had free wifi plus two internet terminals. Because of the crowding we witnessed a lound dispute between other guests over prolonged use of the internet computer. Perhaps more terminals would solve this problem or the abilioty to hire a laptop from the hotel. Overall the extra for the Club room was not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “The best view of Singapore”
Reviews.Author: ewan20s
Reviews.Content: Couldn't ask for a better hotel in Singapore. The best view of Singapore, great location and efficient staff. I would rather stay here again than somewhere in the Orchard Road area. Walking distance to Clark Quay. Didn't know that Raffles Hotel is just around the corner. Dont forget to try the legendary Singapore Sling there.. Glad we chose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Esboare
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with stunnig views across the city. Rooms are a bit oldish but very clean. Service was excellent and the location very good. You should absolutely try the restaurants in 70.-72.nd floor!

Reviews.Title: “Fab Stay !”
Reviews.Author: NainaSingh
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay at Swissotel The Stamford. I've been there twice and have returned all smiles with their service . I like it all the more because of the location. There's an MRT station & a shopping mall adjacent to it and a Starbucks too =) The food was good too. I would recommend the hotel to whoever is willing to pay the extra bucks.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location - very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: videlslki
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a 3 day business trip. Location couldn't be better, bang in the middle of it all, easy access to everything and just about 20 minutes or so to the airport. Check-in and check-out smooth enough. All other enquiries well answered and with a smile. Laundry correct and on time. Rooms: I had a very nice, modern corner room or junior suite on the 55th floor, lots of space and a comfy bed. Great bathroom, good full range of no-nonsense Swissotel amenities. Very clean. Room was good value, breakfast excellent if a little "train-station" busy (as was the lobby all the time....busy. Bar drinks are very expensive and the bar/club at the top floor (71st floor) was, well, boring to be honest. Drab music, drinks at the top end of the price range (no real problem with that but then at least make sure the music has a bit of zing) and the overall atmosphere uninspiring, so left pretty quickly in search of something more interesting outside. That aside, it was an excellent stay. Particularly impressed by the tall young lady in Guest Relations whose name escapes me but she was very helpful and always around the lobby. I have stayed in Swissotels all over (Moscow, Zurich, Berlin, Dusseldorf...), this one is great and up there with the Moscow one.

Reviews.Title: “TOP!”
Reviews.Author: LindaLeiden
Reviews.Content: Great location, in the middle of the colonial district, in a shopping mall, great views, beautiful pool, good bar on the 70th floor, good rooms, good beds, friendly staff, 24 hr Mc Donalds and Starbucks around the corner, above the MRT station. What else need I to say? It is our favorite hotel in Singapore. Ask for a high floor room.

Reviews.Title: “Great views from the hotel”
Reviews.Author: gudiya99
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels i ever stayed in. The views of the Singapore skyline from the room was incredible and so was the bar on the top floor. There was a great mall just outside the hotel and the MTR station was below the hotel only. The food was great and so was the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Really Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: GazPerth
Reviews.Content: There is no doubt that the Swissotel Stamford is in a great location. It's in the large Raffles City mall, has direct access to the MRT and is linked to a number of underground walkways and malls. Its right next door to the historic Raffles hotel and has views of the harbour which are spectacular. As a business traveller I stopped staying at the Swissotel a while ago because I felt the rooms were no longer up to scratch. But after seeing the refurbished rooms on the internet I though I would give the hotel another go. But was dissappointed to find myself in a room which I think is well below requirements for a hotel like this. I didnt accept the room and asked to be moved into a refurbished room as appears on the website. After a long delay I was sent off to another room, only to find myself again in a room that hasn't seen an upgrade in 10 years. The view was great, but the room wasnt. So if your not staying in a refurbished room then be prepared to put up with an extremely tired room that leaves a lot to be desired. From my experience this means stained carpets, old damaged furniture and a 1970' s bathroom. Not the end of the world I guess as the room is still clean and functional and given the location this may be of little importance to many. But dont expect quality. For me, the dissappointed is that I expect to get what's advertised and what I was given was far from that. Even after requesting a room change, I still didnt get it, even as a Club Swiss Gold member. So I'm afraid the Singapore hotel has lost me again.

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed my stay - thank you”
Reviews.Author: TheGeez
Reviews.Content: My first port of call on a far east tour from UK was Singapore. I arrived early in the morning after the 13 hour flight and pre arranged a room to be made available for me. No problems there. I was warmly greeted at the door and by check in staff. ..quick check-in at desk .. free upgrade, immediate help with luggage and I was in my room within 10 minutes.. I have read some previous reports about the condition of the rooms....I can only speak for myself by my room was clean and roomy ...had everything that I needed in there...view over the harbour was fantastic. I had room service twice...both times they arrived promptly ...food was hot...and quality was good ! General cleanliness of hotel was good. I stayed there for 4 nights and didn't have one gripe... breakfast was varied and plentiful... staff couldn't do more to help me with any queries I had and arrangements i needed. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone - business, family or couples!

Reviews.Title: “love the room, but ...”
Reviews.Author: banyuwangi
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel from Oct 28th-Nov 1st. All i can say is that the room was great and clean. I didn't try the pool, but from my window it looked really tempting.The view was really nice.... from my 22nd floor room, really indulged on it! Not an everyday scene you get everyday from your window. One downfall was that the room didn't get any free internet connection, so my Husband had to pay SGD 28/day. Well it was worth it, because we had some business back home that required us to use the internet. A lot of Qantas Flight member crew were staying there also. They seem to be a regular customer. Overall, we loved our stay... loved the breakfast...loved the convenient location near the MRT(plus plus plus). Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic views”
Reviews.Author: Libbo03
Reviews.Content: A very convenient location. Wonderful views of Singapore from the upper floors. A most comfortable and relaxing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Club room, great view, very tired otherwise”
Reviews.Author: traveller_in_oz
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights recently in a Club Room on Level 69 at the Swissotel Stamford. View was fantastic. Bed and in-room amenities, including bathroom, showing their age and very dusty in some parts of the cupboard. A packet of M&M's in the fridge had grown mould. A hot club breakfast would leave a lot to be desired - but for simple cereal and toast, it was fine. Staff hospitality was very good. Stay for the view and the location, not the room itself.

Reviews.Title: “Hardest bed in the world!!”
Reviews.Author: TheKsNewcastle
Reviews.Content: We had a 26 hour stopover in Singapore on the way back from Thailand where we had 2 weeks for our honeymoon. It was my new husbands birthday so I wanted it to be special. We had visited the New Asia Bar (which is impressive) on the 70th floor of the Stamford 3 yrs earlier during a world trip, so I though it would be nice to stay there. Check in was ok and we got vouchers (through Singapore Airlines) for 50% of breakfast...just as well as it would of cost over £20 each for some fruit and scrambled eggs! The room was disaponting..decor was very 80s, mould and mildew around the bath and shower, other than that it seemed clean enough. All we wanted was a good nights kip before the long day the next day..we werent flying back to the UK untill midnight the next day and needed to be well rested.....my husband got about 4 hours sleep and i got around 3..the bed was so hard it was like sleeping on the floor..correction..the floor was softer I know coz that were I ended up! I had to use the spare pillows and create a make shift matteress! at 2am I did think about calling reception but I would be really unhappy if I got moved and ALL the beds were that bad! Hubby prefers a firmer bed but OMG it was just so hard. On check out I mentioned the uncomfortable nights sleep and all I got was 'thanks for the feedback' so we spent the next 13 hours yawning!! The good point was free use of the Hospitaily Suite to freshen up before our bus came for us at 8.30pm.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great place”
Reviews.Author: DelBoy1203
Reviews.Content: After a long flight from South Africa and a short transfer from the airport, arriving at The Stamford was like arriving in heaven. First the glorious air conditioning, the warm welcome, the quick check-in, the free upgrade, a free breakfast (because our flight was early and our room wasn't ready) then the help with luggage and our small kids. Our room was fantastic. Our breakfast was just what we needed. The pool was inviting. Would definitely recommend this hotel. To anyone - business, family or couples!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: luvofholidays
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and thought it was worth every penny. We were picked up from the airport. We had great service from the start. For a big hotel they still managed to make the service very personable. We stayed on the executive floor and this was great. From 5-8 they served nibbles and drinks which we met some lovelly people for good conversation. We thought this was very good value. Alcoholic drinks are very expensive in Singapore and we found that we would go up to the lounge enjoy the view with a couple of glasses of wine. Breakfast was also very good which was included. Lucky enough we travelled with our baby and people seemed to love how well behaved our 5 1/2 month baby was!! Our room was on floor 59th with a great view of the harbour and city. The big sliding doors were able to capture this great view - not for people scared of heights but we loved it! We could totally black out our room for an afternoon nap which we always loved with a great flat screem TV! Would definatley stay here again. Also stayed at the Raffles across the road which I will write a review for as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, ExecutiveFloor is just GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: NorwegianTraveler
Reviews.Content: I spent 8 nights on the 58 level. Second time at this property and I will return. On this trip I had two bookings first here at the Stamford then 3 nights at InterContinental (in a ClubRoom) I should have made only one booking at the Stamford! Better service, better rooms, bigger flat screen tv, an espresso machine from Lavazza and the Executive Lounge at the Stamford are smaller in size but have more tables and better food. This hotel also have a GREAT SPA very nice pool area. And in the Executive Lounge there is FREE WiFi. On my second night at about 11 pm the AC in my room was dead (that can happen) the handyman came and he told me that the engine was dead. He said it would take about one to two hours to fix it so I should get another room. I did not look forward to pack all my belongings in the middle of the night, but the wonderful staff at the Executive Lounge provided me with another room just for the night and promissed that by the afternoon the next day the AC should be working. So I left my stuff and passed a few doors before I came to my "one night" room. The next morning when I returned to my room at about 8 am the AC was working. During the night the AC had been fixed. That is what I call service. I have read reviews stating that the rooms are outdated. I have stayed in 3 rooms at this hotel and they all looked like the picture on the swissotel's web page except for one thing this year, the flat screen TV was a lot larger than the one in the picture. I really enjoy this place!

Reviews.Title: “Great location,”
Reviews.Author: eowl
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located above the MRT (underground railway City Hall station). To and from the Changi Airport, the cheapest way is to take MRT (around fare SGD1.75) and you can avoid bad weather and traffic jam. All the way has air-conditioning and lift to allow you to go with your luggage easily and comfortably. The staff at the lobby is professional and warm. The check-in process was smooth and my room was at 24th floor. When I opened the door, I was surprised that the room was larger than I expected. Verything was clean and tidy. The bathroom had everything you need and the large glass window in the balcony allow you to enjoy the fantastic night view of the Marina Bay. The desk provide a good working area. Three sockets beside the desk are enough to plug notebook PC and other chargers like mobile, digital camera etc. There are two food court near the hotel, one at the basement and the other at the 3rd floor of the shopping mall to let you try various types of food. There is one supermarket at the basement provide you all drinks and snacks. The first comment I would like to make is the internet. It is not free and my three days access charged me SGD89.88 which was too expensive. With the widely use of internet to book tickets and check-in for the air-ticket in Singapore, the charge would be a negative image. Nowadays, most of the hotels provide free internet access especially the one serving business customers. I think the management should solve this problem. I would prefer to choose another hotel next time because internet is now a must to me to keep in touch with my friends in facebook and email telling them what I saw and ate instantly. Secondly, the temperature of the air-cond in the room was too cold even I set it to low fan and warmer. Sometimes, I had to open the door of balcony to get some warm air. Bring your own cloth if you are sensitive to the temperature. The breakfast was included in the rate of room and it was served at Cafe Swiss (2nd floor). It provides different choice of western, Japanese, Chinese and Malayian. The roof is very high and amply sunshine coming in through the glass make you feel awake in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Spot on location but not without its disappointing side”
Reviews.Author: UKflightattendant
Reviews.Content: If it's an excellent location in Singapore you're after, then the Swissotel Stamford can surely be hard to beat; it's easily accessed, (and accessible), and makes a stay here much easier, whether you're visitng for business, pleasure, or a mixture of both. As with some previous viewers, I stay here as it is the accommodation selected by my company and as such I, (a) have no choice over where I stay and, (b), can't reasonably comment on the room rates and their value for money. However, as has also been noted, the Swissotel does seem to revel in charging - and quite exorbitantly - for a lot of services which are (becoming) standard, complementary features of properties of this standard, and without necessarily providing a quality which reflects the price! Internet access is, these days, becoming a necessity for business travellers and a definite deal-breaker with leisure travellers, too, who make use of internet communications to keep in touch while away - so access should not be so expensive, (if there is any charge at all!) Guests who don't wish to fork out for room service or meals in the restaurant should remember the food court in the basement of the adjacent mall, where there is a wide selection of eateries along with a very handy supermarket where you can purchase snacks and beverages which can be stored in the minibar in the room. The food court seems to stay open quite late, (though I've no idea of the exact times), and should you hit Singapore during the monsoons, you don't even need to go outside - fantastic! Accommodations at the hotel are large and airy, with nice high ceilings and plenty of space, (I can't recall ever being allocated a twin-bedded room, but presume some of this sense of space may be lost in order to accommodate two beds). There is a generously-sized wardrobe, (with plenty of hangers!), which also houses the in-room safe and iron and ironing board, and is where you'll find your bathrobes and slippers, (always a nice touch!) A small minibar contains all the usual sundries; I can't comment on the pricing as I never go near the things, (except to empty them out and restock with my own purchases - something which you can do here as it is not one of those hideous electronic things!), but previous reviews seem to think it is expensive - so head to the supermarket downstairs for supplies. The generously-sized king bed is flanked by two nightstands with individual lamps. On one of the nightstands is a secondary telephone and an electronic panel which controls the lighting and a/c in the room, and also acts as an alarm clock. There is the ubiqutous, oversized, flatscreen TV opposite the bed which dominates the room somewhat and seems incongruous within a décor which is very dated and stuck in a late eighties-early nineties timewarp! There is a preponderance of wood (effect) furniture that does nothing to lighten the room, which is otherwise done-out in very safe and sedate shades of browns, beiges and greens, (including a distinctly utilitarian looking carpet which I cannot help but feel needs a jolly good deep clean!) Looking at some of the Swissotel's own publicity material, my room looks nothing like that featured, (do they ever?!) The balcony is appreciated; though the humidity levels might prevent you from lingering too long, it is good to be able to get some 'fresh' air from time to time and appreciate some fine city views, especially at night. This hotel is large - both in terms of size and capacity - so guests have to expect the usual pluses and minuses that this brings. It functions around-the-clock and is well-equipped for dealing with conference guests and large groups. However, this does mean that it gets busy in public areas and, personally, I find it hard to ever feel 'at home' - it's a relief to get in my room sometimes! Service from staff can be very hit-and-miss, I'm afraid; I have had far more 'sour faces' behind the front desk than I am used to in hotels and while the service itself is usually fine - what needs doing gets done - it is hard to feel valued as a guest, and a customer, when there is little warmth displayed. The Stamford is not inherently bad, and indeed, many visitors will love it, I am sure. I just can't help feeling that it is resting on its laurels a little, (as a lot of hotels of this size and standing do), sure and certain in the knowledge that they will consistently achieve secure occupancy rates without offering the extras, and standards, which their competitors are providing. Rooms need an overhaul, but I can't see this happening anytime soon unfortunately. I don't know what the rates are like at this place but I would suggest that anyone considering the hotel have a good look around and see what is being offered at comparative properties elsewhere in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, disappointed no free internet access.”
Reviews.Author: Cleo002
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights on the way back from Japan. I chose the Swissotel from an internet deal on their website. A good overall deal that included breakfast. We had a lovely room on the 50th floor with the most amazing views. Breakfast on the 70th floor was a real treat as was the breakfast, I lost count of the range of dishes. The location was perfect for sightseeing being above the City Hall MRT. This gave us access to just about everywhere we wanted to go. Also getting around on foot was easy. Our room was spacious and of a suitable standard. Access to the wellness spa and pool was a definite plus, particularly in the afternoon after a day of sightseeing in the hot/humid Singapore weather. The only real downside was to have to pay for internet access after three weeks of free access in many other hotels. I would expect in these times, and given the the generally high standard of the hotel, that free internet access should be standard in every room.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it here”
Reviews.Author: tweenshopper
Reviews.Content: Loved my 4-night stay here with my husband and 2 kids. We stayed in a Grand Room at the 28th floor, a corner room that was almost 2 times the size of a standard/deluxe room. It had a king-sized bed and a separate area for the living room which had a big LCD TV, and still a separate area for the workdesk. It also had two balconies...with windows that spanned from ceiling to floor...giving us a great view of Singapore 24/7 One balcony particularly faced the Singapore Flyer and Espalanade! Best of all, our room was renovated, so it had a simple, neat, stylish, modern feel that was perfect. The kids just loved running around the big space we had, which they called "our small home". The room and bathroom were kept satisfyingly clean by the staff. Just some minor issues with the bathroom: (1) The toilet bowl had some bits of stain that stayed there despite the everyday cleaning. (2) The glass enclosure of the combined shower/bathtub was just halfway through the bathtub so if you turned on the shower strong enough, the water would sprinkle outside the tub, leaving the bathroom floor wet. Beyond that, we really appreciated the fact that the toilet supplies were religiously replenished everyday, with the staff giving us 4 sets of hand towels, face towels and bath towels everyday, enough for the entire family. Daily Buffet Breakfast (which was included in our rate) at the Cafe Swiss was good too, with a wide selection of food from Continental, Chinese, Japanese, Indian and kid-friendly dishes. Our young kids ate for free too, so that was one extra that I also loved. Only one improvement area is that they should try changing more dishes from day-to-day so that there could be more variety if you eat there daily. Staff was always courteous and accomodating everywhere..be it at the reception, restaurant or housekeeping. In fact, if you wandered around the reception area, someone was sure to approach you with a smile and ask you if you need anything that they can help you with. Customer Service is surely another thing that this hotel can be proud of! Finally, location is a plus, being attached to the City Hall MRT Station and to the Raffles City Shopping Center. The latter though is a high-end mall, so don't expect to do most of your shopping here if you are looking for a lot of bargain items. The mall has many decent eating areas too, a well-stocked supermarket and a couple of pharmacy shops...so pretty much everything you need is right at your doorstep. Net, my family loved our stay here and this hotel will be on the top of our list for our next visit to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: Tygaman
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located above the City Hall MRT station meaning the MRT from Changi Airport stops right underneath the hotel and that all the areas of the city are easily accessible. The hotel is an easy walk from Merlion Park, Raffles Hotel, the Colonial District and Esplanade - Theatres By The Bay making it ideal for sightseeing. Raffles City Shopping Centre is also underneath the hotel and has a food court on the 3rd floor for good, cheap local food. Our room was a harbour view room on the 31st floor which had fantastic views over Marina Bay, the Padang, Colonial District, CBD and Merlion Park from the balcony. The room itself was large by Asian standards and most importantly it was quiet at night with no noise from neighbouring rooms heard at all. The bed was very hard, but that is normal for Asia. Breakfast, which was included in our rate, was excellent with two restaurants offering breakfast in the mornings from 6-11am meaning you never had to wait for a table. On the last morning the breakfast was moved to the restaurant on the 70th floor which had amazing views around to Clarke Quay and Fort Canning Hill. The pool was probably just ok, the pool closest to the Swissotel was really shallow and used by children with the other pool near the Fairmont Hotel being a bit deeper and more useful for adults. There was a poolside bar with drinks and snacks but we didn't use it. We did not eat at any of the hotel restaurants preferring to eat at foodcourts or local restaurants in Purvis Street as the food is much cheaper at these places. The staff were always friendly and helpful throughout our stay and we would definitely stay here again if in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, views and staff”
Reviews.Author: NYSAILORGAL
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough about this location - right on top of Singapore's transit system, malls, restaurants and siteseeing hot spots. You can walk or ride subway to nearly everywhere in Singapore from this location. Great views of city -- pay a little extra (20.00 USD) and get a corner room, for the bigger room and double windows views of Singapore. The hotel is very clean, neat and constantly striving for the best. The staff was fabulous, well versed in the local area and had lots of recommendations for eating outside of the hotel area. There is a great day spa and fitness center that is shared with another hotel --- the services are amazing and very affordable. The two hotels are joined at the pool area, which also serves an amazing breakfast buffet at the outdoor restaurant area.

Reviews.Title: “BAD to WORSE.”
Reviews.Author: Captivemarket
Reviews.Content: As I stay at the Swissotel alot for work I have no choice of accomodation. I LOVE the large rooms, and the friendly smiles from the staff in the Foyer, but it is starting to stop there. Over my last 5 visits, the minibar in my room has gone from FULL to pratically EMPTY. I make a list of what is NOT in the Minibar and take it down to Reception only to receive a a icy response (like I've eaten and drank EVERYTHING!!!!). The Air conditioning is foul, always either too HOT or too COLD and it is NEVER fixed......EVER! Black hairs in my Bed(s) EVERYTIME. Faint smell of cigarette, even in NON-SMOKING rooms. Access to Shopping Centre near Group Check-In is now closed, which is ridiculous. Prices in the Room Service Menu are OUT OF THIS WORLD, as are prices across the board. SGD$6 for a can of coke is BAD. Menu Selection after 11pm is pathetic to say the least. Men's Sauna/Gym needs (BETTER) Security, as there is ALOT of negative and dirty activity going on. Heterosexual men take NOTE!!! Alot of Airline crew stay here and there is alot of noise at ALL HOURS, in rooms, in hallways, in elevators. Great views. Pool area is nice. Foyer staff standing around are great. Housekeeping always Happy and welcoming. Rooms are in desperate need of an update.

Reviews.Title: “EVERYTHING IS GREAT”
Reviews.Author: riccollectionz
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel! We were upgraded from standard room to executive room upon arrival, how cool was that? The location is really a plus factor if you're attending a convention to Raffles Convention Centre since it's located in one compound. There's a huge selection for breakfast too! Not to forget the staff--- great service! Definitely, I would love to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Service terrible - great view”
Reviews.Author: janolaf
Reviews.Content: Pretty much the only thing to say of nice things about this hotel is the view. As a frequent business traveler, this hotel will not do much to accommodate late arrival of airplanes, letters stating detailed expenses needed for reimbursement. Asking for a letter stating the daily cost will not be done by the staff. There are lots of hotel options in the area and for a business traveler Pan Pacific is a better option with larger and newer rooms and much nicer and bigger bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but great views from the balcony.”
Reviews.Author: Whitefield-Traveller
Reviews.Content: When we visited singapore last year, I wanted my children to have a first hand view of singapore on the first day. I zeroed in on Swissotel the Stamford in Raffles Square. Booked the rooms in advance thru their website. We travelled by tigerairways from Bangalore and reached singapore early in the morning. Hired a taxi and drove directly to swissottel. Check in took time. About 1 hour. Waited patiently since we had arrived early. The junior staff at the front desk was reviewing and reviewing his computer screen. Finally after talking to his manager he did arrange for early check in without any extra cost at around 8:00 AM. We were quite tired but the breathtaking views you get from the balcony did refresh us. Overall the service was good. Value for money? not sure. I would recommend stay here for a day for the great views it offers which is a wonderful sight in itself. You can also see some wonderful cars parked near the hotel lobby most of the time!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Customer Service, Too!”
Reviews.Author: lew0409
Reviews.Content: We really didn't know what to expect when we arrived at 1am after a nineteen hour flight! But, everyone at the hotel was really friendly, and willing to help. They even had people standing around, and if you were looking around like you didn't know where to go, they would ask if they could help you. The location is very convenient to quite a bit, like the Merlion, the Chjimes, and many other areas of interest, including shopping. This town is a shoppers paradise, and the hotel is situated over an underground mall that is connected via tunnels to other malls. There is an entire network of malls and shopping that are all underground, and if you don't like the humidity, you can spend most of your time underground. However, I wouldn't recommend staying underground, because the sites and scenes are too interesting to pass up. There is the Singapore Flyer, which gives you a good view and historical context of the city. Don't rent a car, though, because the amount you will spend in one week in cabs won't even come close to renting a car! The hotel always has taxis waiting (no matter the time of day), but make sure that if you need to use a credit card, you ask ahead of time. Also, DON"T tip the cabby! If they give you more than just a pick up and drop off, a tip isn't expected. If you do tip, you shouldn't give them more than one Singapore dollar. I would recommend this city and this hotel to anyone that is looking to stay in a convenient location with high attention to customer service. My only regret is that I couldn't take them back to the US where we don't get this level of customer service any longer, even at some of the higher priced hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore”
Reviews.Author: anjiehoney
Reviews.Content: Catch up with local friends. Great service, assisted me with transportation to find firends homes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Locations, Great View but Aged Rooms”
Reviews.Author: suitejoe
Reviews.Content: Do not trust the pictures you see on their websites. Our rooms are also considered renovated but still looks a little aged. Apart from that beds are comfortable and the views are amazing! Pools are always crowded wif childrens! So didn't use the pool at all. But shopping is convenient n staffs are friendly n professional. Had the harbourview during National Day fireworks. It was simply amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience and end to a great holiday”
Reviews.Author: Parkerz
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this hotel. We got a great deal on a Stamford Crest Suite and it did not disappoint. The staff were fantastic and looked after our every need. The team are so professional it seemed we had a team of people just looking after us for the entire stay. As honeymooners we were given room 6556 which i must say has the best view of Singapore an if you're GP fan, you could see the whole track from both of the balconies....what a sight!!! We loved every minute of our stay, our private "living room" for breakfast and evening cocktails were great, as was our hotel suite itself. Let's not forget the private gym...a nice way to workout without anyone else around...all the while taking in the view of Singapore from the 65th floor!!! The team are to be commended with a special mention to Polly, our concierge, who personally made sure we got everything we needed, when we needed it......even a Toblerone cocktail at midnight and some last minute bubble wrap to help us pack all of our extra shopping!!! A definite must if you want a perfect holiday.....great shopping, great location, geat food and exceptional service. We'll definitely be staying again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great location / friendly, warm and efficient staff”
Reviews.Author: catondmoon
Reviews.Content: Being located in the Suntec area, it is an ideal location especially for tech / gadget enthusiasts like me. Funan Square is just less than 10 minutes away by foot, a 5 story mall is located under the hotel with a food mall, well stocked supermarket and specialty stores. There are 2 other malls within walking distance. The view at night is incredible, the harbor, Singapore flyer, Esplanade ( just across the street ) and St. Andrew's are best seen at night. The rooms are clean, the staff efficient and warm. My only problem is that being a really large hotel, it does take a while to get to your room especially if your room is located on the other side of each floor's one and only lift lobby. And for a high class hotel, the TV set is just a small old fashioned TV, just no sure if it was 17 or 21 inches. But since you'd be out most of the time, I guess the TV size, doesn't really matter. I'd definitely wouldn't mind staying in STS the next time I'm in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location Dated Rooms”
Reviews.Author: EdinburghGraemekidd
Reviews.Content: Large city centre hotel.Busy lobby area.Attentive service from staff.Rooms dated need udating,but have balconys and most rooms have great views.Room service good and all the dining options available in hotel good.Hotel attatched to large shopping mall which has excellant dining options if you prefer.Two large pools and excellant gym and spa.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Room Amenities”
Reviews.Author: andricScotland
Reviews.Content: For location, particularly if you like F1 racing and shopping, you can't beat The Stamford. The hotel sits sit alongside the F1 night race track and has a shopping mall adjoining the hotel. The hotel also sits alongside the City Mall underground station meaning you are only a couple of stops away from Orchard Road and its various malls. This is my second visit to The Stamford and I have been really impressed with the size of the rooms on both occassions. All rooms are spacious and extremely tidy. If you can try and book a harbour view. My only complaints would be the lack of any free wifi and the inconsistent service levels provided by staff in all parts of the hotel. Most staff were pleasant and efficient, some were exceptional (Alvin on reception), but there were equally as many that provided very poor service. We used the hotel's limo service to and from the airport and while it was an indulgence, I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “great view, great location but...”
Reviews.Author: SLTW
Reviews.Content: good upgraded to a harbour view room so outlook from the room is excellent. location is great a usual - connection to the mrt station and a pretty good shopping mall. however, room deco and service a pretty much the same as as the old time - which my colleague said "it reminded me it was the best in singapore in the 80's". fair comment.

Reviews.Title: “Very desappointing stay. Total waste of money”
Reviews.Author: huow
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at the Stamford on September 2009 === The Hotel === The hotel is located above the Raffle City mall and City Hall MRT station. Great location for a tourist: - 2 MRT lines are stopping at City Hall station. So it is easy to reach most of the sightseeing sites. - food court and restaurants are available in the Raffles City mall. - The Raffles is at door step for the famous Singapore sling, also Chijmes is at 5 min walk. The hotel is linked to the Raffles City mall, the MRT and the Fairmont. The hotel lobby looks more like a train hall than a hotel lobby: busy and noisy not peaceful at all. === The room === Got room #3924 on the 39th, a room with view over marina bay. The room was far from perfection. The room shows its age: old wallpaper with some stains on the wall over the head of the bed and on the sofa, numerous scratches on wooden parts of the furnitures and metal parts of the lights. The wooden doors of the wardrobe were dusty. Dust on the carpet below the refrigerator. Still some dust on the TV remote and phone sets: at this time of H1N1 flu these kind of devices should be better cleaned. The wardrobe contains a iron, ironing board and a safe. The safe is really big, it can easily fit two 15" laptops and there is still place in it. The issue is that 1/3rd of the keys on the keypad were inoperative: 5, 6 and 7 keys didn't work. The bathroom was also old: many stains on the marble around the sink. There is no shower cabin, shower is taken in the bathtub. The room is not soundproof: could hear doors banging somewhere the hotel, someone walking heavily on the floor above till late. Additionally there was a continuous annoying noise coming from an electric device located on the roof in the wardrobe. Not restful at all. The king-size bed that was clean and comfortable. The A/C was not too noisy. While during daytime the view over the marina is not astonishing, it becomes great at night when all the buildings are lighten: the Singapore Flyer, the Esplanade aka the durians, the Merlion, the CDB. Even the casino under construction is great. Internet is chargeable: S$28 for 24h. Can't understand why luxury hotels still charge internet connection... === Pool === There are 2 round pools on the 8th floor. They common pools shared by both the Stamford and the Fairmont so it can be hard to find an available longchair. === Service & Staff ==== On their website the Stamford claims to be a 5 star hotel but I am sceptic about this statement. I found the staff not warmful nor helpful and providing low quality of service. In the first morning at about 9:30am the male housemaid rang at the door to ask me if he could clean the room: could'nt he wait me to leave the room? What if I was still sleeping? The following days I had to remind to turn on the "Do not disturb" light. In the room I didn't have any complementary bottle of water until I request it. Noticed no turn down service.
