During the 3 days I stayed at the Stamford, I had no greetings from any of the staff member: not even a simple "hello, sir". Had the feeling of being completely ignored. At the lobby, the bell boys seems more interested to chat to each other. At the desks, the staff looked deeply concentrated on their work to notice the guests. At the swimming pool, I stayed a few minutes standing by the pool looking for the changing room. A staff member walk by, stared at me then returned to his work: no "hello, sir", no "can I help you, sir?". Same things with other staff members I encountered in corridors and elevators: they seemed just too busy to greet me. Overall I was really disappointed by my stay at the Stamford. Old room, not warmful nor helpful staff. Considering the rates at the Stamford, I won't recommed the Stamford. It was not the right hotel to splurge and was a total waste of money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - but otherwise disappointing”
Reviews.Author: celi36
Reviews.Content: The second of three hotels I stayed in. Was very excited because I got a great deal on a Club Level Room. The room was nice. Recently updated, LCD TV, all clean and new. Bathroom was very small, with shower over the bath, hotel is older than some others and I guess they are stuck with the original room sizes. Still, everything was clean and the view was amazing! Location is by far the best thing about this Hotel. Steps from the MRT, above Raffles City, across from Raffles Hotel, a great base for exploring. Pool area I found very crowded and seemed rather concrete. It was nice that they had a deeper adults pool and a shallower one for children - but the round shape was awkward for serious swimming. Club Level was a massive disappointment. The views were nice, but the room was very small and mostly tables/chairs rather than comfy seating. The staffing was a bit hit and miss, one morning I missed out on a hot drink because I could not get anyone's attention before I had to rush off to an appointment. But the biggest disappointment was the food. It is not entirely fair to compare it to the Conrad or the Ritz-Carlton because it is cheaper - but even it was not *cheap*. The hot selctions for breakfast seemed particularly unappealing - some dreadful chicken and bacon processed thing sliced like meatloaf didn't even look like real food, so other mornings I tried a croissant which was rather stale and a chicken bau which despite coming straight out the steamer was stone cold. Canapes at happy hour were rather better but there was nothing but soft drinks, coffee and rather uninspiring biscuits during the day. Might stay here again for the great location - but would go for the cheapest possible room and spend as little time in the hotel as I could. And frankly - if you just want a base I am sure there are cheaper options out there.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms with spectacular views”
Reviews.Author: FunFunction
Reviews.Content: The Stamford is a great hotel located next to the historic Raffles hotel. The building is a 72-storey high riser offering spectacular views of the waterfront and downtown areas. A shopping mall is integrated in the building and a large number of restaurants and shops are available without having to leave the building. Please make sure you visit the Equinox Restaurant on the 71st floor. It will be hard to beat this view from your dinner table!

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: kinjalnz
Reviews.Content: Since my wife made the booking i knew it''ll be good, but it was great. the check in was swift and fast no waiting at all. the room were big and views were great. staff are well trained for any question. and location is great for shopping distsance to msquare to suntech city.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: SuzanneDevon
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a stay at this hotel. This hotel boasts rooms with the best views in Singapore. After a day spent inside in air-con meetings it was a reall joy to be able to open my room windows for some fresh, albeit humid air. The location is very convenient to the subway and is a brief walk to the river and historical district. The rooms themselves are fine, relatively spacious and the cleaning staff very accomodating. Oddly however, the hotel does not have wifi in the rooms unlike many other asian hotels. I cannot say enough good things about the executive floor staff who were the epitomy of professionalism. I do have a few issues with the hotel though. 1. The elevators were quite slow. It was not uncommon to wait up to 5 minutes for an elevator in the morning. I quickly learned to allow myself extra time if I wanted to get to my meetings on time! 2. After a busy day it was quite nice to decompress and relax in the executive lounge. Relax that is UNTIL the children arrive! Unlike most other hotels I've stayed in, the Stamford allows children into their executive lounge area rendering it less 'executive' and more 'kindergarden'! How relaxing is it to watch a 10 yr old sneeze all over the canapes or a toddler careen into hapless staff or listen to a nearby temper tantrum???? 3. Not enough tables/chairs in the executive lounge. In the mornings and evenings there was a real shortage of tables and chairs. The problem could have been rectified by converting the meeting room into an expension of the lounge by opening the glass door and breaking the large table into smaller tables. Management should consider looking into this during peak periods. 4. Executive lounge implies executive work which these days requires wifi. No wifi. In summary, I recommend the hotel highly but if you are expecting the executive lounge to be an oasis of calm you should look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: michelle002
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week at the Swissotel The Stamford and couldn't have been happier with our experience. We stayed here for our second week in Singapore as we were in the process of relocating. Our first week was spent at the Copthorne Kings hotel - which was so bad that we ended up moving to the Swissotel. We arrived around 10:00 am (since we just wanted to get out of the other hotel) and they we were able to check in immediately. The service was great and the bellmen with our 8 suitcases were waiting for us when we got there. When we opened the door to our room - we were very surprised at how large it was. Our 8 huge suitcases fit in there and we barely even noticed them. We had a nice large balcony overlooking the Singapore Flyer which was great. The room was so quiet - I never heard any of our neighbors. The location was great. Very close to the City Hall MRT and connected to the Raffles City mall. There are tons of restaurants around where you can get a cheap meal (or and expensive meal if you want). We went to the New Asia bar one night during Happy hour and the view was amazing. And prices weren't too bad. We ordered food there too which was great. We'll definitely be taking visitors there for happy hour! The gym was really nice - new machines and lots of TVs. The pools were nice - not great, but we weren't really spending that much time there. All in all - we definitely enjoyed the week that we spent here before moving into our condo.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you'll be sightseeing most of the time”
Reviews.Author: tanner_sash
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights as part of a SIA stopover holiday. We arrived at 6am, our room wasn't available but they let us use their courtesy room. The room we eventually received was very large (more than enough room to lay two suitcases open on the ground and had a great view of the harbour and the Singapore flyer, but was a bit dated (CRT tv, lot's of wood panel). Never had breakfast at the hotel so can't comment - but we did have a buffet breakfast with the orang utans at the zoo which was definitely worth it. We didn't spend that much time at the hotel, sightseeing (Orchard Rd, Orchid Garden, Zoo, Sentosa) but the location and shopping centre attached are really convenient. In terms of service, the room was cleaned well, but the concierge and desk staff were not overly friendly or helpful - couldn't get a late check out even though our flight wasn't till 11pm and I had a terrible cold. We may have been better off choosing a cheaper hotel on the SIA list. Our top tips would be Equinox (top of the hotel) for a drink - good happy hour prices, New Quay for a beer and pepper crab, Newton Circus for hawker food (open till 2am) and the yum cha place on the fourth floor of the Isetan building - authentic if not overly attentive. Our biggest disappointment was probably the Raffles where we went for the obligatory Singapore Sling - it was very touristy and they had the drinks premade and lined up ready to go. It gave you a glimpse of what colonial Singapore may have been like, but it was just a tourist trap.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Singapore!”
Reviews.Author: Merlion09
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location right on top of City Hall MRT. Hotel is connected to multiple shopping centres through an underground walkway – there is no need to go out in the Singaporean heat if you don’t feel like it! We had a harbour facing room on the 23rd floor which had fantastic views. The room was big, spotlessly clean and extremely comfortable. Staff were all friendly and efficient. Excellent transport links (lots of taxis, buses, MRT). This hotel is next door to the Raffles Hotel, which is where the Singapore Sling was invented – make sure you go and try it! The only downside – a bit expensive for my budget (currently S$200 per night excluding taxes). Sometimes Singapore Airlines do a good deal if you fly with them and use their stopover holiday rates – definitely search hard for a bargain because it’s worth it. Overall, a fantastic hotel (in my opinion, the best!) I will always stay here when in Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “hate the staff, stupid procedures,nade my shopping festival worse.”
Reviews.Author: dreamgirl32
Reviews.Content: They were not able to handle my check in properly, i used another cc to book and i wanted to pay with another cc while i was checking in but the rude staff told me pay cash or use the same cc i used earlier. The card i left back home and had another one they still dint accept, bad for a start.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but expensive”
Reviews.Author: Lanko
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was good (food, rooms, stuff). But I'd not stay there again, because I think it is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Upgraded to a superb Crest room - best hotel experience ever!!”
Reviews.Author: bendigoboy
Reviews.Content: In early July my wife and I stayed at the Swissotel Stamford. We had booked an executive room on Wotif at just over $300 a night for 4 nights. Upon arrival we were greeted at the door, taken to reception and informed that because of the Asian Youth Games teams being based at the hotel we were upgraded to Crest level. This was the start to 4 of the best hotel days we have ever spent (we have traveled widely around the world). The suite was huge, living room, bedroom, powder room, bathroom ( nice deep bath) seperate shower, dressing room etc. It was on the 65th floor. Bose sound system. Just up the corridor was our Crest lounge where we had free drinks from 5-8 each night. Food was supplied by the top restaurants - Jaan, Equinox etc and was limitless, beautifully presented and very tasty. Only on one other evening did another guest drop in so we had the lot to ourselves - we even were able to watch live an AFL match ( which our team the Bulldogs won) on the large TV while helping ourselves to the hotel hospitality - perfect after a time away from home! The staff were superb, the Crest level staff spoke very good English, were very knowledgeable and so polite and caring. One afternoon we wanted to have some dumplings at a restaurant located in the basement shopping centre (Din Tai Fung) and one of the staff walked us to the restaurant and helped us pick our courses and get a table! Another lunch at the Lei Gardens nearby was recommended and booked by the staff and they even booked the restaurant specialty (roasted pork) for us. Both restaurants were excellent and we were the only non Singaoreans present ( if the locals eat there its got to be good). Our transport needs were immediately dealt with and frequently while we were in the lobby staff asked us if we needed any assistance. Overall we had a great time in Singapore and i would have no hesitation in recommending or staying at this hotel again. The view from the 65 th floor balcony with a glass of Moet on our 30th wedding anniversary was one of lifes great moments.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient, great views”
Reviews.Author: LongDriver1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel for over 250 nights (believe it or not!) in the past 3 years. I would say that I have consistently had positive experiences, reliable service and no major complaints. The major advantages (not in priority order) 1) Great views, hotel has 66 or 67 floors of rooms 2) Business lounge breakfast (become a Swissotel "Swiss Club" member and you qualify for free breakfast on the 60th floor starting at 7 sm. Also free cocktails and snacks each evening from 5 - 7 pm. You can also check out at the business lounge, bypassing the front desk. 3) Gym - about 8 treadmills, 8 TV channels that you can select; extensive weights and stretching area 4) Health Spa - excellent massages - expensive but worthwhile 5) Pool area 6) Next to City Hall MRT (subway). You can get to Orchard Road in under 10 minutes for I think S$1.90 very convenient 7) Raffles City shopping mall is adjacent - there is a supermarket in the basement level where you can buy food or snacks to bring back to the room (recommend the prepackages sushi!); drug stores, a number of inexpensive places to eat, shopping, clothing -- all in all if you have forgotten to pack something on your trip you can find it here. 8) Room Service - consistently quick, never any problem with an order; fairly extensive menu. Everything in Singapore is expensive and this hotel is no exception. All the hotels will increase the rates to take advantage of spot market opportunities - a major convention, the Singapore Grand Prix - so buyer beware. The hotel is run by the Fairmont Group which operates the adjacent Fairmont Hotel. The Fairmont is more upscale, but they both share the same spa, gym, pool area. On the 70th floor there is a bar and restaurant with fantastic city views..if you can request a room in advance I would ask for something facing Clark Quay and Boat Quay (both South of the hotel) - I think that give the best view of central Singapore. Taxi's can be hard to come by at certain times, there is a place to queue up in front. If you are in a hurry, you can discretely ask the guy directing traffic out front for help in getting a cab and slip him S$5 when he delivers. Over the years they have been upgrading the rooms. I'm not sure if any "older" rooms are left - something to avoid if possible. 60th Floor and above all have newer rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for 2 night stay”
Reviews.Author: lj-lj
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed here for 2 nights on the singapore stopover deal on route to bali. Location wise was perfect, it has a shopping mall attached to hotel and raffles is next block , 5 min walk. Riverside point where there are great restuarants/ bars in a 5 min taxi ride. 10 min taxi to Orchard Rd. Bedroom was spacious with nice bathroom and view overlooking city. We didnt eat in the hotel but did have cocktails every night in the Equinox bar on the 70th floor, great views at night over city. We also went to Raffles Hotel for Singapore Slings x 2 which cost us $54 usd !!!! What a rip off but i guess its a tourist trap and you only do it once at that price...... Overall i would recommend this hotel as we had a great experience here , staff very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic views”
Reviews.Author: edgarn
Reviews.Content: We got upgraded to the 66th floor Stamford suites, the views of the harbor and Singapore were amazing (although the new Sands project is a bit of an eye sore). Service was good, the hotel was busy and buzzing with conventions and meetings which maybe was the only slight negative point on our visit. The executive floor lounge was very nice and it had its own private gym. Overall very good experience from a consistent brand and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: ThomasGirke
Reviews.Content: Some hotels you like as soon as you enter the door and Swissotel The Stamford is one of them. I stayed here for 3 nights to do some shopping during the Great Singapore Sale on my way to Thailand. The hotel is in an ideal location for this situated right on top of Raffles City and just across the road from Suntec City and Marina Square. City Hall MRT can also be accessed without going outside. Service was always friendly and efficient. I misplaced my room cards and the manager on duty personally assisted by deactivating the old ones, issuing new ones, and ensuring everything was OK. Breakfast at Café Swiss was included in the rate. There was more than enough variety here for me. Perhaps I had a renovated room (2761). I found it modern, functional and roomy. The view from the 27th floor was over the city rather than the bay. I’d definitely stay at Swissotel The Stamford again.

Reviews.Title: “swissotel good hotel”
Reviews.Author: adorisgaurav
Reviews.Content: Last year I went into the business conference to singapore and i got to stay there at swissotel it was a skyscraper 70 stories and below the hotel there was a lovely mall 5 to 6 storey below the hotel and it is situated near by the metro,malls and other hotels. so overall everything is nearby from here,i was staying at 40 floor and the view of the ocean was fantastic ,nice elevators which took us to their bar equinox at the 70 floor in 70 seconds man thats quick.the rooms were spacious and one thing i didnt like still they didnt had lcs tvs and other channels they should have atleast 100 channels running ok. my stay was good i will stay there if i again go to singapore...

Reviews.Title: “Business hotel in CBD”
Reviews.Author: Myna-san
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Oct 08 with my husband, who was on a business trip in Singapore. The hotel is at an envious location in the heart of CBD, so that makes it all the more close to scrutiny in terms of service. The hotel room was good for a business traveller with hues of pale yellow all around in the room. The room also had a spacious balcony offering majestic view! The bed was queen size and the mattress was comfortable. That said, my personal opinion is that the room lacked character. Would suffice with minimum basic requirements, but nothing that would make you feel pampered. The room looked impersonal. Would I want to come back again....maybe not.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Shame”
Reviews.Author: t-puk
Reviews.Content: STS has so much potential to become THE hotel, but sadly nothing has changed. Can you imagine Club rooms with obsolete 14" LCD tvs? Maybe 15". Let's not even talk about the cheaper rooms. (OK to be fair club rooms now come with pillow menus and ipod docks). Is the hotel oblivious to competition? Or because it has certain advantages over others, management thinks they can continue selling rooms at prices sometimes even higher than swanky competitors? Nobody knows, but it's certainly not operating in an oligopoly. Of course tourists are often awed by the views on the higher floors, because if you stay here there's no need to go the Flyer. But if the hotel is serious about attracting and retaining guests then surely it would spend big money on refufurbishing the whole place? Obviously not. The deluxe rooms are currently being redone (and they still come with CRT monitors) I was told, but these are on the lower floors. And what about the used-to-be expensive Crest suites? They still look exactly the same, nothing has changed since it was last maintained by Westin. No more colourful bed-covers, but that's just about it. SGD500 is reasonable, considering they're just charging you for the views and exclusiveness of sleeping on the 66th storey, and the use of a dated Bose system. I was told the management (old) was very concerned with revenue, so when times were good, they couldn't be bothered with major upgrading as occupancy was always very high. (Though there were reports quoting former Raffles CEO Jennie Chua that they were planning to transform the top 6 six floors into exclusive club rooms but sadly nothing materialised). So whilst everyone was busy renovating and installing wifi, STS simply enjoyed the good times while it lasted. But now with a new owning company and lousy times, one wonders if they will sit down and rethink their strategy for the next 10 years. Will they continue to be proud of their greenish yellow bed board, or funky retro CRT TVs, your guess is as good as mine.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: payalnarang
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel!!! Great staff, breakfast, beautiful view from bedrooms with the biggest rooms ever ... lovely location .. it was perfect!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just Wonderful..!”
Reviews.Author: jkt_traveller
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Swissotel the Stamford left us a very fond memories, especially for my 4 y.o daughter who liked the swimming pool very much :') I can not really say much as other reviews had mention the hotel's greatness. Location is perfect, just above the raffles city plaza and city hall mrt station. The staff were also very nice and courteous. We spend our first day touring the city by hippo bus, which turn out to be very convinient as we're staying at the stamford. The bus pool was in walking distance (Suntec City) and we can just hop on-off in every hippo bus that goes along, we made stop at orchard road, bugis street, and just easily catch the next hippo bus to return to the hotel, since the stamford location was also included in the hippo's route. We even went to Sentosa island in the afternoon (and return) using this couch, which means we can save a few bucks :) All and all, we did enjoy our trip to Singapore this time more because of we stayed at Swissotel the stamford.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great facilities”
Reviews.Author: JUDITHbristol
Reviews.Content: This is a comfortable, clean and reasonably good value hotel. Great for stop overs as its located at Raffles City shopping centre so lots of facilities. Nice big pool, shared with the Fairmont next door,and an awesome spa with great treatments, large gym (by hotel standards) and separate male and female spa facilities including relaxation area, jacuzzis, steam and sauna. Rooms are comfortable, if a little dated. Breakfast is great but apart from that food in the hotel is less than average. If you want a comfortable hotel with pool, spa and shopping on your doorsteps then its a great place. Also right by a main MRT station so easy to get yourself around.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic room with a view”
Reviews.Author: SydneyAsiaTraveller
Reviews.Content: I was lucky to have stayed for 10 days back in Feb 2009 while settling into Singapore. The great location central to everything helped tremendously. I had a room on the 63 floor and had amazing views. The room was spacious and clean. Most amazing was the bed and how comfortable it was. However it was not without its faults. There were some cleanliness problems with my bath tub and problems with my TV not working. Also, the cost of a continental breakfast was SGD$40, a little steep if I can get SGD$5 breakfasts down at food courts nearby. But overall I cannot fault my stay. Well done and thanks to all the nice and attentive staff who works and keeps the Swissotel Stamford Singapore going well.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Indeed”
Reviews.Author: RobMo
Reviews.Content: I read a few reviews of this hotel on here before I arrived and after reading one very negative one I was slightly apprehensive. From my arrival until departure though this hotel was very hard indeed to fault. Key plus points were as follows: * Very friendly staff at all times and very capable concierge. * Great location attached to Raffles shopping mall and near Clarke Quay for some evening entertainment. * Amazinly comfortable bed and plenty of room in general in the rooms. * Great selection of bars and restaurants within the hotel itself (check out the views from the bars on the 70th and 71st floors) and even more to chose from if you go to the Raffles Mall next door. * Good gym and what looked like a nice pool area plus lots of tennis courts. Only down side (and I amr eally looking hard for negatives now to try and give a balanced reciew) could perhaps be that the room looks ever so slightly dates compared with some other hotels and the TV is a traditional style one rather than a plasma/LCD. I have previously stayed at the Shangri-La and theMarriott on Orchard Rd in Singapore and I would definitely reccomend this Swissotel over either of those two, whether for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Room Quality and Service”
Reviews.Author: gab11
Reviews.Content: Expected a nice stay but was extremely disappointed. Changed rooms twice due to quality. The first room was due to rusty bath stopper. Second room due to air-con not working well. Even the final room that we stayed in also have faulty lights. Got our stuff thrown away as rubbish twice, and when reported to staff in order to get back, was being treated as though we were trying to cheat them which in the end we proved otherwise after complaining to the duty manager.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: Kat2703
Reviews.Content: The view from my room on the 54th floor is the first mention I need to make of this wonderful hotel. Although it is a business hotel, it also caters to tourists. The hotel is connected to the Raffles City mall internally. Swissotel is centrally located and you cannot not find your hotel. All you need to do is look towards the sky and then you will find your hotel. The breakfast was sumptuous and had a variety of cuisines. The staff are really helpful. You get personalised service even if you are one among thousands of their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Proud to be a guest at Swissotel, the Stamford”
Reviews.Author: Trivedi-KA
Reviews.Content: Had an opportunity to be in Swissotel twice. Awsome structure, Excellent view, Comfortable stay, enviable hospitality available in the heart of business district of Singapore. Unforgettable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Unacceptable. For the same amount, you can do much better than The Swissotel.”
Reviews.Author: ChaosHK
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from staying two nights at Swissotel the Stamford during the weekend. I’m a frequent traveler to Singapore for both business and leisure - I've stayed at most of the hotels around Marina Bay (where the Swissotel is located) all within this year. This website has always been invaluable for helping me choose hotels as well as restaurants, so I felt that it was my responsibility to inform the Trip Advisor community of the poor management, the extremely old and dated rooms, and the lack of accountability one would respect from a hotel in this price bracket. Firstly, the decor in the rooms is ridiculously old. The furniture and rugs look like they haven’t been replaced in the last 20 years. The tube TV is reminiscent of something from a cheap motel in the 70s. There is no shower cubicle, no hair dryer (in my first room), and the rooms are poorly lit. As another guest mentioned below, the air conditioning is definitely not strong enough and gave my girlfriend an allergic reaction. There seemed to structural work on the building in the morning which woke me up. For the same price, the best rate rooms at the Pan Pacific or Marina Mandarin are much more luxurious. Yes, the view from the balcony can be nice, but so is the one at the Fairmont next door or the Pan Pacific down the street. Other reviews speak of the great location, but hotels such as the Intercontinental/Meritus Mandarin are a stone’s throw away. Upon my arrival I was informed by a tiny piece of paper on the bedside drawer that there would be no electricity, lighting, air-conditioning or running water on my floor from 1-5am. Some elevators would also cease to function. The reception downstairs failed to mention this at check in and the online website had no mention of this "minor inconvenience," either. If I would have known of this in advance, then I would have cancelled my room and booked one at one of the other hotels nearby. I had the strong impression that guests were expected to tolerate this without prior warning. As many of you know, Singapore can be hot and humid and sleeping without aircon is unbearable. When I returned home on Saturday night I was greeted by a dark and stuffy room. I immediately requested a room change to a higher floor which was not affected by this. While I must admit that the staff was quick and courteous in arranging another room, it also made me wonder why I was assigned this room in the first place since they already knew I would be staying for 2 nights. My new room was obviously unoccupied, and was pretty much the same size and had a similar view. If they had told me when I checked in, then I would have easily paid the extra SGD 20 or so to upgrade to a different room. I informed the staff about my displeasure in person downstairs, and a few of the staff seemed to be annoyed that I was disturbing them from whatever they were doing at 3 am in the morning. The manager meekly explained that this was an oversight but offered no other explanation. Imagine how irritated you would be if you had to pack your entire luggage at 3 AM with only the aid of a small flashlight. The next morning hotel staff also barged into my room even though I had the privacy sign up. Apparently the reception had failed to record that I had switched rooms and I was rudely awoken by two staff. I do understand that it customary for hotels to conduct electrical maintenance a few times a year. Believe me when I say that I'm not angry about the actual lack of electricity, but instead I'm irate about the lack of attention, preparation, and general indifference the staff at Swissotel offer. It might sound like I’m privately ranting, but I did inform the staff if all of my concerns and I was never once met with a satisfactory response. For casual tourists in Singapore who want to stay in the Marina Bay area, you would be better served by choosing another hotel. Other reviews might indicate a wonderful experience, or an amazing view, but these opinions are coming from people who have not had the luxury of staying at other hotels in the same area. Newer, nicer, and more spacious rooms are plentiful in the Marina area; why settle for a substandard room? It goes without saying that all the rooms in the area are clean - it's simply not enough to distinguish this hotel as amazing. For frequent business travelers, I probably don’t need to warn you, you know well enough to stay clear of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the view from the Balcony”
Reviews.Author: Rohit_CG
Reviews.Content: I went to spend my 27th birthday at Singapore. While i was making a booking for various hotels, i came across Swissotel on a travel website. Its the 2nd tallest hotel in Asia as they say. This is what i came across once i reached:- 1. I reached at 9:00am and the staff were courteous to give me a room straightaway instead of making me wait for 3-4 hours 2. I had a room on the 58th floor with a breathtaking view from the balcony. 3. The room was nice, clean and neat and having everything to make a guest's stay comfortable 4. The hotel is located at City Hall which is a very central area and hence commuting to places becomes very easy, especially with the MRT station just round the corner. 5. The food spread was fabulous. Infact me and my friend who accompanied me, loved the spread. 6. The hotel staff was very nice to us and took care of every small little need that we had. To sum it up, it was a great experience with Swissotel and I am looking forward to my stay with them again very soon. I wish they had a few in India, that would be great. Cheers, Rohit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stopover.”
Reviews.Author: wategos
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Swissotel The Stamford on stopover to London in February and chose same hotel upon our return in April. We were treated with the utmost respect from the moment of arrival. From doorman, porter to reception, staff were excellent. We were stunned by the location of our room on sixtieth floor with the most outstanding views. Room service menu was outstanding. The housekeeping was also brilliant. A great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a business trip”
Reviews.Author: escog
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Swissotel 4 times over the last couple of years - each time on business. I've got over 20 nights there in the last 9 months. On this last trip, I was there for a week. I like the Swissotel. The location is fantastic with a mall underneath along with the City Hall MRT stop. Furthermore, there's the Citylink mall which connects to Suntec City, the Esplanade, or Marina Mall, so you don't even have to go above ground to explore the nearby area. There's a good selection of restaurants nearby, and Clark Quay is within walking distance. So, for tourist sites, the hotel is well situated. The service is good - just friendly enough and efficient. I found the wait staff in the Swiss Cafe to have a bit of trouble finding the balance between hovering and attentive service, but it's better than being ignored. Housekeeping kept the room clean, towels replaced, and bed made. No problems there. Though, it should be noted that I was in Singapore on business and made very little use of the hotel staff, but I also had no problems that would require that I contact them. if it's raining outside, stop by the bell desk and they'll loan you an umbrella. My room was on the 30th floor, and had a nice view of St. Andrew's Cathedral. I find the bed rather firm - a bit too firm for my taste. Otherwise, the sheets and pillows were fine. They use a lightweight comforter, which is hardly necessary. The room had the standard amenities - safe, iron, ironing board, hair dryer, tv, alarm clock, etc. The desk was good for working with plenty of electric outlets nearby. The outlets have universal receptacles, so no need for a plug adapter. Ethernet cable was a bit short for using their in-room internet. $S28 per 24 hours for the internet, which was fast enough. There's a very slight discount for multi-day internet plans. Like all the rooms, there's a sliding glass door and a balcony. Air conditioning worked fine for me. Bathroom was roomy enough with a combo bath/shower. There's a grate that gurgles a bit when the water is draining, but it's not a bother. I'm not wild about the complementary shampoo, but it does the job. Housekeeping kept the bathroom very clean. I've done the breakfast buffet and lunch semi-buffet at the Swiss Cafe, and it's fine with a good selection of different cuisines. I do find breakfast overpriced at $S40 (inc taxes). This is really the only alternative for early morning breakfast in the hotel, though if you go around the corner to the entrance to the City Hall MRT station, you'll find a Starbucks and a 24-hour McDonald's. I've also had lunch at Kopi Tiam, which was fair. They use this space as overflow for the breakfast buffet at the Swiss Cafe. I popped up to the New Asia Bar on the 70th floor for a quick drink and to admire the view which is fantastic. It's certainly cheaper than doing the Singapore Flyer. I'm afraid that despite all my nights at this hotel, I have never visited the gym nor the pool, but my colleagues tell me the gym is nice. One note - on this last trip there was a rumbling of some sorts that would occur on occasion - I don't know what it was, though I'll chalk it up to nearby construction or something. Not loud enough to bother me, but I thought I'd mention it. Check out was quick and efficient, though the desk clerk didn't ask me how my stay was.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: gautamjhaveri
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the swiss hotel the stamford in singapore. The hotel is very nice. The rooms are very spacious and comfortable. The best thing about the hotel is its location its very close to all the shopping area. Infact there is a mall connecting with the hotel itself. The view of the singapore city is very good from the hotel. Especially from equinox which is on the 70th floor. The hotel staff was very friendly and the breakfast on the 8th floor beside the pool area was awesome. The only problem we faced initially was there was very little variety of vegetarian food in the breakfast. But the hotel specially made other vegetarian breakfast for us. We stayed on the 28th floor we could see the singapore city. The hotel has two swimming pools both on the 8th floor which was lovely. Guests could even play tennis and use the spa. We paid 200$ per night for a room. It was value for money and the rooms had two double beds. We took 3 rooms as we were 9 people Overall I would say this is a good hotel because its conveniently located from both the airport and to tourist place. Other than that the Air conditioning was not effective even after many complaints they could not fix it.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore Heights”
Reviews.Author: Ashbans
Reviews.Content: Its the tallest hotel in Singapore. The rooms were awsome. We were put on 55th floor. The view of the city, was just so great, that you do not feel like leaving the room. Price wise, it was worth. We had spent approx S$325 nett per room. The ambience, elevators, pool were just right. The breakfast spread was not that great. We expected a lot more for the hotel of that a kind. Not much options for Veg. Hotel not recomended for Indian Food Lovers.

Reviews.Title: “am luvin' it”
Reviews.Author: champagneslut
Reviews.Content: .. was staying for a week , not bad price the room is kinda old, tho i got perfect view from my balcony, what i like is the location is in the central n' the spa is also quite good, ' the club new asia offers u a mavelous view by nite ..super!! infact am coming back again end of the month :)

Reviews.Title: “A Singapore landmark”
Reviews.Author: Gloomsbury
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel and centrally located too. Loved the service, the view (was on a really high floor) and the quiet, efficient service.

Reviews.Title: “Let down! :-(”
Reviews.Author: QLD-BLONDIE
Reviews.Content: We were only in Singapore for 2 nights and thought we would splash out on the The Swissotel Stamford, it was quite pricey but we were willing to pay the price for luxury! Unfortunately we were quite dissapointed however there were some definate positives! So the bad...hotel overall was run down and old, not dirty, just aged, the photos we had seen on the internet were nicer and it just wasn't what we were expecting! It was really just a large let down due to the price that we had paid, coming from KL and staying in the Crowne Plaza which was half the price and absoloutely amazing we just felt short changed! To end on the positives we were on level 57 of 77 storeys, had they most STUNNING view of the Singapore flyer! My friend and I had a double bed each and they were extremely comfortable and location GREAT!

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: larchi
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our stay at the Swissotel Stamford and have nothing but positive comments about this establishment. We had a harbour view room on the 50th floor with a great view from our balcony overlooking the harbour, marina and we could see boat quay around the corner. Our room was cleaned every morning while we were at breakfast and was always of a high standard. We cannot say enough good things about the staff we had dealings with, everyone was so helpful and every morning at breakfast without fail we would have no less than 4 staff members say good morning too us! The buffet spread in Cafe Swiss for breakfast was one of the best we have had, there was always so much too choose from! The hotel is in a fantastic location with the Raffles City Shopping centre directly attached to it, plus the underground walkway directly to Suntec City Mall. We walked to Clarke Quay for dinner which was nice and used the MRT countless times - everything was in such easy reach. We enjoyed ourselves so much that we will be back next year and already know where we will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Consistenly good”
Reviews.Author: bigmacandfriesplease
Reviews.Content: Always stay here when I'm in Singapore (about 5+ times a year) but have never written a review. Have to say, I love this hotel. Great rooms, great location and friendly efficient staff. Plus the AsiaOne bar on the 81st floor with fantacstic views of the city. Recommended

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable business hotel”
Reviews.Author: wantatrip
Reviews.Content: Stayed here about 3 times over the last three years. reasonable business hotel, great location if you want to do some shopping or see around a bit more of Singapore aside from your work. If you have a few dollars more in your allowance stay at the Fairmont next door (same management...) slight gripes - wish the refurbishment was already done - older rooms are a bit grubby - stained carpets etc. but generally the staff have done as good a job as they can in terms of day to day cleanliness wish the hotel "remembered" you better - always being asked to fill out address etc. details internet connection / broadband price is above average hard to find the gym (helps if you know you are meant to look for the spa on the signs...) lobby is always a bit too chaotic...

Reviews.Title: “A seriously top class hotel in a top class location”
Reviews.Author: Andrewww
Reviews.Content: By chance I stumbled on these reviews and thought they are just too harsh so I had to comment. We stayed at this hotel yes a year ago inMarch 2008 but if I look at the traveler photos they are identical and true to form. In a previous review someone complained that they couldnt check in at 7.30 am. You gotta be kidding me, you cannot normally check in to any hotel before 2.00pm. Why not drop the bags and go for a shop. Some people are just never happy. This hotel is in the best location. Its located to the side of the Raffles Plaza shopping Centre so if its stinking hot you don't even need to go outside. Plus from this shopping centre you can get to the MRT (Rail) which is just the best experience and cheap, just buy a card with $20 credit it will last a week. Across the road from the Centre is the Raffles Hotel and Chimes, Chimes is a great eating place, an old monastery I think. We stayed on the 52nd floor facing Clarke Quay. Just magnificent views, the glass wall on the balcony was a bit scary but this meant you could lie in bed and see the sea and river rather than the balcony wall very clever. The room was perfect nothing out of place as you would expect for a 5 star which it is. This was a special trip for us so we paid a little more and it was worth every $. We have stayed at the Peninsular Excelsior which is nearby, its much cheaper and if you are on a budget stay there, but the Swiss is worth every penny. We had breakfast included and it was just the best. The breakfast dining room was alway nearly full but we never had to wait. I like busy breakfasts as it means the food is turning over. Breakfast here is a must and the best I have ever experienced. If you want cheap meals go to the basement in the shopping centre, there are some top spots there, but Chimes is more up market. Would definitly recommend this hotel to those wanting 5 stars at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Beguining of a delicious honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: LorisCoimbra
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for the first step of our honeymoon. The hotel is realy well located, in the centre of the city, and it has a mall, subway, taxi and bus. It's the tallest hotel of Singapore (70 floors). The services were perfect, since the check in till the late heck out, and they did't know we were honeymooners. It's an amasing hotel and it also has great views from the bedrooms balconies.

Reviews.Title: “A catalogue of errors”
Reviews.Author: LudwigVanBeetroot
Reviews.Content: *The bath was broken *The safe was broken *The staff in the 'Equinox' bar were lame and the decor there was worse * They kept getting my room confused with someone elses and calling me Mrs when am a hairy, deep voiced man *They lost some shoes when they took them to clean *The room smelt damp and musty *WE WERE CHARGED TWICE FOR THE SAME MEAL AND THEN WE WERE INFORMED THAT WE MUST HAVE EATEN THE SAME MEAL TWICE< AT EXACTLY THE SAME TIME *WE HAD TO RETURN THE BILL 6, S.I.X! TIMES BEFORE WE WERE CHARGED THE CORRECT AMOUNT *The staff were flustered and disorganised. *The decor was dated. *12 dollars for a bottle of water *25 dollars for internet acess On the up side I had a high room with a balcony which was good for the suicide option after a night in this dump. Stay at the Scarlett instead

Reviews.Title: “Good location, poor service”
Reviews.Author: Taras_Bulba_v_SG
Reviews.Content: Good location for shopping and reaching attractions plus access to the financial district. Poor service, rooms need renovating. Breakfast 3-star standard. Better options available in Singapore, including Shangri-La, Hilton, Hyatt in Orchard area. Definitely not "Swiss" any more since it now belongs to the Singapore Government (via Temasek Holdings). Unfortunately they do not run hotels as well as they do airlines.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: pandegaurav
Reviews.Content: The Stamford Hotel is perhaps the tallest hotel in Singapore. The hotel has an excellent location in the center of the town. Trains/ Buses to most of the tourist destination are easily available. The hotel has a shopping plaza in a lower levels. The key attraction is the set of restaurants in the highest level (72 . if i remember right). The hotel also has a big choice of restaurants to choose from. The room I stayed in was not very spacious but had all the amneties one would like to have. Wifi/ INternet connection is not included in the price of the bill. If you plan to stay here...try getting a room at higher level. the higher the room floor the better the view.

Reviews.Title: “always a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: steph_from_oz
Reviews.Content: Ive stayed at the stamford swissotel several times for work, and have never once been dissapointed. rooms are always clean, staff are always friendly and willing to help, and the facilities are fantastic. rooms are large, and i have stayed in rooms with one king size bed, or 2 doubles, and always feel very comfortable. some rooms have renovated bahrooms, however the ones that are not renovated are still fine. views from the room balcony are lovely from all directions, though one side of the buliding faces the pool and another hotel - you may wish to ask for city views. I love the gym and also the pool there. the gym is very large for a hotel gym, and is free to use. the pool is very nice - there is an outdoor bar area, and waiters will take your orders for drinks and bring them over to you. the hotel is very central ,and it is easy to get to anywhere. The raffles city plaza is attached to the hotel, which is great not only for shopping and cheap eats ( i recommend the japanese in the food court on level three that sells tempura), but is very convenient as it has a supermarket/grocery store which is fantastic for buying breakfast supplies and snacks. All in all, I always look forward to a trip to singapore, and swissotel the stamford.

Reviews.Title: “Sophisticated and stylish in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: vegan_princess
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to start our SE Asia holiday. We had trouble deciding between this place and one of the boutique hotels in Chinatown but definitely made the right choice. Perfect place to recover from jetlag - because the hotel is so large a room was available not too long after our 8am arrival and we didn't feel conspicuous for spending most of the day asleep in our room! Our room was peaceful and blissfully quiet with a very comfy bed. The decor in the rooms is more interesting (and less corporate) than it appears on the website pictures. This hotel didn't represent great value as it is expensive but not totally luxurious, but it was worth paying the extra to stay in an executive room - great views from the 58th floor and my husband liked the free cocktails in the executive lounge! I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great standards and location”
Reviews.Author: SittingbourneOwl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on two occasions on the way to and back from Australia, hotel was chosen as part of the Singapore Airlines stopover package. Previously stayed next door at The Fairmont, so very familiar with the facilities and location of the hotel. On first visit arrived at 7:30 am and room was available, most appreciated after a long flight from Manchester, did also e-mail hotel about the arrival situation. Was given a room on the 34th floor with Marina view. The second occasion was a late arrival at 10:30 pm and was given a 50th floor room with city view panning from Boat Quay to Chinatown to Clarke Quay and across to Orchard Road. The rooms themselves were good with the city view room much bigger than the Marina view room, both had balconies, beware those without a head for heights!! Beds were comfy, bathroom well stocked with towels, TV had plenty of choice particularly news channels like CNN, BBC, Channel News Asia, but only 2 sports channels, maybe time to get another one!! The staff I encountered were excellent, bags were promptly bought up to the room, the Conceirge booked restaurants and even provided a set of bathroom scales to weigh luggage. The lobby was extremely busy which is expected of such a big hotel especially as it was the Chinese New Year period, even had a Lion dance to celebrate the New Year, but was not made to feel unimportant and was addressed several times by lobby staff, the hotel is popular with business travellers and aircrew from BA and Qantas. Did not use the restaurants at the hotel as there was plenty of choice nearby for breakfast, lunch and dinner, special mention for the revamped food court at Raffles City and the excellent Lei Garden across the road at the Chimjes complex. One other thing is tour desk is next to conceirge, handy for booking trips to Night Zoo and reconfirming coach rides to the airport. Other facilities such as pool and gym are excellent as they are shared with The Fairmont next door, never seemed to be too crowded. The location of the hotel is excellent, super transport links with MRT station below for Orchard Road, Vivo City and further beyond locations, but the major attractions like Merlion, Singapore Eye, Chinatown, Boat Quay very easily reach by foot. All major shopping can be done at Raffles City, Marina Square, Suntec Mall, Link Mall underground. Best of all is the price paid, arranged as part of Singapore Airlines stopover package, almost the same facilities as The Fairmont for less price, so will look to stay here again the next time I'm in Singapore. Well done all !!

Reviews.Title: “Tops for location, room lacks finesse”
Reviews.Author: SinGal70
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights from 2/11 to 2/16. We were being offered the Grand Room on the 21st floor. The Grand Room is the corner room with views to 2 different directions, also it is about 1.5 times bigger than the standard rooms. We are familiar with this hotel, been staying at the property when it was called The Westing Stamford-long before it became part of the Swissotel Group today. We stayed there due to its convenient location:- subway underground, integrated shopping mall, short walk to nearby bars and eateries. But I was a bit disappointed by the condition of the room and the amenities. It gives me a feeling that the room was not being maintained for a long time, and that it was not prepped for guest arrival. When we first entered the room, I found that the money plant in the bathroom was withered and mouldy, not the most welcoming sight. The bath amenities were there except for the hair conditioner, we alerted House-Keeping and our request was promptly met though. The plumbling was a terror- the shower tap couldn't stop leaking and the sink couldn't be stopped-imagine the difficulty when I tried soaking some laundry. The water pressure made so much noise when a neighbor hotel guest used the shower/sink. The bed linens were freshly-laundered and changed daily, but they looked old and frayed with tears and holes, albeit small ones. While flat screen TVs are part of the modern room decor nowadays, this room still keeps a 25" old TV. The bedside clock is 15 minutes late and there was no way to adjust it. It seems like the hotel stripped the electronic control to the clock and the window curtains. All these tell me that the hotel simply sits on its laurels and does not bother paying much attention to smaller details. Save for the great location, I'd really wouldn't rate this hotel as my favourite. There are competitive ones nearby and I think it's time I quit Swissotel.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hotel with excellent facilities and staff”
Reviews.Author: jlb284
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Swissotel Stamford in Jan/Feb for three nights on our way to Australia and again on the way back to Europe. We stayed in the Executive club rooms and enjoyed the private check-in, the services provided in the lounge and the large well appointed rooms. The beds were extremely comfortable and the views stunning. The staff were welcoming and friendly - and allowed a 9am check-in on our first visit, a welcome courtesy after the long flight from Barcelona. We travel to Australia regularly and always stay in Singapore on the way, but this is the first time we have stayed outside the Orchard Road area. With the wonderful hotel and the great location it won't be the last.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice!”
Reviews.Author: Tokkelosh
Reviews.Content: I can only say what a lot of other reviewers have said in the past:this is an excellent hotel for tourists staying in Singapore.The hotel is very centrally located and sits basically on the MRT and at Raffles City,a huge shopping complex.The rooms are good,clean and has all the amenities a tourist could wish for!!We were travelling with our 17year old son and were allocated a nice corner room with lots of space,so that we were hardly in one anothers way.The breakfasts were included and very good,with a huge choice.We also stayed at the Shangri-La(see review) but although the SL is a cut above Stamford,I would chose the Stamford for its location anytime!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Ddkent
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Marina Mandarin for 2 nights in January 2009, followed by 6 nights at Swissotel Stamford. Both hotels were good, with excellent location, facilities, staff and food. We agree with the Trip Advisor reviews ranking the Marina Mandarin just above the Stamford. The Mandarin has a nicer foyer, pool area and more recent fittings, while the Stamford is so large it is less personal and more of a business hotel. The Mandarin is well located near the water, but the Stamford has the advantage of being on top of an MRT station. Both are attached to shopping malls (Marina Square and Raffles City) that are actually linked underground by the City Link mall. The Food Loft at Marina Square was our pick of cheap eateries. Would stay at both hotels again, but the Mandarin would be our preference.

Reviews.Title: “Just great - excellent start to our holidays”
Reviews.Author: Happybap
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 days on vacation en route to NZ and then Aus. Third visit to this hotel in 18 months and will be back again. All aspects for us were excellent including the great location. All was positive and although expensive (well Singapore generally is not cheap in any case) we really enjoyed another visit to this great city and the hotel added to our overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location - would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: oscar3010
Reviews.Content: We only stayed 1 night at the Swissotel Stamford on our way to Langkawi as we had stayed in Singapore twice previously. The location is perfect, within walking distance of Clarke Quay and Orchard Road. We had a room on the 34th floor with fantastic views over the harbour and Clark Quay. We only ate in the breakfast cafe once as we thought it was very expensive. The hightlight for us was having a drink in the Asia bar on the 70th floor. Although expensive, even during happy hour between 3-8 pm, we felt it was worth it as the views were amazing. The downside for us came when checking out - we had 30 minutes to spare so we had a beer in the lobby bar - BEWARE 2 medium sized beers cost us £25. However, we found alcohol to be expensive everywhere in Singapore. Would we stay at Swissotel Stamford again - of course but we would not have drinks in the lobby bar.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Swissotel Stamford”
Reviews.Author: wenmarkei
Reviews.Content: One of the better places to stay in Singapore, good rooms. We stayed on the 46th floor (harbour view) during Christmas 2008 for about a week. The view was absolutely amazing. There was a sliding door which allowed us access to the balcony and also let fresh air into the room. However it needs to be made child proof, (The locks have situated a bit higher), it was a bit worrying with our 3 year old son learning to open the sliding door in a couple of days. We never ate at the hotel as a number of restaurants, shops etc are situated in the basement to the 3rd floor in the mall below. There were ATMs nearby which was also useful. Another thing I found out about Singapore this time was that it was so much convenient to use a local sim card in your mobile, the international call charges are dirt cheap and getting a sim card is a breeze. The hotel location was central and walking distance to suntec city mall, fountain etc. We had a wonderful time in Singapore, made even more enjoyable by the service and facilities we enjoyed at the Stamford, we will surely chose it again on our frequent holiday trips to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “hard to fault”
Reviews.Author: Altecka
Reviews.Content: We arrived off a long flight from london at 9am. When we arrived at the hotel i wasn't sure if we could book in early. Not only was out room ready but the check in person upgraded us to the harbour view suites on the 54th floor. Two queen size beds with the most magnificent views of singapore. The staff could not be more helpful and were very friendly. The pool and spa (with gym) on the 8th floor is top notch, We didn't eat or drink in the hotel but we went to Clarkes quay and Boat key. We ate at the Harvest seafood resturant. The shopping centre next door is massive and has every brand. The only drawback on Singapore that i can think of is that it's more expensive than home! Great city... Lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bit tired overall”
Reviews.Author: Mr&MrsWilko
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights on a business trip to Singapore. The hotel is fine - but a bit tired - could do with being modernised. Rooms were very clean and well maintained - just very dated.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: raindropsonroses
Reviews.Content: Our family of three stayed here for two nights and it was excellent. We stayed on the 54th floor and enjoyed the great views. The breakfast was also very good at both restaurants. The hotel is conveniently located near the City Hall MRT, which is just a few stops away from the shops on Orchard Road. Chinatown and Lau Pa Sat are also just a few minutes away by taxi (or you can catch the MRT). My only complaint would be that we had to call housekeeping for the third bed after we waited more than an hour after checking-in when we were promised a third bed would be made ready for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great view at the Swissotel Singapore”
Reviews.Author: libby4719
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5nights at the Swissotel in Jan 2009. I was dubious before we got there because it was a big Hotel. However, from the time we got there with the check in, efficient, friendly. On our accommodation voucher our travel agent stated we were to have an upgrade to Harbour view. When the girl checked us in she went to give us a standard room, but I showed her our voucher and reiterated our upgrade. We got the 36th floor with great harbour views, the porter was friendly and showed us all the "buttons" in the room. We only had the breakfast once it was too expensive for the 6mornings around $90 aus. The food was lovely and varied, but we travelled around other areas for food outlets. The Hotel's proximity is great, Raffles across the road a walk to the Harbour & Quay with restaurants etc. The MRT station next door,(with bus connections) which we used to go most places ie Changi Museum, Orchard Road,Krangi Cemetery. The Hotel is in a big shopping complex which has a supermarket to get those goodies you don't want to pay top prices for. The swimming pool was lovely but it is not heated and although it was Jan, we went for a swim at night and the water was a little chilly for a tropical destination was a shock to the senses. Overall, we found the staff helpful & friendly, we had an enjoyable stay and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I Loved It!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jDarwin
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Swissotel with my partner and two small kids, on the recommendation of some friends who had stayed there. we stayed on the 28th floor with a harbour/city view which was AWESOME - the balcony freaked me out a little bit cos we were so high (is that glass safety proof??? LOL) - we were right over the road from St Marks church so on Xmas day we could hear them ringing out carols on the bells :-) :-) Service by valets, concierge, staff was all excellent and friendly - check in and check out was swift, the buffet breakfast rocked with all the different selections - esp the waffles!!! Kids no problem AT ALL, treated well by everyone :-) one of our kids developed a whole new look-how-cute-i-am face as a direct consequence of getting so much attention!!! the room was ace, sunny, big and comfy, the mattresses and pillows super comfortable, bathroom was a bit - not cramped exactly, a bit awkward in its layout, but frankly didn't care.... gym looked good, pools big and lots of room - lots of chairs to lie on..... also the hotel is sooooo convenient being on top of a mall, great food court on the 3rd floor of the mall which puts western food courts to shame!!! loved that the shops were open late and nothing stopped on xmas day - that just made it more special :-)) ate at prego downstairs too on a last minute whim - expected nothing but got beautiful food and very accomdating and sweet to the kids ... awesome. my ONLY criticism is that the Swissotel could do with a self-service laundrette, cos it was sooo expensive to do thru the hotel and no laundrettes to be found in the CBD! a great stay, would go there again in a heartbeat. Thanks to everyone who made our stay so awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Some good, some bad, not worth the price in the end”
Reviews.Author: jfmanzo
Reviews.Content: Partner and I stayet at the Stamford as what was supposed to be a last week of luxury in a three-week stay in Malaysia and Singapore. And seeing as our room at the Stamford would cost more than triple what we paid for an entire three-bedroom condo in Kota Kinabalu, we were expecting great things. There are, to be fair, some wonderful things about the Stamford. We stayed in the executive floors (57-60) and as such had our pick of several locations for a very nice free breakfast; among these we liked the variety and authenticity of the spread in the hotel's "Kopi Tiam" the best. Also, the spa (gym/spa/pool) was fantastic with a men's spa that was pure luxury. The location was tremendous, right above City Hall MRT and steps from too many dining options, high and low end, to count. And the staff was generally very nice and accommodating. The problem was with the rooms, and no matter how nice location and amenities are, if the room isn't good then neither is the experience. The trouble started when we were first booked into a smoking room on 57 despite adamantly pointing out that this was unviable for us. The room reeked of smoke, especially the mattress, and on first complaint the hotel operator asked if we wanted it SPRAYED. Amazing. We said we wanted a new room and after waiting something like 90 minutes in this smelly room waiting for a "porter" (why, exactly?) we finally got into a nonsmoking room on 58. First problem: 58 smells like smoke too, a problem that we eventually got used to but really why in the 21st century are hotels even allowing smoking? Bigger, MUCH bigger problem: The AC is woefully insufficient. This is SINGAPORE. It is HOT and unspeakably HUMID and without adequate AC your towels (you know, the ones you want to re-use to help the environment?) never dry and sadly neither does your sweaty body or your post-shower corpse, and with two people in the room, it just gets warmer and warmer. We complained several times and after night 4 (of 7) being almost completely sleepless, I called to say that we either get a new room or we are leaving. So we get a new room, on 59. And of course, the AC is just as bad. But we endured and made it out, sleepless and sticky, and were thrilled to return home to Calgary, Canada where it was -15C on our return. It felt like baptism. A couple more minor complaints: S$30 a DAY for WIRED internet is worse than absurd. It was also annoying that we were forced to take the elevator every time we wanted to get two (and then one) storey up to get to the executive lounge. The stairway door to our floors were unlocked but 60 was always locked- why? This was wasteful and very time consuming. When I checked my folio before checkout I was under the impression that I had our first day's charges waived and in light of how poor my experience was here I was happy to see this. Nope. Just an accounting catch-up I guess- no recompense at all. I adored Singapore but compared to our first two nights' experience at the lovely and AIR CONDITIONED Parkroyal on Kitchener Road, the Stamford was a massive disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel....great location!”
Reviews.Author: MissFreo
Reviews.Content: Just come back from staying at this hotel over Christmas! We had stayed here previously when it was called the Westin Stamford so knew what to expect overall. Check-in was prompt and the staff member attending to us was very welcoming! Actually all staff during our stay were very attentive and courteous. Room was big enough for 2 Adults and 2 children. Plenty of toiletries stocked in the bathroom. Only thing about the room that needs improving , maybe putting a child proof lock on the sliding door to the balcony, a little bit worrying with a four year old on the 32nd floor. Swimming Pool area has plenty of room and plenty of chairs with a separate kiddies pool. Plenty of choices right outside the hotel for food. Hotel joins on to Raffles City Shopping Complex. City Hall MRT station is next door to the hotel as well. Orchard Rd is 1- 3 MRT stops away depending on which part of Orchard Rd you want to shop at. You can actually walk to Orchard Rd, probably take 15-20 mins. Nearby shopping complexes Marina Square and Suntec City are accessible via the underground pass Citylink Mall so shops galore! Suntec City had plenty of sales while we were there, I absolutely love Carrefour! Wish they had one of those stores in Perth! Worst thing about my stay in Singapore was it was too short, 5 nights just went too quick!

Reviews.Title: “Great views, central location!”
Reviews.Author: globeman235
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in April as part of a stopover from Australia to London. On arrival at the hotel (around 4pm), the check-in area was absolutely manic and we had to wait around 20 minutes, but staff apologised for the delay and were very friendly. Our room was on 27th floor and was relatively small but comfortable, clean and had everything that we needed. The added bonus with this hotel is that all rooms have a balcony which is great (if not rather scary when you're that far up!). The hotel is in a great location for sightseeing and almost next door to Raffles Hotel (you must go in for a Singapore Sling). You must try out cocktails at Equinox on 72nd floor of the hotel. We timed it just before sunset and the views were amazing. We treated ourselves to a massage (thanks Henry!) which was just what we needed after a hard day of sightseeing :-) We didn't eat at the hotel as there is such a choice of restaurants nearby. Overall, would thoroughly recommend this hotel, especially if you are flying Singapore Airlines as you get a great discount.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place, Centrally Located”
Reviews.Author: SteveInCA
Reviews.Content: My wife was in Singapore for two weeks on business, and I joined her for a long weekend in the middle of the trip. We picked the Swissotel due to its central location and due to its availability during our timeframe. We had a room on the 34th floor, overlooking the harbor. The view was wonderful. The room itself was nicely appointed; I wouldn't say it was sumptuous, but it was quite nice. The staff was quite friendly. They helped me out with tourist questions a few times. We ate at the breakfast buffet, which was wonderful. It was somewhat expensive, but the food was great, and the selection pretty impressive. The hotel sits right on top of a subway station, which made getting around a breeze. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Super Stay”
Reviews.Author: NorthlandKiwi
Reviews.Content: We were originally booked to stay at the Meritus but found out (through Trip Advisor) that Orchard Road has lots of construction going on at the moment and the Meritus is undergoing some renovations. We did some research and ended up booking an internet deal on the Swissotel Stamford hotel website. It was definitely worthwhile to upgrade to the Executive room deal - included breakfast and cocktails. I'm not sure how often these deals are available but it was cheaper than through the travel agent or the Singapore Airlines partnership. We had a wonderful time in Singapore, made even more enjoyable by the service and facilities we enjoyed at the Stamford. The location is wonderful, right next to the City Hall MRT and shopping malls. We liked the views over Boat and Clarke Quays and could see out to where all the ships were waiting for their turn to load/unload. It's a quick ride up to Orchard Road or down to Chinatown. The Singapore Airlines HopOn/HopOff bus has a stop just over the road outside Raffles Hotel. For $6pp (with a Singapore Airlines boarding pass) you can spend the day getting familiar with a few landmarks, hopping on and off at various places on the circuit. Nice pool and restaurants although we only sampled the breakfast at the Cafe Swiss which was part of the internet deal and ate out at other places. Couldn't fault the service, the room was clean, spacious, comfortable and soundproof. We didn't hear any road noise or sirens that seem to be a feature of hotels in other cities. Stayed 6 nights, were sorry to leave and would definitely recommend the Executive room deal.

Reviews.Title: “Good views, OK Value”
Reviews.Author: Mupple
Reviews.Content: Huge hotel with great views from upper floors. Great for shoppers with large mall as part of hotel building lower floors and connecting into several others. Good facilities, centrally located. Probably not the place for peope looking for a very personal service given its size, but the service is fine anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: greymanu
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Swissotel Stamford for a two night stopover on our way from London to Sydney and were delighted with our choice. The hotel is right next to an MRT station on the same line as the airport so it is very convenient to reach by either taxi or public transport. All staff we enountered right throughout the hotel were polite, helpful and efficient. In fact, the housekeeping staff took it to a new level ensuring a dress I left hanging in the wardrobe on checkout was forwarded on to me in New Zealand. As noted in other reviews, all rooms have fantastic views with balconies, are comfortable, quiet and well appointed. We booked via Singapore Stopovers and received a 50% discount in the Swiss Cafe as part of the package. This made the breakfast quite reasonable for us. There was an extensive variety and the quality was as is to be expected at similar hotels. One of the highlights of our stay was Charles, a waiter in the Cafe who really couldn't do enough for us. We will most likely stay here again on our next trip home. As an aside, I absolutely recommend a visit to the Night Safari, it was fabulous. And if you are flying Singapore Airlines, look into the Singapore Stopover package as it offers not just a discount on hotels but all kinds of extras.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: alanyeo76
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel as the standard chartered marathon is just nearby. Check in was easy and the front office staff are helpful. They are smiling all the time. As for the room, its very spacious, clean and tidy. The toilet is huge as well. The bed feels wonderful. The location is great for shoppers as well with the Raffles city shopping centre just below the hotel. The Suntec city convention centre and shopping malls are within walking distance as well. The marina shopping area is very near too, just a 5 minutes walk. Access to the rest of the island is easy too with the MRT station just below the hotel. Overall a hotel with class and comfort...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location; Great Views”
Reviews.Author: travelbugP3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Swissotel Stamford for 17 nights during December 07 and January 08, during the Christmas an New Year Period. We stayed on the 56th floor with harbour views, and you MUST book the harbour views. Yes, every room has a balcony which was very daunting at first, but we quickly got used to going out there! The views were stunning, especially during the New Year celebration fireworks display. The staff were friendly and rooms nicely decorated and clean. You simply cannot beat the location of this hotel. The hotel has direct access to the MRT, and you can walk blocks underground (even to Suntec city), which is very convenient in the rain! The hotel has 2 pools, one suitable for children, which you don't find in very many hotels in Singapore. We included breakfast with our booking and are so glad that we did. The buffet breakfast is the best we have had anywhere, the food was amazing, in fact the choices were unbelievable. We ate so much at breakfast there wasn't a need to have lunch!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: chanmsf
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for 2 days on 19 and 20 Nov. The location is great, connected to Raffles City, a big mall; next to MRT station, very convenient; room very clean and tidy. My room was on 54th floor. Fantastic view. You can select not to dine in the hotel, which is expensive, but to go to restaurant/food stalls in Raffles City. Breakfast is expensive, 40SS per person. Food is just so so. In general, a very good hotel to stay.

Reviews.Title: “someplace else next time”
Reviews.Author: flyfishermanSeattle
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel for the location and proximity to business area and shops for the family. Have stayed at the Chicago and Beijing properties without any issues. Hence, did not hesitate to book family in here - what a mistake! Location was excellent. That was the best thing As reported elsewhere we have encountered the arrogant snobbish concierge - additional training required ? F & B outlets - poor value for money, inattentive service - we had our first dinner in the swiss cafe and went elsewhere the rest of our stay. Rooms - musty smell, is occupancy this low ? surely not Worst of all - Bathroom liquids provided by the hotel - the body lotion seems to have deteriorated over time and separated into different layers with lumps inside. Disgusting ! Lost confidence in the other items immediately and had to make a late dash to the pharmacy and buy all the necessities. Hardly a 4 star experience.

Reviews.Title: “Only one word describes the experience....perfect”
Reviews.Author: commando2828
Reviews.Content: I visited singapore on 23rd of October 2008, with my wife, sister in law and my nephew, after much research on location and prices i selected the swissotel... the reviews i read very good but honestly my personal experience was much better than i had expected. Location: Perfect, the best area to stay in very posh, open air, less congested and just 5 mins by car to clarke quay and orchard street. It has the MRT (city hall) touching the hotel, the most convenient way of travel. ( for long distance . if u r 4 passengers then a cab is better for short distances only. cabs have surcharges in the morning and evening, for a couple as well MRT is much cheaper and convenient, again MRT is for people who have the time to walk a lot, buy a tkt, board the train, reach ur destination and again walk or take a bus, bt for long distances its amazing). It has 3 malls ( suntec + raffles + city mall ) attached with its lobby. The best shoping experience is singapore. You have a orchard street of course but, i still prefered these to orchard street. In orchard street paragon and takashimaya are the only ones i found worthwhile. Service: we got our room within 5 mins of checkin and the best possible on the 43rd floor with a balcony ( what an awesome view).Room service was very prompt and helpful. Reasonable rates too. The staff in general was very helpful, always smiling and made thier best efforts to make u feel comfortable. The pool was good, not extraordinary but has a good spa in the adjoining Fairmont hotel. Also when u dine in some specific restaurants within the adjoining malls u can sign the bill instead of paying cash. It will be charged to your room bill. Very convenient and feels good. Room: large spacious rooms, amazing beds and pillows ( semi soft beds and soft pillows ideal for a long hotel stay, my back was intact without any pain or discomfort. Good bathrooms and accessories. ( though the photograph on expedia was better than the room, i still give full marks to the room, it was very very spacious, infact the twin room actually had 2 double beds.) I guess all in all some travellers might find it a little expensive i guess the overall experience of stay+room+location +service was perfet not more not less. I loved the stay and enjoyed sungapore more than i would have in any other hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The stay was fantastic”
Reviews.Author: KristinBok
Reviews.Content: I have just enjoyed a fantastic 1 night stay with Swissotel The Stamford, Singapore. The hotel stay was fantastic, i felt that is was as though my 2nd home, though it was only a night stay. The service was excellent. Personalised service and speedy check in.
