Most importantly i was assigned to a beautiful and clean room on the members. floor. I have been a couple of hotel in Singapore, but Swissotel was the best that i have stayed so far. The room dinning service was good, nice and warm food was serve in less then 10 mins after the call. Birthday cake was send in on time. Both, me and my boyfriend have never enjoyed such good hospitality before. We told ourselves, we will come back and stay at Swissotel the Stamford in time to come.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location - Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BIG_SOS
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Connected to a nice mall w/ easy access to MTR (subway) which can take you to any part of Singapore. Mall has grocery and any kind of food you can want. Very nice spa and pool connected to hotel. Used to be the tallest hotel in the world. Now not, but still high. Get a high floor facing the harbor for a nice view.

Reviews.Title: “An eye in the sky”
Reviews.Author: aussiesinspain
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a favourite with our family and I am not allowed to book anywhere else for stopovers in Singapore. My 8-year-old son thinks it is the best hotel in the world. He particularly loves one of the regular door men, and had tears in his eyes as we departed on the airport bus after our most recent visit. Staying on the high floors of the hotel is really a highlight of any visit to Singapore as the views are great in all directions. The rooms are generally large and they often have 2 queen-sized beds. The decor is becoming a little old and worn, but there are some great features that I would not swap, such as the heavy sliding glass doors to the balconies that can be propped open to let the warm air and the sounds of Singapore in at night. The pool is a delightful place to spend a jet-lagged day or two. The hotel has so many rooms that you can usually get early check-in and late checkout, and cafe swiss is breakfast heaven. Prices seem to have risen a lot in the last few years but I think this is true of Singapore in general. Overall there is no better place to regroup for your European jaunt or get the blood flowing after a long flight towards home. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with great leisure facilities.”
Reviews.Author: liberoxyz
Reviews.Content: My employer has a contract with the Swissotel so I stay there each time I go to Singapore. If a good hotel gym is important to you then you will be impressed! Also the pool & spa facilities are luxurious. My company negotiates an inclusive rate for the gym/spa but I do believe these are charged additionally for normal rates. The hotel is very tall (around 80 floors) and all rooms have a balcony, not great if you suffer vertigo. Each room I have stayed in has been a little dated, not excessively but not as modern as most 4 or 5* hotels (flat screen TV etc). I do believe the hotel is already re-furbing many rooms though. I have never eaten in the hotel restaurants as the Swissotel is directly connected to a large shopping centre with numerous dining choices from fast food outlets, a food court as well as nicer restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby rip-off impersonal train station”
Reviews.Author: yotam
Reviews.Content: I have stayed one night at the Swissotel the Stamford. I left after one night because was very disasisfied awith the hotel and its value and moved elsehwere for the rest of my stay. They also gave me the impression that I will receive a good price given that I was a guest three times in the past, but I verified that the same (exhorbitant) price is given at the airport to anyone at the Tourist authority counter. I asked for a non-smoker room, but was given a smoker room. The room is shabby. The TV is old and on the small side. The furnishings are old. The hotel is huge and the lobby is like a busy train station. No personal touch. Room service not good. I asked for a laundry bad, and instead a service peronnel came to take laundry. The hotel is very very expensive for ordinary guests. They ask for about 230 USD (330SGD) for room without breakfast---but to fill up this huge hotwel they give large discounts to corporate or other privileged guests. Don't stay here for more than 160 USD which is the price I paid in the past, and which will still might be acceptable, given the shabby condition of room and impersonal service. This rate by the way, even the 230 USD rate, does not entitle use of swimming pool (which is not great anyway) and gym. So what's in this hotel anyway? The worst part is the impersonal train station feel. I moved to a three star hotel paying half the price, got a better room, with Plasma tv and the room service was immensely better and the room cleaner!!! Especially the three star hotel gave me a feeling of a home away from home. Nice staff. Personal touch. Real care that you are happy. The shower in my Swissotel was also not much good. The water pressure was not great and the hanled for shower are complicated. The service very distant and the hotel is not a homey place. Just an exhorbitantly priced lodging place. Checking in out can take quite some time as this is a huge hotel and they seem to be saving on staff as well as raising the prices a lot. The result of GREED! In conclusion, not a nice place to stay. Was better two years ago. Also the service and quality of drinks at the Asia Bar on the 71st floor has gone down a lot. Easy to find a better more affordable place, and if you want five stars there certainly are better pickings in Singapore!!

Reviews.Title: “the best in singapore 5star hotels”
Reviews.Author: kiranMumbai
Reviews.Content: the best in singapore the tallest hotel with the biggest rooms and every room with a balcony .the location is too good to be true get down and mrt train station taxi stand shooping centre there is noway any hotel can beat its location room size and balcony also the staff is very good and sevice with a smile

Reviews.Title: “I love Swissotel The Stamfordl !!! FOREVER & ALWAYS !!!”
Reviews.Author: LonelySad
Reviews.Content: I STAYED at this hotel for a night during the 2nd week of the June holidays. The REASON of me staying at this hotel is to take a BREAK from school & just ENJOY myself. I was VERY HAPPY & EXCITED the moment my parents booked this hotel for me !! As i stepped into the lobby on the day i was checking in I was very IMPRESSED with the whole place. The receptionist that was checking us in was a bit slow, maybe she is tired. Also the housekeepers that were cleaning the rooms were friendly but they didn't really understand english when i asked them for something !! But other than that everyone else was KIND & FRIENDLY !! The highest room in this hotel is on the 66th floor & the room that we were ASSIGNED to was on the 55th floor !! It was so MUCH higher than the HDB flat I'm staying at all my life (I live on the 8th floor) !!! Although my parents found the room not as CLASSY as the rooms at the neighboring hotel the Fairmont Singapore that we stayed during the December holidays last year. I FOUND the room VERY NICE & BIG!!! The room ALSO has a pen, pencil, 2 writing pads & alot of paper for guests to write. I'm also addicted in collecting these items as SOUVENIRS & for MEMORIES !!! The view when looking out of the window was SPECTACULAR especially at NIGHT !!! If i ever have the CHANCE to return to this hotel I MAY decide having lunch at one of their restaurants. I MAY also have dinner & enjoy the most SPECTACULAR view at the EQUINOX restaurant with is located on level 70th !!! WOW !!! Finally, I would like to thank all the staff working at this hotel for ALWAYS being SUPER KIND & FRIENDLY to everybody & especially ME !! I would also like to RECOMMEND anyone RICH or POOR to give this hotel a TRY. Once again, Thank you Swissotel The Stamford for making my stay a MEMORABLE one & may your business PROSPER !!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: calekids
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel and for someone that loves good service - then this is the place. Nothing too hard, friendly staff. Room 4658 on 46th floor was harbour view and spectacular. You didn't want to shut the curtains on the lights at night. Breathtaking. Beds comfy and even got an extra roll out for our son, and wasn't expecting it. Must request harbour view room. Its worth it!! Breakfast had plenty to choose from and service in the restaurant for breakfast was again fantastic. We would definately stay there again and plan to in 2010. Surprising large rooms, even with extra bed and the two doubles. Terrific stay and was a big step down to Patong Merlin in Phuket!

Reviews.Title: “Really liked this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JamesVki
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a wonderful location really cant beat it in Singapore. I stayed here for 5 nights and really did enjoy it, the staff are wonderful and very helpful (duty manager Darren, i think very helpful) and the public areas of the hotel look great. I booked a club room on the top floors and it came with access to the club lounge, free drinks and snacks day and night it was nice. My only disappointment with the hotel was their rooms are looking a little tired and are really in need of a major renovation, but i did still really like the hotel, i dunno if its that view out of my window of the 60th floor out over Singapore, its just great. I also enjoyed the coffee machine in my room, it was one of these pod ones, nice and i like the chocolate and fruit basket they left in my room, the chocolate came in a little wooden box you can keep. Amenity's in the bathroom are there own brand and nothing to wright home about. Beds are a little on the hard side, nothing like a "Sheraton sweet sleeper bed" but they were bearable . I don't know if i would stay here again, at least until they renovate there rooms, but i do like the location and the service is first class.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Helzibob
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights back in February and had a fantastic experience. We arrived after a 13 hour flight from the UK at about 7 in the morning, thinking we would be told we could not get into our room until that afternoon. However we were given the keys to our harbour view room on the 44th floor straight away. This had a balcony and amazing views of the city. The room was clean and modern (I think we got one of the renovated rooms). We had breakfast included which was really enjoyable and buffet service so you could have as little or as much as you wanted. The hotel is in a great location in Singapore with lots of shops, restaurants and bars within walking distance. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay, great location”
Reviews.Author: oztraveller52
Reviews.Content: We had a harbor view room on 63rd floor. Stunning views. Room was large, service good, well maintained. Good location with MRT close by.

Reviews.Title: “large room but noiisy”
Reviews.Author: gadlu
Reviews.Content: Location is good (although you can get tired –and broke- of this tourist area and those restaurants after a while) with MRT close by. I had a regular room and its size was really above average (actually it was huge), which is great. But no decoration at all (looks a little bit Spartan). A good point however: you can open the windows (sounds weird to mention this but it's becoming a luxury now in many hotels). The pool is good looking but not outstanding and what bothered me is that smoking is not allowed even outside (poolside or restaurant terrace!!!). The staff is efficient as always in Singapore, and smiling and nice. The big downside of this hotel is the noise: every time a guest gets out of his/her room you'll hear a "BANG". Just pray that you won't have a bunch of party guys around (it happened to me… a nightmare until 3am).

Reviews.Title: “So So - Messed up the booking”
Reviews.Author: Mullay
Reviews.Content: Was on a business trip with another colleague, but the hotel messed up our booking and gave us 1 bed for 2 men. My colleague ended sleeping on the couch (which was very nice of him)...not much apology was made and nothing else was done to make up for the mix-up. Would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Yet another GREAT Swissotel stay - Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: MistaJinxx
Reviews.Content: Yet again, a pleasant and enjoyable stay at the Swissotel Stamford. We stayed in room 54 on level 54 - Harbourview room. Although not yet refurbished or renovated - still clean and comfortable. We also were treated to FREE daily breakfast at Cafe Swiss on level 2 daily. We declined breakfast at time of booking with our travel agent. Breakfast was always fresh, tasty and plentiful. All facets of staff/customer service were quick and friendly AT ALL TIMES. For any 1st timers to Singapore - I highly recommend this hotel if within budget - the location to shops (Raffles City/Marina Square/Suntec City/Funan) and the MRT (City Hall Interchange) alone makes it worth it. I did contact the hotel via email prior to arriving - requesting a king size bed - and my wish was granted.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug112
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel on our way to Australia, it was such a shame we only had one night there. The rooms were clean and to a high standard with amazing views even from the 15th floor. The hotels views from the bars/restaurants are worth the stay alone. The location of the hotel was excellent also, I will definitely be booking this hotel if I return to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “"Fantastic hotel!!"”
Reviews.Author: HelgaMackay
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stepped out of our taxi we knew we had made the right choice to stay at this fantastic hotel. Check-in was very prompt and our room on the 36th floor overlooking the harbour was excellent and exactly what we have paid for. The view was magnificent, it was just a shame we didn't get to spend enough time relaxing and enjoying the view......too busy sightseeing and shopping. The staff were courteous and helpful at all times and went out of their way to make sure we had a very enjoyable stay. The breakfast in Cafe Swisse was magnificent, great variety and always fresh. The location of the Swissotel The Stamford is perfect, access to 4 shopping malls (via underground walkways) and the MRT, close to Raffles Hotel and a short walk to Boat Quay. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone considering a holiday or stopover in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great stay at Swissotel The Stamford”
Reviews.Author: cacktusjack
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Swissotel The Stamford for the first time in August 2006 for a 4-night-stopover from Bali and chose this excellent hotel with its stunning views again as a city-hotel for our Singapore vacation in April 2007 for 5 nights. We always had that beautiful harbor view rooms (2006: 52nd floor, 2007: 46th floor) which offer spectacular views and a small balcony. The size of the rooms is quite large and comfortable with all the 5* amenities. Our room on 46th floor was sometimes a little noisy at night maybe because of water pipes or the elevators. We also liked the tasty breakfast and the great location at Raffles City.

Reviews.Title: “Well maintained, good location, lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: dougly
Reviews.Content: Great location- hotel is connected to malls with great shopping and wonderful restaurants. I have stayed at this hotel since it first opened as a Westin in the mid-80's. I'm surprised how well the hotel has been maintained and updated. The staff are very friendly and accomodating. The hotel has a great pool and fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but had to fight for a room with a good view”
Reviews.Author: ProfessorMommy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel a couple of years ago and am going back to Singapore again in August and am trying to decide where to stay this time. This hotel was beautiful, the room furnishings were very nice, a bit generic but everything worked well. The pool area was gorgeous and they have a spa and the MRT is attached to the hotel and there's a huge shopping mall attached as well. Everything you could ever want is here. I also liked the hotel's restaurant options and the breakfast was great. My biggest problem is that I had paid to be booked into a room with a "stunning view," and the view from my first room was terrible (a grey wall!). I figured I was in Singapore for almost a week and I'd like to enjoy it to the fullest so I had paid for the Room With View! Now, others in my traveling party (with same travel agent) had an incredible view from their room - so I called politely and asked to have a room like theirs. I had to call and argue and fight and beg at least three times to have my room changed. (I was told over and over again that there were no other rooms available, which is kind of hard to believe.) After my third time calling desk people (3 days into my stay), the manager returned my call and apologized profusely and I was moved to a room with an absolutely stunning view. Now, it's time for me to go back to Singapore again, and though I liked everything about this hotel, I don't think I will stay here; I'm afraid that I'll have to argue about a view again, even if I do pay for the room with the view. So I am trying to find a place where I will not have to argue, and just get what I pay for.

Reviews.Title: “A mixed bag!”
Reviews.Author: IncaWalnut
Reviews.Content: Ok.......the plus points first - Great location, wonderful views, large balconies, generally attentive staff, decent sized rooms, good to average food. Negatives - My first room stank (I mean really stank!) I asked to upgrade (extra S$50 a night) and after a 40 minute wait I was taken to what was clearly a renovated floor. I think a traveller tip here, always ask when the room you are being allocated was last renovated! The pools which are shared with the next door Fairmont hotel are totally charmless. This is a big, busy hotel and you have to share the lobby with all the suitcases, airline crews, tour groups etc. Not my idea of fun and so I will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel & great staff”
Reviews.Author: Bruce W
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 7 night stay at the Swissotel The Stamford in Singapore. The Hotel is in a great location. Check in was very smooth & the room was what we requested.(harbour View room). The room was very clean & was attended to twice daily during our stay. We stayed on the 22nd floor, which had great views over the Marina, business areas & Suntec shopping centre. The staff in the Swiss breakfast room were very polite & helpful at all times . The buffet breakfast was great. Being owners of our own (Motel) we were delighted with the cleanliness of the whole Hotel. The Hotel is very large & we were a bit reluctant to book into such a large establishment as the staff generally don't give the high 7 personal level of service that you get from smaller boutique hotels, however this was not the case at The Stamford, the staff were magnificant. The room furniture as mentioned in other reviews is getting a bit tired and the hotel is not 5 star. The hotel is expensive, but then again so is Singapore. Would we recommend this hotel. yes..

Reviews.Title: “Ask for a room on a renovated floor”
Reviews.Author: dm713
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Swissotel three times now, and it's due for some updating...which is apparently happening in stages. Rooms are fine, really spacious, but carpets are showing their age, decor needs some updating. I only know that they're renovating because they put two of my co-workers in rooms that were much newer looking than mine...you would think they'd have put me in the nicer room since I have a point of reference? Still can't believe they charge extra to use their gym facilities. That is unheard of in my travels. I was also bummed that they downgraded their bathroom amenities from L'Occitane to some very low end/Motel 6 grade shampoo/soap. And shampoo only, mind you, no conditioner! All in all, it's still a nice place, great location and service is good. Just be sure to ask for a room on a renovated floor when you check in, you'll be happy!

Reviews.Title: “A good location hotel”
Reviews.Author: Loeane
Reviews.Content: Stay at this hotel only for the location. It is located on top of a shopping mall, as well as the MRT station. Please do not expect nice and luxurious bedrooms. Breakfast serves are below average due to the high occupancy rates i.e. the hotel has one of the largest number of rooms in Singapore. Again, only stay in this hotel for its location!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, could be better for the price”
Reviews.Author: jaremfan
Reviews.Content: The halls outside the room on the 16th floor smelled funny - like someone threw up one night and they were never really able to remove the smell. The rooms too had a funny smell - it went away after the airconditioning was on, but it wasn't pleasant. The rooms are clean. The service is good - I think sometimes too good. They have staff at every corner almost too eager to ask you if you need help. The food is not bad - I was here for an event, so all I had was catered from the hotel. The bathroom shower leaked water to the floor, because the bath didn't have proper drainage. The water seemed to travel around the bath sidewalls and onto the floor, and that made the floor wet. Room service cleaned it up by the time I got back though. The Equinox restaurant on the 67th floor has a breathtaking view of the city. Simply excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Getting what you request”
Reviews.Author: loriperth
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself are frequent travellers to Singapore and most times stay at the Stamford - mostly because of its location. We have been there around 5 or 6 times so far and apart from the first time, have found every subsequent visit quite disappointing to start with. We always request a non-smoking room with 1 king or queen bed, on a high floor and usually pay for a harbour view room. However, on almost all of our stays, we get told that either there are no non-smoking rooms left or no rooms with 1 bed. This is despite reservations being made months in advance. On a couple of occasions the rooms have been extremely 'tired' with old and stained furniture. After complaining, we usually get moved to another room - however, this is not the best way to start your holiday. When hotels take your booking and requests they should make sure they allocate you the appropriate room that you pay for when you arrive. Having said that, we do like the large rooms of the Stamford, the location, balconies and the breakfast that is usually included! Yes we would stay there again - but we always check in with bated breath hoping that we get the proper room and amenities that we book and not have to move around from room to room.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneNikki
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here at least on six other occassions. It is a very busy hotel with lots of business travellers. They try very hard to be efficient with their guests but it doesnt always work. On these last two stays we have been allocated terribly rooms. The first one Room 2765 had no view at all and was on the corner of the hotel making it a strange shaped room. The TV was so close to the bed making it hard to watch. On check out I complained about the room and asked them to make sure when we came back a week later that we would get a better room. On check in I asked again for a better room. There was no room available with a king size bed and that was non smoking. Both of these things I had specifically requested. We ended up in a smoking room Room 4865. Again a corner room with strange configuration. This room smelt of cigarettes and I had a sore throat in the morning. This hotel has no personal service and takes no notice of return guests. The only reason we stay here is for the fantastic location with the huge shopping centre underneath. For my shopping needs you cant go past the location. I was so dissapointed on this stay however we may need to find a new hotel to frequent.

Reviews.Title: “Tall tales”
Reviews.Author: H4rlap
Reviews.Content: I have been to Singapore before in 1998 and had visited this hotel when it was the Westin. Sadly the bar in the 70th floor Equinox complex, which was great in '98, is now very tired and looked dated. Staff not that good and drinks took an age even though it was early evening. That's my only negative, all else very good/excellent and as the many photos show great views and great position. Good check in system and I liked the offer of an upgrade, which we declined as rooms already good. Great size and views towards the Merlion. Bathroom was very clean and in good condition. Beds very comfortable. Overall I score the room excellent, mainly because the room rate was very fair for the 40th floor. Christmas trees were spread around the hotel, some real too, and gave a great feel. Pool side was relaxing with towels laid out on the loungers. We were here for Christmas Day (3 night stay) so had room service bring up breakfast which was on time, fresh and started off our shopping day along Orchard Road (yes all shops open with plenty to see and do). Odd to hear jack hammers in the streets at work though. I fully recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Accomodating Receptionist, Not so easy to extend the stay.”
Reviews.Author: ArvinLee
Reviews.Content: When i booked the hotel thru a travel agent, i have requested for a king sized bed, non smoking room, and i called them again myself making sure that i need a non smoking room. (health reasons). however when i checked in around 3pm, the room wasnt ready yet. after much talks, she helped me to get upgraded to a corner room, non smoking king size bed. appreciate the effort she made. however, when i had to extend my stay (thru a travel again, which has been confirmed with proof) they couldn't find it in their system. it was a hassle, since i had to reschedule some of the meetings. finally after lots lots of talk to many different people they managed to "find" my reservation in their system. other than that, location is perfect , room is big, standard swissotel amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive”
Reviews.Author: macjellicoe
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel, as part of the Singapore Airlines Stopover programme, and it was excellent value for the room. We also received a voucher which gave a discount of 50% off food in the hotel restaurants. The only factor I would criticise about the SIA stopover was the Hop On bus – yes it is free, but it was overcrowded, uncomfortably hot, and the driver would switch off the engine if he stopped for any time, and the air con such as it was, disappeared, leaving all aboard sweltering. In addition you could not see very much or appreciate the city sights from that vehicle, and it took ages to get you anywhere. The next day we realised that the ‘MRT’ system had a station below the hotel. The entrance to ‘City’ station is just beside ‘Starbucks’. A day ticket is excellent value. Using the ‘Tube’ you can select the area of the city you wish to explore, travel speedily in an air-conditioned carriage, see the particular sights, and move on. Better and more efficient by far. One trip I would highly recommend is the morning trip to the Zoo, with Breakfast included. It is a reasonable meal, but the highlight is when the Orang-utans come with their Keepers and join you. Of course there are good photo opportunities and at times you are literally only an arms length away from them. The trip can be booked from the SH Tours desk which is located just behind Reception in the hotel. A well organised trip which is great value and a memorable experience. The coach leaves the hotel at 8.00 am and has you back by 12.30. The Swissotel is an excellent hotel, good facilities, friendly and helpful staff, nice breakfast, lunch and dinners available at good rates in the Swiss Café on the 1st floor. Super views over the city from the rooms, we were on the 48th floor. Lifts worked very quickly and efficiently. The hotel block contains a multitude of shops on the 1st, 2nd and 3rd floors and below ground level there are a vast number of eateries, and a supermarket. We also found a medical practice on the 2nd floor, Drs Singh & Ptns which we had occasion to use, as my wife had a severe reaction to an insect bite. She was seen and treated without delay, given appropriate medication and a very reasonable fee was charged. We were well impressed with the Swissotel, and would definitely give the brand our custom again.

Reviews.Title: “Swissotel anytime”
Reviews.Author: click11
Reviews.Content: we had a view that looked over the harbour and parts of clarke quay. Even better we looked over the convention centre and the new eye in the sky ride that will be open soon. I have never had a better view. The service was fantastic and the beds sooooo big. Just watch out for your childrens dental retainers. Our room maid accidently threw them out. No problem! the management was all detective like and did everything possible to find them. They didn't turn up, but a cheque in the mail back in Perth did to cover the replacement costs. They were great but it did give us a big laugh having men in suites and notebooks writing down... exactly were we saw the retainers last, and what did they look like!!!!! Oh and the buffett breakfast is the best in singapore and love being attatched to Robbinson department store.

Reviews.Title: “It's a Great Hotel for everything!”
Reviews.Author: Dentelle
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my recent stay in this hotel because it's a really nice and posh hotel! It really is a prestigious Singaporean hotel. The location was superb, just go to the lobby then enter the peacock alley then voila you're in a mall!!! There are many malls and stores near this hotel and the Esdplanade and the Merlion can be seen from the window of this hotel. It takes a short walk from this hotel to Suntec cicty and Marina Square which gives it a superb location. It's across the back of St. Andrews chuch which made us happy. My mom told me that lots of people went to that chuch early during Easter. It was a great sight for our family to see. This hotel is in a really posh location, it's beside raffles hotel. Though it's in a posh location, at least there are lots of malls that are near to this place. When it comes to the room, we were really impressed because the moment we entered it we felt a sense of relaxation right away, the room is very fragrant and clean and its bathroom was spacious enough that about 15 people can be stuffed inside it. The service the staff gave was excellent and I really enjoyed my stay here. If ever you'd like to go a bar and have a niceview for supper, go to the seventieth floor for the Equinox restaurant and bar. For the bar, min. 18 for gals and 21 for guys, SGD 15 after 5. resto, SGD15 entrance, minimun of order of a main course worth SGD40+++. This hotel is so updated that it's expanded a new high rise wing to it. We didn't have to leave the hotel to enjoy ourselves, we'll just go down and voila the malls are flooding!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: Ola8
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night stay at Swissotel The Stamford following a week in Penang. Booked through SIA Stopover which gave us free shuttle to/from the airport as well as free entry to some attractions and free Hop on city bus. The hotel was full so not able to upgrade to room on executive floor. We asked for harbour view but not available. Instead got partial harbour view on 43rd floor. This partial view was south to the marina area ie towards Suntec and the Singapore Flyer (their London Eye) and the mouth of the river. Suffering from vertigo I could not go out onto the balcony but I was reliably informed by my husband that you could see towards Boat Quay and the concert hall if you leaned out slightly. I could look out of the floor to ceiling window without feeling queasy but no way could I have stood out on the balcony! Room a bit tired looking but perfectly adequate for our needs. Had seen mixed reports about breakfasts but we had no problems in the Swiss Cafe. Full buffet with English-type cooked breakfast - fried eggs or omelettes and the like made to order - fruits, cereals, juice, toast, pastries as well as local and Japanese style breakfasts. Service was excellent. Every day we were in about 0800-0815 so don't know if worse at other times but we had no problems. Plates cleared quickly and tea/coffee topped up constantly. Cost for 2 S$70.00 less 50% SIA Stopover discount plus local taxes came to about S$41 (about £15 sterling) so don't think this is expensive. We did eat there one night again got 50% discount. 2 courses and 2 beers totalled about S$60. Main course portions not huge. Talking about food you have to try Clarke Quay and Boat Quay both of which are within easy walking distance from the hotel. An experience not to be missed though food can be a bit hit or miss. But I must say I wished I'd had a sign to hold up typed up in big bold letters - on one side 'Already Eaten' and on the other 'Not Tonight Thanks'. This would save you having to repeat one of them every 2 minutes during your walk along (especially Boat Quay). All in all hotel was good and in the perfect location for getting out and about. Our fifth visit to Singapore and we have stayed in various locations. This is probably the best. Our room was 4350 with the partial harbour view. I would guess that rooms ending 51 to possibly 61 are the ones with the view over the harbour, Padang etc. Looking at the circuit for the forthcoming Grand Prix the harbour views should have a good view of the quite a lot of the circuit though with it being a night race not sure. And it is no doubt sold out for that period. No problems checking in or out. Again saw reviews which said that you could be waiting for ages. They have staff in the lobby who are basically 'meeters and greeters' and if you stand still for a minute you are approached and your query dealt with. The only time I could see there being a problem is if you were a group checking in at the separate group check in and it coincided with one of the many Qantas crews checking in or out you might have a wait. But as individuals we certainly had a good experience. I would certainly recommend this hotel for anyone wanting to be in the central area who want to explore on foot as well as having good access to local transport. Good value with the SIA Stopover. Definitely considering it for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Merlion near by, classy hotel, great service (shame about the breakfast)”
Reviews.Author: KaKwok
Reviews.Content: Overall, the only thing that disappointed me to any real degree was the breakfast. For vegetarians, it's not that great. I expected more from a hotel in Singapore. Anyway, other then that, the room was great. We had our own balcony with great view. Tip: Don't hang you wet swimmers out... one of mine is MIA now. From the time you get to the hotel, the quality and level of service is apparent (bearing in mind the price of the hotel). Example of this is when I had an incident in my room, the duty manager came up toot sweet and sorted it out, no problems. The room's decor while nothing to scream about, fits the room well and gives the room a good ambience. The hotel sports and excellent gym, spa and pool. You have two choices for restaurants for breakfasts. Location wise, the nearest MRT is CITY HALL and that's about a five minute walk from the hotel. The hotel itself has a shopping centre attached. Overall, a great stay. Ka

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rubiru
Reviews.Content: Great location. Great views. Great bars/restaurants on the 70+ floors. Room was nice, could prob do with a bit of a modernisation in the decoration but this would not put me off staying here again. Its also just around the corner from Raffles.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location to enjoy all of Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Flake25
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for about 30 days in December for business. While work was priority, staying at the Stamford allowed easy access to all of Singapore. The Rooms Had a room on the 36th floor overlooking the city (Boat Quay) and skyscrapers and it was amazing. The outdoor balcony was just really cool to walk out and see ALL of Singapore. If you go request a room at least on the 30th floor and higher, again facing the city would be best. I liked that they had a master control of lights, TV, Air all attached to the clock. So you didn't have to leave your bed to shut out lights or adjust the air. The only concern to me was the air. It was either too hot or too cold, couldn't find a way to adjust to a specific temperature, but was able to get used to it after a while. Overall Hotel Lobby was quite small and could get crowded at times, always something going on, wedding, convention so does get crowded although unless you are checking in or out or waiting for someone, no need to worry much on that. I did like that it was attached to the Raffles Plaza mall. Personally I didn't find the mall very good with stores, but also has access to the MRT (train, which is TOP NOTCH) and access to City Link and Sun City Malls, it was convienent on a rainy day, which it seems to do alot in December. Also Hotel had on I believe the 3rd floor, this GREAT Indian restaurant, forget the name... One thing I did find funny, was I read a previous comment before I left and it noted about the prostitutes who hang around the mall right at the entrance, well that is a very true statement. Surprised that they allow that, but I guess it added to the atmosphere in Singapore, shouldn't be too concerned as they seem to be respectable but would not want to have young kids around that area after 10pm. Location Again as mentioned access to all Singapore has to offer. If you are in decent condition and the weather is not brutally hot, easy walks to Arab St., Little India, and Boat and Clake Quay. A walk to Chinatown is not bad either but a little longer. Overall the hotel was great with location and service was decent. A little subjective as it was a business trip, but if I was going to Singapore on vacation and prices were similar to other hotels, I would definitely stay at the Stamford, again would need to be at least 30th floor or higher, to really take in all of Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful! Close to MRT,”
Reviews.Author: pc1029
Reviews.Content: Very happy with Swissotel. Beautiful and clean. Breakfast buffet was expensive, but good. Attached to Raffles shopping mall. convenient to MRT. Within walking distance to Boat Quay where there are lots of choices for dinner along the river.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: wuhsinman
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Stamford. the first was more than seven years years ago. I was a bit nervous at some of the recent reviews about how it had gone down hill, but since the other members of my traveling party were staying there it made sense to go with the flow. The public areas have changed some but seemed quite modern and clean to me. The rooms are also comfortable and clean; sheets were changed every day. i left some small change (<.50 SGP) in a pocket when i sent my clothes for laundry and the change was promptly placed in Lost and Found for me to retrieve. I don't tend to use staff (front desk, concierge) that much, but when i did talk to staff they were unerringly polite and helpful. For American visitors be aware that coffee in the room means an electric water kettle and instant coffee. i ended up getting coffee from room service each morning and could charge to the company so it wasn't too much of an issue. The location of this hotel is excellent; it is central to all city activities and the shopping is great. There is a large mall under the hotel and you can walk between the Raffles Mall, CityLink Mall, and Suntec mall without going outside (it it's raining or too hot).

Reviews.Title: “A Room with a View !!! Great hotel and Location.”
Reviews.Author: Sfran10536
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on 5 occasions over the last 3 years on business and I love it. I can still recall my first visit and the staggering view I saw when I entered by room looking out over the Padang to Clarke Quay, Supreme Court and the Business District. I have shared it with you all. Ausust 2007 I took my family on holiday. I have stayed at the Hilton Singapore but now I would not stay anywhere else in Singapore. The location is unbeatable next to Raffles Hotel, Chijmes and Sunteq Shopping Centre. The rooms are big, luxurious and immaculately clean. The views from every room are amazing and the private balconies really do allow you to soak up the city of Singapore. Every room I have stayed in has been huge and we had 2 adults and 2 children in one room when we stayed in August and there are not to many options for family rooms in Singapore hotels. Hints & tips: Upgrade to Executive room it's not much more but give you access the Executive lounge and it does make the differents when you finish a days work and then wander up for a Tiger Beer or two. Try the breakfast by the pool. Yes, it's an additonal cost but nice to do when you stay. The Night Club - Asia Bar at the top of the hotel gives you a great view over Singapore at night. Also there is a quiet bar next to it you can sit look out over Fort Canning and Orchard Road. I really am looking forward to my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels you will ever stay at”
Reviews.Author: CanberraPammo
Reviews.Content: What can I say - this hotel is one by which all hotels should be measured. I have stayed here 4 different times over the past 10 years and would not stay anywhere else in Singapore. The location is unbeatable, the service is typically Singapore-efficient (best in the world), rooms are luxurious and immaculately clean. The views from every room are amazing and the private balconies really do allow you to soak up the real Singapore. Every room I have stayed in has been huge (compared to European standards) and there is nothing the staff will not do for you, from supplying international adaptors to chatting with you to pass the time whilst you wait for your airport transfer. I just love this place. The shopping mall below has EVERYTHING you could want in beautiful airconditioning surroundings - this place is perfect. I always look forward to my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaTraveler2
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here in January after a cruise and loved everything about it. We selected hotel based on location primarily as we could walk to most all we wanted to see plus the Trip Advisor reviews were so favorable. Our rate was great as we got a Super Saver rate out of the many options they offer. We found the shopping center they connected to was wonderful and we were here every day. Our room was large for a hotel and had everything imaginable - shoe horn, shopping bag, coffee pot, safe, robes and slippers, iron and board - cannot think of one thing they missed. Plus hotel employees were so cordial and helpful. Clean sheets every night! We have nothing but good things to say about The Stamford and will look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “After a tricky start, fabulous time”
Reviews.Author: BestOfBreed
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week with our family of four. After a 12 hour flight we got here to find out there had been some kind of a mistake in our reservation. They had booked us a room a day earlier and cancelled it for "no-show". I knew I had made it correctly and got quite upset. Naturally the hotel was fully booked now... After a while the manager came to talk to us, guided us to the bar and offered us something to drink. Then he kindly managed to find us a small room for the first night. (I have a funny feeling that it was actually one of the staff's room?) We stayed there for a night and the next day got upgraded to the corner room we had paid for. After that it was great. A big hotel makes it not so personal, but the pools were great and views from the room fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Just Great”
Reviews.Author: Xoaninha
Reviews.Content: A really good hotel! This hotel is just great if you want to visit Singapore. Is really in the city center (great location) right next to the Raffles Hotel and it has a wonderful view of the city (I was in the 64th floor). In the beginning there was a little misunderstanding because of the bed (we were in honeymoon and they gave us a 2 bed room) but it was immediately solved. The breakfast is fantastic, were you can chose a continental one or if you prefer there is a lot of Asian choices. The staff is polite and they try to help you in any way they can. They even have a room that you can access after cheeking out, were you can change, have a shower or just relax for some time (our flight was at 11 PM and we had to check out at 1 PM, so it was very useful).

Reviews.Title: “Busy but well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: rhino_oz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night before Christmas and 4 nights over New Year prior to moving out of Singapore. This is a well located hotel being directly above City Hall MRT, and forms part of the Raffles City shopping complex which is joined to other nearby malls (Citylink, Marina Square and Suntec City). Great if you can't stand the Singapore heat as you don't need to step outside to get to them. The hotel is big and shares some facilities with the Fairmont (until recently known as Raffles the Plaza) next door, such as swimming pools and the gym and spa area - all of these are of good quality and very well maintained. Stayed in a Harbour King overlooking the Esplanade which was generous in size, and like all rooms has a balcony, so you can open the door and get fresh air, and not be hermetically sealed in your hotel room as is usually the case. Breakfast is in the Kopitiam or Cafe Swiss downstairs. Opted for Cafe Swiss which has a very good selection of food, and great service - the only gripe I would have was the way they present the cereal - on a three tiered structure with you having to use a regular sized spoon to serve yourself. Not so great if you are short and like a lot of cereal! I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel but would say that's its not such a great place to stay at peak times (like New Year when I was there). As I said its a big hotel with over 800 rooms, and was very full during my second stay. To give and idea what its like at these times: - I waited about 10 minutes to be served at check in (though the three guests that were being served admittedly seemed very high maintenance). Check out however was a breeze (separate desk facing lifts). - The lift service was average (I waited 6 minutes in the lift lobby one morning to get to breakfast). - The Cafe Swiss gets very crowded (though to the hotel's credit they set up the buffet breakfast in an upstairs ballroom as an alternative location) - If you call for something to be brought to your room you could be waiting a while (45 minutes for ice). - The swimming pools on New Year's Eve afternoon were seething masses of humanity. If you like lap swimming, you'd probably need to be in there first thing in the morning. Hotel also offers broadband in room for (from memory) S$25 + service charge + GST for 24 hours. Its not unnormal to quote prices like this in Singapore but maybe a lot of overseas visitors are not used to this. If you have a laptop with WiFi you can use the free Wireless@SG service, but is better from ground level - on the 40th floor where I was I received no reception.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: TrevorWells
Reviews.Content: Possibly the best city centre hotel you will stay at. Location fantastic. Rooms are great. Food is fantastic. Check-in, check-out easy and swift. Staff helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great rates”
Reviews.Author: paulncath
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night on stop over home from Oz. Hotel was excellent, rooms very clean and well appointed, stayed on 43rd floor over looking city, and got fantastic views. We are a family of 4 including 2 teenages so managed to get connecting rooms. Beds very comfortable. Loads of rates available, would suggest getting rate including breakfast. This was buffet style and selection of food was enormous. Would also suggest you book via airline if you can, we travelled with Sinagpore Airlines who get very good rates unfortunatly all these rooms gone when we booked. Managed to get rooms at SG$360 each including breakfast. Did not recognise many of the negative comments noted on previous reviews. Could not use bars as kids were under age, 18 for girls, 21 for boys, but you can get a drink in the foyer cafe area with teenagers. Hotel was busy each time we went through reception, but with so many floors this is to be expected. Our check in was quick and efficient, check out is at a separate check out desk, and was again quick and efficient. Hotel will hold luggage if you have late flights, we used this facility and were happy with the security of storage. They alos have a hospitality room for you to use to freshen up before departure. Note that this is an oversize room and you share it with other travellers. Hotel does not have airport transfer facility, so we used cabs. Normal taxi cost via meter cost us SG$16, but you can use maxicab, for a fixed SG$35.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Sue046
Reviews.Content: Have just returned after spending 8 wonderful nights at the Swissotel The Stamford in Singapore. Was a little apprehensive as I had heard varying reports about it, but from the beginning to the end of my stay everything went extremely smoothly. Had a harbourview room on the 22nd Floor, non-smoking as requested. Marvellous views. It was not what I would call flash but was very roomy and clean. The housekeeping was very efficient. Its excellent central location was a huge plus and with the MRT underneath the hotel I was able to travel easily to all places of interest in Singapore. There were also many eating places in the huge mall adjoining the hotel. Had the buffet breakfast in the Swiss Cafe at the hotel and it was superb. Huge choice of western and asian dishes and the service was almost overwhelming in its attentiveness and friendliness. Without exception every hotel employee I came into contact with was friendly, courteous and eager to assist. I have previously stayed at the York and the Carlton hotels in Singapore but found this hotel better than both of them and I will definitely stay in the Swissotel The Stamford the next time I visit Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel With Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AmizaAmira
Reviews.Content: I stayed at a deluxe room (+ breakfast) for a night as I was on business trip. I paid S$276 for the room at Level 17. There were 2 double beds but I was alone......so the other bed was left unoccupied. The bathroom door was decorated with mirror. There were a few moment where I was caught by surprise that I saw "someone" inside the room but it was actually myself.!!! The hotel was nice and had such great service. I booked the room through email and everything went smoothly. I stated my preferences but the hotel could not confirm until checking in. Upon checking in, to my surprise, there was a room available at Level 17 (??? Grrr!!!). Kind of frustrated as I thought I could get a room at higher level as I was told that the view would be great at night. However, the room, bathroom, mini bar, toiletries, service at the restaurant, food, Christmas decoration, were great. The hotel location is great! The hotel is connected to shopping complexes and a lot of tourist spots such as the Espalanade and the Singapore's icon, i.e Merlion are just walking distance away from the hotel. The City Hall MRT Station is located just next door and as such, the hotel is easily accessible via MRT. The only thing I do not like about this hotel is the "Extras". Everything extra you need to pay such as buffet breakfast, spa, airport transfer.....Hope the hotel mgmt could consider about this as with the expensive rate, those extras should have been included.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel- shame about the extras.”
Reviews.Author: AngusY
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after fleeing a cyclone in Vietnam. Everywhere was booked out in Singapore due to the Asean summit and we didnt want to look around for hours so we decided to treat ourselves. We had a room on the 55th floor with a great view of the city. The room was good, balcony, bathroom was good. The swimming was also nice and the location in the Raffles was perfect for shopping, dining,MRT etc. The most annoying thing about this hotel is the extras. To stay a night is not cheap. I booked on the hotels website.The final price does not include a daily GST rate (7%) no breakfast, 24$ a day for fitness centre access 24$ a day for internet either high speed or WIFI. When your paying so much for the hotel room these should be included. Even 1 star guest houses in Singapore include these free. Better to book somewhere online well in advance if planning to visit Singapore and you can get just as good elsewhere in other 5 star hotels for half the price and inclusive of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Very accessible - great location”
Reviews.Author: freshia31
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as it is the closest hotel to my venue. I checked in at 9pm and was so disappointed when the receptionist told me to wait for an hour as they have not cleaned up my room. At 9 pm!!!! Apparently it was full house because of the ASEAN summit. They gave me access to hospitality lounge where I can rest, take a shower and watch TV. I finally get my room one hour later. I checked by phone and the operator did dare to advise me to go down to receptionist to pick up my key. I obviously refused and finally the customer service delivered the key to me. My room is nice. spacious, good bathroom and has a high speed internet access. The swimming pool is average, shared with Hotel Raffles the Plaza. Not so happy as the GYM didn't come free!!! However the good side is...the restaurant is good. Buffet breakfast is okay. May choices for room service dining. Had to order room service 3X and all the food was delicious. The second good thing is location. It is next to Raffles shopping center and next to City Hall MRT station. Entertainment wise if good... they have Equinox complex which has a good view of Singapore. Mind you the hotel is the tallest building in the country. It is also near to the \historic raffles hotel, chimes and Funan Digital iT Mall.

Reviews.Title: “Not a luxury hotel!”
Reviews.Author: drrw
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at Swissotel The Stamford with my fiancee as a treat after backpacking through Malaysia. We booked a deluxe harbour view room through Expedia (weekend rate). Reception was a chaotic with queues every time we went there. The first room we were given (30th floor) was tatty with chipped furniture and a stained bath, and the harbour was only just visible from the far end of the balcony. We complained and after a 3 hour wait were given a satisfactory room on the 26th floor. The hotel literature mentions a fitness centre and spa, but access to this is NOT included in the room rate. A charge of SGD 24.50 per person per day is made for access to the gym. We were very disappointed. Swimming pool access is free. There were two breakfast buffets. The main buffet in Cafe Swiss is fine - good food and service and a pleasant environment. When Cafe Swiss is full, however, guests are directed to the nextdoor Kopi Tiam restaurant where the buffet was poor (food was cold, service was poor, lighting was dim, and the staff started to put away the food half an hour before the official end of breakfast). All in all, the hotel has some nice rooms, but its standard ones are mid-range rather than luxury in quality. The lack of inclusive gym access is inexcusable for a hotel of this standard. Not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Two Stays - 2 totally different experiences”
Reviews.Author: BigTimeTravel
Reviews.Content: I recently took a 15 day cruise from Singapore to Sydney and booked this hotel for a caouple days prior to the ruise and then again for an overnight on the way back. The first two nights were great... arrived late on Nov 2nd and was provided a really nice room on the 54th floor. The room was spotless with twin balconies which provided a great view. The Internet connection, wired only, is rather expensive at $28 per 24 hours. Not really a great connection. No wireless offered in the hotel. The return night on Nov 21st was a totally different experience. The room I received was on the 7th floor and totally minimal. Same rate as the previous stay and same booking but disappointing room. Booked directly with the hotel website at full rate. Will stay at another hotel next time I am in Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dinthurai
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 2 nights. Great welcome at check in, my room was not ready yet as I came ealier than the check in time. Another room was provided to freshen up. Once receiving my room it was on the 32nd floor, providing great views of Singapore. The room was very clean and modern looking. There was a great view from the balcony and amenities were excellent. The location of the hotel is excellent as it is near key areas Marina, Plaza shopping city, Raffles hotel and the MRT station. Staff are very polite, and courteous. I would defiinteyl stay here again. Got a cheaper deal through booking this with Singapore Airlines, as they also arrange transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Too many hookers”
Reviews.Author: Stephen_Lloyd
Reviews.Content: I frequently stay at the old sister hotel, the Plaza, but could not get in there due to a conference of Insurance firms being held. I was therefore put into the Stamford, my first visit here for many years. Both hotels are located at the Raffles City shopping centre and connected by a ground floor passageway which also enters the shopping centre The check in was good, and staff as ever helpful in the hotel. I had a 54th floor room with great views across both Boat and Clark Quays. The room itself was how the Plaza had been several years ago before they started refurbshing. As such it is a little dated but totally adequate and confortable. A good working desk is provided but the shower and bath combined is looking old. A glass screen to keep water in was fairly useless. I found two problems. The lifts to the guest floors are accessible during the day directly from the shopping centres second and third floors. I did not need my key card to use these, despite having slots available on the panels to use them. As a result I felt security of the rooms was loose as anyone could go up stairs without going through the lobby. Which dovetails with the second point - on my last night, also the last night of the conference, I walked via the passageway to have a nightcap in Raffles which directly over the road from the Plaza. I was approached by two hookers in what I consdiered hotel space, within a minute of each other. I raised it with a member of the Plaza staff as I passed him to get a response of "there's a conference on" but no other action. Likewise there were several hanging about outside the Plaza. This is a nuisance factor most travellers can do without and a big disappointment as I had not seen this before. Before going back to either Stamford or Plaza hotels in future I will ensure there is not a conference on.

Reviews.Title: “a terrific hotel - absolutely recommended!”
Reviews.Author: reddygirl
Reviews.Content: my daughter and i stayed at swissotel the stamford singapore for one night in june this year on the way back from dubai and the uk. i stayed at raffles the plaza next door (i have written a review for this hotel also) with my husband almost three years prior, and as i was travelling with my daughter, thought i would try out the swissotel. my husband stays there regularly on business. i was very impressed with the swissotel. check in, whilst there was a queue, was very efficient and polite. our bags were taken very quickly to our room, very welcome after a long and exhausting trip. my daughter and i had an enormous room with two queen sized beds in, and a lovely bathroom. although i had requested from the travel agent a low floor (i know how high this place is!) we ended up on the 43rd floor! my husband hasn't even stayed that high! anyway, we had marvellous views of the city and surrounds. the bathroom was lovely with nice toiletries. my daughter was very impressed with the size of the room, but i kept her away from the balcony! the location of course is excellent with the shopping centre, chijmes and transport nearby. my daughter couldn't believe the shops were next door. sad to say we ate burger king for dinner, but it was quick, easy and cheap! we had breakfast the next day, which had an enormous choice. we arrived during a busy time, but the staff were still very polite, friendly and helpful. my daughters eyes boggled at all the food, and although she didn't like some things she ate (she can be a tad fussy and it had nothing to do with the quality of the food) it was wonderful that there were so many things to try. the guava juice proved a hit! the coffee was lovely too. the pool is shared with raffles the plaza next door, and a lovely cool retreat from the heat and humdity of singapore. what i liked most about the hotel was however the staff., from the check in staff right through to the guy who hails the taxi (he even offered to be in my daughters photo, which left her very pleased!) they were constantly approaching my daughter and chatting to her, even the male staff! children can sometimes be made to feel invisible, or like nuisances, but they were so lovely to her that she shone every time they spoke to her! what made me laugh was that they were noticed her because of her blonde hair, blue eyes and fair skin (so different to them, they said)! she had a doll which looked like her, and the staff found it hilarious (again, including the males) and asked her all about the doll! several of the female staff complimented her on her lovely hair, which was such a sweet thing to do. there was a slight mix up at check out, but it was handled with humour and sorted quickly and efficiently. we were offered the use of a room and the pool at check out as our flight home was late at night. that was very appreciated. in short, i would highly recommend the swissotel if you are taking kids, as raffles the plaza next door is really a business/couples hotel. i loved it, and when travelling with my family will be my hotel of choice for singapore (raffles the plaza for just myself and hubby though). very reasonably priced too. and thanks for being so nice to my daughter!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: move55
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel 1 month and had a Harbor view room. The location is excellent - right above the Raffles MRT station so you can take the MRT from the airport and stop right under the hotel. The breakfast is excellent with continental as well as local dishes. At the 8th floor is a pool and a tennis court. The only ‘–‘ is the price. Also long stay rates were quite high (around 150 EUR / night - breakfast included). I would recommend you to book a Harbor View room.

Reviews.Title: “A good start to our vacation in S.E. Asia”
Reviews.Author: limelemon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as part of the Singapore Stopover package during the first leg of our trip. Some observations: 1. Excellent location - right above the Raffles MRT station and just a few steps away was the shopping mall. 2. Check-in at 1:30 A.M. was efficient, however, the bell-hop was no where to be found and the front desk didn't offer to call for one. It wasn't fun lugging our suitcases around after a 20 plus hour flight. 3. We were given a room on the 44th floor overlooking the marina bay area (Esplanade, Marina Square, Suntec City etc). The room itself had two double beds and was of average size and roomy enough for two people. The washroom was roomy with a tub/shower combo and a toilet. We found the beds to be a little hard. 4. Breakfast was not included in our package. We did, however, have the breakfast buffet at the Kopi Tiam restaurant (right beside the Swiss Cafe) on the 2nd level. Service from the host and servers was great! There was a good selection of western breakfast favourites (scrambled eggs, sausage, toast, pastries etc) as well as asian favourites (noodles, kaya for the toast, steamed dumplings, nasi lemak, porridge etc) All in all, a good hotel. Excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if possible”
Reviews.Author: georgie_girl1
Reviews.Content: There are only 2 things going for this hotel -- its location and its breakfast buffets. We should have heard warning bells from the outset when we were making our reservation -- the person was audibly typing on his computer the entire time and wasn't paying attention to anything I was asking. I had to keep repeating myself and the only time he truly snapped to attention was when I confirmed my reservation. When we checked in, the room on the higher floor that I'd requested (note -- it's the higher floors that have been renovated) was not ready. We were given one on a low floor. I decided to give it a chance but it wasn't long before we found 1) the previous occupants' crusty oily stains on the sheets and hairs in the sink, and 2) that the bathtub was not working (the stopper was screwed so there could be no chance of soaking in the tub). A technician came to try to fix the tub, but he could not. He had the sense to say he'd ask for another room for us. We eventually got another room -- on the supposedly renovated higher floor -- but on entering with the porter, we were all appalled to find the toilet repeatedly flushing and overflowing. The bathroom floor was flooded. I wasn't prepared to repack all my stuff AGAIN, so we sat down and waited for a technician to fix that and housekeeping to come clean up the bathroom. The technician took ages to come (while gallons of water continued pouring out), and housekeeping took even longer. We were dying to pee! And in the meantime, we found some creamy white stuff on the sheets... Honestly, like I'd said, the only things going for this hotel are the location -- being very central and connected to a nice mall -- and its breakfast buffets -- yummy, substantial and in a very pleasant environment. If you get one of those unrenovated rooms, be prepared for things not working and icky stuff on the old furnishings. Housekeeping is horribly inefficient -- you could be gone for 3 hours or even 6, and your room can still not be made up. And the scum on the bathtubs is proof of how well they do their job. The bathroom, incidentally, is not child-friendly -- there is only a fixed shower overhead, which means you will have difficulty washing your little one down.

Reviews.Title: “Great luxury hotel, check the promotions”
Reviews.Author: Gez_egen
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night at Stamford after a honeymoon at Bali. We stayed at weekend and there was a promotion with %50 discount on rack rates. We stayed a 42th floor harbour view room and the view is great especially at night. The room is luxurious and spacious, with a balcony and it is a privilege to have balcony at that height. You can take pictures of the harbour and downtown from the balcony. There is a shopping mall inside the building and you can easily access the mall from lobby. Also it is near the metro station where there is an underground shopping mall and connects Raffles to Suntec City. These malls are very handy at a place where there is always rain. With metro, to get around is very easy. The breakfast is very good with lots of choice. We checked out at noon but our flight was at night, so we spend some time around singapore and when we get to hotel to pick our luggage they gave us a room at 1st floor to have a shower and change our clothes before our flight and that's cool. Highly recommended if you get a bargain price.

Reviews.Title: “Swiss Precision and Efficiency”
Reviews.Author: Nonnapn
Reviews.Content: It's always a pleasure to stay at The Swissotel in Singapore. I go for overnight business trips and appreciate how smooth everything works. From checking in and having a room ready for me even if I get to the hotel before check in time to the speedy and efficient express check out service, so useful when you have to run to the airport to catch the flight back. The hotel is also convenient in terms of location, there is an MRT station right beside it. There is a small shopping center right in the hotel complex and lots of small coffee shops and restaurants, even a bookstore that stays open till 10 pm. The staff are always smiling and helpful and everything works well. It also helps a lot that they always give me a room on the higher floors with a terrific view of the harbour. Maybe one of these days I can try out their Amrita Spa which seems to have good reviews from other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “high in the sky”
Reviews.Author: Pete3080
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before a long time ago and it looked much the same. 70 floors, shopping mall and underground line. On arrival from the transfer bus we were greeted like VIP's and a receptionist was summoned to check us in. The round shape of the hotel makes the rooms slightly non-square, we had a great view of the central park and cathedral and a small balcony. The rooms are large and well appointed. There are a lot of restaurants of all standards in the hotel and in the mall below. There is a blurring so it isn't that clear when you are in a hotel restaurant or outside. Our first breakfast was a disappointment, the main restaurant area looks spectacular but the food had a poor selection, it is a Swissotel and so was Swiss style, cheese, ham and buns, bircher muesli. Coffee was scarce. Service wasn't very good either - the receptionist and service staff seemed to be hiding if you looked at them. It took an expedition to find a very good breakfast place, outside next to the pool. We ate in the hotel restaurant and it was very good for service and style, but not cheap. We found two very plush restaurants in a passageway between the hotel and the mall - an Indian and a Thai. We chose the Indian and it was excellent, the food, service and decor - in Britain a place with decor like this would have cost hundreds of pounds but it was very reasonable. We also stumbled on a sandwich bar / deli with tables that overlook the mall and appears to be part of the hotel. The service and food was excellent there as well. There is long distance walking along City Mall which extends from the Stamford Mall, seems like about a mile of tunnels acting as a shopping mall. Also the subway station is an interchange so its good to go in most directions. Staying in this complex is one long period of discovery, there are bits that pop up everywhere and its all high quality. Our flight out was at midnight and the hotel had a room put by for late check out. We thought the room was for us but there were 12 others crammed in and a family queueing to use the one shower facility in the room. It kept emptying and filling and the staff were struggling to keep it freshened. Still it was better than the hotel we stayed in a couple of years ago who only let us use their gym shower with a late check out. Overall I'd use this again for certain.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: HJCF
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights as an extended family and had 2 rooms, on the 41st and 43rd floors. The rooms were nice, very large, although our agent had not requested non-smoking rooms and the 43rd floor was a little smokey (but my husband couldn't tell!). The pool is lovely, and there is a good choice of restaurants. We had breakfast in the hotel, which was very nice, and we ate in the asian restaurant there too, which was excellent. The hotel was incredibly busy when we were there (it was a national holiday), so the lifts were a nightmare - twice we took the stairs to the 39th floor and took the separate lift there after waiting for ages. However, in spite of this they sat us down at breakfast very quickly. The concierge staff were excellent, very helpful, and there was nothing wrong with reception either. We would stay there again definitely, and the location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: jurassic
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Swisotel for a 1 night stopover on route to Australia. Very impressed. Check in very quick for a large hotel. Booking was for a std. room on 10th floor. Was offerred an upgrade to a refurbished room on a higher floor for 40 dollars. Declined this and our room was actually excellent. Large confortable bed. good bathroom, and a balcony. The swimming pool, which is shared wirh Raffles Plaza Hotel, is on the 8th floor which was convenient. Had breakfast in the shopping mall underneath the Hotel. The hotel's location is ideal for a short stopover. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with hard beds”
Reviews.Author: NJnobleone
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel in late July for a conference. Think the hotel is a typical business hotel but does a very good job for such a large place. Had a room on the 35th floor overlooking the city and each room has a balcony which is unusual for such a tall hotel. Got a twin bedded room as had my daughter in tow and found the beds to be very hard for western tastes and had similar comments from many colleagues. Room was clean and service in the hotel was fine. Food wise most of my eating was at the hotel and I found it to be of a very high standard for such food which was a pleasant suprise and the hotel staff service at events was excellent. Location wise the hotel is next door to City Hall station (we got the train to and from the airport which is a bargain at $1.50 each way) and walking distance from the waterfront which has many resturants and bars. There are also three large malls, one next door, one five mins walk away and one mall connecting the two and Raffles Hotel is just round the corner which makes it a great location to get around Singapore from in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Great location especially for families”
Reviews.Author: SpiderBoy
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at this hotel ... room/view/staff were all wonderful. The hotel is located very centrally making it easy to shop/eat/shop/eat and get to the next place to shop/eat. The hotel is located above a shopping mall, metro line and guests can use the pool of the neighbouring hotel which is great in the humid hot days. Singapore is underrated as a city (you can actually enjoy it) for families and this hotel make it easy to keep everyone happy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: jills12
Reviews.Content: We had a 2 night stop-over at this hotel following a trip to Australia. We found this to be a lovely hotel in a great location. The rooms were clean and comfortable and the service was good. We had the full buffet breakfast included in the price, which was good with a large selection. I am not sure how much this would have cost separately. The pool was lovely however it was shared with the hotel next door (Raffles the Plaza) and hence because both hotels had many rooms, the pool could be over-crowded in better weather (it was raining most of the time we were there and so did not make use of the pool, and it wasn't busy then). The hotel had loads of facilities, which we would have made us of had we been there longer. The hotel was located around 10 minutes in a taxi from China Town and about 15 minutes from the main shopping plaza on Orchid Road. One suggestion for potential travellers to Singapore - make sure you visit the night safari - it is excellent! The zoo was very good too however, if you are only doing one of these trips I highly recommend the night safari. The Swissotel is about 25 minutes in a taxi from the zoo and safari but taxi's are VERY cheap ($13 - around 5 British pounds!) We got this hotel for 70 british pounds per night (which included 2 full buffet breakfasts and our daughter ate free), so if you get a good deal like this then I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: madanut
Reviews.Content: great hotel,clean,well located for shopping and using trains. service overall was wonderful. very large hotel so lifts a bit slow at times. hospitality lounge not clean enough, only compliant. otherwise highly recommened. will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views - Standard Rooms”
Reviews.Author: HallTravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Swissotel for a couple of nights after visiting Bali. The hotel have excellent views from many of the rooms and also the bar/restaurant on the 70th Floor. We had a room on the 46th floor which had views all over Singapore. They room itself was large with a modern bathroom. The decor is dated in some respects but not really too bad. We had asked for a double but they gave us a twin room instead which was annoying but the twin beds are in fact small double beds and they were fully booked so no chance of moving. If you are staying here on holiday then you are likely to be below the 50th floor as those ones are for frequent members and business travellers, so if you want one with a view ask for one on the 40th floor. Breakfast you have the choice of two restaurants serving pretty much the same thing. One is supposed to be more European and the other Asia but each of them serve the same food and to be honest there are less people in the Asia one meaning quicker service. Overall good hotel in a great location with excellent views.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place from which to explore Singapore”
Reviews.Author: not_now_kato
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Singapore, and the Stamford was a perfect choice. It's right on the MRT, the public transport system and a short walk from the harbour The staff are extremely helpful and pleasant, and went out of their way to make sure that we were well looked after. The breakfast, although pricey is well worth having, as there is an incredible variety of food on offer, and plenty of it. The rooms are clean and comfortable, and the views are amazing. I will definitely book the Stamford again next time I am in Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Ok facilities, Great location”
Reviews.Author: Belly2007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Swissotel Stamford for a week in June. The location was very central, right at the City Hall MRT station. Room was a good size, but cleanliness left much to be desired.. the general areas were clean but the tiny area between the wall and the bed had a lot of dust balls! Also the guy in the big red uniform by the lobby entrance wasn't very helpful. I had called for a taxi through the concierge and they gave me this sheet of paper with teh taxi's plate number on it and told me to hand it to the big guy. I did as they said and the big guy handed me back the paper and said "Can you see? Look at the taxi's plates ok? Do it yourself." Needless to say I was in a state of shock at this unhelpfulness.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Hot_Dots
