Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel in a great location with the MRT right below it. Our room was comfortable (although the beds were way too hard). Really as expected a very good hotel. I have stayed at the Swissotel Merchant Court and to tell the truth, even thought the Stamford is a better hotel, I am not sure it is worth the extra money, however I could not fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but expensive”
Reviews.Author: MacAsia
Reviews.Content: This hotel is connected very will by a maze of underground corridors and MRT that will lead you to the concert hall (Durian!) and other shopping centers. The hotel itself is expensive (even with corporate rate). The room was typical 4 star. Free paper every morning, You pay for breakfast Yoy pay to use the gym.

Reviews.Title: “Competent. Comfortable. Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: Bangkokexpat
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Swissotel The Stamford for four nights during the end of June, 2007. This four star hotel lived up to my expectations. It was competent, comfortable, polite, clean and well-appointed. My room on the 26th floor, was large, modern and pleasant, with all the amenities one would expect. The large bathroom sparkled. The décor, while standard issue, was pleasant. While I had no complaints, and was generally satisfied, the hotel has no particular distinction or character, which is admittedly difficult to achieve in a downtown 70-story high rise. The breakfast was as varied, ample, and delicious as I've had anywhere, and the large, striking, three-story atrium breakfast room, made up in theatre what it lacked in intimacy. Unlike many of its four star brethren, the friendly staff did an excellent job of continuously cleaning my table of plates and keeping my tea topped up. Breakfast was served until 11:00 AM, which was terrific for my schedule. The major advantage of this hotel is its location. The hotel is attached to the Raffles City shopping mall, which itself is attached to the City Hall MRT station. Through numerous underground air conditioned tunnels, themselves constituting shopping malls, you can walk to The Esplanade, and to numerous shopping malls and a convention center. It is an easy and cheap (about US$1) MRT ride from Changi Airport to the hotel, which is about as convenient as you can get. In the past, I stayed at the more expensive Raffles The Plaza, which is next door to Swissotel The Stamford, and is also attached to the same mall. I could find no differences in the two hotels which would justify a higher price for Raffles The Plaza. Bottom line: I'll stay at Swissotel The Stamford again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Sarah J
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Swissotel for 2 nights. Upon check-in we were offered an upgrade, which we accepted at a reasonable price. However, upon check-out the bill plus many taxes had gone up substantially. Would recommend if offered an upgrade, to ask how much the price is plus taxes, so that you don't get caught out. We were also charged a higher price to what was offered, which we are fighting out with them at the moment. On the whole though, our stay was very enjoyable. The hotel is clean, convenient to many shops and restaurants and our 5 room suite was unbelievable. 64th Floor with views across Singapore. Service was good but you get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “Busy Lobby, Large Room”
Reviews.Author: Philipat
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this property for the first time recently for a one night business stay. The location is closer to the Business District than the shopping. It's close to the Funan electronics centre which is just a 10 minute walk through the adjacent shopping centre. It's connected on the first 4 floors to Raffles City Mall and also has a large conference centre, so the lobby area is constantly busy and it's not a hotel with public ares in which you can relax. There are, however, many restaurants between the Hotel and the Mall so, together with the hotel retaurants, there is an amazing selection, including the exceptional Maharani restaurant for excellent Indian food. One of the best in Singapore in my opinion. Check-in was very slow despite the fact that there were only 3 guests checking in, but check-out at the desk behind the lobby, in front of the elevators, was fast and convenient. My Room was on the 56th Floor, had superb viewsand was a very good size, much larger than the average room. Overall, this is not a property you would die to stay at again but it is very functional and comfortable with reasonable value for money rates.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! We'll be back.”
Reviews.Author: chelsea91
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for a girlie weekend. Shared a room on the 58th floor with views over the harbour which were fantastic. The rooms were spacious with 2 queen size beds. Having the Lavazza coffee machine in the room was great. We started our mornings with a coffee sitting on our beds gazing out at the harbour. So relaxing! The breakfast in the Executive Lounge was good. The service in the hotel was great. My friend lost her credit card in an ATM in the Raffles City shopping complex and the staff member in the Executive Lounge was so helpful in helping her with phone calls etc and she managed to get her card back the next day. Normally, sorting out issues like that is a nightmare. The location is great. Just above the Raffles City MRT (making it so easy to get everywhere) and the Raffles City shopping complex. Loads of great inexpensive food places in the market place at the bottom of Raffles City as well as a great supermarket. The pool area was lovely as well. We'll definitely be back for another girlie weekend as well as bring the family here. It is also an ideal place to have a family break.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic view”
Reviews.Author: Purle3121
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at the Swissotel The Stamford after staying four nights at the Albert Court hotel in Little India. Our habourview room at the Stamford with such a fantastic view seemed like total luxury after the three star Albert Court. Our room was on the 44th floor facing towards Little China. Initially I was a bit disappointed our room wasn't higher up, but after seeing the view up higher (which is fantastic) I was glad to be staying a bit lower. We were looking out towards other high rises (and down below of course) rather than looking down on everything. The room was a great size with a lovely big king sized bed. It was fantastic going to sleep at night with that view! The reception staff were lovely and the concierge staff were very helpful, including giving honest opinions on various Singapore attractions and trying to track down a store that used to be located at Raffles. The location of the hotel is great - above the City Hall MRT station (so easy to get to Orchard Road, the night safari etc). The pool was also nice. On our last night we had dinner at Equinox. The view was fantastic and, while it wasn't cheap, it was not as expensive as we expected (about $280 for the two of us, including champagne and wine).

Reviews.Title: “deteriorating”
Reviews.Author: ahmlaw
Reviews.Content: I am in Singapore at least 4 times a year, and I often stay at this hotel. In the past two years, however, the service and accomodations have deteriorated. You need to specify that you be given a room on the higher floors, as these have been renovated. I asked the front desk this last visit if the lower floors have been renovated, and I was told that not all rooms have been refurbished. There are 2 locations for breakfast. I found it odd that in one location, honey for toast was available, while in the other area, you would have to request for it. Breakfast coffee in this hotel is awful. But breakfast time is until 11am, which is great. Almost all hotels close their breakfast service by 10am or 10:30am. Check-out efficiency is hit-and-miss. My last stay, I was lucky, and was able to check out quickly. However, I have experienced very long check-outs here that have made me nervous about getting to the airport on time! Good feature are the ice-machines available on some floors; when you check in, ask if that floor has a working ice-machine. Bathroom amenities: even if there are two of you in the room, they'll only give you a set for one (so it's a scramble for the shower cap!). And replenishment of bathroom amenities also hit-and-miss; some days they give you a new bar of soap, other times they don't. The bathtub/shower is horrible; the half-glass door shower enclosure was a huge design mistake. it causes the bathroom to flood, once you take a shower. This last visit, half the shower time was spent mopping up the flooded floor! Room service is fair. I don't know if other hotels have first aid facilities, as I have never had use for them, although I travel constantly. This last time, I had a bad cut, and called for a band-aid. I was told I had to buy the whole pack of twenty for about S$5. I recall that in some hotels, you get band-aids in the room, so I was a bit surprised, but paid for it anyway (it was late in the evening, so I had no choice). This last stay, because they could not give me a room on a higher floor, I was "upgraded" to the member's floor. Normally, an upgrade implies either an upgrade of facilities, or added perks (like use of the members' lounge). In this case, I got nothing new for the "upgrade", it was the same-sized room, same amenities, no use of the lounge. And one of the two phones was busted. This used to be my favorite Singapore hotel, but in recent months, I've transferred my business to the Mandarin Oriental, where the accomodations are superior, the breakfast selection awesome, and the service and amenities exceptional. Am still hoping this hotel gets its act together, since the location is prime (City Hall MRT station is just beneath the hotel, and there's an attached mall - Raffles City). Otherwise, its star rating should be downgraded.

Reviews.Title: “well worth it”
Reviews.Author: neda2000
Reviews.Content: 1st night we stayed in a standard room. that was perfect. then we upgraded to an executive room, and it was more than perfect. just as well we stayed in a standard room 1st night cause once we went to executive room we did not leave our room all day. the view was awsome, what a beautiful city. the cocktail hour and the breakfast up there was such a pleaseure with the whole city under you. the staff were very friendly. everone from check in moment to room service, pool staff, the club room and porters. evern the taxi drivers in singapore were friendly and helpful. we will go back again to this city and will stay in Swissotel stamford (executive club room). contact the hotel directly and you will get a better deal. to australian dollar it works out quite reasonable and even if it is pricey at least it is value for money and you are not being ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised this is not higher in the ratings!!”
Reviews.Author: BalUK69
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, I really liked the nightclub on the top floor, even moreso because we got complimentary entry. One thing I will always remember is that we took a transfer from the airport with a group in a minivan, you had to see the look on the peoples faces when they saw us (In our trampy clothes) get out and walk into this hotel. Location: Spot on. Couldnt imagine staying anywhere else. Noted that this is far from orchard road, but hey I can live with that. Biggest gripe: having no method of getting a taxi from the concierge.... i.e we waited outside for 20 minutes one time in a queue.

Reviews.Title: “What happened to the lights?!?!?”
Reviews.Author: ks-bike-rider
Reviews.Content: I arrived at 1AM after enduring 20+ hours of flights; probably not at my sharpest. Of course, nature was calling, so I opened the door, saw a small electronic thingy by the door that said "Insert Card", swiped my door card in it, lights came on, dropped key on the desk, tossed luggage on the bed and headed for bathroom - when the lights went out! Fumbled around for the key, found it again, swiped it again, more lights, headed for bathroom - and the lights went out again! Swiped card again, and discovered that lights would go out after about 15 seconds. By this time was nature wasn't just calling, it was screaming. I went back to the card swiper and this time left my card in the swiper - and the lights stayed on. WHAT RELIEF! I learned that "Insert Card" means leave your door card right here by the door if you want electricity, not "Insert, Remove and put in pocket for safe keeping". So, after my introduction to energy saving technology, I had more relaxed time to look around the room. I was told it was one of the recently updated king rooms. It was very comfortable with a large desk, counters, fridge - the usual. The bed was rock hard, which I prefer. There were 110 and 220 outlets available in the room, along with a plug adapter. It also appears all rooms have a balcony, which was nice after it cooled down later in the day. Internet access was available for SIN$30/day - a little pricey for vacation, but I was there on work, so I sucked it up and paid the outrageous amount. I might have to stop complaining about Marriott hotels in the US charging for internet access on top of thier already inflated room rates - but probably I won't ;) The concierges were very helpful finding things, assisting with minor problems, and making arrangements. However, unless you had a specific request for a restaurant, they directed you to the on-site facilities - acceptable, but like most hotel food, uninspired, right down to the "American" breakfast buffet featuring Micheal Jackson, Cher, and "Achy-Breaky Heart" for Muzak. The food was good, but the music over-powered my memory of it. Please, someone send them a new CD! A co-worker heard the same medley the next morning. Overall, it was a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: mandeeqld
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel at the beginning of May. We found that the hotel was very good in all aspects. The staff were polite and very helpful. The room was excellent, comfortable and well serviced and the view priceless. The breakfast which we had for the 5 days of our stay was an extensive buffet catering for western and asian tastes and it would be difficult to find fault with the food and the service. The hotel is well located and convenient to City Hall MRT. It is also within easy walking distance of Boat Quay and Clark Quay. We had a thoroughly enjoyable stay and will not hesitate in future to use this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: FazSydney
Reviews.Content: It was fantastic,every thing was at its best.A bit pricy but worth it. Highly recommand/

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: AussieTravelholic
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights at this modern high rise hotel near the harbour. Great location - has a shopping mall and underground station as part of the complex. Room large, good quality furnishings etc, quiet with a small balcony. Had 2 queen sized beds. We were upgraded to a room on the 37th floor with a wonderful view over the marina end of town. Is away from the hustle and bustle of Orchard Rd but can easily get there in a few minutes by underground. Have stayed in Singapore a couple of times and prefer this "quieter" end of town. Plenty of shopping malls, restaurants within easy access.

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: aberdeen01
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice during our recent trip to Asia, was booked into the Robertson Quay(see my review), it was awful so moved here instead. the hotel is lovely, all be it a bit pricy, luckily we got a deal through my sister in law( a local) who gets discounts with the raffles group, and stayed here on a friday night very cheaply. We had a harbour view room on the 46th floor with stunning views over the CBD and Boat Quay, 2 queen beds, and a reasonably large room. They couldnt accomodate us on the Sat, so we transfered through to Raffles The Plaza and were upgraded to a suite. View not so good as not as high but very luxurious, bed sheets turned down for us, slippers on floor etc and not to mention the electric curtains-more than we are used to! returned to The Stamford a week later paying the local rate (approx £80pn), this time took a city view room on 44th floor. Only fault was the toilet, it had a strange odour, but housekeeping did come and spray it with bleach and we were offered a room move but for 2 nights i couldnt be bothered moving, just kept door closed and popped in a toilet block. New Asia bar on 70th floor a must if not just for the view, go when its still light but turning dark and get best of all views. Try the cocktails, and for a few dollars extra get a novelty stamford tower or merlion glass to keep. the 2 pools shared between the 2 hotels+tennis courts are on the 8th floor, plenty of sunbeds available, towels laid out on them every morning by the staff for you. had room only basis, but hotels sitting above the marketplace, lower ground of the raffles plaza shopping mall, so lots of places to buy breakfast. liked a wee place called MIX which does smoothies! Also had a family meal at Pregos, an italian restaurant at the entrance to Raffles The Plaza hotel, food very nice but cant comment on price as my brother paid! Both very well situated for sightseeing and the MRT.

Reviews.Title: “Summer Inside my Room!”
Reviews.Author: crispypata
Reviews.Content: Coming from a great stay at the Royal Plaza on Scotts just 2 days before I stayed at the Stamford, I really had very high expectations (Yes as high as the hotel!) As I entered the hotel, I was really impressed. It really feels and looks like a great hotel. The staff looks very professional in their nice uniforms. But that's where all my woes began! My company booked me here for a 4 day 3 night stay. I was told by our Singapore office that I will not pay anything and will just give my credit card for the customary "incidentals deposit." But I was surprised that they were asking me to pay for the payment of my whole stay! I know there's a mix up and probably its not their fault if that's what their computer said! I was scrambling to call the Singapore office, unfortunately, the front desk people where not even offering for me use their phones! After countless haggling, they agreed for me to just swipe the card for the incidentals. I was given a room at the 48th floor with a stunning view of Suntec City and the Singapore River! The room is also elegantly furnished and the bathroom okay. My only problem is that the room is like so hot! The air-con is not woking properly! It feels like summer inside! I called up maintenance and they sent people to the room, they fixed it and told me that the unit is clogged but it will be okay. After an hour, it feels the same, I called up again and maintenance went there again! They said they fixed it but it was still hot. I am a very busy person preparing for work so I said to myself that I would rather work than mind this problem. I decided to sleep but my night was terribly hot! I woke up the next day and advised the front desk to fix the aircon. After a days work I returned to the room and at least it was quite cold. But after a few hours it was back to being hot!!! Again beacuse I am very busy, moving to another room is much more of a hassle so I just requested the hotel for an electric fan! Well it helped and I had a nice sleep. Breakfast was not that good though I love the pastrami! The location of the hotel is superb with the MRT literally just at the hotels door step. There is a good mall downstairs with a food court! There are ups and downs but I reccommended our Singapore office to get another hotel next time I'm in Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel plus shopping!”
Reviews.Author: Epollene
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this a hotel for 3 nights on our return from Europe. We had stayed at this hotel previously. Normally I book our hotels via the hotels website but this time I booked through an agent. When I checked in I asked about the standard of the room and was advised we had a basic room. I asked for a renovated room and the reception was very happy to offer me a nicer room for no extra charge. The room was lovely, with lots of space even with 2 queen sized beds. The hotel has 2 great pools which kept our kids happy. The best for me was the hotel is adjacent to a shopping centre and very close to the subway should you want to venture elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not great”
Reviews.Author: kay-l-gee
Reviews.Content: This hotel was incredibly busy when we arrived a couple of weeks before Chrismas. The room (with king bed) we'd booked was not available and neither was the 'room on a high floor' we'd requested well in advance. The distainful receptionist was unable to upgrade us as there was nothing better available, even though we were willing to pay extra, but eventually gave us the room we'd booked, grumbling all the while that we'd 'taken someone else's room'. This was the only low point of our stay. Our room was pleasant, if not quite the luxury you expect from a five star hotel in the east. The breakfast buffet was delicious with a great selection of east and west options. Equinox restaurant, on level 69, is stunning, for its decor, food and views. The hotel is well situated, particularly for the MRT and the adjoining shopping arcade is handy - particularly the little well-stocked supermarket in the basement. The Singapore Airlines 'hop-on' bus, which makes a round tour of the sights, stops close by (reduced fare with a SIA boarding pass, free on stopover packages) and is great if the humidity gets too much for walking far. We found it was also possible to walk from the hotel to all the way to the spectacular Esplanade arts centre (where there are plenty of restaurants) by way of interconnecting, air conditioned shopping malls! A useful tip: our flight was very late at night and the hotel was unable to offer us a particularly late check out. It does, however, have a complimentary guest suite with a bathroom and tea and coffee making facilities, which was was very welcome after a day sight seeing. We weren't offered use of this automatically and the hotel literature didn't seem to mention it (I discovered it from other tripadvisor reviewers) - so it is worth asking.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: MDU
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through asiarooms.com. Got a good deal for 5 star hotel including breakfast,although found out gym/steam room was not included in price. It's something that i did not expect and was disappointed with. The hotel is the 3rd tallest hotel in the Word so i was told and has a good reputation. It is an old hotel and rooms are fine, nothing special. Swimming pool area is excellent and worth a visit. The location of this hotel is excellent with MTR a minute walk away. Excellent shopping mall joins onto this hotel. Top floor(71st/72nd floor) has a club and restaurant.The view is really good. Breakfast buffet is very good. Singapore is a great place to visit especially Night Safari,Sentosa Island,Zoo and for shopping. We stayed only 2.5 days and felt 4-5 days would have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Sooze-7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Swissotel The Stamford four times now. 34 nights altogether. On our last visit we took our two young children and they too loved the hotel. The staff are always very pleasant and the restaurants are very good. We have always had a high floor and the views are spectacular. If we stayed at another hotel in Singapore, I know that we would regret not going back to the Stamford. We plan on going back for a fifth time next year. The hotel has a friendly atmosphere about it and so you feel relaxed there. We love it and always recommend it to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “oxygen needed”
Reviews.Author: truckeruk
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Singapore Airlines Stopover Offer. At the time of booking we requested that we should have a harbour view room and the highest possible floor that we could get . Singapore Air said they would e-mail request to hotel . On arrival at hotel reception area was very busy and seemed somewhat chaotic, upon reaching front desk we were advised that there were no harbour view rooms available however if we wished to up grade we could have a harbour view suite on the 55th floor (which would now include breakfast) for an extra £10 per night . As we had only booked room only , £10 for a suite and breakfast for 2 seemed a very good deal. Room was brilliant, and the views over the harbour and the old cricket ground were out of this world, would recommend harbour view to everyone well worth the expense. The bar on floor 70 is a must food is good and the cocktails were a lot cheaper then we expected , in fact we stayed so long up there the night just disappeared . The big plus to this hotel is the fact that you have Raffles City and the Metro at the bottom of the hotel , and of course Raffles itself just across the road , Clarke Quay around the corner etc.

Reviews.Title: “Their suites are lovely”
Reviews.Author: xksb
Reviews.Content: I was extremely pleased with their junior suites. Very exquisite, spacious with a nice view from the 53rd floor. Their prices are reasonable and location is excellent. The only disappointment was the lack of service. According to their internet service provider, their internet was down for over 4 hours. I asked front desk to confirm whether it is down and contact me when it's fixed. No one bothered to come back to me. I also request ahead of time to separate my room expense from incidentals. They completely forgot and held me up during check-out.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel in Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelMadLad
Reviews.Content: Travelling to Singapore a few times a year, I found the Swissotel to be the best hotel with the most ideal location. The hotel is connected to the popular raffles place shopping mall with an array of shops, restaurants and a terminal to the MRT. The hotel boast some of the best views of singapore which can be best seen from the amazing new asia bar on the 72 floor. I found the hotel hard to fault and will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “6th Stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: B2A1C3
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, friendly and helpful service, great room on 48th floor overlooking the harbour - very central location - will certainly stay again

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service and great views”
Reviews.Author: crispy123
Reviews.Content: Much better than I had expected, stayed in a King Room on the Executive floors. The room had two balconies, and fantastic views over Singapore. Very clean room, with top notch facilities including plasma TV, full bedside control unit, coffee machine etc. The service was superb, staff always referred to me by name when passing in the corridor etc. Complimentary drinks / snacks in the executive lounge were nice as was the relaxed breakfasts in the same room - both making it worth the extra for an executive room. Location good - situated in the same complex as a subway station. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A bit pricey but central location and spacious room”
Reviews.Author: Jaratpan
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in Swisshotel Stamford Singapore in March 2006. The hotel is centrally located in the center of Singapore with MRT subway and Starbucks on the door step, walkable distance to Suntec City, and 5 mins by MRT to Orchard Road (East). Spacious room with modern amenities and business like (cold but efficient) services. A bit pricey but still good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “53rd floor views”
Reviews.Author: OZcouplePerth
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel. We stayed on the 53rd floor with views of the city and river, truely breathtaking. The room was big with a balcony and good size bathroom. The hotel staff were polite and very helpful. The whole place was very service orientated. Breakfast was excellent with a wide range to choose from and varied from one day to the next. The location is excellent and the mall attached to the hotel is one of the best with a good range of shops and places to eat. A short and inexpensive taxi ride gets you to orchard road and the resturants at the marina. You could easily walk but the humidity makes a taxi ride much more enjoyable! We had a great stay and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Basic”
Reviews.Author: MouMou
Reviews.Content: The lobby of the hotel looks upmarket but it is clear that this hotel caters for the masses. Kind of reminds me of the Bonaventure Hotel in Los Angeles. The difference is that the facade is upgraded and looks modern. After checking in the hotel room look spartan and basic (note: I checked in on behalf of a friend who is visiting from overseas). LOCATION. The location is par excellence. It sits on top of a MRT station & a very respectable shopping mall. It is just next to Raffles The Plaza Hotel (a more upmarket hotel). FACILITIES. It shares the same swimming pool, gym facilities as well as Amrita Spa facilities as Raffles The Plaza. Everything else is the same as Raffles The Plaza, except for room ambience. Therein lies the price difference!! If you don't want to pay a lot for your hotel, but want location & good facilities, this is it!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Better location.”
Reviews.Author: housebuyer
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location in Singapore, over looking the harbour and the hotel plaza opens into the MRT interchange station of City Hall means you can access this hotel from the airport without leaving air conditioned buildings. It also means that you have excellent access to the rest of the city. Its the tallest hotel in South East Asia, so take advantage and book a high floor, the views are stunning. Breakfast can be taken in the cafe swiss which is ok but the high atrium means it was hot, the smaller room ( I forget its name) offers the same food in a more pleasant atmosphere. The room was large and spacious with a modern contemporary feel with a huge bed. The balcony offered a birds eye view of the city. Bathroom good with powerful shower. Only 5 mins walk from Raffles Hotel. Only minor was a disappointing pool - its shared with the hotel next door and in circular and small. Its fine for cooling down but poor for serious exercise

Reviews.Title: “High up in the clouds”
Reviews.Author: MidnightMint
Reviews.Content: I was staying with my sister at the Swissotel when her husband came back early from his business trip, so I found myself having to book another room on no notice. I tried to book via a travel website, they confirmed but later rejected my email. I had only received the confirmation email so I kicked up a real fuss when Swissotel staff could not find my booking. One of their managers took me to their office level so I could use a computer free of charge to try to sort out the booking mess. I was mortified when I discovered that it was the travel website that had mucked up. The manager was still nice and polite to me. They gave me a slightly discounted rate as my sister was a long-stay guest in another room, and they knew I hadnt expected to have to book my own accommodation. I was given a room on the 55th floor, and the view was fantastic. My sister was on the 19th floor and the view was very average. I would recommend putting a request in for a high-level floor, however this isnt a good idea for those that are afraid of heights or elevators. I'd go up so high in the elevator, my ears would pop! The room was very nice, perfectly clean, with good facilities and a balcony. Their buffet breakfasts are great - lots of things to choose from, and a glass frontage so you could see when the morning sun shower had finished. Nice pool area. The best thing about this hotel is that you are right above a huge shopping centre, and an underground tube station. However if you're one to be paranoid about terrorist attacks, I'd stay away from this hotel. Otherwise it's fantastic, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location & Great Views”
Reviews.Author: HS1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in December for a week on a business trip. I arrived at around midnight and check-in took half an hour which didn't impress me after my long flight. Nevertheless, the room was clean and spacious with excellent views across the city. The hotel was located within the Raffles City Shopping Centre which was handy, especially because there was a supermarket downstairs. Also the MRT station was within the complex making it easy to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Great View, Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: Smile07
Reviews.Content: For anyone who's looking to travel to Singapore, I would definitely recommend the Stamford. Strategically located in the heart of the city, the stamford boasts breathtaking views of the city's main attractions and the shopping centres are all within walking distance. At first, I was worried about the cleanliness of the hotel, however, even though the furntiture wasn't state-of-art, the rooms (especially the bathroom) were well maintained and always clean. Room service was impeccable, which made our stay at the hotel even more relaxing. I even went for a massage at the Amrita Spa, and couldn't help but indulge myself in one with the most soothing massage experiences ever. I would definitely recommend this hotel and I hope you enjoy your trip as much as I did! Money well spent and lots of fond memories!

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking views, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Gafia
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights from 29th October 2006 at the start of a long trip. The location is excellent, in the heart of the city, right on top of the Raffles City Shopping Plaza and the MRT so you can get to anywhere in the city but the taxis were also cheap and clean and there were always taxis outside. We found this really useful as it felt far too hot and humid for long walks anywhere during the day. The rooms were really comfortable and well furnished and the bathrooms adequate rather than luxurious. We managed to get a deal and had a room on one of the executive floors (58) which had a stunning view We'd paid only a few dollars more than the standard room rate and it ssaved us a lot of money especially given the price of drinks in Singapore! The executive floor provides breakfast including hot food, biscuits and tea or coffee all day and snacks and alcoholic drinks between 5 and 9 in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Good views”
Reviews.Author: zmrzlina
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one day. Pros: good clean room. Got upgraded without asking. Stunning views. Allowed me to leave my luggage after I checked out, though I had to wait a long time to be served. Probably a bit pricey for what I got, but I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not good for early check in but great view”
Reviews.Author: widi
Reviews.Content: I wanted to check in early as I landed @ 07:00 in Singapore. Unfortunately, I had to wait till 10:30 to get a room. Breakfast is ok but I have seen better (more choice, better quality of food) View from the room is just great, see my pictures.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: sanjiws
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Singapore, and I probably would stay there again. The concierge service was reliable, efficient, informative, and thoughtful. The folks at the reception were also helpful, but sometimes the lines are quite long to get to a person--if you need immediate assistance in that case, pop over to the concierge. Your luggage--you might have to carry your own bags to your room and let yourself in when you check in. I only had one bag so it didn't bother me--especially I was not sure how to tip in Singapore and I wanted some privacy, I was glad for this, but those travelling with children and/or lots of luggage might want to check with the front desk about getting some assistance checking in and out. The room I had (on the 14th floor) was very big and thoughtfully laid out. A big bonus was that there was an iron and ironing board in the room which I really found handy. There is also a hotpot, for anyone who wants to boil water and drink it (or have tea/coffee in the room). The linen was very clean, white and spotless (and comfortable). The bathroom was very big. The only complaint I have was that the commode had a highly dubious brown splotch on the seat. I disinfected it and put a disposable toilet seat cover on it since I am rather finiky and that put me off. Breakfast is served in two restaurants on the 2nd floor. Those with schedules to keep up should try to go before 8:30am otherwise there is a long queue to both. The staff members at the restaurants were efficient and friendly. There is a shopping mall attached to the hotel, which is fantastic. There are reasonable places to eat in the mall, and from the shopping center you can get to the metro (train, tube, whatever you like to call it). I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent for business and leisure”
Reviews.Author: Portugal_Paul
Reviews.Content: Stayed there from 30th Oct till 2nd Nov during a business trip. My second time in Singapore. Upon check in I asked for a harbour view room in a high floor and got one on the 41st. Spacious and very quite room (stayed in the 4172 twin, even with single occupancy) and bath (water pressure is understandably low, since you are sky high). Slippers, bathrobe, iron+board, customizable AirCond, choice of pillows, easy-to-set alarm, electronic do-not-disturb button, quick dry-cleaner, quick check in and check out, helpful valet and taxi-hailing service are just a few of the very pleasant surprises. Checkout is until 1PM, but if you have a late flight out of Singapore, you can ask for a late checkout (not available this time due to fully-booked status) or access to the hospitality lounge (a shared room in the 8th floor, where you (and others) can refresh and relax). Breakfast in the 2nd floor is either in the SwissCafe (bigger, louder, more food-choices) or the asian-inspired Copi Tiam (where they try to get you to go, because the SwissCafe is most of the times full), which is good for a change. This is a self-contained complex, with 2 hotels (Stamford+Plaza), 15 restaurants+bars, a conference centre (4th floor), an 8th floor SPA (extra charge) and a 4 level shopping-mall (except the NewYork Metropolitan Museum of Art shop, nothing to crave about). Eat out at one of the street Hawkers, which are clean, safe and full of local cuisine Walking distance to everything of interest for leisure (Boat Quay, Clarke Quay, Esplanade, Asian Civ Museum), Shopping (next door Chijmes is excellent for ethnic artwork; 10 min walk to Orchard Road or Sim Slim Square+Funan for IT stuff); ethnic diversity sightseeing/shopping (Chinatown, Little India, Arab Quarter) or business (Central Business District, Big Corporate Offices on Bridge Road or Suntec). If you manage to get a room in a high floor, then don’t bother going to the 70-72 floor restaurants and bars, since the view is not so much different then from your room and the price-service relation is below what you can get elsewhere. Don’t miss the next door Raffles Hotel. Pure luxury. Indulge in the buffet lunch and feel like a maharaja for a couple of hours. 15 min to the airport (even in rush our) cost you either 21 SingDollar (standard taxi) or 35 (limo-service). Would definitely stay here again and recommend this to all my colleagues and friends without hesitation. The only neg was a bar-charge I never did, but they tried to pin on my invoice upon check-out. Since they couldn't produce a signed receipt, the took it out at once.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: bloodbubble
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel over the weekend in October 2006 when I was in the city for a concert with my friend. We got a room on the 30th floor, which wasn't too high up, (The haze was so bad then we could hardly see anything outside the window so we didn't bother to request for a room on a higher level) but we were pleased that the room was fairly spacious. We could easily squeeze 4 people in our double queen bed room! The best thing about the hotel is the location. Loved the location!! Underneath the hotel is the City Hall MRT station which takes you to all the tourist attractions nearby.. most of which are less than 3 stops away. Also adjoining the hotel is the Raffles City shopping mall. A fairly big mall where you can find almost anything there. There is also the Citylink underground mall with connects the hotel to other nearby shopping malls, namely Suntec City and Marina Parade.

Reviews.Title: “Up in the sky”
Reviews.Author: gags9999
Reviews.Content: We spent a couple of nights in Swissotel Singapore. We were a bit worried about the negative reports but still chose this hotel for its excellent location and its skyscraping height(72 floors). On arrival, the lobby was crowded with all hustle and bustle going around. But there were no delays in check-in. Because of a very accomodating receptionist, we also got upgraded to a 63rd floor harbor view room (original booking was for a deluxe room). The room was spacious with contemporary decor. The best thing for us was the balcony which overlooked the Singapore harbour, marina area and The Esplanade. Bathroom was also pretty neat and well stocked on bathing accessories (bath salts, bathrobes, slippers etc) Breakfast was served in Stamford Cafe. Food was good with plentiful of choices. There is a bar and restaurant on the top level of the hotel-The Equinox Complex (70-72nd floors). The best part was the location. The hotel is connected at the lobby level to Raffles City Shopping Centre. The shopping center is also connected to another Raffles hotel, Raffles The Plaza. Beneath the hotel and the shopping centre, is the City Hall Interchange for MRT. The hotel is close to the Esplanade and Marina Bay area. The shopping centre is also connected to Suntec City via underground passageways lined by shopping outlets. Overall, we had a delightful experience at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great views (harbour view room, 57th floor)”
Reviews.Author: London-Travella
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded the day of our arrival from the Deluxe to the Harbour View (which we incidentally tried to book), which was a bonus and the view from the 57th floor was most amazing. Unfortunately the upgrade meant to double beds rather than a king. As we extended our stay by two days, we were allowed to keep our room at the same rate, rather than having to pay extra (S$30 + tax) or downgrade room, which was certainly a bonus. The lobby for a 5-star is somewhat disappointing and the pool is quite average, without any whirlpools apparent changing rooms etc., really nothing special but the I suppose you do go to the Stamford for the view rather than the pool. All in all: comfortable & nice, good-sized rooms, balcony (harbour view rooms), great views, average pool. All in all we still had above average value due to the upgrade. Saying that: S$270 (+ 16.55% tax = approx. S$300) for a deluxe (NON-HARBOUR view ) excl. breakfast is not really excellent value but really the minimum you would expect (not saying this a bad hotel but I suppose in that ‘league’ hotels are a bit pricier). BUT if you do SHOP AROUND and book in advance, you can get the Harbourview for £88 (S$259) incl. b'fast AND TAX, which then again is great value for money!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay in Style!!!”
Reviews.Author: IvanaM
Reviews.Content: The hotel is magnificent. I have just returned from a 10 days vacation with my family. We couldn't have choose better. First of all- the location is great. Next to a lot of attractions, shooping centres, dinning and entertainment areas. The hotel itself is well maintained. The lobby area is designed in latest style, and the Raffles shopping mall is right next door. The rooms are comfortable, clean and spacious. We had our room on the 56th floor with one of the most amazing views I've ever seen. Breakfast is available in the newly open Swiss Cafe. Not much food choise but the breakfast room is cosy, elegant and decorated with great care of detail. Restaurants and bars on the 71st floor are a must. Expensive but worth visiting. The pool is lovely, very clean, but not big. Although big enough to be able to relax there after a long day of sightseeing. Concierge service is very helpful. Reception was excellent. The pool attendants were wonderful. Overall the service was profesional. Without doubt I would stay here again. Highly recommendeed.

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: akn
Reviews.Content: From reading reviews about this hotel we knew to ask for a room above 38th floor. We got one on 51st without a problem. Excellent views of harbour/city. Great illuminations at night. very central, next door to Raffles and attached to Raffles City shopping Mall which was fantastic for shopping and food ...cafes/restaurants of every sort. The Chimjes complex across the road....lots of shops and restaurants in very nice ambiance. Both breakfast restaurants very good. We were travelling home on a night flight and they gave us a late check out at 4pm. Altogether an excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, very roomy, no complaints”
Reviews.Author: Jen D
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel at least four times now, and never been disappointed. On my most recent stay the reception staff were friendly - when they couldn't find my reservation initially they apologised with a room upgrade that gave me the roomiest corner suite I'd ever stayed in. Room service was fantastic - the meals were delicious and the maids discreet and thorough. Given that the hotel is the tallest in Asia, the views are fantastic and better than you'd get at any other location in Singapore, even Mt Faber. Newspapers are delivered each morning and the quality of the room fit-out is superb. If I had to complain about anything, I would point out that there is only one roll of toilet paper in each room, and that your ears must pop several times in the lift due to the height of the building.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints with Swissotel”
Reviews.Author: ZRacer
Reviews.Content: As part of a stopover on our way to Turkey, we stayed one night at this hotel. We were greeted by a modern style hotel and friendly staff. The hotel was interconnected to a large shopiing mall. Location was great but required a taxi ride to Orchard Road if you really wanted to get amongst the shops. Could not fault the service by the staff and the room was clean and with a great view from the 59th floor. As our plane did not leave until midnight its was great having a late checkout as well as the use of a room to watch tv have a cup of coffee and a shower is you wanted. This was provided up until when we departed for the airport at 9.00pm The only thing that was disappointing was the costs for a cup of coffee in the restaurant, ouch!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have picked better.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived the foyer looked quite plain and business like, but when we were shown our room we knew we had made the right choice of hotel. Get a harbour view room and you can't go wrong (we got an upgrade as part of a package). Deluxe rooms look over the pool and at another hotel, but harbourview is just specacular. Uninterupted postcard views of the city and the convention centre. The room was comfortable and looked recently renovated. Another plus is the hotel is built over a shopping centre and MRT station so you don't have to walk to far for transport. The Raffles is right next door. The pool area wasn't too bad, plenty of lounges, a bit too much concrete, but probably the best city pool weve seen. Overall I think probably one of the best for the view and for being central.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but the fitness center a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: TravlnTwins
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nice, clean with good service. Was quite disappointed to be charged Sing $21 (US$14) to use the fitness center for one day. Use of the fitness center is expected within the cost of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great View of the Skyline of Singapore”
Reviews.Author: non_sh
Reviews.Content: My gf and I stayed @ the hotel for the Easter Weekend. As recommended by some of the previous reviews on this very site, I asked for a high floor room and they were able to accomodate me with a room on the 42/F. My first impression of the room was that it was very spacious. It got a nice balcony and you can go outside and enjoy the nice skyline of Singapore. I opened my curtains most of the time so that I can catch the view. The bed was a very comfortable one, something you would expect from a five star. The breakfast was excellent (highly recommended) but the line-ups for omellettes is quite long and it would be nice if they have an extra cook there. The hotel is located in the heart of Singapore. The subway is just underneath and there is a underground mall that link you to Suntec. You can pretty much walk to most of the tourist attractions and even if you are too lazy to walk, taking the taxi is not expensive. The services by their staff is pretty much what you would normally expect which unlike some of the other hotel staff in eg.) Bangkok; staff in Stamford don't go that extra mile to make you feel more welcomed.... and this was the only reason why I rate this hotel a four not a five.

Reviews.Title: “for businesspeople not tourists”
Reviews.Author: antonyb
Reviews.Content: Very ambivalent re this hotel which is not as pleasing as it used to be given the cost.& refurbishment deterioration. Magniificent site with rail station at front door & Raffles City shopping centre at back which has everything, food halls ,supermarket,internet outlet, many shops.. The problem is the aesthetically unattractive unappealing barren foyer - no chairs for waiting when queues at reception, no colour , nothing Asian. And the noise level at reception & foyer so loud I couldn't hear the receptionist because of the awful acoustic plus a thumping pianiste. It was always crowded & too noisy as was the first floor restaurant where food was just average. The fact that Singapore has full employment was reflected in the disinterested attitude of the men looking after luggage . Once on the 58 floor excellent - large well serviced room with a great harbor view. Most obliging & helpful room staff. Will stay again because of its location but avoid the foyer as much as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: kauriNewZealand
Reviews.Content: Arrived 5 hours before check in. Reception checked us in early and gave us a room upgrade due to length of stay (8 days)-all for free. Found ourselves on the 61st floor. Room service excellent. Ice bucket filled nightly with bed turn down and choccies! Great views. Handy to MRT and the CBD (less walking or taxi fares) Room was excellent. Well maintained and clean.They would return at a time that suited you to clean the room. I've never expected a hotel to supply me with a toothbrush! Staff were always pleasant and helpful. Breakfast was included in the price. The Swiss cafe on level 2 for breakfast(opened mid March) is a bit short on service, considering the rating of the hotel-but it is buffet style.Food-wise, it has something for everyone. Hotel allowed an extended check out time free of charge. They could not have been more helpful. Only criticism was the charge for the gym. We left March 30th.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - just don't be afraid to complain”
Reviews.Author: Kerryman92
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in the Swissotel for 5 days on a recent visit to Singapore. We had an excellent stay and really enjoyed it. We are on a 6 month journey through Australia and SE Asia and it was one of the nicest hotels we stayed in. However I can understand some of the negative comments and I am very grateful to the review 'One hotel, very different standards'. We checked in after midnight on a very long journey from Luang Prabang. We were given a very mediocre room on the 9th floor (stained carpets, dull lighting, general poor standard). While on this trip we have learned to complain and not to accept poor quality. I would advise everyone to do this. Without any discussion we were transferred to a room on the 48th floor. I had originally booked a standard room (101 Euro as per Asiarooms). This new room proved to be a harbour view room (127 Euro) but we were not charged anything extra. It was a wonderful room and really enhanced our stay. Remember - don't settle for second best, always complain!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MsSG
Reviews.Content: At first looking at swissotel,i was impressed by the structure and its height,but after staying there for 1 night,i am utterly dissapointed by the service and the room. We paid like 500SGD+++ for a standard room,which was not even as good as fullerton or other 4-5 star hotels,but the price was very steep. We suspected the staff had miscalculated the numbers of days we had stayed there(instead of 1 night,he registered 2). My bf clarified before paying and they mentioned that we checked in late(11pm). It was not even 12hours that we stayed in that hotel before we left.We left at 8am the next morning. I wanted to get a refund but my bf told me not to make a fuss over it. I still think,it was not worth the money because the ugly room is not worth the amount we paid. First of all,the staffs was not very helpful and they seemed to be in dazed and confused. When we got into the room,it was very basic. The carpets was quite old and dirty and through the windows,we saw construction sites. It was not a romantic sight for couples. The bath tub was small and there was no toothbrush. Everything looked old inside the room. The queen sized bed was big but hard. The breakfast had little choices and very simple. This hotel shouldn't be called a 4-5 star hotel. I will never go back to that hotel and will try hotels in marina/boat quay/clarke quay or orchard area,that have a better standard for 4-5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Stamford twice now.Its got everthing you need.Fabulous pool,great restaurants,central to everthing.Wonderful staff.Look forward to the next visit.

Reviews.Title: “One Hotel, Very Differennt Standards”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is owned by Raffles International, who also own the one and only Raffles Hotel Singapore, along with sister hotel to the Stamford, The Raffles Plaza. Sadly, the Swissotel does not live up to the and reputation created by it's relatively new owners. In fact if anyone from 'Raffles Holdings' stayed in any of the rooms below the 38th floor, I think that they would be very embarrased indeed! Once tallest hotel in Asia, the rooms are certainly that. No-one can say that they don't have great views! Which is just as well, as the the hotel seems to be split into two halves. Get a room on the 38th floor and above and you will have spectacular views, along with a 'refreshed' room. New carpets, curtains, soft furnishings and beds with white duvets, along with new look and more mordern bathrooms, make for a pleasant stay. Below the 38th floor and your in for a diffent kind of stay. The rooms are a disgrace. Fithy window nets, dirty carpets and curtains along with shabby bedcoverings and poor room maintenace. The bathrooms are tired but clean, as are the white sheets on the bed. However, the rooms are well overdue a refurbishment. The hotel does however, have a fantastic pool, gym and SPA. Unfortunately, whilst use of the pool is free there is a charge for the gym and SPA of SG$21 The above said, the hotel is in a great location for the MTR, Raffles Hotel, Chimes, The Opera House, Waterfront and Boat Key. With one of Singapore's best and highest bars on the top floor, the 'New Asia Bar' makes for pleasant drink, if you can cope with the poor service!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Swissotel”
Reviews.Author: seeingtheworld7
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Swissotel on a stop over on our way to New Zealand. Two days out and 1 1/2 days back to the U.K. We found the location ideal for Raffles City. The service was excellent. On our return visit we arrived at the hotel at 7.00am on the morning after an overnight flight from Auckland. Our allocated room was not ready for occupation but reception could see we were in need in a shower and a rest and we were given an alternative room without any bother for which we were both very appreicative. The choice of food for breakfast was excellent and as we were on a stop over deal a 50% discount was offered. Summarising I would definitely stay at the Swissotel again and certainly recommend it to friends. Thank you all at the hotel for excellent and always polite service.

Reviews.Title: “Better by far tha expected”
Reviews.Author: Blossom55
Reviews.Content: After having read some of the recent negative reviews, was pleasantly surprised by the experience of staying at the Stamford. Apart from being in an excellent location and having good facilities and services either on site or nearby, the hotel itself proved to be a clean and well kept environment for myself and seven other family members for a family reunion. I cannot comment on the ordinary rooms. We reserved the Executive club facilities at S$330 per night. This rate included breakfast (which was adequate and plentiful) in the Executive Club lounge, Early evening (5pm to 8pm)complimentary drinks, again in the Club lounge and complimentary daily access to the Amrita Spa facilities (Spa, sauna, steam room, complementary toiletries provided & hairdryers etc. As additional expenses on the basic room, breakfast would have cost S$30 and access to the spa S$25 per day, so the larger rooms and additional facilities certainly made for a pleasant stay at a favourable price for this category of hotel. Staff were efficient, courteous and helpful and all levels of staff were mostly very sociable and friendly. The restaurant Jaan,(modern French)on the 70th floor, though potentially very expensive had magnifcent views, interesting decor and a S$35 3-course luncheon which was excellent value for money. All 8 of u from UK and Australia Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, Great service!”
Reviews.Author: andhope
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a business trip mid-August 2005. We arrived in the early morning hours (2AM) and were promptly helped by the bellboy and by the front desk staff. Front desk was very polite and friendly (at 2am, this was a pleasant surprise!). We had a city-view room. The room was very clean but too warm. Our air conditioner did not work properly so we called the front desk and a repairman came up within 30 minutes to fix it. That is service! The bed was very comfortable, and bathroom was spacious and clean. We enjoyed the buffet breakfast at the restaurant but it was a little expensive. There is a huge mall connected to this hotel (and a subway system on the bottom level of the mall). The location of this hotel is just superb -- you can walk to many points of interest around the city from the hotel. We splurged on our last night and ate at the Equinox Restaurant on the 71st floor -- the panoramic views of the city are breathtaking (so were the prices on the menu). Overall, a great hotel with excellent service. Singapore is not our first choice of countries to visit, but the hotel is worth staying at again.

Reviews.Title: “3rd rate hotel”
Reviews.Author: Caravaggio
Reviews.Content: Swissotel Stamford is one of the worst hotels I've ever stayed at. For the price we paid (more than US$135 a night), my boyfriend and I were appalled (to say the least) at the level of service at this so-called 5-star hotel. We arrived close to 1:00 am as our plane landed after midnight, and there was no one to help us with our luggage. It took nearly 20 min. for us to register as the receptionist was not ready to meet us. The wineglasses and other items on the room bar and the TV were covered in dust. The bedsheet was not clean. There were hairs on the bathroom toilet. After I had my shower the following morning, I discovered that the bath towels were musty! Breakfast was one of the worst I've had, but the service of the restaurant staff was the worst. One waiter spilled tea on our table. He simply walked away without a word of apology or indication that he would clean up the mess. The top floor bars were closed (although they were supposed to be open until 1:00 am), without prior advice to hotel guests, and when we inquired we were given conflicting reasons (either the hotel staff did not know or they were deliberately lying). The bell boys were not helpful at all. These are but a few of our bad experiences at this hotel. Needless to say, it marred our experience of Singapore. We will definitely not return, and we will not recommend this hotel to anyone. If I can give no rating at all (as in, worse than "terrible") I would.

Reviews.Title: “The Stamford was OK”
Reviews.Author: litekimchi
Reviews.Content: Overall, I found my stay at the Stamford OK. The staff were professional--I especially liked the bellboy who assisted me during check out. He was very friendly and very helpful. Too bad I never got his name. The rooms were spacious for somebody staying alone. It provided for different kinds of tea, but only enough for two cups of coffee. It had your usual business hotel amenities--internet access (which was expensive), iron and ironing boards, heating kettle, an alarm clock that doubled as a control station for the lights, A/C, TV and Radio (the tv plays the radio) and a complimentary shoe shine service. I wasn't impressed with the bathroom--something I am critical of, especially when staying in luxury/business hotels. It didn't feel clean enough, and there were stains on the tub. I did appreciate the fact that they provided me with many towels (but which I didn't use much--I normally bring my own. I am wary of hotel towels!) They looked and smelled clean, though. I was just disappointed that I was assigned a 12th floor room. The breakfast was OK, I've had worse. Besides, I normally prefer a continental, anyway, when out on trips abroad--but I venture to taste local delights and specialties whenever I have the appetite for it. It could improve on variety, though. They, for example, only offer 3 kinds of juices--orange, pink guava and grapefruit. While their baked goodies were aplenty, some didn't taste appetizing at all. I also hope that they could find a more efficient and effective way of keeping the food warmer. I was travelling with my boss, who didn't like the place at all. He does tend to be very critical about his hotels. He didn't like the smell of the carpet (it wasn't that bad, but it did smell a bit old), he didn't like the breakfast at all--the tables at the Stamford Cafe were covered with white paper! Kopitiam provided a relatively better breakfast, but it opened later. The Cafe opened at 6:30am, Kopitiam opens an hour later. I think the hotel's best quality is its location. It was raining during my stay in Singapore (2nd week of January), but I was still able to move around and get to the Suntec City and the Esplanade. The hotel is connected to the City Hall MRT, Raffles City Shopping Center, Raffles the Plaza, and the CityLink Shopping Mall, which linked the above stated to the Marina, the Esplanade and Suntec City (where the Fountain of Wealth is located). And because it was near malls, changing money was not much of a problem. For those staying here, there's a DBS Bank at the Raffles City Shopping Complex, which is just across Chjimes. Banking hours: 8:30am-4:30pm. There's a mall concierge if you need help on anything. The next time I'm in town, I'd probably look for another hotel--I've seen better reviews of others.

Reviews.Title: “Not good...”
Reviews.Author: Carla123
Reviews.Content: On arrival had a bad experience with the front desk who had my reservation all mixed up. He thought I was arriving a day later and leaving the following day when I was actually staying for four nights. I booked with Asiarooms and clearly someone made a mistake. My confirmation and voucher from the hotel proved my dates to the man who replied this is the nightly rate to which I reminded him that I had pre-paid. The following day I went back to the front desk to ask everything was cleared up to which the receptionist new nothing about and nothing had been sorted. The following evening I went again and was told it was all fine, they had not come back to me so I took it upon my self. The room had no view and the linen and towels were badly stained. The cleaner however was very friendly and the room was never seen to be like this again. In addition hair in the bath tub. The breakfasts had little variety and more often then not the hot selection was cold. The only plus was location which was indeed fantastic. Would not return.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Stamford, Loved Singapore!”
Reviews.Author: Liverbird1
Reviews.Content: This hotel by my own experience does not deserve the previous negative reviews, I found it to be a very good hotel in an excellent location. My room on the 41st floor had beautiful views across the harbour, the quays and esplanade, with huge picture windows and balcony from which to admire the stunning view. The rooms have everything you require for your stay and were very quiet, unlike other hotels in which I've stayed where you hear doors banging and people coming and going, we didn't hear a sound throughout our stay. The hotel has many good bars and restaurants between itself and it's sister hotel Raffles the Plaza which is next door, and there are 2 nice swimming pools to use and good spa facilities. We arrived at the hotel at 8am and were given access to a courtesy room to freshen up, with tea,coffee and water available, and were then able to access our room at 10am which I was very impressed with. The location is excellent with Suntec City shopping Mall a short walk away, and its a 5-10 minute walk to the waterfront. The hotel also has an entrance into the Raffles shopping Mall too with many shops. The Equinox bar and restaurants at the top of this hotel are well worth a visit for the views alone, it is breathtaking. I would definitely return to this hotel and absolutely adored Singapore, the warmth, friendliness and general hospitality of the people make this island very special and a joy to visit!.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great View, Little else”
Reviews.Author: sankar
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights at an executive room at the Stamford. Being one of the tallest hotels around, you are bound to have a great view, and the balcony definitely helps (do avoid stepping out if you have even a mild case of vertigo)! Location right above City Hall subway means you can get virtually anywhere in Singapore very quickly. Rooms are decent, but a touch of renovation is due. There were some small issues which i wouldn't expect in the exectutive floor of a hotel of this stature : The bathroom had a slight 'drain' smell and some stains are present, the in-room safe and the telephone had problems. The elevators are woefully inadequate and you can expect a long wait for one, and when you do get one, you are likely to have quite a few stops on the way to or from the ground floor. The service was mixed. The girl who served me at check in staff was very friendly and helpful, and so were the excellent bell desk staff. The executive club serves a very basic breakfast and has pretty average staff, and i would have expected the hotel to place the better staff there. There was a dour-faced lady at the reception there and an even more dour-faced lady serving inside - not really the first faces you want to see every morning. And I had to pay for internet access even at the executive floors, which was a tad surprising - but you may get free wireless internet if you step out onto the balcony and are not staying at a very high floor. Overall, I would say it was disappointing for a raffles brand hotel at this price - were it 30-40% cheaper, I wouldn't be complaining.

Reviews.Title: “Love it...”
Reviews.Author: StillPhone
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at this hotel on business trips since 1983 and love the place. The rooms are always clean and airconditioned well, which is a big deal in Singapore. Higher floors are generally nicer but the rooms are always large which ever floor you get. The only problem I have experienced is that sometimes the rooms are so large that remote control for the TV doesn't work! The arrival desk used to be slow but on my last trip they had fixed that problem. I always get the train from the airport rather than taxis as the hotel is on top of the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Very dissapointing for a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: member078
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 6 night stay here. I originally chose this hotel because of the location and the good rate i was given.However when I went to check in i noticed that the rate was actually much higher then what i was told. They add extra tax that you dont know about until you get the bill.Dont believe the pictures on the website, the rooms look NOTHING like this!! I was given a room on the 56th floor and was promised a riverview, instead I got views of building work,suntec city and a quarter of the river! A few times i found little ants crawling round near the bedside cabinet, apart from this the room was clean. I expected so much better for a 5 star and was very dissapointed. the reception staff were not very helpful. breakfast was average, there should be more choice.The best part about this hotel is the excellent location, City hall MRT is right on the doorstep and suntec city a few mins walk.Overall i wouldnt stay here again, for the same money you can stay at a much better hotel. i would rate this hotel an average 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “Average services--dissapointing for a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Singapore12345
Reviews.Content: The stay was meant to be a menigful stay as I was supposed to celebrate National Day, The check-in was extremely slow although there were only a few guest. The hotel interior looks worn and needs to be refurbished altough our room on the 43TH story had a great view. The room we were given was a smoking one although I specified for a non smoking room. We were being brought to Kopi-Tiam for breakfast altough we preffered to have it at Stamford Cafe. The breakfast for the child was charged although it was meant to be complimentary--the manager was nonchalant when we wanted to explain the situation. It was later being waived during check-out.

HotelInfo.Name: Swissotel The Stamford
HotelInfo.Address: 2 Stamford Road, Singapore 178882, Singapore
